availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Enter the name of a schedule that defines the availability of the unit. Schedule values of 0 denote the unit is off. All other values denote the unit is available. If this field is left blank, the unit is available the entire simulation.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.description: Enter the total cooling capacity in watts at rated conditions or set to autosize. Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.title: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Enter the coefficient of performance at rated conditions or leave blank to use default. COP includes compressor and condenser fan electrical energy input COP does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electric power input
gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Gross Rated Cooling Cop

minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For cooling mode operation, enter the minimum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or minimum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Cooling is disabled below this temperature.
minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Minimum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Cooling Mode

maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For cooling mode operation, enter the maximum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or maximum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Cooling is disabled above this temperature.
maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Maximum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Cooling Mode

cooling_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.description: Enter a curve name that represents full load cooling capacity ratio as a function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature and indoor wet-bulb temperature. Up to two curves are allowed if the performance cannot be represented by a single curve. The following two fields are used if two curves are required.
cooling_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.title: Cooling Capacity Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Temperature Curve Name

cooling_capacity_ratio_boundary_curve_na.description: This curve object is used to allow separate low and high cooling capacity ratio performance curves. This curve represents a line passing through the points where performance changes. The curve calculates outdoor dry-bulb temperature given weighted average indoor wet-bulb temperature. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
cooling_capacity_ratio_boundary_curve_na.title: Cooling Capacity Ratio Boundary Curve Name

cooling_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.description: This curve object is used to describe the high outdoor temperature performance curve used to describe cooling capacity ratio. This curve is used when a single performance curve does not accurately describe cooling capacity ratio as a function of temperature. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
cooling_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.title: Cooling Capacity Ratio Modifier Function Of High Temperature Curve Name

cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: Enter a curve name that represents cooling energy ratio as a function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature and indoor wet-bulb temperature
cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Cooling Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Temperature Curve Name

cooling_energy_input_ratio_boundary_curv.description: This curve object is used to allow separate low and high cooling energy input ratio performance curves. This curve represents a line passing through the points where performance changes. The curve calculates outdoor dry-bulb temperature given weighted average indoor wet-bulb temperature. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
cooling_energy_input_ratio_boundary_curv.title: Cooling Energy Input Ratio Boundary Curve Name

cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: This curve object is used to describe the high outdoor temperature performance curve used to describe cooling energy ratio. This curve is used when a single performance curve does not accurately describe cooling energy ratio as a function of temperature
cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Cooling Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of High Temperature Curve Name

cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: Enter a curve name that represents cooling energy ratio as a function of part-load ratio for part-load ratios less than or equal to 1. If this field is left blank, the model assumes energy is proportional to part-load ratio.
cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Cooling Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Part Load Ratio Curve Name

cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: Enter a curve name that represents cooling energy ratio as a function of part-load ratio for part-load ratios greater than 1. Part-load ratios can exceed 1 in variable speed compression systems. If this field is left blank, the model assumes energy is proportional to part-load ratio.
cooling_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Cooling Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of High Part Load Ratio Curve Name

cooling_combination_ratio_correction_fac.description: This curve defines how rated capacity changes when the total indoor terminal unit cooling capacity is greater than the Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity defined in this object. If this field is left blank, the model assumes total indoor terminal unit cooling capacity is equal to the Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity defined above.
cooling_combination_ratio_correction_fac.title: Cooling Combination Ratio Correction Factor Curve Name

cooling_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.description: This curve defines the cycling losses when the heat pump compressor cycles on and off below the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio specified in the field below.
cooling_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.title: Cooling Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

gross_rated_heating_capacity.description: Enter the heating capacity in watts at rated conditions or set to autosize. Heating capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_heating_capacity.title: Gross Rated Heating Capacity

rated_heating_capacity_sizing_ratio.description: If the Gross Rated Heating Capacity is autosized, the heating capacity is sized to be equal to the cooling capacity multiplied by this sizing ratio. The zone terminal unit heating coils are also sized using this ratio unless the sizing ratio input in the ZoneHVAC:TerminalUnit:VariableRefrigerantFlow object is entered.
rated_heating_capacity_sizing_ratio.title: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio

gross_rated_heating_cop.description: COP includes compressor and condenser fan electrical energy input COP does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
gross_rated_heating_cop.title: Gross Rated Heating Cop

minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For heating mode operation, enter the minimum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or minimum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Heating is disabled below this temperature.
minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Minimum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Heating Mode

maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For heating mode operation, enter the maximum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or maximum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Heating is disabled below this temperature.
maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Maximum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Heating Mode

heating_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.description: Enter a curve name that represents full load heating capacity ratio as a function of outdoor wet-bulb temperature and indoor dry-bulb temperature. Outdoor dry-bulb temperature may be used if wet-bulb temperature data is unavailable. See Heating Performance Curve Outdoor Temperature Type input below to determine which outdoor temperature type to use. Up to two curves are allowed if the performance cannot be represented by a single curve. The following two fields are used if two curves are required.
heating_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.title: Heating Capacity Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Temperature Curve Name

heating_capacity_ratio_boundary_curve_na.description: This curve object is used to allow separate low and high heating capacity ratio performance curves. This curve represents a line passing through the points where performance changes. The curve calculates outdoor dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature given weighted average indoor dry-bulb temperature. See Heating Performance Curve Outdoor Temperature Type input below to determine which outdoor temperature type to use. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
heating_capacity_ratio_boundary_curve_na.title: Heating Capacity Ratio Boundary Curve Name

heating_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.description: This curve object is used to describe the high outdoor temperature performance curve used to describe heating capacity ratio. This curve is used when a single performance curve does not accurately describe heating capacity ratio as a function of temperature. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
heating_capacity_ratio_modifier_function.title: Heating Capacity Ratio Modifier Function Of High Temperature Curve Name

heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: Enter a curve name that represents heating energy ratio as a function of outdoor wet-bulb temperature and indoor dry-bulb temperature Outdoor dry-bulb temperature may be used if wet-bulb temperature data is unavailable. See Heating Performance Curve Outdoor Temperature Type input below to determine which outdoor temperature type to use.
heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Heating Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Temperature Curve Name

heating_energy_input_ratio_boundary_curv.description: This curve object is used to allow separate low and high heating energy input ratio performance curves. This curve represents a line passing through the points where performance changes. The curve calculates outdoor dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature given weighted average indoor dry-bulb temperature. See Heating Performance Curve Outdoor Temperature Type input below to determine which outdoor temperature type to use. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
heating_energy_input_ratio_boundary_curv.title: Heating Energy Input Ratio Boundary Curve Name

heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: This curve object is used to allow separate performance curves for heating energy. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Heating Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of High Temperature Curve Name

heating_performance_curve_outdoor_temper.description: Determines temperature type for heating capacity curves and heating energy curves. This input determines whether the outdoor air dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature is used to evaluate these curves.
heating_performance_curve_outdoor_temper.title: Heating Performance Curve Outdoor Temperature Type

heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: This curve represents the heating energy input ratio for part-load ratios less than 1.
heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Heating Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Low Part Load Ratio Curve Name

heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: This curve represents the heating energy input ratio for part-load ratios greater than 1.
heating_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Heating Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of High Part Load Ratio Curve Name

heating_combination_ratio_correction_fac.description: This curve defines how rated capacity changes when the total indoor terminal unit heating capacity is greater than the Gross Rated Heating Capacity defined in this object. If this field is left blank, the model assumes total indoor terminal unit heating capacity is equal to the Gross Rated Heating Capacity defined above.
heating_combination_ratio_correction_fac.title: Heating Combination Ratio Correction Factor Curve Name

heating_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.description: This curve defines the cycling losses when the heat pump compressor cycles on and off below the Minimum Heat Pump Part-Load Ratio specified in the following field.
heating_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.title: Heating Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

minimum_heat_pump_part_load_ratio.description: Enter the minimum heat pump part-load ratio (PLR). When the cooling or heating PLR is below this value, the heat pump compressor will cycle to meet the cooling or heating demand.
minimum_heat_pump_part_load_ratio.title: Minimum Heat Pump Part Load Ratio

zone_name_for_master_thermostat_location.description: Enter the name of the zone where the master thermostat is located.
zone_name_for_master_thermostat_location.title: Zone Name For Master Thermostat Location

master_thermostat_priority_control_type.description: Choose a thermostat control logic scheme. If these control types fail to control zone temperature within a reasonable limit, consider using multiple VRF systems. This field is not used when all terminal units are set point controlled.
master_thermostat_priority_control_type.title: Master Thermostat Priority Control Type

thermostat_priority_schedule_name.description: this field is required if Master Thermostat Priority Control Type is Scheduled. Schedule values of 0 denote cooling, 1 for heating, and all other values disable the system.
thermostat_priority_schedule_name.title: Thermostat Priority Schedule Name

zone_terminal_unit_list_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneTerminalUnitList. This list connects zone terminal units to this heat pump.
zone_terminal_unit_list_name.title: Zone Terminal Unit List Name

heat_pump_waste_heat_recovery.description: This field enables heat recovery operation within this VRF outdoor unit.
heat_pump_waste_heat_recovery.title: Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery

equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.description: Enter the equivalent length of the farthest terminal unit from the condenser
equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.title: Equivalent Piping Length Used For Piping Correction Factor In Cooling Mode

vertical_height_used_for_piping_correcti.description: Enter the height difference between the highest and lowest terminal unit
vertical_height_used_for_piping_correcti.title: Vertical Height Used For Piping Correction Factor

piping_correction_factor_for_length_in_c.description: PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*L^3 + a4*H PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*CR + a4*CR^2 + a5*(L)(CR) where L = length and CR = combination ratio specifies coefficients for a0, a1, a2, and a3 in the PCF equation
piping_correction_factor_for_length_in_c.title: Piping Correction Factor For Length In Cooling Mode Curve Name

piping_correction_factor_for_height_in_c.description: PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*L^3 + a4*H PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*CR + a4*CR^2 + a5*(L)(CR) + a6*H where L = length, H = height, and CR = combination ratio specifies coefficient a4 (or a6 for biquadratic) in the PCF equation
piping_correction_factor_for_height_in_c.title: Piping Correction Factor For Height In Cooling Mode Coefficient

equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.description: Enter the equivalent length of the farthest terminal unit from the condenser
equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.title: Equivalent Piping Length Used For Piping Correction Factor In Heating Mode

piping_correction_factor_for_length_in_h.description: PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*L^3 + a4*H PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*CR + a4*CR^2 + a5*(L)(CR) + a6*H where L = length and CR = combination ratio specifies coefficients for a0, a1, a2, and a3 (or a0-a5 for biquadratic) in the PCF equation
piping_correction_factor_for_length_in_h.title: Piping Correction Factor For Length In Heating Mode Curve Name

piping_correction_factor_for_height_in_h.description: PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*L^3 + a4*H PCF = a0 + a1*L + a2*L^2 + a3*CR + a4*CR^2 + a5*(L)(CR) + a6*H where L = length, H = height, and CR = combination ratio specifies coefficient a4 (or a6 for biquadratic) in the PCF equation
piping_correction_factor_for_height_in_h.title: Piping Correction Factor For Height In Heating Mode Coefficient

crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.description: Enter the value of the resistive heater located in the compressor(s). This heater is used to warm the refrigerant and oil when the compressor is off.
crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.title: Crankcase Heater Power Per Compressor

number_of_compressors.description: Enter the total number of compressor. This input is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
number_of_compressors.title: Number Of Compressors

ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.description: Enter the ratio of the first stage compressor to total compressor capacity. All other compressors are assumed to be equally sized. This inputs is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.title: Ratio Of Compressor Size To Total Compressor Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the crankcase heaters are disabled.
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater

defrost_strategy.description: Select a defrost strategy. Reverse cycle reverses the operating mode from heating to cooling to melt frost formation on the condenser coil. The resistive strategy uses a resistive heater to melt the frost.
defrost_strategy.title: Defrost Strategy

defrost_control.description: Choose a defrost control type. Either use a fixed Timed defrost period or select OnDemand to defrost only when necessary.
defrost_control.title: Defrost Control

defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: A valid performance curve must be used if reversecycle defrost strategy is selected.
defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Defrost Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode. Only applicable if timed defrost control is specified.
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: Enter the size of the resistive defrost heating element. Only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which defrost operation is disabled.
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation

condenser_type.description: Select either an air-cooled, evaporatively-cooled or water-cooled condenser.
condenser_type.title: Condenser Type

condenser_inlet_node_name.description: Choose an outside air node name or leave this field blank to use weather data. If this field is blank, the Condenser Type is assumed to be AirCooled. This input must be specified if Condenser Type = WaterCooled.
condenser_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Inlet Node Name

condenser_outlet_node_name.description: Enter a water outlet node name if Condenser Type = WaterCooled. Leave this field blank if Condenser Type = Air or EvaporativelyCooled.
condenser_outlet_node_name.title: Condenser Outlet Node Name

water_condenser_volume_flow_rate.description: Only used when Condenser Type = WaterCooled.
water_condenser_volume_flow_rate.title: Water Condenser Volume Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.description: Enter the effectiveness of the evaporatively cooled condenser. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.title: Evaporative Condenser Effectiveness

evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Rated Power Consumption

supply_water_storage_tank_name.description: A separate storage tank may be used to supply an evaporatively cooled condenser.
supply_water_storage_tank_name.title: Supply Water Storage Tank Name

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For heat recovery mode operation, enter the minimum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or minimum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Heat recovery is disabled below this temperature.
minimum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Minimum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.description: For heat recovery mode operation, enter the maximum inlet outdoor air dry-bulb temperature for air-cooled units or maximum inlet water temperature for water-cooled units. Heat recovery is disabled above this temperature.
maximum_condenser_inlet_node_temperature.title: Maximum Condenser Inlet Node Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_modifier_.description: Enter the name of a performance curve which represents the change in cooling capacity when heat recovery is active A default constant of 0.9 is used if this input is blank
heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_modifier_.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Modifier Curve Name

initial_heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_f.description: Enter the fractional capacity available at the start of heat recovery mode. The capacity exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_f.title: Initial Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_time_cons.description: Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_time_cons.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant

heat_recovery_cooling_energy_modifier_cu.description: Enter the name of a performance curve which represents the change in cooling energy when heat recovery is active A default constant of 1.1 is used if this input is blank
heat_recovery_cooling_energy_modifier_cu.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier Curve Name

initial_heat_recovery_cooling_energy_fra.description: Enter the fractional electric consumption rate at the start of heat recovery mode. The electric consumption rate exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_cooling_energy_fra.title: Initial Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Fraction

heat_recovery_cooling_energy_time_consta.description: Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_cooling_energy_time_consta.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant

heat_recovery_heating_capacity_modifier_.description: Enter the name of a performance curve which represents the change in heating capacity when heat recovery is active A default constant of 1.1 is used if this input is blank
heat_recovery_heating_capacity_modifier_.title: Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Modifier Curve Name

initial_heat_recovery_heating_capacity_f.description: Enter the fractional capacity available at the start of heat recovery mode. The capacity exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Modifier and Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_heating_capacity_f.title: Initial Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_heating_capacity_time_cons.description: Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_heating_capacity_time_cons.title: Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Time Constant

heat_recovery_heating_energy_modifier_cu.description: Enter the name of a performance curve which represents the change in heating electric consumption rate when heat recovery is active A default constant of 1.1 is used if this input is blank
heat_recovery_heating_energy_modifier_cu.title: Heat Recovery Heating Energy Modifier Curve Name

initial_heat_recovery_heating_energy_fra.description: Enter the fractional electric consumption rate at the start of heat recovery mode. The electric consumption rate exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_heating_energy_fra.title: Initial Heat Recovery Heating Energy Fraction

heat_recovery_heating_energy_time_consta.description: Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_heating_energy_time_consta.title: Heat Recovery Heating Energy Time Constant

heat_pump_name.description: Enter a unique name for this variable refrigerant flow heat pump
heat_pump_name.title: Heat Pump Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Enter the name of a schedule that defines the availability of the unit Schedule values of 0 denote the unit is off. All other values denote the unit is available If this field is left blank, the unit is available the entire simulation
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_terminal_unit_list_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneTerminalUnitList. This list connects zone terminal units to this heat pump
zone_terminal_unit_list_name.title: Zone Terminal Unit List Name

rated_evaporative_capacity.description: Enter the total evaporative capacity in watts at rated conditions This is the capacity corresponding to the max compressor speed at rated conditions The actual evaporative capacity is obtained by multiplying the rated capacity with the modification factor calculated by Evaporative Capacity Multiplier Function of Temperature Curve
rated_evaporative_capacity.title: Rated Evaporative Capacity

rated_compressor_power_per_unit_of_rated.description: Enter the rated compressor power per Watt of rated evaporative capacity [W/W] Rated compressor power corresponds to the max compressor speed at rated conditions The actual compressor power is obtained by multiplying the rated power with the modification factor calculated by Compressor Power Multiplier Function of Temperature Curve
rated_compressor_power_per_unit_of_rated.title: Rated Compressor Power Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation Cooling is disabled below this temperature
minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature In Cooling Mode

maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation Cooling is disabled above this temperature
maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.title: Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature In Cooling Mode

minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation Heating is disabled below this temperature
minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature In Heating Mode

maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation Heating is disabled below this temperature
maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.title: Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature In Heating Mode

refrigerant_temperature_control_algorith.title: Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm For Indoor Unit

reference_evaporating_temperature_for_in.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is ConstantTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
reference_evaporating_temperature_for_in.title: Reference Evaporating Temperature For Indoor Unit

reference_condensing_temperature_for_ind.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is ConstantTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
reference_condensing_temperature_for_ind.title: Reference Condensing Temperature For Indoor Unit

variable_evaporating_temperature_minimum.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_evaporating_temperature_minimum.title: Variable Evaporating Temperature Minimum For Indoor Unit

variable_evaporating_temperature_maximum.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_evaporating_temperature_maximum.title: Variable Evaporating Temperature Maximum For Indoor Unit

variable_condensing_temperature_minimum_.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_condensing_temperature_minimum_.title: Variable Condensing Temperature Minimum For Indoor Unit

variable_condensing_temperature_maximum_.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_condensing_temperature_maximum_.title: Variable Condensing Temperature Maximum For Indoor Unit

outdoor_unit_fan_power_per_unit_of_rated.description: Enter the outdoor unit fan power per Watt of rated evaporative capacity [W/W]
outdoor_unit_fan_power_per_unit_of_rated.title: Outdoor Unit Fan Power Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

outdoor_unit_fan_flow_rate_per_unit_of_r.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to autocalculate and performance input method is NominalCapacity
outdoor_unit_fan_flow_rate_per_unit_of_r.title: Outdoor Unit Fan Flow Rate Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

outdoor_unit_evaporating_temperature_fun.title: Outdoor Unit Evaporating Temperature Function Of Superheating Curve Name

outdoor_unit_condensing_temperature_func.title: Outdoor Unit Condensing Temperature Function Of Subcooling Curve Name

diameter_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor.description: used to calculate the piping loss
diameter_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor.title: Diameter Of Main Pipe Connecting Outdoor Unit To The First Branch Joint

length_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor_u.description: used to calculate the heat loss of the main pipe
length_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor_u.title: Length Of Main Pipe Connecting Outdoor Unit To The First Branch Joint

equivalent_length_of_main_pipe_connectin.description: used to calculate the refrigerant pressure drop of the main pipe
equivalent_length_of_main_pipe_connectin.title: Equivalent Length Of Main Pipe Connecting Outdoor Unit To The First Branch Joint

height_difference_between_outdoor_unit_a.description: Difference between outdoor unit height and indoor unit height Positive means outdoor unit is higher than indoor unit Negative means outdoor unit is lower than indoor unit
height_difference_between_outdoor_unit_a.title: Height Difference Between Outdoor Unit And Indoor Units

crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.description: Enter the value of the resistive heater located in the compressor(s). This heater is used to warm the refrigerant and oil when the compressor is off
crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.title: Crankcase Heater Power Per Compressor

number_of_compressors.description: Enter the total number of compressor. This input is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
number_of_compressors.title: Number Of Compressors

ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.description: Enter the ratio of the first stage compressor to total compressor capacity All other compressors are assumed to be equally sized. This inputs is used only for crankcase heater calculations
ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.title: Ratio Of Compressor Size To Total Compressor Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the crankcase heaters are disabled
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater

defrost_strategy.description: Select a defrost strategy. Reverse cycle reverses the operating mode from heating to cooling to melt frost formation on the condenser coil The resistive strategy uses a resistive heater to melt the frost.
defrost_strategy.title: Defrost Strategy

defrost_control.description: Choose a defrost control type Either use a fixed Timed defrost period or select OnDemand to defrost only when necessary
defrost_control.title: Defrost Control

defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: A valid performance curve must be used if ReverseCycle defrost strategy is selected
defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Defrost Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode Only applicable if timed defrost control is specified
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: Enter the size of the resistive defrost heating element Only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the defrost operation is disabled
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation

number_of_compressor_loading_index_entri.description: First index represents minimal capacity operation Last index represents full capacity operation
number_of_compressor_loading_index_entri.title: Number Of Compressor Loading Index Entries

availability_schedule_name.description: Enter the name of a schedule that defines the availability of the unit Schedule values of 0 denote the unit is off. All other values denote the unit is available If this field is left blank, the unit is available the entire simulation
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_terminal_unit_list_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneTerminalUnitList. This list connects zone terminal units to this heat pump
zone_terminal_unit_list_name.title: Zone Terminal Unit List Name

rated_evaporative_capacity.description: Enter the total evaporative capacity in watts at rated conditions This is the capacity corresponding to the max compressor speed at rated conditions The actual evaporative capacity is obtained by multiplying the rated capacity with the modification factor calculated by Evaporative Capacity Multiplier Function of Temperature Curve
rated_evaporative_capacity.title: Rated Evaporative Capacity

rated_compressor_power_per_unit_of_rated.description: Enter the rated compressor power per Watt of rated evaporative capacity [W/W] Rated compressor power corresponds to the max compressor speed at rated conditions The actual compressor power is obtained by multiplying the rated power with the modification factor calculated by Compressor Power Multiplier Function of Temperature Curve
rated_compressor_power_per_unit_of_rated.title: Rated Compressor Power Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation Cooling is disabled below this temperature
minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature In Cooling Only Mode

maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation Cooling is disabled above this temperature
maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_cooli.title: Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature In Cooling Only Mode

minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation Heating is disabled below this temperature
minimum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature In Heating Only Mode

maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation Heating is disabled below this temperature
maximum_outdoor_air_temperature_in_heati.title: Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature In Heating Only Mode

minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.description: The minimum outdoor temperature below which heat recovery mode will not operate.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.description: The maximum outdoor temperature above which heat recovery mode will not operate.
maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

refrigerant_temperature_control_algorith.title: Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm For Indoor Unit

reference_evaporating_temperature_for_in.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is ConstantTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
reference_evaporating_temperature_for_in.title: Reference Evaporating Temperature For Indoor Unit

reference_condensing_temperature_for_ind.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is ConstantTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
reference_condensing_temperature_for_ind.title: Reference Condensing Temperature For Indoor Unit

variable_evaporating_temperature_minimum.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_evaporating_temperature_minimum.title: Variable Evaporating Temperature Minimum For Indoor Unit

variable_evaporating_temperature_maximum.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Evaporating temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_evaporating_temperature_maximum.title: Variable Evaporating Temperature Maximum For Indoor Unit

variable_condensing_temperature_minimum_.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_condensing_temperature_minimum_.title: Variable Condensing Temperature Minimum For Indoor Unit

variable_condensing_temperature_maximum_.description: This field is used if Refrigerant Temperature Control Algorithm is VariableTemp Condensing temperature is the refrigerant temperature, not air temperature
variable_condensing_temperature_maximum_.title: Variable Condensing Temperature Maximum For Indoor Unit

outdoor_unit_evaporator_rated_bypass_fac.title: Outdoor Unit Evaporator Rated Bypass Factor

outdoor_unit_condenser_rated_bypass_fact.title: Outdoor Unit Condenser Rated Bypass Factor

difference_between_outdoor_unit_evaporat.title: Difference Between Outdoor Unit Evaporating Temperature And Outdoor Air Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

outdoor_unit_heat_exchanger_capacity_rat.description: Enter the rated capacity ratio between the main and supplementary outdoor unit heat exchangers [W/W]
outdoor_unit_heat_exchanger_capacity_rat.title: Outdoor Unit Heat Exchanger Capacity Ratio

outdoor_unit_fan_power_per_unit_of_rated.description: Enter the outdoor unit fan power per Watt of rated evaporative capacity [W/W]
outdoor_unit_fan_power_per_unit_of_rated.title: Outdoor Unit Fan Power Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

outdoor_unit_fan_flow_rate_per_unit_of_r.description: Enter the outdoor unit fan flow rate per Watt of rated evaporative capacity [W/W]
outdoor_unit_fan_flow_rate_per_unit_of_r.title: Outdoor Unit Fan Flow Rate Per Unit Of Rated Evaporative Capacity

outdoor_unit_evaporating_temperature_fun.title: Outdoor Unit Evaporating Temperature Function Of Superheating Curve Name

outdoor_unit_condensing_temperature_func.title: Outdoor Unit Condensing Temperature Function Of Subcooling Curve Name

diameter_of_main_pipe_for_suction_gas.description: used to calculate the piping loss
diameter_of_main_pipe_for_suction_gas.title: Diameter Of Main Pipe For Suction Gas

diameter_of_main_pipe_for_discharge_gas.description: used to calculate the piping loss
diameter_of_main_pipe_for_discharge_gas.title: Diameter Of Main Pipe For Discharge Gas

length_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor_u.description: used to calculate the heat loss of the main pipe
length_of_main_pipe_connecting_outdoor_u.title: Length Of Main Pipe Connecting Outdoor Unit To The First Branch Joint

equivalent_length_of_main_pipe_connectin.description: used to calculate the refrigerant pressure drop of the main pipe
equivalent_length_of_main_pipe_connectin.title: Equivalent Length Of Main Pipe Connecting Outdoor Unit To The First Branch Joint

height_difference_between_outdoor_unit_a.description: Difference between outdoor unit height and indoor unit height Positive means outdoor unit is higher than indoor unit Negative means outdoor unit is lower than indoor unit
height_difference_between_outdoor_unit_a.title: Height Difference Between Outdoor Unit And Indoor Units

crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.description: Enter the value of the resistive heater located in the compressor(s). This heater is used to warm the refrigerant and oil when the compressor is off
crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.title: Crankcase Heater Power Per Compressor

number_of_compressors.description: Enter the total number of compressor. This input is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
number_of_compressors.title: Number Of Compressors

ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.description: Enter the ratio of the first stage compressor to total compressor capacity All other compressors are assumed to be equally sized. This inputs is used only for crankcase heater calculations
ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.title: Ratio Of Compressor Size To Total Compressor Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the crankcase heaters are disabled
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater

defrost_strategy.description: Select a defrost strategy. Reverse cycle reverses the operating mode from heating to cooling to melt frost formation on the condenser coil The resistive strategy uses a resistive heater to melt the frost.
defrost_strategy.title: Defrost Strategy

defrost_control.description: Choose a defrost control type Either use a fixed Timed defrost period or select OnDemand to defrost only when necessary
defrost_control.title: Defrost Control

defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.description: A valid performance curve must be used if ReverseCycle defrost strategy is selected
defrost_energy_input_ratio_modifier_func.title: Defrost Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode Only applicable if timed defrost control is specified
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: Enter the size of the resistive defrost heating element Only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the defrost operation is disabled
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation

initial_heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_f.description: This is used to describe the transition from Cooling Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the fractional capacity available at the start of heat recovery mode. The capacity exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_f.title: Initial Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_time_cons.description: This is used to describe the transition from Cooling Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_cooling_capacity_time_cons.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant

initial_heat_recovery_cooling_energy_fra.description: This is used to describe the transition from Cooling Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the fractional electric consumption rate at the start of heat recovery mode. The electric consumption rate exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_cooling_energy_fra.title: Initial Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Fraction

heat_recovery_cooling_energy_time_consta.description: This is used to describe the transition from Cooling Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_cooling_energy_time_consta.title: Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant

initial_heat_recovery_heating_capacity_f.description: This is used to describe the transition from Heating Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the fractional capacity available at the start of heat recovery mode. The capacity exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Modifier and Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_heating_capacity_f.title: Initial Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_heating_capacity_time_cons.description: This is used to describe the transition from Heating Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_heating_capacity_time_cons.title: Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Time Constant

initial_heat_recovery_heating_energy_fra.description: This is used to describe the transition from Heating Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the fractional electric consumption rate at the start of heat recovery mode. The electric consumption rate exponentially approaches the steady-state value according to the inputs for Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier and Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Time Constant
initial_heat_recovery_heating_energy_fra.title: Initial Heat Recovery Heating Energy Fraction

heat_recovery_heating_energy_time_consta.description: This is used to describe the transition from Heating Only mode to Heat Recovery mode Enter the time constant used to model the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode
heat_recovery_heating_energy_time_consta.title: Heat Recovery Heating Energy Time Constant

compressor_evaporative_capacity_correcti.description: Describe the evaporative capacity difference because of system configuration difference between test bed and real system.
compressor_evaporative_capacity_correcti.title: Compressor Evaporative Capacity Correction Factor

number_of_compressor_loading_index_entri.description: Load index describe the compressor operational state, either a single compressor or multiple compressors, at different load levels. First index represents minimal capacity operation Last index represents full capacity operation
number_of_compressor_loading_index_entri.title: Number Of Compressor Loading Index Entries

controller_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AirLoopHVAC:ControllerList object.
controller_list_name.title: Controller List Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

branch_list_name.description: Name of a BranchList containing all the branches in this air loop
branch_list_name.title: Branch List Name

connector_list_name.description: Name of a ConnectorList containing all the splitters and mixers in the loop
connector_list_name.title: Connector List Name

supply_side_inlet_node_name.description: Name of inlet node where air enters the supply side of the air loop. If this air loop has a return path, then this node is where return air enters the supply side. If this air loop has no return path, then this node is where outdoor air or other air enters the supply side.
supply_side_inlet_node_name.title: Supply Side Inlet Node Name

demand_side_outlet_node_name.description: Name of outlet node where return air leaves the demand side and enters the supply side. Required if this air loop has a return path. Leave this field blank if there is no return.
demand_side_outlet_node_name.title: Demand Side Outlet Node Name

demand_side_inlet_node_names.description: Name of a Node or NodeList containing the inlet node(s) supplying air to zone equipment.
demand_side_inlet_node_names.title: Demand Side Inlet Node Names

supply_side_outlet_node_names.description: Name of a Node or NodeList containing the outlet node(s) supplying air to the demand side.
supply_side_outlet_node_names.title: Supply Side Outlet Node Names

design_return_air_flow_fraction_of_suppl.description: The design return air flow rate as a fraction of supply air flow rate with no exhaust. This can be used to model a pressurized system or set to zero to model a DOAS with no return flow. Use ZoneAirMassFlowConservation to balance zone infiltration and mixing flows.
design_return_air_flow_fraction_of_suppl.title: Design Return Air Flow Fraction Of Supply Air Flow

airloophvac_outdoorairsystem_name.description: Enter the name of an AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem object.
airloophvac_outdoorairsystem_name.title: Airloophvac Outdoorairsystem Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

number_of_airloophvac.description: Enter the number of the AirLoopHAVC served by AirLoopHVAC:DedicatedOutdoorAirSystem
number_of_airloophvac.title: Number Of Airloophvac

zone_mixer_name.description: The name of the exhaust system AirLoopHVAC:ZoneMixer
zone_mixer_name.title: Zone Mixer Name

controller_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AirLoopHVAC:ControllerList object or blank if this object is used in AirLoopHVAC:DedicatedOutdoorAirSystem.
controller_list_name.title: Controller List Name

outdoor_air_equipment_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem:EquipmentList object.
outdoor_air_equipment_list_name.title: Outdoor Air Equipment List Name

return_air_path_outlet_node_name.title: Return Air Path Outlet Node Name

induced_air_outlet_node_or_nodelist_name.title: Induced Air Outlet Node Or Nodelist Name

supply_air_path_inlet_node_name.title: Supply Air Path Inlet Node Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

unitary_system_air_inlet_node_name.title: Unitary System Air Inlet Node Name

unitary_system_air_outlet_node_name.title: Unitary System Air Outlet Node Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: A fan operating mode schedule value of 0 indicates cycling fan mode (supply air fan cycles on and off in tandem with the cooling or heating coil). Any other schedule value indicates continuous fan mode (supply air fan operates continuously regardless of cooling or heating coil operation). Provide a schedule with non-zero values when high humidity control is specified. Leaving this schedule name blank will default to cycling fan mode for the entire simulation period.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate. Only used when fan operating mode is continuous (disregarded for cycling fan mode). This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required (i.e., the DX coil compressor and heating coil are off). If this field is left blank or zero, the supply air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

supply_fan_object_type.description: Fan:ConstantVolume only works with continuous fan operating mode (i.e. supply air fan operating mode schedule values not equal to 0).
supply_fan_object_type.title: Supply Fan Object Type

heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
heating_coil_object_type.title: Heating Coil Object Type

cooling_coil_object_type.description: Only works with DX cooling coil types or Coil:Cooling:DX:VariableSpeed.
cooling_coil_object_type.title: Cooling Coil Object Type

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only Multimode = activate enhanced dehumidification mode as needed and meet sensible load. Valid only with cooling coil type CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted. This control mode allows the heat exchanger to be turned on and off based on the zone dehumidification requirements. A ZoneControl:Humidistat object is also required. CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint. as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid with all cooling coil types. When a heat exchanger assisted Cooling coil is used, the heat exchanger is locked on at all times. A ZoneControl:Humidistat object is also required.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

reheat_coil_object_type.description: Only required if dehumidification control type is "CoolReheat" works with gas, electric, desuperheating, hot water and steam heating coils
reheat_coil_object_type.title: Reheat Coil Object Type

reheat_coil_name.description: Only required if dehumidification control type is "CoolReheat"
reheat_coil_name.title: Reheat Coil Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Enter the availability schedule name. Schedule values of zero denote system is Off. Non-zero schedule values denote system is available to operate.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the system air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the system air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Only used when the supply air fan operating mode is continuous (see field Supply air fan operating mode schedule name). This system air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the coils are off. If this field is left blank or zero, the system air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the outdoor air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Outdoor Air Flow Rate

heating_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the outdoor air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Outdoor Air Flow Rate

no_load_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Only used when the supply air fan operating mode is continuous (see field Supply air fan operating mode schedule name). This outdoor air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the coils are off. If this field is left blank or zero, the outdoor air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate

outdoor_air_flow_rate_multiplier_schedul.description: Enter the name of a schedule that contains multipliers for the outdoor air flow rates. Schedule values must be from 0 to 1. If field is left blank, model assumes multiplier is 1 for the entire simulation period.
outdoor_air_flow_rate_multiplier_schedul.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Multiplier Schedule Name

air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of the unitary system's air inlet node.
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

bypass_duct_mixer_node_name.description: Enter the name of the bypass duct mixer node. This name should be the name of the return air node for the outdoor air mixer associated with this system. This node name must be different from the air inlet node name.
bypass_duct_mixer_node_name.title: Bypass Duct Mixer Node Name

bypass_duct_splitter_node_name.description: Enter the name of the bypass duct splitter node. This splitter air node is the outlet node of the last component in this unitary system. For blow through fan placement, the splitter air node is the outlet node of the heating coil. For draw through fan placement, the splitter node is the outlet node of the supply air fan.
bypass_duct_splitter_node_name.title: Bypass Duct Splitter Node Name

air_outlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of the unitary system's air outlet node.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.description: currently only one type OutdoorAir:Mixer object is available.
outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type

outdoor_air_mixer_name.description: Enter the name of the outdoor air mixer used with this unitary system.
outdoor_air_mixer_name.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Name

supply_air_fan_object_type.description: Specify the type of supply air fan used in this unitary system.
supply_air_fan_object_type.title: Supply Air Fan Object Type

supply_air_fan_name.description: Enter the name of the supply air fan used in this unitary system.
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

supply_air_fan_placement.description: Specify supply air fan placement as either blow through or draw through. BlowThrough means the supply air fan is located before the cooling coil. DrawThrough means the supply air fan is located after the heating coil.
supply_air_fan_placement.title: Supply Air Fan Placement

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule to control the supply air fan. Schedule Name values of zero mean that the supply air fan will cycle off if there is no cooling or heating load in any of the zones being served by this system. Non-zero schedule values mean that the supply air fan will operate continuously even if there is no cooling or heating load in any of the zones being served. If this field is left blank, the supply air fan will operate continuously for the entire simulation period.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

cooling_coil_object_type.description: Specify the type of cooling coil used in this unitary system.
cooling_coil_object_type.title: Cooling Coil Object Type

cooling_coil_name.description: Enter the name of the cooling coil used in this unitary system.
cooling_coil_name.title: Cooling Coil Name

heating_coil_object_type.description: works with DX, gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils Specify the type of heating coil used in this unitary system.
heating_coil_object_type.title: Heating Coil Object Type

heating_coil_name.description: Enter the name of the heating coil used in this unitary system.
heating_coil_name.title: Heating Coil Name

priority_control_mode.description: CoolingPriority = system provides cooling if any zone requires cooling. HeatingPriority = system provides heating if any zone requires heating. ZonePriority = system controlled based on the total number of zones requiring cooling or heating (highest number of zones in cooling or heating determines the system's operating mode). LoadPriority = system provides cooling or heating based on total zone loads.
priority_control_mode.title: Priority Control Mode

minimum_outlet_air_temperature_during_co.description: Specify the minimum outlet air temperature allowed for this unitary system during cooling operation. This value should be less than the maximum outlet air temperature during heating operation.
minimum_outlet_air_temperature_during_co.title: Minimum Outlet Air Temperature During Cooling Operation

maximum_outlet_air_temperature_during_he.description: Specify the maximum outlet air temperature allowed for this unitary system during heating operation. This value should be greater than the minimum outlet air temperature during cooling operation.
maximum_outlet_air_temperature_during_he.title: Maximum Outlet Air Temperature During Heating Operation

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only. Multimode = activate enhanced dehumidification mode as needed and meet sensible load. Valid only with Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode. CoolReheat = cool beyond the Dry-Bulb temperature setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid only with Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode. For all dehumidification controls, the max humidity setpoint on this unitary system's air outlet node is used. This must be set using ZoneControl:Humidistat and SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Maximum, SetpointManager:MultiZone:Humidity:Maximum or SetpointManager:MultiZone:MaximumHumidity:Average objects.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

plenum_or_mixer_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of the bypass duct node connected to a plenum or mixer. This field is required when this HVAC System is connected to a plenum or mixer. This is a different node name than that entered in the Bypass Duct Splitter Node Name field.
plenum_or_mixer_inlet_node_name.title: Plenum Or Mixer Inlet Node Name

minimum_runtime_before_operating_mode_ch.description: This is the minimum amount of time the unit operates in cooling or heating mode before changing modes.
minimum_runtime_before_operating_mode_ch.title: Minimum Runtime Before Operating Mode Change

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

unitary_system_air_inlet_node_name.title: Unitary System Air Inlet Node Name

unitary_system_air_outlet_node_name.title: Unitary System Air Outlet Node Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: A fan operating mode schedule value of 0 indicates cycling fan mode (supply air fan cycles on and off in tandem with the heating coil). Any other schedule value indicates continuous fan mode (supply air fan operates continuously regardless of heating coil operation). Leaving this schedule name blank will default to cycling fan mode for the entire simulation period.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: This value should be > 0 and <= than the fan air flow rate.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

supply_fan_object_type.description: Fan:ConstantVolume only works with continuous fan operating mode (i.e. fan operating mode schedule values are greater than 0).
supply_fan_object_type.title: Supply Fan Object Type

heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
heating_coil_object_type.title: Heating Coil Object Type

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. A schedule value greater than zero (usually 1 is used) indicates that the unit is available to operate as needed. A value less than or equal to zero (usually zero is used) denotes that the unit must be off.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to the fan's maximum flow rate. Only used when fan operating mode is continuous (disregarded for cycling fan mode). This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required (i.e., the DX coil compressor and supplemental heating coil are off). If this field is left blank or zero, the supply air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

supply_air_fan_object_type.description: Fan:ConstantVolume only works with continuous fan operating mode (i.e. fan operating mode schedule values are greater than 0 or the fan operating mode schedule name field is left blank).
supply_air_fan_object_type.title: Supply Air Fan Object Type

supply_air_fan_name.description: Needs to match in the fan object
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

heating_coil_object_type.description: Only works with Coil:Heating:DX:SingleSpeed or Coil:Heating:DX:VariableSpeed or CoilSystem:IntegratedHeatPump:AirSource
heating_coil_object_type.title: Heating Coil Object Type

heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the DX heating coil object
heating_coil_name.title: Heating Coil Name

cooling_coil_object_type.description: Only works with Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed or CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted or Coil:Cooling:DX:VariableSpeed or CoilSystem:IntegratedHeatPump:AirSource
cooling_coil_object_type.title: Cooling Coil Object Type

cooling_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the DX cooling coil object
cooling_coil_name.title: Cooling Coil Name

supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Object Type

supplemental_heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the supplemental heating coil object
supplemental_heating_coil_name.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Name

maximum_supply_air_temperature_from_supp.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature From Supplemental Heater

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Supplemental Heater Operation

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: A fan operating mode schedule value of 0 indicates cycling fan mode (supply air fan cycles on and off in tandem with the cooling or heating coil). Any other schedule value indicates continuous fan mode (supply air fan operates continuously regardless of cooling or heating coil operation). Leaving this schedule name blank will default to cycling fan mode for the entire simulation period.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only Multimode = activate enhanced dehumidification mode as needed and meet sensible load. Valid only with cooling coil type CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted. This control mode allows the heat exchanger to be turned on and off based on the zone dehumidification requirements. A ZoneControl:Humidistat object is also required. CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint. as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid with all cooling coil types. When a heat exchanger assisted Cooling coil is used, the heat exchanger is locked on at all times. A ZoneControl:Humidistat object is also required.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

supply_air_fan_object_type.description: Select the type of supply air fan used in this unitary system.
supply_air_fan_object_type.title: Supply Air Fan Object Type

supply_air_fan_name.description: Enter the name of the supply air fan used in this unitary system.
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

supply_air_fan_placement.description: Select supply air fan placement as either BlowThrough or DrawThrough. BlowThrough means the supply air fan is located before the cooling coil. DrawThrough means the supply air fan is located after the heating coil but before the optional supplemental heating coil.
supply_air_fan_placement.title: Supply Air Fan Placement

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule to control the supply air fan. Schedule values of zero mean that the supply air fan will cycle off if there is no cooling or heating load in the control zone. Non-zero schedule values mean that the supply air fan will operate continuously even if there is no cooling or heating load in the control zone. If this field is left blank, the supply air fan will operate continuously for the entire simulation period.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

heating_coil_object_type.description: Multi Speed DX, Electric, Gas, and Single speed Water and Steam coils
heating_coil_object_type.title: Heating Coil Object Type

minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Needs to match the corresponding minimum outdoor temperature defined in the DX heating coil object.
minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Compressor Operation

cooling_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the DX Cooling Coil object
cooling_coil_name.title: Cooling Coil Name

supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Object Type

supplemental_heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the supplemental heating coil object
supplemental_heating_coil_name.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Name

maximum_supply_air_temperature_from_supp.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature From Supplemental Heater

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Supplemental Heater Operation

design_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.description: If non-zero, then the heat recovery inlet and outlet node names must be entered. Used for heat recovery to an EnergyPlus plant loop.
design_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

heat_recovery_water_inlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Water Inlet Node Name

heat_recovery_water_outlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Water Outlet Node Name

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Only used when the supply air fan operating mode is continuous (see field Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name). This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the coils are off. If this field is left blank or zero, the supply air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

number_of_speeds_for_heating.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for air flow rates. If Heating Coil Object Type is Coil:Heating:Water or Coil:Heating:Steam, this field should be 1.
number_of_speeds_for_heating.title: Number Of Speeds For Heating

number_of_speeds_for_cooling.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for air flow rates.
number_of_speeds_for_cooling.title: Number Of Speeds For Cooling

heating_speed_1_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_speed_1_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Speed 1 Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_speed_2_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_speed_2_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Speed 2 Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_speed_3_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_speed_3_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Speed 3 Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_speed_4_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during heating operation or specify autosize.
heating_speed_4_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Speed 4 Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_speed_1_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_speed_1_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Speed 1 Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_speed_2_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_speed_2_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Speed 2 Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_speed_3_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_speed_3_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Speed 3 Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_speed_4_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the operating supply air flow rate during cooling operation or specify autosize.
cooling_speed_4_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Speed 4 Supply Air Flow Rate

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

supply_air_flow_rate.description: This value should be > 0 and <= than the fan air flow rate.
supply_air_flow_rate.title: Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the water-to-air heat pump heating coil object
heating_coil_name.title: Heating Coil Name

cooling_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the water-to-air heat pump cooling coil object
cooling_coil_name.title: Cooling Coil Name

maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor Suggested value is 2.5 for a typical heat pump
maximum_cycling_rate.title: Maximum Cycling Rate

heat_pump_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's capacity to reach steady state after startup Suggested value is 60 for a typical heat pump
heat_pump_time_constant.title: Heat Pump Time Constant

fraction_of_on_cycle_power_use.description: The fraction of on-cycle power use to adjust the part load fraction based on the off-cycle power consumption due to crankcase heaters, controls, fans, and etc. Suggested value is 0.01 for a typical heat pump
fraction_of_on_cycle_power_use.title: Fraction Of On Cycle Power Use

heat_pump_fan_delay_time.description: Programmed time delay for heat pump fan to shut off after compressor cycle off. Only required when fan operating mode is cycling Enter 0 when fan operating mode is continuous
heat_pump_fan_delay_time.title: Heat Pump Fan Delay Time

supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Object Type

supplemental_heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the supplemental heating coil object
supplemental_heating_coil_name.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Name

maximum_supply_air_temperature_from_supp.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature From Supplemental Heater

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Supplemental Heater Operation

outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_sensor_node.title: Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature Sensor Node Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule that controls fan operation. Schedule values of 0 denote cycling fan operation (fan cycles with cooling or heating coil). Schedule values greater than 0 denote constant fan operation (fan runs continually regardless of coil operation). The fan operating mode defaults to cycling fan operation if this field is left blank.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint. as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid only with Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit or Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:VariableSpeedEquationFit
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type
