This field adjusts the minimum airflow turndown below the design minimum air flow and is intended for use with ASHRAE Standard 170. If this field is left blank, then the turndown minimum air flow fraction value is set to 1 and the model uses the fixed fraction specified in in the field "Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction".
minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.description: Constant = Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow Rate) FixedFlowRate = Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate (a fixed minimum air volume flow rate) Scheduled = Scheduled Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow
zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.title: Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method

constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Constant If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional; if a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the following field are entered, the larger result is used. The values for autosizing are picked up from the Sizing:Zone input fields "Cooling Minimum Air Flow per Zone Floor Area", "Cooling Minimum Air Flow", and "Cooling Minimum Air Flow Fraction". If there is no sizing calculation a default of 0.000762 m3/s-m2 (0.15 cfm/ft2) is used.
constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction

fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is FixedFlowRate. If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional; if a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the previous field are entered, the larger result is used. The values for autosizing are picked up from the Sizing:Zone input fields "Cooling Minimum Air Flow per Zone Floor Area", "Cooling Minimum Air Flow", and "Cooling Minimum Air Flow Fraction". If there is no sizing calculation a default of 0.000762 m3/s-m2 (0.15 cfm/ft2) is used.
fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.title: Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate

minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled Schedule values are fractions, 0.0 to 1.0. If the field Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction is blank, then the average of the minimum and maximum schedule values is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils.
minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Fraction Schedule Name

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the terminal unit will increase flow as needed to meet this outdoor air requirement. If Outdoor Air Flow per Person is non-zero, then the outdoor air requirement will be computed based on the current number of occupants in the zone. At no time will the supply air flow rate exceed the value for Maximum Air Flow Rate. If this field is blank, then the terminal unit will not be controlled for outdoor air flow.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.description: This field adjusts the design minimum flow rate by multiplying it using this schedule of fraction values. This field can be used with any of the three "Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method". Schedule values are fractions, 0.0 to 1.0. This field adjusts the minimum airflow turndown below the design minimum air flow and is intended for use with ASHRAE Standard 170. If this field is left blank, then the turndown minimum air flow fraction value is set to 1.
minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

damper_air_outlet_node_name.description: the outlet node of the damper and the inlet node of the reheat coil this is an internal node to the terminal unit and connects the damper and reheat coil
damper_air_outlet_node_name.title: Damper Air Outlet Node Name

air_inlet_node_name.description: the inlet node to the terminal unit and the damper
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.description: Constant = Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow Rate) FixedFlowRate = Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate (a fixed minimum air volume flow rate) Scheduled = Scheduled Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow
zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.title: Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method

constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Constant If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional; if a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the following field are entered, the larger result is used. The values for autosizing are picked up from the Sizing:Zone input fields "Cooling Minimum Air Flow per Zone Floor Area", "Cooling Minimum Air Flow", and "Cooling Minimum Air Flow Fraction". If there is no sizing calculation a default of 0.000762 m3/s-m2 (0.15 cfm/ft2) is used.
constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction

fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is FixedFlowRate. If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional; if a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the previous field are entered, the larger result is used. The values for autosizing are picked up from the Sizing:Zone input fields "Cooling Minimum Air Flow per Zone Floor Area", "Cooling Minimum Air Flow", and "Cooling Minimum Air Flow Fraction". If there is no sizing calculation a default of 0.000762 m3/s-m2 (0.15 cfm/ft2) is used.
fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.title: Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate

minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled Schedule values are fractions, 0.0 to 1.0. If the field Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction is blank, then the average of the minimum and maximum schedule values is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils.
minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Fraction Schedule Name

maximum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.description: Not used when reheat coil type is gas or electric
maximum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.title: Maximum Hot Water Or Steam Flow Rate

minimum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.description: Not used when reheat coil type is gas or electric
minimum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.title: Minimum Hot Water Or Steam Flow Rate

air_outlet_node_name.description: The outlet node of the terminal unit and the reheat coil. This is also the zone inlet node.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

damper_heating_action.description: Normal means the damper is fixed at the minimum position in heating mode Reverse means the damper can open fully during reheat ReverseWithLimits means the damper will open partially during reheat as specified in the following 2 fields
damper_heating_action.title: Damper Heating Action

maximum_flow_per_zone_floor_area_during_.description: Used only when Reheat Coil Object Type = Coil:Heating:Water and Damper Heating Action = ReverseWithLimits When autocalculating, the maximum flow per zone is set to 0.002032 m3/s-m2 (0.4 cfm/sqft) This optional field limits the maximum flow allowed in reheat mode. At no time will the maximum flow rate calculated here exceed the value of Maximum Air Flow Rate.
maximum_flow_per_zone_floor_area_during_.title: Maximum Flow Per Zone Floor Area During Reheat

maximum_flow_fraction_during_reheat.description: Used only when Reheat Coil Object Type = Coil:Heating:Water and Damper Heating Action = ReverseWithLimits When autocalculating, the maximum flow fraction is set to the ratio of 0.002032 m3/s-m2 (0.4 cfm/sqft) multiplied by the zone floor area and the Maximum Air Flow Rate. This optional field limits the maximum flow allowed in reheat mode. At no time will the maximum flow rate calculated here exceed the value of Maximum Air Flow Rate.
maximum_flow_fraction_during_reheat.title: Maximum Flow Fraction During Reheat

maximum_reheat_air_temperature.description: Specifies the maximum allowable supply air temperature leaving the reheat coil. If left blank, there is no limit and no default. If unknown, 35C (95F) is recommended.
maximum_reheat_air_temperature.title: Maximum Reheat Air Temperature

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the terminal unit will increase flow as needed to meet this outdoor air requirement. If Outdoor Air Flow per Person is non-zero, then the outdoor air requirement will be computed based on the current number of occupants in the zone. At no time will the supply air flow rate exceed the value for Maximum Air Flow Rate. If this field is blank, then the terminal unit will not be controlled for outdoor air flow.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.description: This field adjusts the design minimum flow rate by multiplying it using this schedule of fraction values. This field can be used with any of the three "Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method". Schedule values are fractions, 0.0 to 1.0. This field adjusts the minimum airflow turndown below the design minimum air flow and is intended for use with ASHRAE Standard 170. If this field is left blank, then the turndown minimum air flow fraction value is set to 1.
minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: fraction of cooling air flow rate
zone_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction

air_inlet_node_name.description: The name of the HVAC system node that is the air inlet node for the terminal unit. This is also the air inlet node for the unit's fan.
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

air_outlet_node_name.description: The name of the HVAC system node that is the air outlet node for the terminal unit. This is also the air outlet node for the unit's heating coil's air outlet node. This node is also a zone inlet node.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

maximum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.description: Not used when heating coil type is gas or electric
maximum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.title: Maximum Hot Water Or Steam Flow Rate

minimum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.description: Not used when heating coil type is gas or electric
minimum_hot_water_or_steam_flow_rate.title: Minimum Hot Water Or Steam Flow Rate

minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.description: This field adjusts the fan-off minimum flow rate by multiplying it using this scheduled fraction values. This field is used with "Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction". Schedule values are fractions 0.0 to 1.0. This field adjusts the minimum airflow turndown below the design minimum air flow and is intended for use with ASHRAE Standard 170. If this field is left blank, then the turndown minimum air flow fraction value is set to 1 and the model uses the fixed fraction specified in in the field "Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction".
minimum_air_flow_turndown_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name

coil_name.description: Enter the name of a cooling or heating coil in the primary Air loop.
coil_name.title: Coil Name

coil_object_type.description: Select the type of coil corresponding to the name entered in the field above.
coil_object_type.title: Coil Object Type

air_path_length.description: Enter the air path length (depth) for the coil.
air_path_length.title: Air Path Length

air_path_hydraulic_diameter.description: Enter the hydraulic diameter of this coil. The hydraulic diameter is defined as 4 multiplied by the cross section area divided by perimeter.
air_path_hydraulic_diameter.title: Air Path Hydraulic Diameter

pressure_difference_across_the_component.description: Enter the pressure drop across this component.
pressure_difference_across_the_component.title: Pressure Difference Across The Component

duct_length.description: Enter the length of the duct.
duct_length.title: Duct Length

hydraulic_diameter.description: Enter the hydraulic diameter of the duct. Hydraulic diameter is defined as 4 multiplied by cross section area divided by perimeter
hydraulic_diameter.title: Hydraulic Diameter

cross_section_area.description: Enter the cross section area of the duct.
cross_section_area.title: Cross Section Area

surface_roughness.description: Enter the inside surface roughness of the duct.
surface_roughness.title: Surface Roughness

coefficient_for_local_dynamic_loss_due_t.description: Enter the coefficient used to calculate dynamic losses of fittings (e.g. elbows).
coefficient_for_local_dynamic_loss_due_t.title: Coefficient For Local Dynamic Loss Due To Fitting

heat_transmittance_coefficient_u_factor_.description: conduction only Default value of 0.943 is equivalent to 1.06 m2-K/W (R6) duct insulation.
heat_transmittance_coefficient_u_factor_.title: Heat Transmittance Coefficient U Factor For Duct Wall Construction

overall_moisture_transmittance_coefficie.description: Enter the overall moisture transmittance coefficient including moisture film coefficients at both surfaces.
overall_moisture_transmittance_coefficie.title: Overall Moisture Transmittance Coefficient From Air To Air

outside_convection_coefficient.description: optional. convection coefficient calculated automatically, unless specified
outside_convection_coefficient.title: Outside Convection Coefficient

inside_convection_coefficient.description: optional. convection coefficient calculated automatically, unless specified
inside_convection_coefficient.title: Inside Convection Coefficient

fan_name.description: Enter the name of the fan in the primary air loop.
fan_name.title: Fan Name

heatexchanger_name.description: Enter the name of an air-to-air heat exchanger in the primary Air loop.
heatexchanger_name.title: Heatexchanger Name

heatexchanger_object_type.description: Select the type of heat exchanger corresponding to the name entered in the field above.
heatexchanger_object_type.title: Heatexchanger Object Type

air_path_length.description: Enter the air path length (depth) for the heat exchanger.
air_path_length.title: Air Path Length

air_path_hydraulic_diameter.description: Enter the hydraulic diameter of this heat exchanger. The hydraulic diameter is defined as 4 multiplied by the cross section area divided by perimeter.
air_path_hydraulic_diameter.title: Air Path Hydraulic Diameter

air_mass_flow_coefficient.description: Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference across this component. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent
air_mass_flow_coefficient.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient

air_mass_flow_exponent.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent
air_mass_flow_exponent.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent

effective_leakage_ratio.description: Defined as a ratio of leak flow rate to the maximum flow rate.
effective_leakage_ratio.title: Effective Leakage Ratio

maximum_flow_rate.description: Enter the maximum air flow rate in this air loop.
maximum_flow_rate.title: Maximum Flow Rate

reference_pressure_difference.description: Enter the pressure corresponding to the Effective leakage ratio entered above.
reference_pressure_difference.title: Reference Pressure Difference

air_mass_flow_exponent.description: Enter the exponent used in the air mass flow equation.
air_mass_flow_exponent.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_no_outdoo.description: Enter the air mass flow coefficient at the conditions defined in the Reference Crack Conditions object. Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when no outdoor air flow rate.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_no_outdoo.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When No Outdoor Air Flow At Reference Conditions

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_no_outdoor_a.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when no outdoor air flow rate.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_no_outdoor_a.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When No Outdoor Air Flow

reference_crack_conditions.description: Select a AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions name associated with the air mass flow coefficient entered above.
reference_crack_conditions.title: Reference Crack Conditions

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_no_outdoo.description: Enter the air mass flow coefficient at the conditions defined in the Reference Crack Conditions object. Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when no outdoor air flow rate.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_no_outdoo.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When No Outdoor Air Flow At Reference Conditions

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_no_outdoor_a.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when no outdoor air flow rate.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_no_outdoor_a.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When No Outdoor Air Flow

reference_crack_conditions.description: Select a AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions name associated with the air mass flow coefficient entered above.
reference_crack_conditions.title: Reference Crack Conditions

terminal_unit_name.description: Enter the name of a terminal unit in the AirLoopHVAC.
terminal_unit_name.title: Terminal Unit Name

terminal_unit_object_type.description: Select the type of terminal unit corresponding to the name entered in the field above.
terminal_unit_object_type.title: Terminal Unit Object Type

air_path_length.description: Enter the air path length (depth) for the terminal unit.
air_path_length.title: Air Path Length

air_path_hydraulic_diameter.description: Enter the hydraulic diameter of this terminal unit. The hydraulic diameter is defined as 4 multiplied by the cross section area divided by perimeter.
air_path_hydraulic_diameter.title: Air Path Hydraulic Diameter

maximum_airflow_velocity.description: Used only if Duct Sizing Type = MaximumVelocity or PressureLossWithMaximumVelocity. When MaximumVelocity is entered, duct diameter is calculated at D = flow rate /  cross section area. When PressureLossWithMaximumVelocity is entered, duct diameter is calculated based on  PressureLoss. The value is used to check to ensure the final velocity is less than the maximum value. If greater, final value will be obtained from MaximumVelocity. This field is apply for trunk size, while branch size is based on total pressure drop.
maximum_airflow_velocity.title: Maximum Airflow Velocity

total_pressure_loss_across_supply_trunk.description: Used only if Duct Sizing Type = PressureLoss or PressureLossWithMaximumVelocity. When PressureLoss is entered, duct diameter is calculated using Colebrook's equation   When PressureLossWithMaximumVelocity is entered, duct diameter is calculated based on  PressureLoss. The value is used to check to ensure the final velocity is less than the maximum value. If greater, final value will be obtained from MaximumVelocity. This field is apply for trunk size, while branch size is based on total pressure drop.
total_pressure_loss_across_supply_trunk.title: Total Pressure Loss Across Supply Trunk

total_pressure_loss_across_supply_branch.description: Duct diameter is calculated using Colebrook's equation. When there is no solution,  velocity = 5 m/s is used to calculate duct diameter.
total_pressure_loss_across_supply_branch.title: Total Pressure Loss Across Supply Branch

total_pressure_loss_across_return_trunk.description: Duct diameter is calculated using Colebrook's equation. When there is no solution,  velocity = 5 m/s is used to calculate duct diameter.
total_pressure_loss_across_return_trunk.title: Total Pressure Loss Across Return Trunk

total_pressure_loss_across_return_branch.description: Duct diameter is calculated using Colebrook's equation. When there is no solution,  velocity = 5 m/s is used to calculate duct diameter.
total_pressure_loss_across_return_branch.title: Total Pressure Loss Across Return Branch

node_1_name.description: Enter the name of zone or AirflowNetwork Node.
node_1_name.title: Node 1 Name

node_2_name.description: Enter the name of zone or AirflowNetwork Node.
node_2_name.title: Node 2 Name

component_name.description: Enter the name of an AirflowNetwork component. A component is one of the following AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component objects: Leak, LeakageRatio, Duct, ConstantVolumeFan, Coil, TerminalUnit, ConstantPressureDrop, or HeatExchanger.
component_name.title: Component Name

thermal_zone_name.description: Only used if component = AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component:Duct The zone name is where AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component:Duct is exposed. Leave this field blank if the duct conduction loss is ignored.
thermal_zone_name.title: Thermal Zone Name

component_name_or_node_name.description: Designates node names defined in another object. The node name may occur in air branches. Enter a node name to represent a node already defined in an air loop. Leave this field blank if the Node or Object Type field below is entered as AirLoopHVAC:ZoneMixer, AirLoopHVAC:ZoneSplitter, AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem, or Other.
component_name_or_node_name.title: Component Name Or Node Name

component_object_type_or_node_type.description: Designates Node type for the Node or Component Name defined in the field above. AirLoopHVAC:ZoneMixer -- Represents a AirLoopHVAC:ZoneMixer object. AirLoopHVAC:ZoneSplitter -- Represents a AirLoopHVAC:ZoneSplitter object. AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem -- Represents an AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem object. OAMixerOutdoorAirStreamNode -- Represents an external node used in the OutdoorAir:Mixer OutdoorAir:NodeList -- Represents an external node when a heat exchanger is used before the OutdoorAir:Mixer OutdoorAir:Node -- Represents an external node when a heat exchanger is used before the OutdoorAir:Mixer Other -- none of the above, the Node name already defined in the previous field is part of an air loop.
component_object_type_or_node_type.title: Component Object Type Or Node Type

node_height.description: Enter the reference height used to calculate the relative pressure.
node_height.title: Node Height

node_1_name.description: Enter the name of zone or AirflowNetwork Node.
node_1_name.title: Node 1 Name

node_2_name.description: Enter the name of zone or AirflowNetwork Node.
node_2_name.title: Node 2 Name

component_name.description: Enter the name of an AirflowNetwork component. A component is one of the following AirflowNetwork:Multizone:Component objects: AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:Crack, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:EffectiveLeakageArea, If the next field is specified, this field can be either blank or ignored.
component_name.title: Component Name

airflownetwork_multizone_surface_name.description: Only used when one of two nodes defined above are not located in the same zone, and the input of the Component Name field in this object is ignored
airflownetwork_multizone_surface_name.title: Airflownetwork Multizone Surface Name

roomair_node_airflownetwork_name.description: Enter the name of a RoomAir:Node object defined in a RoomAirSettings:AirflowNetwork object.
roomair_node_airflownetwork_name.title: Roomair Node Airflownetwork Name

zone_name.description: Enter the name of a zone object defined in a AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Zone object.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

node_height.description: Enter the reference height used to calculate the relative pressure
node_height.title: Node Height

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.description: Defined at 1 Pa per meter of crack length. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening (window or door) is closed.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When Opening Is Closed

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening (window or door) is closed.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When Opening Is Closed

type_of_rectangular_large_vertical_openi.description: Select the type of vertical opening: Non-pivoted opening or Horizontally pivoted opening.
type_of_rectangular_large_vertical_openi.title: Type Of Rectangular Large Vertical Opening Lvo

extra_crack_length_or_height_of_pivoting.description: Extra crack length is used for LVO Non-pivoted type with multiple openable parts. Height of pivoting axis is used for LVO Horizontally pivoted type. Specifies window or door characteristics that depend on the LVO type. For Non-pivoted Type (rectangular windows and doors), this field is the extra crack length in meters due to multiple openable parts, if present. Extra here means in addition to the length of the cracks on the top, bottom and sides of the window/door. For Horizontally pivoted Type, this field gives the height of the pivoting axis measured from the bottom of the glazed part of the window (m).
extra_crack_length_or_height_of_pivoting.title: Extra Crack Length Or Height Of Pivoting Axis

number_of_sets_of_opening_factor_data.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for opening factor, discharge coefficient, width factor, height factor, and start height factor.
number_of_sets_of_opening_factor_data.title: Number Of Sets Of Opening Factor Data

opening_factor_1.description: This value must be specified as 0.
opening_factor_1.title: Opening Factor 1

discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through a window or door at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.title: Discharge Coefficient For Opening Factor 1

width_factor_for_opening_factor_1.description: The Width Factor is the opening width divided by the window or door width.
width_factor_for_opening_factor_1.title: Width Factor For Opening Factor 1

height_factor_for_opening_factor_1.description: The Height Factor is the opening height divided by the window or door height.
height_factor_for_opening_factor_1.title: Height Factor For Opening Factor 1

start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_1.description: The Start Height Factor is the Start Height divided by the window or door height. Start Height is the distance between the bottom of the window or door and the bottom of the window or door opening. The sum of the Height Factor and the Start Height Factor must be less than 1.0 in order to have the opening within the window or door dimensions.
start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_1.title: Start Height Factor For Opening Factor 1

opening_factor_2.description: If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 2, this value must be 1.0. If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 3, this value must be less than 1.0. If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 4, this value must be less than the value entered for Opening factor 3 and greater than the value entered for Opening factor 1.
opening_factor_2.title: Opening Factor 2

discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through a window or door at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.title: Discharge Coefficient For Opening Factor 2

width_factor_for_opening_factor_2.description: The Width Factor is the opening width divided by the window or door width.
width_factor_for_opening_factor_2.title: Width Factor For Opening Factor 2

height_factor_for_opening_factor_2.description: The Height Factor is the opening height divided by the window or door height.
height_factor_for_opening_factor_2.title: Height Factor For Opening Factor 2

start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_2.description: The Start Height Factor is the Start Height divided by the window or door height. Start Height is the distance between the bottom of the window or door and the bottom of the window or door opening. The sum of the Height Factor and the Start Height Factor must be less than 1.0 in order to have the opening within the window or door dimensions.
start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_2.title: Start Height Factor For Opening Factor 2

opening_factor_3.description: If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 3, this value must be 1.0. If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 4, this value must be less than 1.0, and greater than value entered for Opening factor 2.
opening_factor_3.title: Opening Factor 3

discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through a window or door at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.title: Discharge Coefficient For Opening Factor 3

width_factor_for_opening_factor_3.description: The Width Factor is the opening width divided by the window or door width.
width_factor_for_opening_factor_3.title: Width Factor For Opening Factor 3

height_factor_for_opening_factor_3.description: The Height Factor is the opening height divided by the window or door height.
height_factor_for_opening_factor_3.title: Height Factor For Opening Factor 3

start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_3.description: The Start Height Factor is the Start Height divided by the window or door height. Start Height is the distance between the bottom of the window or door and the bottom of the window or door opening. The sum of the Height Factor and the Start Height Factor must be less than 1.0 in order to have the opening within the window or door dimensions.
start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_3.title: Start Height Factor For Opening Factor 3

opening_factor_4.description: If Number of Sets of Opening Factor Data = 4, this value must be 1.0
opening_factor_4.title: Opening Factor 4

discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through a window or door at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient_for_opening_factor.title: Discharge Coefficient For Opening Factor 4

width_factor_for_opening_factor_4.description: The Width Factor is the opening width divided by the window or door width.
width_factor_for_opening_factor_4.title: Width Factor For Opening Factor 4

height_factor_for_opening_factor_4.description: The Height Factor is the opening height divided by the window or door height.
height_factor_for_opening_factor_4.title: Height Factor For Opening Factor 4

start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_4.description: The Start Height Factor is the Start Height divided by the window or door height. Start Height is the distance between the bottom of the window or door and the bottom of the window or door opening. The sum of the Height Factor and the Start Height Factor must be less than 1.0 in order to have the opening within the window or door dimensions.
start_height_factor_for_opening_factor_4.title: Start Height Factor For Opening Factor 4

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.description: Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass flow rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening is closed.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When Opening Is Closed

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass flow rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening is closed.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When Opening Is Closed

sloping_plane_angle.description: Sloping plane angle = 90 is equivalent to fully open.
sloping_plane_angle.title: Sloping Plane Angle

discharge_coefficient.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through the opening at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient.title: Discharge Coefficient

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.description: Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening (window or door) is closed.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_opening_i.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When Opening Is Closed

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when opening (window or door) is closed.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_opening_is_c.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When Opening Is Closed

minimum_density_difference_for_two_way_f.description: Enter the minimum density difference above which two-way flow may occur due to stack effect.
minimum_density_difference_for_two_way_f.title: Minimum Density Difference For Two Way Flow

discharge_coefficient.description: The Discharge Coefficient indicates the fractional effectiveness for air flow through a window or door at that Opening Factor.
discharge_coefficient.title: Discharge Coefficient

air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_the_zone_.description: Enter the air mass flow coefficient at the conditions defined in the Reference Crack Conditions object. Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference. Enter the coefficient used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when the fan is off.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_when_the_zone_.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient When The Zone Exhaust Fan Is Off At Reference Conditions

air_mass_flow_exponent_when_the_zone_exh.description: Enter the exponent used in the following equation: Mass Flow Rate = Air Mass Flow Coefficient * (dP)^Air Mass Flow Exponent. Used only when the fan is off.
air_mass_flow_exponent_when_the_zone_exh.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent When The Zone Exhaust Fan Is Off

reference_crack_conditions.description: Select a AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions name associated with the air mass flow coefficient entered above.
reference_crack_conditions.title: Reference Crack Conditions

external_node_height.description: Designates the reference height used to calculate relative pressure.
external_node_height.title: External Node Height

wind_pressure_coefficient_curve_name.description: The name of the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientValues, curve, or table object specifying the wind pressure coefficient.
wind_pressure_coefficient_curve_name.title: Wind Pressure Coefficient Curve Name

symmetric_wind_pressure_coefficient_curv.description: Specify whether the pressure curve is symmetric or not. Specify Yes for curves that should be evaluated from 0 to 180 degrees Specify No for curves that should be evaluated from 0 to 360 degrees
symmetric_wind_pressure_coefficient_curv.title: Symmetric Wind Pressure Coefficient Curve

wind_angle_type.description: Specify whether the angle used to compute the wind pressure coefficient is absolute or relative Specify Relative to compute the angle between the wind direction and the surface azimuth Specify Absolute to use the wind direction angle directly
wind_angle_type.title: Wind Angle Type

reference_temperature.description: Enter the reference temperature under which the surface crack data were obtained. Suggested value 20C.
reference_temperature.title: Reference Temperature

reference_barometric_pressure.description: Enter the reference barometric pressure under which the surface crack data were obtained.
reference_barometric_pressure.title: Reference Barometric Pressure

reference_humidity_ratio.description: Enter the reference humidity ratio under which the surface crack data were obtained.
reference_humidity_ratio.title: Reference Humidity Ratio

air_flow_units.description: Enter the units of the air flow value. VolumetricFlow (m3/s) MassFlow (kg/s)
air_flow_units.title: Air Flow Units

surface_name.description: Enter the name of a heat transfer surface.
surface_name.title: Surface Name

leakage_component_name.description: Enter the name of an Airflow Network leakage component. A leakage component is one of the following AirflowNetwork:Multizone objects: AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:SimpleOpening, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:Crack, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:EffectiveLeakageArea, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:HorizontalOpening, or AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:ZoneExhaustFan. When the zone exhaust fan name is entered, any surface control fields below A3 are ignored when the zone exhaust fan turns on.
leakage_component_name.title: Leakage Component Name

external_node_name.description: Used if Wind Pressure Coefficient Type = Input in the AirflowNetwork:SimulationControl object, otherwise this field may be left blank.
external_node_name.title: External Node Name

window_door_opening_factor_or_crack_fact.description: This field specifies a multiplier for a crack, window, or door.
window_door_opening_factor_or_crack_fact.title: Window Door Opening Factor Or Crack Factor

ventilation_control_mode.description: When Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy, the following fields are used to modulate the Ventilation Open Factor for a window or door opening according to the parent zone's indoor-outdoor temperature or enthalpy difference. When Ventilation Control Mode = AdjacentTemperature or AdjacentEnthalpy, the following fields are used to modulate the Ventilation Open Factor for an interior window or door opening according to temperature or enthalpy difference between the parent zone and the adjacent zone. Constant: controlled by field Venting Schedule Name. NoVent: control will not open window or door during simulation (Ventilation Open Factor = 0). ZoneLevel: control will be controlled by AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Zone Mode.
ventilation_control_mode.title: Ventilation Control Mode

ventilation_control_zone_temperature_set.description: Used only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy.
ventilation_control_zone_temperature_set.title: Ventilation Control Zone Temperature Setpoint Schedule Name

minimum_venting_open_factor.description: Used only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy.
minimum_venting_open_factor.title: Minimum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature
indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.title: Indoor And Outdoor Temperature Difference Lower Limit For Maximum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature. This value must be greater than the corresponding lower value (previous field).
indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.title: Indoor And Outdoor Temperature Difference Upper Limit For Minimum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_l.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Enthalpy. This value must be less than the corresponding upper value (next field).
indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_l.title: Indoor And Outdoor Enthalpy Difference Lower Limit For Maximum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_u.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Enthalpy. This value must be greater than the corresponding lower value (previous field).
indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_u.title: Indoor And Outdoor Enthalpy Difference Upper Limit For Minimum Venting Open Factor

venting_availability_schedule_name.description: Non-zero schedule value means venting is allowed if other venting control conditions are satisfied. A zero (or negative) schedule value means venting is not allowed under any circumstances. The schedule values should be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1. If this schedule is not specified then venting is allowed if other venting control conditions are satisfied. Not used if Ventilation Control Mode = NoVent or ZoneLevel.
venting_availability_schedule_name.title: Venting Availability Schedule Name

occupant_ventilation_control_name.description: Enter the name where Occupancy Ventilation Control is required.
occupant_ventilation_control_name.title: Occupant Ventilation Control Name

equivalent_rectangle_method.description: This field is applied to a non-rectangular window or door. The equivalent shape has the same area as a polygonal window or door.
equivalent_rectangle_method.title: Equivalent Rectangle Method

equivalent_rectangle_aspect_ratio.description: This field is used when UserDefinedAspectRatio is entered in the Equivalent Rectangle Method field.
equivalent_rectangle_aspect_ratio.title: Equivalent Rectangle Aspect Ratio

air_mass_flow_coefficient_at_reference_c.description: Enter the air mass flow coefficient at the conditions defined in the Reference Crack Conditions object. Defined at 1 Pa pressure difference across this crack.
air_mass_flow_coefficient_at_reference_c.title: Air Mass Flow Coefficient At Reference Conditions

air_mass_flow_exponent.description: Enter the air mass flow exponent for the surface crack.
air_mass_flow_exponent.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent

reference_crack_conditions.description: Select a AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions name associated with the air mass flow coefficient entered above.
reference_crack_conditions.title: Reference Crack Conditions

discharge_coefficient.description: Enter the coefficient used in the air mass flow equation.
discharge_coefficient.title: Discharge Coefficient

reference_pressure_difference.description: Enter the pressure difference used to define the air mass flow coefficient and exponent.
reference_pressure_difference.title: Reference Pressure Difference

air_mass_flow_exponent.description: Enter the exponent used in the air mass flow equation.
air_mass_flow_exponent.title: Air Mass Flow Exponent

zone_name.description: Enter the zone name where ventilation control is required.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

ventilation_control_mode.description: When Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy, the following fields are used to modulate the Ventilation Open Factor for all window and door openings in the zone according to the zone's indoor-outdoor temperature or enthalpy difference. Constant: controlled by field Venting Schedule Name. NoVent: control will not open window or door during simulation (Ventilation Open Factor = 0).
ventilation_control_mode.title: Ventilation Control Mode

ventilation_control_zone_temperature_set.description: Used only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy.
ventilation_control_zone_temperature_set.title: Ventilation Control Zone Temperature Setpoint Schedule Name

minimum_venting_open_factor.description: Used only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature or Enthalpy.
minimum_venting_open_factor.title: Minimum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature. This value must be less than the corresponding upper value (next field).
indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.title: Indoor And Outdoor Temperature Difference Lower Limit For Maximum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Temperature. This value must be greater than the corresponding lower value (previous field).
indoor_and_outdoor_temperature_differenc.title: Indoor And Outdoor Temperature Difference Upper Limit For Minimum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_l.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Enthalpy. This value must be less than the corresponding upper value (next field).
indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_l.title: Indoor And Outdoor Enthalpy Difference Lower Limit For Maximum Venting Open Factor

indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_u.description: Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = Enthalpy. This value must be greater than the corresponding lower value (previous field).
indoor_and_outdoor_enthalpy_difference_u.title: Indoor And Outdoor Enthalpy Difference Upper Limit For Minimum Venting Open Factor

venting_availability_schedule_name.description: Non-zero Schedule value means venting is allowed if other venting control conditions are satisfied. A zero (or negative) Schedule value means venting is not allowed under any The Schedule values should be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1. circumstances. If this Schedule is not specified then venting is allowed if other venting control conditions are satisfied. Not used if Ventilation Control Mode = NoVent.
venting_availability_schedule_name.title: Venting Availability Schedule Name

single_sided_wind_pressure_coefficient_a.description: Selecting Advanced results in EnergyPlus calculating modified Wind Pressure Coefficients to account for wind direction and turbulence effects on single sided ventilation rates. Model is only valid for zones with 2 openings, both of which are on a single facade.
single_sided_wind_pressure_coefficient_a.title: Single Sided Wind Pressure Coefficient Algorithm

facade_width.description: This is the whole building width along the direction of the facade of this zone.
facade_width.title: Facade Width

occupant_ventilation_control_name.description: Enter the name where Occupancy Ventilation Control is required.
occupant_ventilation_control_name.title: Occupant Ventilation Control Name

thermal_comfort_low_temperature_curve_na.description: Enter a curve name that represents thermal comfort temperature as a function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature. Up to two curves are allowed if the performance cannot be represented by a single curve. The following two fields are used if two curves are required.
thermal_comfort_low_temperature_curve_na.title: Thermal Comfort Low Temperature Curve Name

thermal_comfort_temperature_boundary_poi.description: This point is used to allow separate low and high thermal comfort temperature curves. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
thermal_comfort_temperature_boundary_poi.title: Thermal Comfort Temperature Boundary Point

thermal_comfort_high_temperature_curve_n.description: Enter a curve name that represents thermal comfort temperature as a function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature. Up to two curves are allowed if the performance cannot be represented by a single curve. If a single performance curve is used, leave this field blank.
thermal_comfort_high_temperature_curve_n.title: Thermal Comfort High Temperature Curve Name

maximum_threshold_for_persons_dissatisfi.title: Maximum Threshold For Persons Dissatisfied Ppd

occupancy_check.description: If Yes, occupancy check will be performed as part of the opening probability check.
occupancy_check.title: Occupancy Check

opening_probability_schedule_name.description: If this field is blank, the opening probability check is bypassed and opening is true.
opening_probability_schedule_name.title: Opening Probability Schedule Name

closing_probability_schedule_name.description: If this field is blank, the closing probability check is bypassed and closing is true.
closing_probability_schedule_name.title: Closing Probability Schedule Name

airflownetwork_control.description: NoMultizoneOrDistribution: Only perform Simple calculations (objects ZoneInfiltration:*, ZoneVentilation:*, ZoneMixing, ZoneCrossMixing, ZoneRefrigerationDoorMixing, ZoneAirBalance:OutdoorAir, ZoneEarthtube, ZoneThermalChimney, and ZoneCoolTower:Shower); MultizoneWithoutDistribution: Use AirflowNetwork objects to simulate multizone Airflows driven by wind during simulation time, and objects of ZoneInfiltration:*, ZoneVentilation:*, ZoneMixing, ZoneCrossMixing ZoneRefrigerationDoorMixing, ZoneAirBalance:OutdoorAir, ZoneEarthtube, ZoneThermalChimney, and ZoneCoolTower:Shower are ignored; MultizoneWithDistributionOnlyDuringFanOperation: Perform distribution system calculations during system fan on time and Simple calculations during system Fan off time; MultizoneWithDistribution: Perform distribution system calculations during system fan on time and multizone Airflow driven by wind during system fan off time.
airflownetwork_control.title: Airflownetwork Control

wind_pressure_coefficient_type.description: Input: User must enter AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientArray, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ExternalNode, and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientValues objects. SurfaceAverageCalculation: used only for rectangular buildings. If SurfaceAverageCalculation is selected, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientArray, AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ExternalNode, and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientValues objects are not used.
wind_pressure_coefficient_type.title: Wind Pressure Coefficient Type

height_selection_for_local_wind_pressure.description: If ExternalNode is selected, the height given in the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ExternalNode object will be used. If OpeningHeight is selected, the surface opening height (centroid) will be used to calculate local wind pressure This field is ignored when the choice of the Wind Pressure Coefficient Type field is SurfaceAverageCalculation.
height_selection_for_local_wind_pressure.title: Height Selection For Local Wind Pressure Calculation

building_type.description: Used only if Wind Pressure Coefficient Type = SurfaceAverageCalculation, otherwise this field may be left blank.
building_type.title: Building Type

maximum_number_of_iterations.description: Determines the maximum number of iterations used to converge on a solution. If this limit is exceeded, the program terminates.
maximum_number_of_iterations.title: Maximum Number Of Iterations

relative_airflow_convergence_tolerance.description: This tolerance is defined as the absolute value of the sum of the mass Flow Rates divided by the sum of the absolute value of the mass Flow Rates. The mass Flow Rates described here refer to the mass Flow Rates at all Nodes in the AirflowNetwork model. The solution converges when both this tolerance and the tolerance in the next field (Absolute Airflow Convergence Tolerance) are satisfied.
relative_airflow_convergence_tolerance.title: Relative Airflow Convergence Tolerance

absolute_airflow_convergence_tolerance.description: This tolerance is defined as the absolute value of the sum of the mass flow rates. The mass flow rates described here refer to the mass flow rates at all nodes in the AirflowNetwork model. The solution converges when both this tolerance and the tolerance in the previous field (Relative Airflow Convergence Tolerance) are satisfied.
absolute_airflow_convergence_tolerance.title: Absolute Airflow Convergence Tolerance

azimuth_angle_of_long_axis_of_building.description: Degrees clockwise from true North. Used only if Wind Pressure Coefficient Type = SurfaceAverageCalculation.
azimuth_angle_of_long_axis_of_building.title: Azimuth Angle Of Long Axis Of Building

ratio_of_building_width_along_short_axis.description: Used only if Wind Pressure Coefficient Type = SurfaceAverageCalculation.
ratio_of_building_width_along_short_axis.title: Ratio Of Building Width Along Short Axis To Width Along Long Axis

height_dependence_of_external_node_tempe.description: If Yes, external node temperature is height dependent. If No, external node temperature is based on zero height.
height_dependence_of_external_node_tempe.title: Height Dependence Of External Node Temperature

solver.description: Select the solver to use for the pressure network solution
solver.title: Solver

allow_unsupported_zone_equipment.description: Set this input to Yes to have zone equipment that are currently unsupported in the AirflowNetwork model allowed in the simulation if present. Setting this field to Yes, allows the following equipments to be modeled along an AirflowNetwork model: ZoneHVAC:Dehumidifier, ZoneHVAC:EnergyRecoveryVentilator, WaterHeater:HeatPump:*.
allow_unsupported_zone_equipment.title: Allow Unsupported Zone Equipment

do_distribution_duct_sizing_calculation.description: Controls duct sizing. See AirflowNetwork:Distribution:DuctSizing for sizing options.
do_distribution_duct_sizing_calculation.title: Do Distribution Duct Sizing Calculation

control_object_name.description: Control names are names of individual control objects
control_object_name.title: Control Object Name

pressure_control_availability_schedule_n.description: Availability schedule name for pressure controller. Schedule value > 0 means the pressure controller is enabled. If this field is blank, then pressure controller is always enabled.
pressure_control_availability_schedule_n.title: Pressure Control Availability Schedule Name

temperature_difference_off_limit.description: Defaults to Temperature Difference On Limit.
temperature_difference_off_limit.title: Temperature Difference Off Limit

hvac_air_loop_name.description: Enter the name of an AirLoopHVAC or HVACTemplate:System:* object. If this field is left blank, hybrid ventilation managers will be simulated for zone equipment control
hvac_air_loop_name.title: Hvac Air Loop Name

control_zone_name.description: the zone name should be a zone where a thermostat or humidistat is located served by an air primary loop.
control_zone_name.title: Control Zone Name

ventilation_control_mode_schedule_name.description: The Ventilation control mode contains appropriate integer control types. 0 - uncontrolled (Natural ventilation and HVAC system are controlled by themselves) 1 = Temperature control 2 = Enthalpy control 3 = Dewpoint control 4 = Outdoor ventilation air control 5 = Operative temperature control with 80% adaptive comfort acceptability limits 6 = Operative temperature control with 90% adaptive comfort acceptability limits 7 = Carbon dioxide control
ventilation_control_mode_schedule_name.title: Ventilation Control Mode Schedule Name

use_weather_file_rain_indicators.description: If Yes, ventilation is shutoff when there is rain If No, there is no rain control
use_weather_file_rain_indicators.title: Use Weather File Rain Indicators

maximum_wind_speed.description: this is the wind speed above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_wind_speed.title: Maximum Wind Speed

minimum_outdoor_temperature.description: this is the outdoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff
minimum_outdoor_temperature.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature

maximum_outdoor_temperature.description: this is the outdoor temperature above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_outdoor_temperature.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature

minimum_outdoor_enthalpy.description: this is the outdoor Enthalpy below which ventilation is shutoff
minimum_outdoor_enthalpy.title: Minimum Outdoor Enthalpy

maximum_outdoor_enthalpy.description: this is the outdoor Enthalpy above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_outdoor_enthalpy.title: Maximum Outdoor Enthalpy

minimum_outdoor_dewpoint.description: this is the outdoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = 3
minimum_outdoor_dewpoint.title: Minimum Outdoor Dewpoint

maximum_outdoor_dewpoint.description: this is the outdoor dewpoint above which ventilation is shutoff Applicable only if Ventilation Control Mode = 3
maximum_outdoor_dewpoint.title: Maximum Outdoor Dewpoint

minimum_outdoor_ventilation_air_schedule.description: Used only if Ventilation Control Mode = 4
minimum_outdoor_ventilation_air_schedule.title: Minimum Outdoor Ventilation Air Schedule Name

opening_factor_function_of_wind_speed_cu.description: linear curve = a + b*WS quadratic curve = a + b*WS + c*WS**2 WS = wind speed (m/s)
opening_factor_function_of_wind_speed_cu.title: Opening Factor Function Of Wind Speed Curve Name

airflownetwork_control_type_schedule_nam.description: The schedule is used to incorporate operation of AirflowNetwork large opening objects and HVAC system operation.
airflownetwork_control_type_schedule_nam.title: Airflownetwork Control Type Schedule Name

simple_airflow_control_type_schedule_nam.description: The schedule is used to incorporate operation of simple airflow objects and HVAC system operation. The simple airflow objects are Ventilation and Mixing only
simple_airflow_control_type_schedule_nam.title: Simple Airflow Control Type Schedule Name

zoneventilation_object_name.description: This field has not been instrumented to work with global Zone or Zone List names option for Ventilation:DesignFlowRate. In order to use, you must enter the single <Ventilation:DesignFlowRate> name in this field. If it is a part of a global ventilation assignment the name will be <Zone Name> <global Ventilation:DesignFlowRate> name. The other ZoneVentilation:* and ZoneMixing objects controlled in the same AirLoopHVAC will work in the same way as this ventilation object.
zoneventilation_object_name.title: Zoneventilation Object Name

minimum_hvac_operation_time.description: Minimum operation time when HVAC system is forced on.
minimum_hvac_operation_time.title: Minimum Hvac Operation Time

minimum_ventilation_time.description: Minimum ventilation time when natural ventilation is forced on.
minimum_ventilation_time.title: Minimum Ventilation Time

applicability_schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always active
applicability_schedule_name.title: Applicability Schedule Name

control_type.description: When AvailabilityManager:NightCycle is used in the zone component availability manager assignment list, the key choices for Control Type would only be StayOff and CycleOnControlZone
control_type.title: Control Type

control_zone_or_zone_list_name.description: When AvailabilityManager:NightCycle is used in the zone component availability manager assignment list, the Control Zone Name should be the name of the zone in which the zone component is.
control_zone_or_zone_list_name.title: Control Zone Or Zone List Name

cooling_control_zone_or_zone_list_name.title: Cooling Control Zone Or Zone List Name

heating_control_zone_or_zone_list_name.title: Heating Control Zone Or Zone List Name

heating_zone_fans_only_zone_or_zone_list.title: Heating Zone Fans Only Zone Or Zone List Name

ventilation_temperature_schedule_name.description: One zone temperature must be above this scheduled temperature for night ventilation to be enabled
ventilation_temperature_schedule_name.title: Ventilation Temperature Schedule Name

ventilation_temperature_difference.description: The outdoor air temperature minus the control zone temperature must be greater than the ventilation delta T
ventilation_temperature_difference.title: Ventilation Temperature Difference

ventilation_temperature_low_limit.description: Night ventilation is disabled if any conditioned zone served by the system falls below this temperature
ventilation_temperature_low_limit.title: Ventilation Temperature Low Limit

night_venting_flow_fraction.description: the fraction (could be > 1) of the design system Flow Rate at which night ventilation will be done
night_venting_flow_fraction.title: Night Venting Flow Fraction

control_zone_name.description: When AvailabilityManager:NightVentilation is used in the zone component availability manager assignment list, the Control Zone Name should be the name of the zone in which the zone component is.
control_zone_name.title: Control Zone Name

maximum_value_for_optimum_start_time.description: this is the maximum number of hours that a system can start before occupancy
maximum_value_for_optimum_start_time.title: Maximum Value For Optimum Start Time

constant_start_time.description: this is the number of hours before occupancy for a system
constant_start_time.title: Constant Start Time

number_of_previous_days.description: this is the number of days that their actual temperature gradients will be used in the AdaptiveTemperatureGradient method
number_of_previous_days.title: Number Of Previous Days

nominal_thermal_efficiency.description: Based on the higher heating value of fuel.
nominal_thermal_efficiency.title: Nominal Thermal Efficiency

normalized_boiler_efficiency_curve_name.description: Linear, Quadratic and Cubic efficiency curves are solely a function of PLR. All other efficiency curve types are a function of PLR and boiler water temperature. Linear = C1 + C2*PLR Quadratic = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 Cubic = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 + C4*PLR^3 Biquadratic = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 + C4*T + C5*T^2 + C6*PLR*T QuadraticLinear = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 + (C4 + C5*PLR + C6*PLR^2)*T BiCubic = C1+C2*PLR+C3*PLR^2+C4*T+C5*T^2+C6*PLR*T+C7*PLR^3+C8*T^3+C9*PLR^2*T+C10*PLR*T^2 TriQuadratic curves are not allowed. PLR = part-load ratio T = boiler water temperature (either entering or leaving).
normalized_boiler_efficiency_curve_name.title: Normalized Boiler Efficiency Curve Name

boiler_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the boiler. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by boiler to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by boiler to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
boiler_flow_mode.title: Boiler Flow Mode

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

coefficient_1_of_fuel_use_function_of_pa.title: Coefficient 1 Of Fuel Use Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_2_of_fuel_use_function_of_pa.title: Coefficient 2 Of Fuel Use Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_3_of_fuel_use_function_of_pa.title: Coefficient 3 Of Fuel Use Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

pressure_drop_curve_name.description: Optional field to include this branch in plant pressure drop calculations This field is only relevant for branches in PlantLoops and CondenserLoops Air loops do not account for pressure drop using this field Valid curve types are: Curve:Functional:PressureDrop or one of Curve:{Linear,Quadratic,Cubic,Exponent}')
pressure_drop_curve_name.title: Pressure Drop Curve Name

terrain.description: Country=FlatOpenCountry | Suburbs=CountryTownsSuburbs | City=CityCenter | Ocean=body of water (5km) | Urban=Urban-Industrial-Forest
terrain.title: Terrain

loads_convergence_tolerance_value.description: Loads Convergence Tolerance Value is a change in load from one warmup day to the next
loads_convergence_tolerance_value.title: Loads Convergence Tolerance Value

maximum_number_of_warmup_days.description: EnergyPlus will only use as many warmup days as needed to reach convergence tolerance. This field's value should NOT be set less than 25.
maximum_number_of_warmup_days.title: Maximum Number Of Warmup Days

minimum_number_of_warmup_days.description: The minimum number of warmup days that produce enough temperature and flux history to start EnergyPlus simulation for all reference buildings was suggested to be 6. However this can lead to excessive run times as warmup days can be repeated needlessly. For faster execution rely on the convergence criteria to detect when warmup is complete. When this field is greater than the maximum warmup days defined previous field the maximum number of warmup days will be reset to the minimum value entered here. Warmup days will be set to be the value you entered. The default is 1.
minimum_number_of_warmup_days.title: Minimum Number Of Warmup Days

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Non-blank only if the field Outside Boundary Condition is Surface, Zone, OtherSideCoefficients or OtherSideConditionsModel If Surface, specify name of corresponding surface in adjacent zone or specify current surface name for internal partition separating like zones If Zone, specify the name of the corresponding zone and the program will generate the corresponding interzone surface If Foundation, specify the name of the corresponding Foundation object and the program will calculate the heat transfer appropriately If OtherSideCoefficients, specify name of SurfaceProperty:OtherSideCoefficients If OtherSideConditionsModel, specify name of SurfaceProperty:OtherSideConditionsModel
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

view_factor_to_ground.description: From the exterior of the surface Unused if one uses the "reflections" options in Solar Distribution in Building input unless a DaylightingDevice:Shelf or DaylightingDevice:Tubular object has been specified. autocalculate will automatically calculate this value from the tilt of the surface
view_factor_to_ground.title: View Factor To Ground

number_of_vertices.description: shown with 120 vertex coordinates -- extensible object "extensible" -- duplicate last set of x,y,z coordinates (last 3 fields), remembering to remove ; from "inner" fields. for clarity in any error messages, renumber the fields as well. (and changing z terminator to a comma "," for all but last one which needs a semi-colon ";") vertices are given in GlobalGeometryRules coordinates -- if relative, all surface coordinates are "relative" to the Zone Origin. If world, then building and zone origins are used for some internal calculations, but all coordinates are given in an "absolute" system.
number_of_vertices.title: Number Of Vertices
