reference_cooling_mode_cop.description: Efficiency of the chiller compressor (cooling output/compressor energy input).
reference_cooling_mode_cop.title: Reference Cooling Mode Cop

reference_cooling_mode_leaving_chilled_w.title: Reference Cooling Mode Leaving Chilled Water Temperature

reference_cooling_mode_entering_condense.title: Reference Cooling Mode Entering Condenser Fluid Temperature

reference_cooling_mode_leaving_condenser.title: Reference Cooling Mode Leaving Condenser Water Temperature

reference_heating_mode_cooling_capacity_.description: During simultaneous cooling-heating mode, this ratio is relative to the Reference Cooling Mode Cooling Capacity (Evaporator capacity at simul clg-htg mode ref condition)/ (Evaporator capacity at cooling mode ref condition)
reference_heating_mode_cooling_capacity_.title: Reference Heating Mode Cooling Capacity Ratio

reference_heating_mode_cooling_power_inp.description: During simultaneous cooling-heating mode, this ratio is relative to the Reference Cooling Mode COP (Power at simultaneous clg-htg mode reference condition)/ (Power at cooling mode reference condition)
reference_heating_mode_cooling_power_inp.title: Reference Heating Mode Cooling Power Input Ratio

reference_heating_mode_leaving_chilled_w.title: Reference Heating Mode Leaving Chilled Water Temperature

reference_heating_mode_leaving_condenser.title: Reference Heating Mode Leaving Condenser Water Temperature

reference_heating_mode_entering_condense.title: Reference Heating Mode Entering Condenser Fluid Temperature

heating_mode_entering_chilled_water_temp.title: Heating Mode Entering Chilled Water Temperature Low Limit

chilled_water_flow_mode_type.description: Sets chilled water flow rate to either constant or variable.
chilled_water_flow_mode_type.title: Chilled Water Flow Mode Type

compressor_motor_efficiency.description: Fraction of compressor electrical energy that must be rejected by the condenser. Enter 1.0 or leave this field blank for a hermetic compressor.
compressor_motor_efficiency.title: Compressor Motor Efficiency

cooling_mode_temperature_curve_condenser.description: Sets the second independent variable in the three temperature dependent performance curves to either the leaving or entering condenser water temperature. Manufacturers express the performance of their chillers using either the leaving condenser water temperature (to the tower) or the entering condenser water temperature (from the tower). Cooling mode is generally a stronger function of Entering Condenser Fluid Temperature
cooling_mode_temperature_curve_condenser.title: Cooling Mode Temperature Curve Condenser Water Independent Variable

cooling_mode_cooling_capacity_function_o.description: Cooling capacity as a function of leaving chilled water temperature and either entering or leaving condenser fluid temperature curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*TCond + e*TCond**2 + f*CWS*TCond If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = EnteringCondenser, TCond = ECT If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = LeavingCondenser, TCond = LCT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
cooling_mode_cooling_capacity_function_o.title: Cooling Mode Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

cooling_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of supply (leaving) chilled water temperature and leaving condenser fluid temperature. EIR = 1/COP. curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*TCond + e*TCond**2 + f*CWS*TCond If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = EnteringCondenser, TCond = ECT If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = LeavingCondenser, TCond = LCT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
cooling_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.title: Cooling Mode Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

cooling_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) EIR = 1/COP Bicubic = a + b*TCond + c*TCond**2 + d*PLR + e*PLR**2 + f*TCond*PLR +g*0 + h*PLR**3+i*0+j*0 If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = EnteringCondenser, TCond = ECT If ClgModeCondWaterCurveInputVariable = LeavingCondenser, TCond = LCT Normally, a bicubic curve here should be in terms of LCT rather than ECT Also, a bicubic curve is more applicable for variable-speed compressor motor drives or Quadratic = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady-state capacity) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
cooling_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.title: Cooling Mode Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

cooling_mode_cooling_capacity_optimum_pa.description: Optimum part load ratio where the chiller is most efficient. Must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio. The Min/Max PLR are taken from their associated EIR-FPLR curve references.
cooling_mode_cooling_capacity_optimum_pa.title: Cooling Mode Cooling Capacity Optimum Part Load Ratio

heating_mode_temperature_curve_condenser.description: Sets the second independent variable in the three temperature dependent performance curves to either the leaving or entering condenser water temperature. Manufacturers express the performance of their chillers using either the leaving condenser water temperature (to the tower) or the entering condenser water temperature (from the tower). Heating mode (or Simul Clg/Htg Load) should be a function of Leaving Condenser Fluid Temperature Only use EnteringCondenser as a last resort in case no performance data exists for LeavingCondenser
heating_mode_temperature_curve_condenser.title: Heating Mode Temperature Curve Condenser Water Independent Variable

heating_mode_cooling_capacity_function_o.description: Evaporator (cooling) capacity as a function of leaving chilled water temperature and leaving condenser fluid temperature when in heating or simultaneous cool/heat mode curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*TCond + e*TCond**2 + f*CWS*TCond If independent variable = EnteringCondenser, TCond = ECT If independent variable = LeavingCondenser, TCond = LCT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
heating_mode_cooling_capacity_function_o.title: Heating Mode Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of leaving chilled water temperature when in heating or simultaneous cool/heat mode and leaving condenser fluid temperature. EIR = 1/COP. curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*TCond + e*TCond**2 + f*CWS*TCond If independent variable = EnteringCondenser, TCond = ECT If independent variable = LeavingCondenser, TCond = LCT CWS = leaving chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
heating_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.title: Heating Mode Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) when in heating or simultaneous cool/heat mode EIR = 1/COP Bicubic = a + b*LCT + c*LCT**2 + d*PLR + e*PLR**2 + f*LCT*PLR + g*0 + h*PLR**3 + i*0 + j*0 Normally, a bicubic curve here should be in terms of LCT rather than ECT Also, a bicubic curve is more applicable for variable-speed compressor motor drives or Quadratic = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady-state capacity) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
heating_mode_electric_input_to_cooling_o.title: Heating Mode Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

heating_mode_cooling_capacity_optimum_pa.description: Optimum part load ratio where the chiller is most efficient when in heating or simultaneous cool/heat mode. Must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio. The Min/Max PLR are taken from their associated EIR-FPLR curve references.
heating_mode_cooling_capacity_optimum_pa.title: Heating Mode Cooling Capacity Optimum Part Load Ratio

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

heating_to_cooling_capacity_ratio.description: A positive fraction that represents the ratio of the heating capacity divided by the cooling capacity at rated conditions.
heating_to_cooling_capacity_ratio.title: Heating To Cooling Capacity Ratio

fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the ratio of the instantaneous fuel used divided by the cooling capacity at rated conditions.
fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio.title: Fuel Input To Cooling Output Ratio

fuel_input_to_heating_output_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the ratio of the instantaneous fuel used divided by the nominal heating capacity.
fuel_input_to_heating_output_ratio.title: Fuel Input To Heating Output Ratio

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the ratio of the instantaneous electricity used divided by the cooling capacity at rated conditions. If the chiller is both heating and cooling only the cooling electricity is used.
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio

electric_input_to_heating_output_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the ratio of the instantaneous electricity used divided by the nominal heating capacity. If the chiller is both heating and cooling only the cooling electricity is used.
electric_input_to_heating_output_ratio.title: Electric Input To Heating Output Ratio

minimum_part_load_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the minimum cooling output possible when operated continually at rated temperature conditions divided by the nominal cooling capacity at those same conditions. If the load on the chiller is below this fraction the chiller will cycle.
minimum_part_load_ratio.title: Minimum Part Load Ratio

maximum_part_load_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the maximum cooling output possible at rated temperature conditions divided by the nominal cooling capacity at those same conditions. If greater than 1.0, the chiller is typically thought of as capable of being overloaded.
maximum_part_load_ratio.title: Maximum Part Load Ratio

optimum_part_load_ratio.description: The positive fraction that represents the optimal cooling output at rated temperature conditions divided by the nominal cooling capacity at those same conditions. It represents the most desirable operating point for the chiller.
optimum_part_load_ratio.title: Optimum Part Load Ratio

design_entering_condenser_water_temperat.description: The temperature of the water entering the condenser of the chiller when operating at design conditions. This is usually based on the temperature delivered by the cooling tower in a water cooled application.
design_entering_condenser_water_temperat.title: Design Entering Condenser Water Temperature

design_leaving_chilled_water_temperature.description: The temperature of the water leaving the evaporator of the chiller when operating at design conditions also called the chilled water supply temperature or leaving chilled water temperature.
design_leaving_chilled_water_temperature.title: Design Leaving Chilled Water Temperature

design_chilled_water_flow_rate.description: For variable volume this is the max flow & for constant flow this is the flow.
design_chilled_water_flow_rate.title: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate

design_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: The water flow rate at design conditions through the condenser. This field is not used for Condenser Type = AirCooled
design_condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Design Condenser Water Flow Rate

design_hot_water_flow_rate.description: The water flow rate at design conditions through the heater side.
design_hot_water_flow_rate.title: Design Hot Water Flow Rate

cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: The CoolCapFT curve represents the fraction of the cooling capacity of the chiller as it varies by temperature. The curve is normalized so that at design conditions the value of the curve should be 1.0. This is a biquadratic curve with the input variables being the leaving chilled water temperature and either the entering or leaving condenser water temperature.
cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_funct.description: The curve represents the fraction of the fuel input to the chiller at full load as it varies by temperature. The curve is normalized so that at design conditions the value of the curve should be 1.0. This is a biquadratic curve with the input variables being the leaving chilled water temperature and either the entering or leaving condenser water temperature.
fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_funct.title: Fuel Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_funct.description: The curve represents the fraction of the fuel input to the chiller as the load on the chiller varies but the operating temperatures remain at the design values. The curve is normalized so that at full load the value of the curve should be 1.0. The curve is usually linear or quadratic.
fuel_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_funct.title: Fuel Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: The curve represents the fraction of the electricity to the chiller at full load as it varies by temperature. The curve is normalized so that at design conditions the value of the curve should be 1.0. This is a biquadratic curve with the input variables being the leaving chilled water temperature and either the entering or leaving condenser water temperature.
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: The curve represents the fraction of the electricity to the chiller as the load on the chiller varies but the operating temperatures remain at the design values. The curve is normalized so that at full load the value of the curve should be 1.0. The curve is usually linear or quadratic.
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

heating_capacity_function_of_cooling_cap.description: The curve represents how the heating capacity of the chiller varies with cooling capacity when the chiller is simultaneous heating and cooling. The curve is normalized so an input of 1.0 represents the nominal cooling capacity and an output of 1.0 represents the full heating capacity (see the Heating to cooling capacity ratio input) The curve is usually linear or quadratic.
heating_capacity_function_of_cooling_cap.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Cooling Capacity Curve Name

fuel_input_to_heat_output_ratio_during_h.description: When the chiller is operating as only a heater, this curve is used to represent the fraction of fuel used as the heating load varies. It is normalized so that a value of 1.0 is the full heating capacity. The curve is usually linear or quadratic and will probably be similar to a boiler curve for most chillers.
fuel_input_to_heat_output_ratio_during_h.title: Fuel Input To Heat Output Ratio During Heating Only Operation Curve Name

temperature_curve_input_variable.description: Sets the second independent variable in the three temperature dependent performance curves to either the leaving or entering condenser water temperature. Manufacturers express the performance of their chillers using either the leaving condenser water temperature (to the tower) or the entering condenser water temperature (from the tower).
temperature_curve_input_variable.title: Temperature Curve Input Variable

condenser_type.description: The condenser can either be air cooled or connected to a cooling tower.
condenser_type.title: Condenser Type

chilled_water_temperature_lower_limit.description: The chilled water supply temperature below which the chiller will shut off.
chilled_water_temperature_lower_limit.title: Chilled Water Temperature Lower Limit

thermal_energy_input_to_heating_output_r.title: Thermal Energy Input To Heating Output Ratio

coefficient_1_of_the_hot_water_or_steam_.title: Coefficient 1 Of The Hot Water Or Steam Use Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_2_of_the_hot_water_or_steam_.title: Coefficient 2 Of The Hot Water Or Steam Use Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_3_of_the_hot_water_or_steam_.title: Coefficient 3 Of The Hot Water Or Steam Use Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_1_of_the_pump_electric_use_p.description: The pump electric use coefficients specify the pumping power as a Fraction of Nominal pumping power
coefficient_1_of_the_pump_electric_use_p.title: Coefficient 1 Of The Pump Electric Use Part Load Ratio Curve

coefficient_2_of_the_pump_electric_use_p.title: Coefficient 2 Of The Pump Electric Use Part Load Ratio Curve

chilled_water_outlet_temperature_lower_l.title: Chilled Water Outlet Temperature Lower Limit

chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

generator_heat_source_type.description: The Generator side of the chiller can be connected to a hot water or steam plant where the generator inlet and outlet nodes are connected to a plant loop. If the generator is not connected to a plant loop, and the generator inlet/outlet nodes are not used, this field should be specified as steam or left blank. When a plant is not used, the model assumes steam as the heat source.
generator_heat_source_type.title: Generator Heat Source Type

degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_generator.description: This field is not used when the generator inlet/outlet nodes are not specified or the generator is connected to a hot water loop.
degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_generator.title: Degree Of Subcooling In Steam Generator

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

design_condenser_inlet_temperature.description: Used only when condenser flow rate is autosized.
design_condenser_inlet_temperature.title: Design Condenser Inlet Temperature

condenser_inlet_temperature_lower_limit.description: Provides warnings when entering condenser temperature is below minimum. Capacity is not adjusted when entering condenser temperature is below minimum.
condenser_inlet_temperature_lower_limit.title: Condenser Inlet Temperature Lower Limit

chilled_water_outlet_temperature_lower_l.description: Capacity is adjusted when leaving chilled water temperature is below minimum.
chilled_water_outlet_temperature_lower_l.title: Chilled Water Outlet Temperature Lower Limit

design_chilled_water_flow_rate.description: For variable flow this is the max flow & for constant flow this is the flow.
design_chilled_water_flow_rate.title: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate

chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

generator_heat_input_function_of_part_lo.title: Generator Heat Input Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

pump_electric_input_function_of_part_loa.title: Pump Electric Input Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

generator_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the generator inlet node name which connects this chiller to a steam or hot water plant, otherwise leave this field blank. Generator nodes are used to model heat input to the chiller.
generator_inlet_node_name.title: Generator Inlet Node Name

generator_outlet_node_name.description: Enter the generator outlet node name which connects this chiller to a steam or hot water plant, otherwise leave this field blank. Generator nodes are used to model heat input to the chiller.
generator_outlet_node_name.title: Generator Outlet Node Name

capacity_correction_function_of_condense.description: Curve which shows the change in normalized capacity to changes in condenser temperature.
capacity_correction_function_of_condense.title: Capacity Correction Function Of Condenser Temperature Curve Name

capacity_correction_function_of_chilled_.description: Curve which shows the change in normalized capacity to changes in leaving chilled water temperature.
capacity_correction_function_of_chilled_.title: Capacity Correction Function Of Chilled Water Temperature Curve Name

capacity_correction_function_of_generato.description: Used when generator fluid type is hot water Curve which shows the change in normalized capacity to changes in generator temperature.
capacity_correction_function_of_generato.title: Capacity Correction Function Of Generator Temperature Curve Name

generator_heat_input_correction_function.description: Curve which shows the change in normalized heat input to changes in condenser temperature.
generator_heat_input_correction_function.title: Generator Heat Input Correction Function Of Condenser Temperature Curve Name

generator_heat_input_correction_function.description: Curve which shows the change in normalized heat input to changes in leaving chilled water temperature.
generator_heat_input_correction_function.title: Generator Heat Input Correction Function Of Chilled Water Temperature Curve Name

generator_heat_source_type.description: The Generator side of the chiller can be connected to a hot water or steam plant where the generator inlet and outlet nodes are connected to a plant loop. When a plant is not used, the model assumes steam as the heat source.
generator_heat_source_type.title: Generator Heat Source Type

design_generator_fluid_flow_rate.description: For variable flow this is the max flow and for constant flow this is the flow.
design_generator_fluid_flow_rate.title: Design Generator Fluid Flow Rate

temperature_lower_limit_generator_inlet.description: Provides warnings when entering generator temperature is below minimum. Capacity is not adjusted when entering generator temperature is below minimum.
temperature_lower_limit_generator_inlet.title: Temperature Lower Limit Generator Inlet

degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_generator.description: This field is not used when the generator inlet/outlet nodes are not specified or the generator is connected to a hot water loop.
degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_generator.title: Degree Of Subcooling In Steam Generator

degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_condensate.description: This field is not used when the generator inlet/outlet nodes are not specified or the generator is connected to a hot water loop.
degree_of_subcooling_in_steam_condensate.title: Degree Of Subcooling In Steam Condensate Loop

sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

design_chilled_water_flow_rate.title: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate

design_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: This field is not used for Condenser Type = AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled
design_condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Design Condenser Water Flow Rate

design_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, The heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the chiller is not operating.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.description: This optional field is the fraction of total rejected heat that can be recovered at full load. Also used to autosize Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate as a fraction of Design Condenser Water Flow Rate.
condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.title: Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction

turbine_engine_efficiency.description: This optional field is the nominal turbine engine efficiency and is used when Gas Turbine Engine Capacity is set to Autosize
turbine_engine_efficiency.title: Turbine Engine Efficiency

design_chilled_water_flow_rate.description: For variable volume this is the maximum flow and for constant flow this is the flow.
design_chilled_water_flow_rate.title: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate

design_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: This field is not used for Condenser Type = AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled
design_condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Design Condenser Water Flow Rate

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the chiller is not operating.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.description: This optional field is the fraction of total rejected heat that can be recovered at full load
condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.title: Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_inlet_high_temperature_lim.description: This optional schedule of temperatures will turn off heat recovery if inlet exceeds the value
heat_recovery_inlet_high_temperature_lim.title: Heat Recovery Inlet High Temperature Limit Schedule Name

heat_recovery_leaving_temperature_setpoi.description: This optional field provides control over the heat recovery Using this triggers a model more suited to series bundle and chillers with higher temperature heat recovery If this field is not used, the bundles are modeled as being in parallel
heat_recovery_leaving_temperature_setpoi.title: Heat Recovery Leaving Temperature Setpoint Node Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

representation_file_name.description: The name of the ASHRAE205 RS0001 (chiller) representation file
representation_file_name.title: Representation File Name

rated_capacity.description: Not yet implemented / reserved for future use. Full load capacity at AHRI 550/590 test conditions. Used to scale representation data.
rated_capacity.title: Rated Capacity

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized flow rates.
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

ambient_temperature_zone_name.description: Any energy imbalance on the chiller results in heat added to this zone.
ambient_temperature_zone_name.title: Ambient Temperature Zone Name

ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.title: Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name

chilled_water_maximum_requested_flow_rat.title: Chilled Water Maximum Requested Flow Rate

chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

oil_cooler_inlet_node_name.description: Use if the oil cooler uses an external cooling loop, otherwise the oil cooler will add heat to the ambient conditions (i.e., it is air cooled).
oil_cooler_inlet_node_name.title: Oil Cooler Inlet Node Name

auxiliary_inlet_node_name.description: Use if the auxiliary components of the chiller use an external cooling loop, otherwise the auxiliary components will add heat to the ambient conditions (i.e., they are air cooled).
auxiliary_inlet_node_name.title: Auxiliary Inlet Node Name

heat_recovery_inlet_node_name.description: Not yet implemented / reserved for future use. Heat recovery is not yet within scope of ASHRAE Stanard 205.
heat_recovery_inlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Inlet Node Name

heat_recovery_outlet_node_name.description: Not yet implemented / reserved for future use. Heat recovery is not yet within scope of ASHRAE Stanard 205.
heat_recovery_outlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Outlet Node Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

reference_cop.description: Efficiency of the chiller compressor (cooling output/compressor energy input). Condenser fan power should not be included here.
reference_cop.title: Reference Cop

reference_condenser_fluid_flow_rate.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled when Heat Recovery is specified
reference_condenser_fluid_flow_rate.title: Reference Condenser Fluid Flow Rate

cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: Cooling capacity as a function of CW supply temp and entering condenser temp curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*ECT + e*ECT**2 + f*CWS*ECT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of temperature EIR = 1/COP curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*ECT + e*ECT**2 + f*CWS*ECT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) ECT = entering condenser fluid temperature(C)
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) EIR = 1/COP quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 is typical, other univariate curves may be used PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity)
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

minimum_part_load_ratio.description: Part load ratio below which the chiller starts cycling on/off to meet the load. Must be less than or equal to Maximum Part Load Ratio.
minimum_part_load_ratio.title: Minimum Part Load Ratio

maximum_part_load_ratio.description: Maximum allowable part load ratio. Must be greater than or equal to Minimum Part Load Ratio.
maximum_part_load_ratio.title: Maximum Part Load Ratio

optimum_part_load_ratio.description: Optimum part load ratio where the chiller is most efficient. Must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio.
optimum_part_load_ratio.title: Optimum Part Load Ratio

minimum_unloading_ratio.description: Part load ratio where the chiller can no longer unload and false loading begins. Minimum unloading ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio.
minimum_unloading_ratio.title: Minimum Unloading Ratio

condenser_inlet_node_name.description: Not required if air-cooled or evaporatively-cooled
condenser_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Inlet Node Name

condenser_outlet_node_name.description: Not required if air-cooled or evaporatively-cooled
condenser_outlet_node_name.title: Condenser Outlet Node Name

condenser_fan_power_ratio.description: Use for air-cooled or evaporatively-cooled condensers. Ratio of condenser fan power to reference chiller capacity
condenser_fan_power_ratio.title: Condenser Fan Power Ratio

fraction_of_compressor_electric_consumpt.description: Fraction of compressor electrical energy that must be rejected by the condenser. Enter a value of 1.0 when modeling hermetic chillers. For open chillers, enter the compressor motor efficiency. This value should be greater than 0.6 for practical applications.
fraction_of_compressor_electric_consumpt.title: Fraction Of Compressor Electric Consumption Rejected By Condenser

leaving_chilled_water_lower_temperature_.title: Leaving Chilled Water Lower Temperature Limit

chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

design_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.description: If non-zero, then the heat recovery inlet and outlet node names must be entered. Heat recovery is only available with Condenser Type = WaterCooled.
design_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the chiller is not operating.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.description: This optional field is the fraction of total rejected heat that can be recovered at full load
condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.title: Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction

heat_recovery_inlet_high_temperature_lim.description: This optional schedule of temperatures will turn off heat recovery if inlet exceeds the value
heat_recovery_inlet_high_temperature_lim.title: Heat Recovery Inlet High Temperature Limit Schedule Name

heat_recovery_leaving_temperature_setpoi.description: This optional field provides control over the heat recovery Using this triggers a model more suited to series bundle and chillers with higher temperature heat recovery If this field is not used, the bundles are modeled as being in parallel
heat_recovery_leaving_temperature_setpoi.title: Heat Recovery Leaving Temperature Setpoint Node Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

reference_cop.description: Efficiency of the chiller compressor (cooling output/compressor energy input). Condenser fan power should not be included here.
reference_cop.title: Reference Cop

cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: Cooling capacity as a function of supply (leaving) chilled water temperature and leaving condenser fluid temperature curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*LCT + e*LCT**2 + f*CWS*LCT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C)
cooling_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of supply (leaving) chilled water temperature and leaving condenser fluid temperature. EIR = 1/COP. curve = a + b*CWS + c*CWS**2 + d*LCT + e*LCT**2 + f*CWS*LCT CWS = supply (leaving) chilled water temperature(C) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C)
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: Two curve types are available: Type LeavingCondenserWaterTemperature: based on the leaving condenser water temperature. Type Lift: based on the normalized lift, which is the temperature difference between the leaving condenser water temperature and the leaving evaporator water temperature.
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Type

electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.description: Electric Input Ratio (EIR) as a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) EIR = 1/COP The form of this curve is based on the input for Electric Input to Cooling Output RatioFunction of Part Load Ratio Curve Type Type=LeavingCondenserWaterTemperature: Calculated based on LCT and PLR Curve object type should be Curve:Bicubic or Table:Lookup Bicubic curve = a + b*LCT + c*LCT**2 + d*PLR + e*PLR**2 + f*LCT*PLR + g*0 + h*PLR**3 + i*0 + j*0 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity) LCT = leaving condenser fluid temperature(C) Type=Lift: Calculated based on dT*, Tdev* and PLR Curve object type should be Curve:ChillerPartLoadWithLiftCurves or Table:Lookup ChillerPartLoadWithLiftCurves curve = a + b*(dT*) + c*(dT*)**2 + d*PLR + e*PLR**2 + f*(dT*)*PLR + g*(dT*)**3 + h*PLR**3 + i*(dT*)**2*PLR + j*(dT*)*PLR**2 + k*(dT*)**2*PLR**2 + l*(Tdev*)*PLR**3 x = dT* = normalized fractional Lift = dT / dTref y = PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity) z = Tdev* = normalized Tdev = Tdev / dTref Where: dT = Lift = Leaving Condenser Water Temperature - Leaving Chilled Water Temperature dTref = dT at the reference condition Tdev = Leaving Chilled Water Temperature - Reference Chilled Water Temperature
electric_input_to_cooling_output_ratio_f.title: Electric Input To Cooling Output Ratio Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

design_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: This field is not used for Condenser Type = AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled

fuel_use_curve_name.description: Curve is a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 PLR = Ratio of evaporator heat transfer rate to nominal capacity
fuel_use_curve_name.title: Fuel Use Curve Name

jacket_heat_recovery_curve_name.description: Curve is a function of Part Load Ratio (PLR) curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 PLR = Ratio of evaporator heat transfer rate to nominal capacity
jacket_heat_recovery_curve_name.title: Jacket Heat Recovery Curve Name
