chiller_flow_mode.description: Select operating mode for fluid flow through the chiller. "NotModulated" is for either variable or constant pumping with flow controlled by the external plant system. "ConstantFlow" is for constant pumping with flow controlled by chiller to operate at full design flow rate. "LeavingSetpointModulated" is for variable pumping with flow controlled by chiller to vary flow to target a leaving temperature setpoint.
chiller_flow_mode.title: Chiller Flow Mode

maximum_temperature_for_heat_recovery_at.title: Maximum Temperature For Heat Recovery At Heat Recovery Outlet Node

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the chiller is not operating.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.description: This optional field is the fraction of total rejected heat that can be recovered at full load. Also used to autosize Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate as a fraction of Design Condenser Water Flow Rate.
condenser_heat_recovery_relative_capacit.title: Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction

gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.title: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Gross Rated Cooling Cop

rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to Rated total Cooling capacity, Rated SHR and Rated COP
rated_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Air Flow Rate

fraction_of_air_flow_bypassed_around_coi.description: Fraction of Rated Air Flow Rate which bypasses the cooling coil in this performance mode. The remaining portion of the flow should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity. This is used to model face-split coils on multi-stage units or bypass dampers. If total flow rate varies during simulation, the same fraction is bypassed.
fraction_of_air_flow_bypassed_around_coi.title: Fraction Of Air Flow Bypassed Around Coil

total_cooling_capacity_function_of_tempe.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
total_cooling_capacity_function_of_tempe.title: Total Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

total_cooling_capacity_function_of_flow_.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
total_cooling_capacity_function_of_flow_.title: Total Cooling Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_function_of_temperatu.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
energy_input_ratio_function_of_temperatu.title: Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_function_of_flow_frac.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
energy_input_ratio_function_of_flow_frac.title: Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity)
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.title: Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.title: Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor, which occurs at 50% run time fraction. Suggested value is 3; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
maximum_cycling_rate.title: Maximum Cycling Rate

latent_capacity_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's latent capacity to reach steady state after startup. Suggested value is 45; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
latent_capacity_time_constant.title: Latent Capacity Time Constant

condenser_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
condenser_air_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Air Inlet Node Name

evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use
evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump
evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Rated Power Consumption

sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_temperat.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) entering temperature can be outside air or pretreated air.
sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_temperat.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_flow_fra.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_flow_fra.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

dx_cooling_coil_system_inlet_node_name.title: Dx Cooling Coil System Inlet Node Name

dx_cooling_coil_system_outlet_node_name.title: Dx Cooling Coil System Outlet Node Name

dx_cooling_coil_system_sensor_node_name.title: Dx Cooling Coil System Sensor Node Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only Multimode = activate enhanced dehumidification mode as needed and meet sensible load. If no sensible load exists, and Run on Latent Load = Yes, and a latent load exists, the unit will operate to meet the latent load. Valid only with Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode or CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted. CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint. as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid for all coil types. For all dehumidification controls, the max humidity setpoint on the Sensor Node is used. SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Maximum, SetpointManager:MultiZone:Humidity:Maximum, or SetpointManager:MultiZone:MaximumHumidity:Average, and SetpointManager:OutdoorAirPretreat (optional) objects.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

run_on_sensible_load.description: If Yes, unit will run if there is a sensible load. If No, unit will not run if there is only a sensible load. Dehumidification controls will be active if specified.
run_on_sensible_load.title: Run On Sensible Load

run_on_latent_load.description: If Yes, unit will run if there is a latent load. even if there is no sensible load. If No, unit will not run only if there is a latent load. Dehumidification controls will be active if specified.
run_on_latent_load.title: Run On Latent Load

use_outdoor_air_dx_cooling_coil.description: This input field is designed for use with DX cooling coils with low air flow to capacity ratio range (100 - 300 cfm/ton). Typical application is 100% dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS). Other air loop or zone HVAC systems with low flow to capacity ratio range may also use this input field. If Yes, the DX cooling coil runs as 100% DOAS DX coil or low flow to capacity ratio range. If No, the DX cooling coil runs as a regular DX coil. If left blank the default is regular DX coil.
use_outdoor_air_dx_cooling_coil.title: Use Outdoor Air Dx Cooling Coil

outdoor_air_dx_cooling_coil_leaving_mini.description: DX cooling coil leaving minimum air temperature defines the minimum DX cooling coil leaving air temperature that should be maintained to avoid frost formation. This input field is optional and only used along with the input field above.
outdoor_air_dx_cooling_coil_leaving_mini.title: Outdoor Air Dx Cooling Coil Leaving Minimum Air Temperature

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only. Valid with all cooling coil types. When a heat exchanger assisted cooling coil is used, the heat exchanger is locked on at all times. Multimode = activate water coil and meet sensible load. If no sensible load exists, and Run on Latent Load = Yes, and a latent load exists, the coil will operate to meet the latent load. If the latent load cannot be met the heat exchanger will be activated. Valid only with cooling coil type CoilSystem:Cooling:Water:HeatExchangerAssisted. CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint. Valid with all cooling coil types. When a heat exchanger assisted cooling coil is used, the heat exchanger is locked on at all times. For all dehumidification controls, the max humidity setpoint on the Sensor Node is used. SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Maximum, SetpointManager:MultiZone:Humidity:Maximum, or SetpointManager:MultiZone:MaximumHumidity:Average, and SetpointManager:OutdoorAirPretreat (optional) objects.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

run_on_sensible_load.description: If Yes, unit will run if there is a sensible load. If No, unit will not run if there is only a sensible load. Dehumidification controls will be active if specified.
run_on_sensible_load.title: Run On Sensible Load

run_on_latent_load.description: If Yes, unit will run if there is a latent load. even if there is no sensible load. If No, unit will not run if there is only a latent load. Dehumidification controls will be active if specified.
run_on_latent_load.title: Run On Latent Load

minimum_air_to_water_temperature_offset.description: Coil will turn on as required when inlet air temperature is above water temperature by amount of offset. To model a waterside economizer connect to condenser loop and increase offset as desired.
minimum_air_to_water_temperature_offset.title: Minimum Air To Water Temperature Offset

economizer_lockout.description: Yes means that the heat exchanger will be locked out (off)
economizer_lockout.title: Economizer Lockout

minimum_water_loop_temperature_for_heat_.description: Only used for heat recovery loops. Loop will turn off below this temperature.
minimum_water_loop_temperature_for_heat_.title: Minimum Water Loop Temperature For Heat Recovery

companion_coil_used_for_heat_recovery.description: Only used for heat recovery loops. Entering a coil name indicates a heat recovery loop is specified. Coil listed is connected in series with this objects coil on demand side branch of a plant loop. A dedicated plant loop with no supply side equipment, other than a pump, is currently required. Only Coil:Cooling:Water coil type is currently allowed for heat recovery loops.
companion_coil_used_for_heat_recovery.title: Companion Coil Used For Heat Recovery

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

supply_hot_water_flow_sensor_node_name.title: Supply Hot Water Flow Sensor Node Name

space_cooling_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:Cooling:DX:VariableSpeed object.
space_cooling_coil_name.title: Space Cooling Coil Name

space_heating_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:Heating:DX:VariableSpeed object.
space_heating_coil_name.title: Space Heating Coil Name

dedicated_water_heating_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object.
dedicated_water_heating_coil_name.title: Dedicated Water Heating Coil Name

scwh_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object.
scwh_coil_name.title: Scwh Coil Name

scdwh_cooling_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:Cooling:DX:VariableSpeed object.
scdwh_cooling_coil_name.title: Scdwh Cooling Coil Name

scdwh_water_heating_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object.
scdwh_water_heating_coil_name.title: Scdwh Water Heating Coil Name

shdwh_heating_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:Heating:DX:VariableSpeed object.
shdwh_heating_coil_name.title: Shdwh Heating Coil Name

shdwh_water_heating_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object.
shdwh_water_heating_coil_name.title: Shdwh Water Heating Coil Name

indoor_temperature_limit_for_scwh_mode.description: Indoor Temperature above which Indoor Overcooling is Allowed during Cooling Operation
indoor_temperature_limit_for_scwh_mode.title: Indoor Temperature Limit For Scwh Mode

ambient_temperature_limit_for_scwh_mode.description: Ambient Temperature above which Indoor Overcooling is Allowed during Cooling Operation
ambient_temperature_limit_for_scwh_mode.title: Ambient Temperature Limit For Scwh Mode

indoor_temperature_above_which_wh_has_hi.description: Indoor Temperature above which Water Heating has the higher priority and Space Heating Call Can be ignored.
indoor_temperature_above_which_wh_has_hi.title: Indoor Temperature Above Which Wh Has Higher Priority

ambient_temperature_above_which_wh_has_h.description: Ambient Temperature above which Water Heating has the higher priority and Space Heating Call Can be ignored.
ambient_temperature_above_which_wh_has_h.title: Ambient Temperature Above Which Wh Has Higher Priority

flag_to_indicate_load_control_in_scwh_mo.description: 0: match space cooling load in SCWH mode, 1: match water heating load in SCWH mode
flag_to_indicate_load_control_in_scwh_mo.title: Flag To Indicate Load Control In Scwh Mode

minimum_speed_level_for_scwh_mode.title: Minimum Speed Level For Scwh Mode

maximum_water_flow_volume_before_switchi.title: Maximum Water Flow Volume Before Switching From Scdwh To Scwh Mode

minimum_speed_level_for_scdwh_mode.title: Minimum Speed Level For Scdwh Mode

maximum_running_time_before_allowing_ele.title: Maximum Running Time Before Allowing Electric Resistance Heat Use During Shdwh Mode

minimum_speed_level_for_shdwh_mode.title: Minimum Speed Level For Shdwh Mode

availability_schedule_name.description: Schedule value > 0 means the coil is available. If this field is blank, the coil is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

condenser_zone_name.description: This input field is name of a conditioned or unconditioned zone where the secondary coil (condenser) of a DX system or heat pump is to be placed. This is an optional input field specified only when the user desires to reject the condenser heat into a zone. The heat rejected is modeled as internal sensible heat gain of the zone.
condenser_zone_name.title: Condenser Zone Name

condenser_inlet_node_name.description: This is the name of an air node in the simulation. This may be an explicitly defined outdoor air node, or it may be a separate air node.
condenser_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Inlet Node Name

condenser_outlet_node_name.description: This is the name of an air node in the simulation.
condenser_outlet_node_name.title: Condenser Outlet Node Name

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

evaporative_condenser_supply_water_stora.title: Evaporative Condenser Supply Water Storage Tank Name

rated_gross_total_cooling_capacity.description: Total (sensible+latent) cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat. Rating point: air entering the evaporator coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb. gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat
rated_gross_total_cooling_capacity.title: Rated Gross Total Cooling Capacity

rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, Rated SHR and Rated COP. Should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and 0.00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity.
rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate

rated_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use.
rated_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Condenser Air Flow Rate

maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling Rate for the compressor, which occurs at 50% run time fraction. Suggested value is 3; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
maximum_cycling_rate.title: Maximum Cycling Rate

ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.title: Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

latent_capacity_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's latent capacity to reach steady state after startup. Suggested value is 45; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
latent_capacity_time_constant.title: Latent Capacity Time Constant

nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.title: Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

apply_latent_degradation_to_speeds_great.title: Apply Latent Degradation To Speeds Greater Than 1

nominal_evaporative_condenser_pump_power.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump
nominal_evaporative_condenser_pump_power.title: Nominal Evaporative Condenser Pump Power

nominal_speed_number.description: Must be lower than or equal to the highest speed number. If blank, defaults to the highest speed number used.
nominal_speed_number.title: Nominal Speed Number

minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Compressor Operation

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

unit_internal_static_air_pressure.description: Enter pressure drop for the unit containing the coil. This value is only used to calculate Energy Efficiency Ratio (EER), Integrated Energy Efficiency Ratio (IEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
unit_internal_static_air_pressure.title: Unit Internal Static Air Pressure

evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_capac.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off.
evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_capac.title: Evaporative Condenser Basin Heater Capacity

evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_setpo.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_setpo.title: Evaporative Condenser Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_opera.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
evaporative_condenser_basin_heater_opera.title: Evaporative Condenser Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

base_operating_mode.description: Operating Mode 1 is always used as the base design operating mode.
base_operating_mode.title: Base Operating Mode

alternative_operating_mode_1.description: The alternative operating mode is used for enhanced dehumidification. If this is blank, the coil will always operate in the base operating mode. If an alternate mode is defined here, the coil will use the enhanced mode if activated by the parent system controls.
alternative_operating_mode_1.title: Alternative Operating Mode 1

alternative_operating_mode_2.description: The alternative operating mode is used for enhanced dehumidification. If this is blank, the coil will always operate in the base operating mode or Alternative Mode 1. If both Alternative Operating Mode 1 and Mode 2 are defined here, the coil will perform both Subcool and Reheat modes for enhanced dehumidification. Alternative Operating Mode 1 is used as Subcool mode, and Alternative Operating Mode 2 is used as Reheat mode.
alternative_operating_mode_2.title: Alternative Operating Mode 2

gross_total_cooling_capacity_fraction.description: Ratio of capacity at this speed to the operating mode Rated Gross Total Cooling Capacity
gross_total_cooling_capacity_fraction.title: Gross Total Cooling Capacity Fraction

evaporator_air_flow_rate_fraction.description: Ratio of capacity at this speed to the operating mode Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate
evaporator_air_flow_rate_fraction.title: Evaporator Air Flow Rate Fraction

condenser_air_flow_rate_fraction.description: Ratio of condenser air flow at this speed to the operating mode Rated Condenser Air Flow Rate
condenser_air_flow_rate_fraction.title: Condenser Air Flow Rate Fraction

gross_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
gross_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Gross Sensible Heat Ratio

gross_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and condenser fan. Does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input.
gross_cooling_cop.title: Gross Cooling Cop

active_fraction_of_coil_face_area.description: The fraction of the cooling coil face which is actively cooled at this speed. For non-split-face coils, this should be 1.0.
active_fraction_of_coil_face_area.title: Active Fraction Of Coil Face Area

2017_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2017_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.title: 2017 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

2023_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2023 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER2), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2023_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.title: 2023 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_pump_power_fractio.description: Ratio of evaporative condenser pump power at this speed to the operating mode Nominal Evaporative Condenser Pump Power
evaporative_condenser_pump_power_fractio.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Power Fraction

total_cooling_capacity_modifier_function.description: biquadratic curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb quadratic curve = a + b*edb + c*edb**2 wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
total_cooling_capacity_modifier_function.title: Total Cooling Capacity Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

total_cooling_capacity_modifier_function.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = Fraction of the full load flow
total_cooling_capacity_modifier_function.title: Total Cooling Capacity Modifier Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_modifier_function_of_.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
energy_input_ratio_modifier_function_of_.title: Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_modifier_function_of_.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = Fraction of the full load flow
energy_input_ratio_modifier_function_of_.title: Energy Input Ratio Modifier Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity)
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_power_input.description: Recoverable waste heat at full load and rated conditions
rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_power_input.title: Rated Waste Heat Fraction Of Power Input

waste_heat_modifier_function_of_temperat.description: curve = a + b*cdb + c*cdb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*cdb*edb cdb = entering condenser dry-bulb temperature (C) edb = entering coil dry-bulb temperature (C)
waste_heat_modifier_function_of_temperat.title: Waste Heat Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) entering temperature can be outside air or pretreated air. If this curve is used and the Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function of Flow Fraction (SHRFFF) Curve Name is blank, the SHRFFF is assumed to be a constant value of 1.0.
sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow If this curve is used and the Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function of Temperature Curve Name (SHRFT) Curve Name is blank, the SHRFT is assumed to be a constant value of 1.0.
sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

condenser_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
condenser_air_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Air Inlet Node Name

minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Compressor Operation

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

apply_part_load_fraction_to_speeds_great.title: Apply Part Load Fraction To Speeds Greater Than 1

apply_latent_degradation_to_speeds_great.title: Apply Latent Degradation To Speeds Greater Than 1

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

number_of_speeds.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for coil capacity, SHR, COP, flow rate, and associated curves.
number_of_speeds.title: Number Of Speeds

speed_1_gross_rated_total_cooling_capaci.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat Gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat Rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb Speed 1 is defined as low speed
speed_1_gross_rated_total_cooling_capaci.title: Speed 1 Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

speed_1_gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) Sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
speed_1_gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Speed 1 Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

speed_1_gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
speed_1_gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Speed 1 Gross Rated Cooling Cop

speed_1_rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, rated SHR and rated COP should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity
speed_1_rated_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 1 Rated Air Flow Rate

2017_speed_1_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2017_speed_1_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.title: 2017 Speed 1 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

2023_speed_1_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2023 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER2), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2023_speed_1_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.title: 2023 Speed 1 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

speed_1_total_cooling_capacity_function_.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
speed_1_total_cooling_capacity_function_.title: Speed 1 Total Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_1_total_cooling_capacity_function_.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = Fraction of the full load Flow
speed_1_total_cooling_capacity_function_.title: Speed 1 Total Cooling Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_1_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
speed_1_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.title: Speed 1 Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_1_energy_input_ratio_function_of_f.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
speed_1_energy_input_ratio_function_of_f.title: Speed 1 Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_1_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity)
speed_1_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.title: Speed 1 Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

speed_1_nominal_time_for_condensate_remo.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_1_nominal_time_for_condensate_remo.title: Speed 1 Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

speed_1_ratio_of_initial_moisture_evapor.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation Rate from the Cooling Coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the Coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_1_ratio_of_initial_moisture_evapor.title: Speed 1 Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

speed_1_maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor, which occurs at 50% run time fraction. Suggested value is 3; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_1_maximum_cycling_rate.title: Speed 1 Maximum Cycling Rate

speed_1_latent_capacity_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's latent capacity to reach steady state after startup. Suggested value is 45; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_1_latent_capacity_time_constant.title: Speed 1 Latent Capacity Time Constant

speed_1_rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_pow.description: Recoverable waste heat at full load and rated conditions
speed_1_rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_pow.title: Speed 1 Rated Waste Heat Fraction Of Power Input

speed_1_waste_heat_function_of_temperatu.description: curve = a + b*odb + c*odb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*odb*db odb = Outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) db = entering coil dry-bulb temperature (C)
speed_1_waste_heat_function_of_temperatu.title: Speed 1 Waste Heat Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_1_evaporative_condenser_air_flow_r.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use
speed_1_evaporative_condenser_air_flow_r.title: Speed 1 Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

speed_1_rated_evaporative_condenser_pump.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump at high speed
speed_1_rated_evaporative_condenser_pump.title: Speed 1 Rated Evaporative Condenser Pump Power Consumption

speed_2_gross_rated_total_cooling_capaci.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat Gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat Rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
speed_2_gross_rated_total_cooling_capaci.title: Speed 2 Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

speed_2_gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) Sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
speed_2_gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Speed 2 Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

speed_2_gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
speed_2_gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Speed 2 Gross Rated Cooling Cop

speed_2_rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, rated SHR and rated COP should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity for Speed 2.
speed_2_rated_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 2 Rated Air Flow Rate

2017_speed_2_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2017_speed_2_rated_evaporator_fan_power_.title: 2017 Speed 2 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER2), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.

speed_2_total_cooling_capacity_function_.title: Speed 2 Total Cooling Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_2_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)

speed_2_energy_input_ratio_function_of_f.title: Speed 2 Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_2_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (Cooling load/steady state capacity)
speed_2_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.title: Speed 2 Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

speed_2_nominal_time_for_condensate_remo.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_2_nominal_time_for_condensate_remo.title: Speed 2 Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

speed_2_ratio_of_initial_moisture_evapor.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_2_ratio_of_initial_moisture_evapor.title: Speed 2 Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

speed_2_maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor, which occurs at 50% run time fraction. Suggested value is 3; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_2_maximum_cycling_rate.title: Speed 2 Maximum Cycling Rate

speed_2_latent_capacity_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's latent capacity to reach steady state after startup. Suggested value is 45; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
speed_2_latent_capacity_time_constant.title: Speed 2 Latent Capacity Time Constant

speed_2_rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_pow.description: Recoverable waste heat at full load and rated conditions
speed_2_rated_waste_heat_fraction_of_pow.title: Speed 2 Rated Waste Heat Fraction Of Power Input

speed_2_waste_heat_function_of_temperatu.description: curve = a + b*odb + c*odb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*odb*db odb = Outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) db = entering coil dry-bulb temperature (C)

zone_name_for_condenser_placement.description: This input field is name of a conditioned or unconditioned zone where the secondary coil (condenser) of DX system or a heat pump is to be placed. This is an optional input field specified only when user desires to reject the condenser heat into a zone. The heat rejected is modelled as internal sensible heat gain of the zone.
zone_name_for_condenser_placement.title: Zone Name For Condenser Placement

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.title: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
gross_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Gross Rated Cooling Cop

rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, Rated SHR and Rated COP should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity
rated_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Air Flow Rate

2017_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.description: Enter the evaporator fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240.  The test conditions vary external static pressure based on total cooling capacity. This value is only used to calculate Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER), Energy Efficiency Ratio (EER), Integrated Energy Efficiency Ratio (IEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity which will be outputs in the EnergyPlus eio file. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2017_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.title: 2017 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
2023_rated_evaporator_fan_power_per_volu.title: 2023 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

condenser_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
condenser_air_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Air Inlet Node Name

evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use
evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump
evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Rated Power Consumption

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_temperat.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the DX cooling coil (C) entering temperature can be outside air or pretreated air.
sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_temperat.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_flow_fra.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
sensible_heat_ratio_function_of_flow_fra.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

report_ashrae_standard_127_performance_r.description: when this input field is specified as Yes then the program calculates the net cooling capacity and total electric power input of DX cooling coils per ANSI/ASHRAE 127.
report_ashrae_standard_127_performance_r.title: Report Ashrae Standard 127 Performance Ratings

zone_name_for_condenser_placement.description: This input field is name of a conditioned or unconditioned zone where the secondary coil (condenser) of DX system or a heat pump is to be placed. This is an optional input field specified only when user desires to reject the condenser heat into a zone. The heat rejected is modelled as internal sensible heat gain of the zone.
zone_name_for_condenser_placement.title: Zone Name For Condenser Placement

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

operation_mode_control_schedule_name.description: This field is used if the control method is set to ScheduledModes Schedule values control operating mode: 0=off, 1=cooling only, 2= cooling and charge, 3= cooling and discharge, 4= charge only, and 5= discharge only
operation_mode_control_schedule_name.title: Operation Mode Control Schedule Name

user_defined_fluid_type.description: This field is required when Storage Type is UserDefinedFluidType
user_defined_fluid_type.title: User Defined Fluid Type

fluid_storage_volume.description: required field if Storage Type is Water or UserDefinedFluidType
fluid_storage_volume.title: Fluid Storage Volume

ice_storage_capacity.description: required field if Storage Type is Ice
ice_storage_capacity.title: Ice Storage Capacity

storage_capacity_sizing_factor.description: If one of the previous two fields is set to autocalculate, this determines the storage capacity as a function of Cooling Only Mode Rated Total Evaporator Cooling Capacity
storage_capacity_sizing_factor.title: Storage Capacity Sizing Factor

storage_tank_ambient_temperature_node_na.title: Storage Tank Ambient Temperature Node Name

storage_tank_to_ambient_u_value_times_ar.title: Storage Tank To Ambient U Value Times Area Heat Transfer Coefficient

fluid_storage_tank_rating_temperature.description: required field if Storage Type is Water or UserDefinedFluidType
fluid_storage_tank_rating_temperature.title: Fluid Storage Tank Rating Temperature

rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, Rated SHR and Rated COP
rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate

cooling_only_mode_rated_total_evaporator.description: required field if Cooling Only Mode is available or if autocalculating sizes gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
cooling_only_mode_rated_total_evaporator.title: Cooling Only Mode Rated Total Evaporator Cooling Capacity

cooling_only_mode_rated_sensible_heat_ra.description: required field if Cooling Only Mode is available Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
cooling_only_mode_rated_sensible_heat_ra.title: Cooling Only Mode Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

cooling_only_mode_rated_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input required field if Cooling Only Mode is available
cooling_only_mode_rated_cop.title: Cooling Only Mode Rated Cop

cooling_only_mode_total_evaporator_cooli.description: required field if Cooling Only Mode is available Any curve or table with two independent variables can be used biquadratic curve = a + b*ewb + c*ewb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*ewb*db x = ewb = evaporator entering wet-bulb temperature (C) y = db = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)
cooling_only_mode_total_evaporator_cooli.title: Cooling Only Mode Total Evaporator Cooling Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

cooling_only_mode_total_evaporator_cooli.description: required field if Cooling Only Mode is available Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 x = ff = Fraction of the full load evaporator air flow rate
cooling_only_mode_total_evaporator_cooli.title: Cooling Only Mode Total Evaporator Cooling Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

cooling_only_mode_energy_input_ratio_fun.description: required field if Cooling Only Mode is available Any curve or table with two independent variables can be used curve = a + b*ewb + c*ewb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*ewb*db x = ewb = evaporator entering wet-bulb temperature (C) y = db = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)

discharge_only_mode_storage_discharge_ca.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with two independent variables can be used curve = a + b*ewb + c*ewb**2 + d*stes + e*stes**2 + f*ewb*stes x = ewb = evaporator entering wet-bulb temperature (C) y = stes = state of thermal energy storage (C or fraction)
discharge_only_mode_storage_discharge_ca.title: Discharge Only Mode Storage Discharge Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_storage_discharge_ca.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 x = ff = Fraction of the full load evaporator air flow
discharge_only_mode_storage_discharge_ca.title: Discharge Only Mode Storage Discharge Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_energy_input_ratio_f.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with two independent variables can be used curve = a + b*ewb + c*ewb**2 + d*stes + e*stes**2 + f*ewb*stes x = ewb = evaporator entering wet-bulb temperature (C) y = stes = state of thermal energy storage (C or fraction)
discharge_only_mode_energy_input_ratio_f.title: Discharge Only Mode Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_energy_input_ratio_f.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 x = ff = Fraction of the full load evaporator air flow
discharge_only_mode_energy_input_ratio_f.title: Discharge Only Mode Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_part_load_fraction_c.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3
discharge_only_mode_part_load_fraction_c.title: Discharge Only Mode Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_sensible_heat_ratio_.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Curves or tables with either two or three independent variables can be used. For two independent variables: x = ewb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the cooling coil (C) y = edb = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the cooling coil (C) For three independent variables: curve or table = func(x = ewb, y = edb, z = stes) z = stes = state of thermal energy storage (C or fraction)
discharge_only_mode_sensible_heat_ratio_.title: Discharge Only Mode Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

discharge_only_mode_sensible_heat_ratio_.description: required field if Discharge Only Mode is available Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = Fraction of the full load evaporator air flow
discharge_only_mode_sensible_heat_ratio_.title: Discharge Only Mode Sensible Heat Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

ancillary_electric_power.description: controls and miscellaneous standby ancillary electric power draw, when available
ancillary_electric_power.title: Ancillary Electric Power

cold_weather_operation_minimum_outdoor_a.title: Cold Weather Operation Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature

condenser_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
condenser_air_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Air Inlet Node Name

condenser_design_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate condenser leaving conditions and water use if evaporatively cooled.
condenser_design_air_flow_rate.title: Condenser Design Air Flow Rate

condenser_air_flow_sizing_factor.description: If previous field is autocalculate, this determines the condenser air flow size as a multiplier on the Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate.
condenser_air_flow_sizing_factor.title: Condenser Air Flow Sizing Factor

evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.description: required field if condenser type is evaporatively cooled
evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.title: Evaporative Condenser Effectiveness

evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump
evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Rated Power Consumption

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off. If this field is blank, the basin heater is always available.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_availability_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_availability_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Availability Schedule Name

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

storage_tank_plant_connection_inlet_node.title: Storage Tank Plant Connection Inlet Node Name

storage_tank_plant_connection_outlet_nod.title: Storage Tank Plant Connection Outlet Node Name

storage_tank_plant_connection_design_flo.title: Storage Tank Plant Connection Design Flow Rate

storage_tank_plant_connection_heat_trans.title: Storage Tank Plant Connection Heat Transfer Effectiveness

storage_tank_minimum_operating_limit_flu.description: For fluid storage tanks only, minimum limit for storage tank If omitted,then the minimum temperature limit is that used for fluid property data.
storage_tank_minimum_operating_limit_flu.title: Storage Tank Minimum Operating Limit Fluid Temperature

storage_tank_maximum_operating_limit_flu.description: For fluid storage tanks only, maximum limit for storage tank If omitted,then the maximum temperature limit is that used for fluid property data.
storage_tank_maximum_operating_limit_flu.title: Storage Tank Maximum Operating Limit Fluid Temperature

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

high_speed_gross_rated_total_cooling_cap.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
high_speed_gross_rated_total_cooling_cap.title: High Speed Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

high_speed_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) sensible and total capacities do not include supply fan heat
high_speed_rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: High Speed Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

high_speed_gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
high_speed_gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: High Speed Gross Rated Cooling Cop

high_speed_rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total cooling capacity, Rated SHR and Rated COP. Should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total cooling capacity.
high_speed_rated_air_flow_rate.title: High Speed Rated Air Flow Rate

unit_internal_static_air_pressure.description: Enter pressure drop for the unit containing the coil. This value is only used to calculate Energy Efficiency Ratio (EER), Integrated Energy Efficiency Ratio (IEER), and the Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity. This value is not used for modeling the evaporator fan during simulations.
unit_internal_static_air_pressure.title: Unit Internal Static Air Pressure

energy_input_ratio_function_of_temperatu.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*edb + e*edb**2 + f*wb*edb wb = entering wet-bulb temperature (C) edb = dry-bulb temperature seen by the condenser (C)

energy_input_ratio_function_of_flow_frac.title: Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (cooling load/steady state capacity)
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

low_speed_gross_rated_total_cooling_capa.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat gross capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

design_water_temperature_difference.description: This input field is optional. If specified, it is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate. If blank or omitted, the Loop Design Temperature Difference value specified in Sizing:Plant object is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate.
design_water_temperature_difference.title: Design Water Temperature Difference

gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.description: Total cooling capacity at rated conditions not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.title: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling COP at rated conditions
gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Gross Rated Cooling Cop

rated_entering_water_temperature.description: Rated entering water temperature corresponding to the water-to -air application for which this coil is used. For example: for water loop applications, the rated temperature is 30 degree Celsius
rated_entering_water_temperature.title: Rated Entering Water Temperature

rated_entering_air_dry_bulb_temperature.description: Rated entering air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to the water-to-air application for which this coil is used. For example: for water loop applications, the rated temperature is 27 degree Celsius
rated_entering_air_dry_bulb_temperature.title: Rated Entering Air Dry Bulb Temperature

rated_entering_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Rated entering air wet-bulb temperature corresponding to the water-to-air application for which this coil is used. For example: for water loop applications, the rated temperature is 19 degree Celsius
rated_entering_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Rated Entering Air Wet Bulb Temperature

nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.title: Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.title: Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

compressor_type.description: Parameters 1-5 are as named below. Parameters 6-10 depend on the type of compressor and fluid. Refer to the InputOutputReference on the parameters required
compressor_type.title: Compressor Type

nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.description: The nominal time for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Nominal time is equal to the ratio of the energy of the coil's maximum condensate holding capacity (J) to the coil's steady state latent capacity (W). Suggested value is 1000; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
nominal_time_for_condensate_removal_to_b.title: Nominal Time For Condensate Removal To Begin

ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.description: Ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off) and the coil's steady state latent capacity at rated air flow rate and temperature conditions. Suggested value is 1.5; zero value means latent degradation model is disabled.
ratio_of_initial_moisture_evaporation_ra.title: Ratio Of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate And Steady State Latent Capacity

volume_ratio.description: Use when Compressor Type is Scroll. Leave this field blank for Compressor Type is Rotary or Reciprocating. Previously part of Parameter 7

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

fin_diameter.description: Fin diameter or the coil height
fin_diameter.title: Fin Diameter

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

design_water_temperature_difference.description: This input field is optional. If specified, it is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate. If blank or omitted, the Loop Design Temperature Difference value specified in Sizing:Plant object is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate.
design_water_temperature_difference.title: Design Water Temperature Difference

design_inlet_water_temperature.description: This input field is optional. If specified, it is used for sizing the coil Design Geomtery Parameters. If autosized, the Design Loop Exit Temperature value specified in Sizing:Plant object is used for sizing the coil Design Geomtery Parameters. If the autosized value is higher than the coil design outlet air temperature, then the design inlet water temperature value is reset to coil design outlet air temperature minus 5.0 DeltaC.
design_inlet_water_temperature.title: Design Inlet Water Temperature

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Compressor Operation

outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_to_turn_on_.description: The outdoor temperature when the compressor is automatically turned back on following an automatic shut off because of low outdoor dry-bulb temperature. This field is only used for the calculation of HSPF. If this field is not provided, then outdoor bin temperature used in the HSPF calculation is always considered to be greater than this temperature and 'Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation' field described above. This assumption is based on AHRI standard 210/240 (2008) and can introduce significant error in the final value of HSPF.
outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_to_turn_on_.title: Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature To Turn On Compressor

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

defrost_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.description: biquadratic curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*oat + e*oat**2 + f*wb*oat wb = wet-bulb temperature (C) of air entering the indoor coil oat = outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) only required if ReverseCycle defrost strategy is specified
defrost_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.title: Defrost Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode only applicable if timed defrost control is specified
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

apply_part_load_fraction_to_speeds_great.title: Apply Part Load Fraction To Speeds Greater Than 1

region_number_for_calculating_hspf.description: Standard Region number for which HSPF and other standard ratings are calculated
region_number_for_calculating_hspf.title: Region Number For Calculating Hspf

number_of_speeds.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for coil capacity, COP, flow rate, and associated curves.
number_of_speeds.title: Number Of Speeds

speed_1_gross_rated_heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C
speed_1_gross_rated_heating_capacity.title: Speed 1 Gross Rated Heating Capacity

speed_1_gross_rated_heating_cop.description: Rated heating capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply air fan heat or supply air fan electrical energy
speed_1_gross_rated_heating_cop.title: Speed 1 Gross Rated Heating Cop

speed_1_rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total capacity should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated total heating capacity
speed_1_rated_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 1 Rated Air Flow Rate

2017_speed_1_rated_supply_air_fan_power_.description: Enter the supply air fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated speed 1 test conditions as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. The test conditions vary external static pressure based on heating capacity. This value is only used to calculate Heating Seasonal Performance Factor(HSPF). This value is not used for modeling the supply air fan during simulations.
2017_speed_1_rated_supply_air_fan_power_.title: 2017 Speed 1 Rated Supply Air Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

2023_speed_1_rated_supply_air_fan_power_.description: Enter the supply air fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated speed 1 test conditions as defined in the 2023 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240. This value is not used for modeling the supply air fan during simulations.
2023_speed_1_rated_supply_air_fan_power_.title: 2023 Speed 1 Rated Supply Air Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

speed_1_heating_capacity_function_of_tem.title: Speed 1 Heating Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_1_part_load_fraction_correlation_c.title: Speed 1 Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name
