zone_name_for_evaporator_placement.description: This input field is name of a conditioned or unconditioned zone where the secondary coil (evaporator) of a heat pump is to be placed. This is an optional input field specified only when user desires to extract heat from the zone. The heat extracted is modeled as internal heat gain of the zone. If the primary DX system is a heat pump, then the zone name should be the same as the zone name specified for placing the secondary cooling DX coil.
zone_name_for_evaporator_placement.title: Zone Name For Evaporator Placement

speed_1_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.description: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary DX coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode.
speed_1_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 1 Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate

speed_1_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.description: This input field is scaling factor for autosizing the secondary DX coil fan flow rate. The secondary air flow rate is determined by multiplying the primary DX coil rated air flow rate by the fan flow scaling factor. Default value is 1.25. If the secondary coil fan flow rate is not autosized, then the secondary coil fan flow scaling factor is set to 1.0.
speed_1_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.title: Speed 1 Secondary Coil Fan Flow Scaling Factor

speed_1_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.description: This input value is the nominal sensible heat ratio used to split the heat extracted by a secondary DX coil (evaporator) of a heat pump into sensible and latent components. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then pure sensible internal heat gain is assumed, i.e., sensible heat ratio of 1.0.
speed_1_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.title: Speed 1 Nominal Sensible Heat Ratio Of Secondary Coil

speed_1_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the secondary DX coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the primary DX coil (C) This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier biquadratic curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary zone air node wet-bulb temperature and the heating DX coil entering air dry-bulb temperature. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified in the field above will be used.
speed_1_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 1 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_1_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = secondary air flow fraction of the full load flow This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified will be used.
speed_1_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 1 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_2_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.description: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary DX coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode.
speed_2_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 2 Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate

speed_2_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.description: This input field is scaling factor for autosizing the secondary DX coil fan flow rate. The secondary air flow rate is determined by multiplying the primary DX coil rated air flow rate by the fan flow scaling factor. Default value is 1.25. If the secondary coil fan flow rate is not autosized, then the secondary coil fan flow scaling factor is set to 1.0.
speed_2_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.title: Speed 2 Secondary Coil Fan Flow Scaling Factor

speed_2_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.description: This input value is the nominal sensible heat ratio used to split the heat extracted by a secondary DX coil (evaporator) of a heat pump into sensible and latent components. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then pure sensible internal heat gain is assumed, i.e., sensible heat ratio of 1.0.
speed_2_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.title: Speed 2 Nominal Sensible Heat Ratio Of Secondary Coil

speed_2_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the secondary DX coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the primary DX coil (C) This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier biquadratic curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary zone air node wet-bulb temperature and the heating DX coil entering air dry-bulb temperature. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified in the field above will be used.
speed_2_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 2 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_2_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = secondary air flow fraction of the full load flow This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified will be used.
speed_2_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 2 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_3_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.description: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary DX coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode.
speed_3_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 3 Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate

speed_3_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.description: This input field is scaling factor for autosizing the secondary DX coil fan flow rate. The secondary air flow rate is determined by multiplying the primary DX coil rated air flow rate by the fan flow scaling factor. Default value is 1.25. If the secondary coil fan flow rate is not autosized, then the secondary coil fan flow scaling factor is set to 1.0.
speed_3_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.title: Speed 3 Secondary Coil Fan Flow Scaling Factor

speed_3_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.description: This input value is the nominal sensible heat ratio used to split the heat extracted by a secondary DX coil (evaporator) of a heat pump into sensible and latent components. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then pure sensible internal heat gain is assumed, i.e., sensible heat ratio of 1.0.
speed_3_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.title: Speed 3 Nominal Sensible Heat Ratio Of Secondary Coil

speed_3_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the secondary DX coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the primary DX coil (C) This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier biquadratic curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary zone air node wet-bulb temperature and the heating DX coil entering air dry-bulb temperature. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified in the field above will be used.
speed_3_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 3 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_3_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = secondary air flow fraction of the full load flow This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified will be used.
speed_3_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 3 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

speed_4_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.description: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary DX coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode.
speed_4_secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.title: Speed 4 Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate

speed_4_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.description: This input field is scaling factor for autosizing the secondary DX coil fan flow rate. The secondary air flow rate is determined by multiplying the primary DX coil rated air flow rate by the fan flow scaling factor. Default value is 1.25. If the secondary coil fan flow rate is not autosized, then the secondary coil fan flow scaling factor is set to 1.0.
speed_4_secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_.title: Speed 4 Secondary Coil Fan Flow Scaling Factor

speed_4_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.description: This input value is the nominal sensible heat ratio used to split the heat extracted by a secondary DX coil (evaporator) of a heat pump into sensible and latent components. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then pure sensible internal heat gain is assumed, i.e., sensible heat ratio of 1.0.
speed_4_nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_s.title: Speed 4 Nominal Sensible Heat Ratio Of Secondary Coil

speed_4_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the secondary DX coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the primary DX coil (C) This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier biquadratic curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary zone air node wet-bulb temperature and the heating DX coil entering air dry-bulb temperature. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified in the field above will be used.
speed_4_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 4 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

speed_4_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = secondary air flow fraction of the full load flow This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified will be used.
speed_4_sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_fun.title: Speed 4 Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

gross_rated_heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat capacity excluding supply air fan heat rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C
gross_rated_heating_capacity.title: Gross Rated Heating Capacity

gross_rated_heating_cop.description: Rated heating capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply air fan heat or supply air fan electrical energy does not include supply air fan heat or supply air fan electrical energy
gross_rated_heating_cop.title: Gross Rated Heating Cop

rated_air_flow_rate.description: Flow rate corresponding to rated total capacity should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and .00006041 m3/s per watt of rated heating capacity
rated_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Air Flow Rate

2017_rated_supply_fan_power_per_volume_f.description: Enter the supply fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions. as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240.  The test conditions vary external static pressure based on heating capacity. This value is only used to calculate Heating Seasonal Performance Factor(HSPF). This value is not used for modeling the supply (condenser) fan during simulations.
2017_rated_supply_fan_power_per_volume_f.title: 2017 Rated Supply Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

2023_rated_supply_fan_power_per_volume_f.description: Enter the supply fan power per air volume flow rate at the rated test conditions. as defined in the 2017 version of ANSI/AHRI Standard 210/240.  The test conditions vary external static pressure based on heating capacity. This value is only used to calculate Heating Seasonal Performance Factor(HSPF). This value is not used for modeling the supply (condenser) fan during simulations.
2023_rated_supply_fan_power_per_volume_f.title: 2023 Rated Supply Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate

heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: quadratic curve = a + b*oat + c*oat**2 cubic curve = a + b*oat + c*oat**2 + d*oat**3 biquadratic curve = a + b*iat + c*iat**2 + d*oat + e*oat**2 + f*iat*oat oat = outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) iat = indoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) Biquadratic curve is recommended if sufficient manufacturer data is available for the heating capacity to be sensitive to both iat and oat.
heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_capacity_function_of_flow_fracti.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
heating_capacity_function_of_flow_fracti.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_function_of_temperatu.description: quadratic curve = a + b*oat + c*oat**2 cubic curve = a + b*oat + c*oat**2 + d*oat**3 biquadratic curve = a + b*iat + c*iat**2 + d*oat + e*oat**2 + f*iat*oat oat = outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) iat = indoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) biquadratic curve is recommended if sufficient manufacturer data is available for the energy input ratio to be sensitive to both iat and oat.
energy_input_ratio_function_of_temperatu.title: Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

energy_input_ratio_function_of_flow_frac.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = fraction of the full load flow
energy_input_ratio_function_of_flow_frac.title: Energy Input Ratio Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (sensible heating load/steady state heating capacity)
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

defrost_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.description: biquadratic curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*oat + e*oat**2 + f*wb*oat wb = wet-bulb temperature (C) of air entering the indoor coil oat = outdoor air dry-bulb temperature (C) only required if ReverseCycle defrost strategy is specified
defrost_energy_input_ratio_function_of_t.title: Defrost Energy Input Ratio Function Of Temperature Curve Name

minimum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Compressor Operation

outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_to_turn_on_.description: The outdoor temperature when the compressor is automatically turned back on following an automatic shut off because of low outdoor dry-bulb temperature. This field is only used for the calculation of HSPF. If this field is not provided, then outdoor bin temperature used in the HSPF calculation is always considered to be greater than this temperature and 'Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation' field described above. This assumption is based on AHRI standard 210/240 (2008) and can introduce significant error in the final value of HSPF.
outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_to_turn_on_.title: Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature To Turn On Compressor

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation
Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode only applicable if timed defrost control is specified
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

region_number_for_calculating_hspf.description: Standard Region number for which HSPF and other standard ratings are calculated
region_number_for_calculating_hspf.title: Region Number For Calculating Hspf

evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.title: Evaporator Air Inlet Node Name

zone_name_for_evaporator_placement.description: This input field is name of a conditioned or unconditioned zone where the secondary coil (evaporator) of a heat pump is to be placed. This is an optional input field specified only when user desires to extract heat from the zone. The heat extracted is modelled as internal gain of the zone. If the primary DX system is a heat pump, then the zone name should be the same as the zone name specified for placing the secondary cooling DX coil.
zone_name_for_evaporator_placement.title: Zone Name For Evaporator Placement

secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.description: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary DX coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode.
secondary_coil_air_flow_rate.title: Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate

secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_factor.description: This input field is scaling factor for autosizing the secondary DX coil fan flow rate. The secondary air flow rate is determined by multiplying the primary DX coil rated air flow rate by the fan flow scaling factor. Default value is 1.25. If the secondary coil fan flow rate is not autosized, then the secondary coil fan flow scaling factor is set to 1.0.
secondary_coil_fan_flow_scaling_factor.title: Secondary Coil Fan Flow Scaling Factor

nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_secondary.description: This input value is the nominal sensible heat ratio used to split the heat extracted by a secondary DX coil (evaporator) of a heat pump into sensible and latent components. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then pure sensible internal heat gain is assumed, i.e., sensible heat ratio of 1.0.
nominal_sensible_heat_ratio_of_secondary.title: Nominal Sensible Heat Ratio Of Secondary Coil

sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.description: curve = a + b*wb + c*wb**2 + d*db + e*db**2 + f*wb*db wb = entering wet-bulb temperature seen by the secondary DX coil (C) db = entering dry-bulb temperature seen by the primary DX coil (C) This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier biquadratic curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary zone air node wet-bulb temperature and the heating DX coil entering air dry-bulb temperature. This is an optional input field. If this input field is left blank, then the nominal sensible heat ratio specified in the field above will be used.
sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Temperature Curve Name

sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.description: quadratic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 cubic curve = a + b*ff + c*ff**2 + d*ff**3 ff = secondary air flow fraction of the full load flow This input field is name of sensible heat ratio modifier curve. The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction. This is an optional input field. sensible_heat_ratio_modifier_function_of.title: Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function Of Flow Fraction Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: Required if coil is temperature controlled. Temperature-based control requires the use of a SetpointManager object
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

parasitic_electric_load.description: parasitic electric load associated with the desuperheater coil operation such as solenoid valves, etc.
parasitic_electric_load.title: Parasitic Electric Load

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: Required if coil is temperature controlled.
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: Required if coil is temperature controlled. controlled
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

number_of_stages.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for coil capacity and Efficiency.
number_of_stages.title: Number Of Stages

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: optional, used if coil is temperature control and not load-base controlled
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

parasitic_electric_load.description: parasitic electric load associated with the coil operation such as an inducer fan, etc... This will be modified by the part load ratio to reflect the time of operation in a timestep.
parasitic_electric_load.title: Parasitic Electric Load

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve, PLF = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve, PLF = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLF = part load fraction PLR = part load ratio (sensible heating load/steady state heating capacity) Coil runtime fraction = Part Load Ratio / PLF This part load degradation is for coil performance & will increase the fuel consumption of the coil due to transient coil operation.
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

parasitic_fuel_load.description: parasitic fuel load associated with the coil operation (i.e., standing pilot)
parasitic_fuel_load.title: Parasitic Fuel Load

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: optional, used if coil is temperature control and not load-base controlled.
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: quadratic curve, PLF = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve, PLF = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLF = part load fraction PLR = part load ratio (sensible heating load/steady state heating capacity) Coil runtime fraction = Part Load Ratio / PLF This part load degradation is for coil performance & will increase the gas consumption of the coil due to transient coil operation.
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

parasitic_gas_load.description: parasitic gas load associated with the gas coil operation (i.e., standing pilot)
parasitic_gas_load.title: Parasitic Gas Load

number_of_stages.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for coil capacity and Gas Burner Efficiency.
number_of_stages.title: Number Of Stages

stage_1_parasitic_electric_load.description: Stage 1 parasitic electric load associated with the gas coil operation such as an inducer fan, etc. This will be modified by the part load ratio to reflect the time of operation in a timestep.
stage_1_parasitic_electric_load.title: Stage 1 Parasitic Electric Load

stage_2_parasitic_electric_load.description: Stage 2 parasitic electric load associated with the gas coil operation such as an inducer fan, etc. This will be modified by the part load ratio to reflect the time of operation in a timestep.
stage_2_parasitic_electric_load.title: Stage 2 Parasitic Electric Load

stage_3_parasitic_electric_load.description: Stage 3 parasitic electric load associated with the gas coil operation such as an inducer fan, etc. This will be modified by the part load ratio to reflect the time of operation in a timestep.
stage_3_parasitic_electric_load.title: Stage 3 Parasitic Electric Load

stage_4_parasitic_electric_load.description: Stage 4 parasitic electric load associated with the gas coil operation such as an inducer fan, etc. This will be modified by the part load ratio to reflect the time of operation in a timestep.
stage_4_parasitic_electric_load.title: Stage 4 Parasitic Electric Load

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

coil_control_type.description: Use ZoneLoadControl if the coil is contained within another component such as an air terminal unit, zone HVAC equipment, or unitary system. Use TemperatureSetpointControl if the coil is located directly in an air loop branch or outdoor air equipment list.
coil_control_type.title: Coil Control Type

temperature_setpoint_node_name.description: Required if Coil Control Type is TemperatureSetpointControl
temperature_setpoint_node_name.title: Temperature Setpoint Node Name

availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

rated_ratio_for_air_and_water_convection.title: Rated Ratio For Air And Water Convection

design_water_temperature_difference.description: This input field is optional. If specified, it is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate. If blank or omitted, the Loop Design Temperature Difference value specified in Sizing:Plant object is used for sizing the Design Water Flow Rate.
design_water_temperature_difference.title: Design Water Temperature Difference

gross_rated_heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity at rated conditions not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_heating_capacity.title: Gross Rated Heating Capacity

gross_rated_heating_cop.description: Gross heating COP at rated conditions
gross_rated_heating_cop.title: Gross Rated Heating Cop

rated_entering_water_temperature.description: Rated entering water temperature corresponding to the water-to -air application for which this coil is used. For example: for water loop applications, the rated temperature is 20 degree Celsius.
rated_entering_water_temperature.title: Rated Entering Water Temperature

rated_entering_air_dry_bulb_temperature.description: Rated entering air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to the water-to-air application for which this coil is used. For example: for water loop applications, the rated temperature is 20 degree Celsius.
rated_entering_air_dry_bulb_temperature.title: Rated Entering Air Dry Bulb Temperature

ratio_of_rated_heating_capacity_to_rated.description: Ratio of rated heating capacity to rated cooling capacity. This input is used to calculate the heating or cooling capacity when autosizing. This input is only used if a companion cooling coil of the same type  (Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit) is used. This input is only used when a sizing run for the system which uses this object is requested and when the coil capacity is autosized.
ratio_of_rated_heating_capacity_to_rated.title: Ratio Of Rated Heating Capacity To Rated Cooling Capacity

compressor_suction_discharge_pressure_dr.title: Compressor Suction Discharge Pressure Drop

compressor_clearance_factor.description: Used when Compressor Type is Reciprocating. Leave this field blank for Compressor Type is Rotary or Scroll. Previously part of Parameter 7
compressor_clearance_factor.title: Compressor Clearance Factor

overall_model_simulation_program_calling.title: Overall Model Simulation Program Calling Manager Name

model_setup_and_sizing_program_calling_m.title: Model Setup And Sizing Program Calling Manager Name

air_connection_1_inlet_node_name.description: Inlet air for primary air stream
air_connection_1_inlet_node_name.title: Air Connection 1 Inlet Node Name

air_connection_1_outlet_node_name.description: Outlet air for primary air stream
air_connection_1_outlet_node_name.title: Air Connection 1 Outlet Node Name

air_connection_2_inlet_node_name.description: Inlet air for secondary air stream
air_connection_2_inlet_node_name.title: Air Connection 2 Inlet Node Name

air_connection_2_outlet_node_name.description: Outlet air for secondary air stream
air_connection_2_outlet_node_name.title: Air Connection 2 Outlet Node Name

supply_inlet_water_storage_tank_name.description: Water use storage tank for alternate source of water consumed by device
supply_inlet_water_storage_tank_name.title: Supply Inlet Water Storage Tank Name

collection_outlet_water_storage_tank_nam.description: Water use storage tank for collection of condensate by device
collection_outlet_water_storage_tank_nam.title: Collection Outlet Water Storage Tank Name

ambient_zone_name.description: Used for modeling device losses to surrounding zone
ambient_zone_name.title: Ambient Zone Name

rated_heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Can optionally include condenser pump heat.
rated_heating_capacity.title: Rated Heating Capacity

rated_cop.description: Heating coefficient of performance at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Can optionally include condenser pump power and evaporator fan power (see fields below).
rated_cop.title: Rated Cop

rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Gross air-side sensible heat ratio at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Sensible heat ratio equals gross sensible cooling capacity divided by gross total cooling capacity. Rated SHR (gross) should not include evaporator fan heat, only sensible cooling and dehumidification by the coil alone.
rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Dry Bulb Temperature

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air wet-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

rated_condenser_inlet_water_temperature.description: Condenser inlet water temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_condenser_inlet_water_temperature.title: Rated Condenser Inlet Water Temperature

rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Evaporator air flow rate corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR). Default is 5.035E-5 m3/s/W (31.25 cfm/MBH) of rated heating capacity when autocalculated.
rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate

rated_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: Condenser water flow rate corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR). Default is 4.487E-8 m3/s/W (0.208 gpm/MBH) of rated heating capacity when autocalculated. A warning message will be issued if the ratio of Rated Condenser Water Flow Rate to Heating Capacity is less than 1.79405E-8 m3/s/W (0.083 gpm/MBH) or greater than 8.97024E-8 m3/s/W (0.417 gpm/MBH), but the simulation will continue.
rated_condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Rated Condenser Water Flow Rate

evaporator_fan_power_included_in_rated_c.description: Select Yes if the evaporator fan power is included in the rated COP. This choice field impacts the calculation of compressor electric power.
evaporator_fan_power_included_in_rated_c.title: Evaporator Fan Power Included In Rated Cop

condenser_pump_power_included_in_rated_c.description: Select Yes if the condenser pump power is included in the rated COP. This choice field impacts the calculation of compressor electric power.
condenser_pump_power_included_in_rated_c.title: Condenser Pump Power Included In Rated Cop

condenser_pump_heat_included_in_rated_he.description: Select Yes if the condenser pump heat is included in the rated heating capacity and rated COP. This choice field impacts the calculation of water heating capacity.
condenser_pump_heat_included_in_rated_he.title: Condenser Pump Heat Included In Rated Heating Capacity And Rated Cop

condenser_water_pump_power.description: A warning message will be issued if the ratio of Condenser Water Pump Power to Rated Heating Capacity exceeds 0.1422 W/W (41.67 Watts/MBH), but the simulation will continue.
condenser_water_pump_power.title: Condenser Water Pump Power

fraction_of_condenser_pump_heat_to_water.description: Fraction of pump heat transferred to the condenser water. The pump is assumed to be located downstream of the condenser.
fraction_of_condenser_pump_heat_to_water.title: Fraction Of Condenser Pump Heat To Water

evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.description: The node from which the DX coil draws its inlet air.
evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.title: Evaporator Air Inlet Node Name

evaporator_air_outlet_node_name.description: The node to which the DX coil sends its outlet air.
evaporator_air_outlet_node_name.title: Evaporator Air Outlet Node Name

condenser_water_inlet_node_name.description: The node from which the DX coil condenser draws its inlet water. This name should match the source side outlet node name in the associated water heater tank object.
condenser_water_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Water Inlet Node Name

condenser_water_outlet_node_name.description: The node to which the DX coil condenser sends its outlet water. This name should match the source side inlet node name in the associated water heater tank object.
condenser_water_outlet_node_name.title: Condenser Water Outlet Node Name

crankcase_heater_capacity.description: The compressor crankcase heater only operates when the dry-bulb temperature of air surrounding the compressor is below the Maximum Ambient Temperature for Crankcase Heater Operation and the DX coil is off. The ambient temperature surrounding the compressor is set by the WaterHeater:HeatPump:PumpedCondenser parent object (field Compressor Location).
crankcase_heater_capacity.title: Crankcase Heater Capacity

maximum_ambient_temperature_for_crankcas.description: The compressor crankcase heater only operates when the dry-bulb temperature of air surrounding the compressor is below the Maximum Outdoor Temperature for Crankcase Heater Operation and the unit is off. The ambient temperature surrounding the compressor is set by the WaterHeater:HeatPump:PumpedCondenser parent object (field Compressor Location).
maximum_ambient_temperature_for_crankcas.title: Maximum Ambient Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

evaporator_air_temperature_type_for_curv.description: Determines temperature type for heating capacity curves and heating COP curves. This input determines whether the inlet air dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature is used to evaluate these curves.
evaporator_air_temperature_type_for_curv.title: Evaporator Air Temperature Type For Curve Objects

heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: Heating capacity modifier curve (function of temperature) should be biquadratic or cubic. Biquadratic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(tw) + e(tw)^2 + f(ta)(tw). Cubic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(ta)^3. ta = evaporator inlet air [dry-bulb or wet-bulb] temperature (C). tw = condenser inlet water temperature (C). The field Evaporator Air Temperature Type for Curve Objects determines if dry-bulb or wet-bulb is used as the evaporator inlet air temperature (ta).
heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_capacity_function_of_air_flow_fr.description: Heating capacity modifier curve (function of air flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated evaporator air flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in air flow rate fraction.
heating_capacity_function_of_air_flow_fr.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

heating_capacity_function_of_water_flow_.description: Heating capacity modifier curve (function of water flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated condenser water flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in water flow rate fraction.
heating_capacity_function_of_water_flow_.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Water Flow Fraction Curve Name

heating_cop_function_of_temperature_curv.description: Heating COP modifier curve (function of temperature) should be biquadratic or cubic. Biquadratic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(tw) + e(tw)^2 + f(ta)(tw). Cubic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(ta)^3. ta = evaporator inlet air [dry-bulb or wet-bulb] temperature (C). tw = condenser inlet water temperature (C). The field Evaporator Air Temperature Type for Curve Objects determines if dry-bulb or wet-bulb is used as the evaporator inlet air temperature (ta).
heating_cop_function_of_temperature_curv.title: Heating Cop Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_cop_function_of_air_flow_fractio.description: Heating COP modifier curve (function of air flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated evaporator air flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in air flow rate fraction.
heating_cop_function_of_air_flow_fractio.title: Heating Cop Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

heating_cop_function_of_water_flow_fract.description: Heating COP modifier curve (function of water flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated condenser water flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in water flow rate fraction.
heating_cop_function_of_water_flow_fract.title: Heating Cop Function Of Water Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: Part Load Fraction Correlation (function of part load ratio) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(PLR) + c(PLR)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(PLR) + c(PLR)^2 + d(PLR)^3. PLR = part load ratio (heating delivered/steady state heating capacity). Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in part load ratio.
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

nominal_speed_level.description: must be lower than or equal to the highest speed number
nominal_speed_level.title: Nominal Speed Level

rated_water_heating_capacity.description: Water Heating capacity at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Can optionally include condenser pump heat.
rated_water_heating_capacity.title: Rated Water Heating Capacity

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Dry Bulb Temperature

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air wet-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

rated_condenser_inlet_water_temperature.description: Condenser inlet water temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_condenser_inlet_water_temperature.title: Rated Condenser Inlet Water Temperature

rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Evaporator air flow rate corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR). Default is 5.035E-5 m3/s/W (31.25 cfm/MBH) of rated heating capacity when autocalculated.
rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate

rated_condenser_water_flow_rate.description: Condenser water flow rate corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR). Default is 4.487E-8 m3/s/W (0.208 gpm/MBH) of rated heating capacity when autocalculated. A warning message will be issued if the ratio of Rated Condenser Water Flow Rate to Heating Capacity is less than 1.79405E-8 m3/s/W (0.083 gpm/MBH) or greater than 8.97024E-8 m3/s/W (0.417 gpm/MBH), but the simulation will continue.
rated_condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Rated Condenser Water Flow Rate

condenser_pump_power_included_in_rated_c.description: Select Yes if the condenser pump power is included in the rated COP. This choice field impacts the calculation of compressor electric power.

rated_sensible_heat_ratio_at_speed_1.description: Gross air-side sensible heat ratio at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Rated SHR (gross) should not include evaporator fan heat, only sensible cooling and dehumidification by the coil alone.

rated_heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Can optionally include condenser pump heat.
rated_heating_capacity.title: Rated Heating Capacity

rated_cop.description: Heating coefficient of performance at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Can optionally include condenser pump power and evaporator fan power (see fields below).
rated_cop.title: Rated Cop

rated_sensible_heat_ratio.description: Gross air-side sensible heat ratio at the rated inlet air temperatures, rated condenser inlet water temperature, rated air flow rate, and rated water flow rate. Sensible heat ratio equals gross sensible cooling capacity divided by gross total cooling capacity. Rated SHR (gross) should not include evaporator fan heat, only sensible cooling and dehumidification by the coil alone.
rated_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Dry Bulb Temperature

rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.description: Evaporator inlet air wet-bulb temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_evaporator_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temp.title: Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

rated_condenser_water_temperature.description: Condenser inlet water temperature corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR).
rated_condenser_water_temperature.title: Rated Condenser Water Temperature

rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Evaporator air flow rate corresponding to rated coil performance (heating capacity, COP and SHR). Default is 5.035E-5 m3/s/W (31.25 cfm/MBH) of rated heating capacity when autocalculated.
rated_evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate

evaporator_fan_power_included_in_rated_c.description: Select Yes if the evaporator fan power is included in the rated COP. This choice field impacts the calculation of compressor electric power.
evaporator_fan_power_included_in_rated_c.title: Evaporator Fan Power Included In Rated Cop

evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.description: The node from which the DX coil draws its inlet air.
evaporator_air_inlet_node_name.title: Evaporator Air Inlet Node Name

evaporator_air_outlet_node_name.description: The node to which the DX coil sends its outlet air.
evaporator_air_outlet_node_name.title: Evaporator Air Outlet Node Name

crankcase_heater_capacity.description: The compressor crankcase heater only operates when the dry-bulb temperature of air surrounding the compressor is below the Maximum Ambient Temperature for Crankcase Heater Operation and the DX coil is off. The ambient temperature surrounding the compressor is set by the WaterHeater:HeatPump:WrappedCondenser parent object (field Compressor Location).
crankcase_heater_capacity.title: Crankcase Heater Capacity

maximum_ambient_temperature_for_crankcas.description: The compressor crankcase heater only operates when the dry-bulb temperature of air surrounding the compressor is below the Maximum Outdoor Temperature for Crankcase Heater Operation and the unit is off. The ambient temperature surrounding the compressor is set by the WaterHeater:HeatPump:WrappedCondenser parent object (field Compressor Location).
maximum_ambient_temperature_for_crankcas.title: Maximum Ambient Temperature For Crankcase Heater Operation

evaporator_air_temperature_type_for_curv.description: Determines temperature type for heating capacity curves and heating COP curves. This input determines whether the inlet air dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature is used to evaluate these curves.
evaporator_air_temperature_type_for_curv.title: Evaporator Air Temperature Type For Curve Objects

heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.description: Heating capacity modifier curve (function of temperature) should be biquadratic or cubic. Biquadratic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(tw) + e(tw)^2 + f(ta)(tw). Cubic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(ta)^3. ta = evaporator inlet air [dry-bulb or wet-bulb] temperature (C). tw = condenser inlet water temperature (C). The field Evaporator Air Temperature Type for Curve Objects determines if dry-bulb or wet-bulb is used as the evaporator inlet air temperature (ta).
heating_capacity_function_of_temperature.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_capacity_function_of_air_flow_fr.description: Heating capacity modifier curve (function of air flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated evaporator air flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in air flow rate fraction.
heating_capacity_function_of_air_flow_fr.title: Heating Capacity Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

heating_cop_function_of_temperature_curv.description: Heating COP modifier curve (function of temperature) should be biquadratic or cubic. Biquadratic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(tw) + e(tw)^2 + f(ta)(tw). Cubic curve = a + b(ta) + c(ta)^2 + d(ta)^3. ta = evaporator inlet air [dry-bulb or wet-bulb] temperature (C). tw = condenser inlet water temperature (C). The field Evaporator Air Temperature Type for Curve Objects determines if dry-bulb or wet-bulb is used as the evaporator inlet air temperature (ta).
heating_cop_function_of_temperature_curv.title: Heating Cop Function Of Temperature Curve Name

heating_cop_function_of_air_flow_fractio.description: Heating COP modifier curve (function of air flow fraction) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(ff) + c(ff)^2 + d(ff)^3. ff = fraction of the rated evaporator air flow rate. Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in air flow rate fraction.
heating_cop_function_of_air_flow_fractio.title: Heating Cop Function Of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: Part Load Fraction Correlation (function of part load ratio) should be quadratic or cubic. Quadratic curve = a + b(PLR) + c(PLR)^2. Cubic curve = a + b(PLR) + c(PLR)^2 + d(PLR)^3. PLR = part load ratio (heating delivered/steady state heating capacity). Use curve coefficients of 1,0,0 or leave this field blank when neglecting performance impacts due to variations in part load ratio.
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Schedule values of 0 denote the desuperheater heating coil is off and the parasitic electric energy is also off.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

setpoint_temperature_schedule_name.description: Defines the cut-out temperature where the desuperheater water heating coil turns off. The desuperheater heating coil setpoint temperature should always be greater than the water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature. Temperature schedule values should be in degrees C.
setpoint_temperature_schedule_name.title: Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

dead_band_temperature_difference.description: Setpoint temperature minus the dead band temperature difference defines the cut-in temperature where the desuperheater water heating coil turns on. The water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature should always be less than the desuperheater heating coil cut-in temperature.
dead_band_temperature_difference.title: Dead Band Temperature Difference

rated_heat_reclaim_recovery_efficiency.description: Enter the fraction of waste heat reclaimed by the desuperheater water heating coil.
rated_heat_reclaim_recovery_efficiency.title: Rated Heat Reclaim Recovery Efficiency

rated_inlet_water_temperature.description: The inlet water temperature corresponding to the rated heat reclaim recovery efficiency.
rated_inlet_water_temperature.title: Rated Inlet Water Temperature

rated_outdoor_air_temperature.description: The outdoor air dry-bulb temperature corresponding to the rated heat reclaim recovery efficiency.
rated_outdoor_air_temperature.title: Rated Outdoor Air Temperature

maximum_inlet_water_temperature_for_heat.description: The desuperheater water heating coil is off when the inlet water temperature is above the maximum inlet water temperature for heat reclaim.
maximum_inlet_water_temperature_for_heat.title: Maximum Inlet Water Temperature For Heat Reclaim

heat_reclaim_efficiency_function_of_temp.description: A biquadratic curve defining the performance of the desuperheater heating coil. Performance can be specified as a function of inlet water temperature, outdoor air dry-bulb temperature, or both. Curve = a + b*Tw + c*Tw**2 + d*odb + e*odb**2 + f*Tw*odb. Tw = desuperheater heating coil entering water temperature (C). Odb = outdoor dry-bulb temperature at DX system condenser (C).
heat_reclaim_efficiency_function_of_temp.title: Heat Reclaim Efficiency Function Of Temperature Curve Name

water_inlet_node_name.description: The node from which the desuperheater heating coil draws its inlet water. This name should match the source side outlet node name in the associated water heater tank object.
water_inlet_node_name.title: Water Inlet Node Name

water_outlet_node_name.description: The node to which the desuperheater heating coil sends its outlet water. This name should match the source side inlet node name in the associated water heater tank object.
water_outlet_node_name.title: Water Outlet Node Name

tank_object_type.description: Specify the type of water heater tank used by this desuperheater water heating coil.
tank_object_type.title: Tank Object Type

tank_name.description: The name of the water heater tank used by this desuperheater water heating coil. Needs to match the name used in the corresponding water heater object.
tank_name.title: Tank Name

heating_source_object_type.description: The type of DX system that is providing waste heat for reclaim.
heating_source_object_type.title: Heating Source Object Type

heating_source_name.description: The name of the DX system used for heat reclaim.
heating_source_name.title: Heating Source Name

water_pump_power.description: The water circulation pump electric power.
water_pump_power.title: Water Pump Power

fraction_of_pump_heat_to_water.description: The fraction of pump heat transferred to the water. The pump is assumed to be downstream of the desuperheater water heating coil.
fraction_of_pump_heat_to_water.title: Fraction Of Pump Heat To Water

on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the desuperheater water heating coil operates. Parasitic electric load does not contribute to water heating or the zone air heat balance.
on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: On Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric load consumed when the desuperheater water heating coil is off. Parasitic electric load does not contribute to water heating or the zone air heat balance. Off-cycle parasitic power is 0 when the availability schedule is 0.
off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

layer_1_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
layer_1_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.title: Layer 1 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name

layer_2_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
layer_2_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.title: Layer 2 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name

layer_3_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
layer_3_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.title: Layer 3 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name

layer_4_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
layer_4_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.title: Layer 4 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name

layer_5_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
layer_5_solar_radiation_absorbed_schedul.title: Layer 5 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name

building_rotation_for_appendix_g.description: Additional degrees of rotation to be used with the requirement in ASHRAE Standard 90.1 Appendix G that states that the baseline building should be rotated in four directions.
building_rotation_for_appendix_g.title: Building Rotation For Appendix G

miscellaneous_cost_per_conditioned_area.description: based on conditioned floor area for cost not accounted for in current line item cost model
miscellaneous_cost_per_conditioned_area.title: Miscellaneous Cost Per Conditioned Area

regional_adjustment_factor.description: for use with average data in line item and Misc cost models
regional_adjustment_factor.title: Regional Adjustment Factor

line_item_type.description: extend choice-keys as Cases are added to code
line_item_type.title: Line Item Type

item_name.description: wildcard "*" is acceptable for some components
item_name.title: Item Name

cost_per_unit_of_output_capacity.title: Cost Per Unit Of Output Capacity

cost_per_unit_of_output_capacity_per_cop.description: The value is per change in COP.
cost_per_unit_of_output_capacity_per_cop.title: Cost Per Unit Of Output Capacity Per Cop

cost_per_energy_per_temperature_differen.description: as in for use with UA sizing of Coils
cost_per_energy_per_temperature_differen.title: Cost Per Energy Per Temperature Difference

quantity.description: optional for use with Cost per Each and "General" object Type
quantity.title: Quantity

reference_building_line_item_costs.description: should be comparable to the components in current line item cost model
reference_building_line_item_costs.title: Reference Building Line Item Costs

reference_building_miscellaneous_cost_pe.description: based on conditioned floor area for cost not accounted for in reference line item costs
reference_building_miscellaneous_cost_pe.title: Reference Building Miscellaneous Cost Per Conditioned Area

reference_building_design_and_engineerin.title: Reference Building Design And Engineering Fees

reference_building_permits_bonding_and_i.title: Reference Building Permits Bonding And Insurance

reference_building_regional_adjustment_f.description: for use with average data in line item and Misc cost models
reference_building_regional_adjustment_f.title: Reference Building Regional Adjustment Factor

user_defined_fluid_type.description: This field is only required when Fluid Type is UserDefinedFluidType
user_defined_fluid_type.title: User Defined Fluid Type

condenser_loop_temperature_setpoint_node.title: Condenser Loop Temperature Setpoint Node Name

condenser_demand_side_branch_list_name.title: Condenser Demand Side Branch List Name

condenser_demand_side_connector_list_nam.title: Condenser Demand Side Connector List Name

loop_circulation_time.description: This field is only used to autocalulate the Condenser Loop Volume. Loop Volume = Loop Circulation Time * Maximum Loop Flow Rate
loop_circulation_time.title: Loop Circulation Time

thermal_source_present_after_layer_numbe.description: refers to the list of materials which follows

temperature_calculation_requested_after_.description: refers to the list of materials which follows
temperature_calculation_requested_after_.title: Temperature Calculation Requested After Layer Number

tube_spacing.description: uniform spacing between tubes or resistance wires in direction perpendicular to main intended direction of heat transfer
tube_spacing.title: Tube Spacing

two_dimensional_temperature_calculation_.description: used in conjunction with field Temperature Calculation Requested After Layer Number this field is the location perpendicular to the main direction of heat transfer 0.0 means in line with the tubing, 1.0 means at the midpoint between two adjacent pipes this field is ignored for 1-D calculations
two_dimensional_temperature_calculation_.title: Two Dimensional Temperature Calculation Position

air_exchange_method.description: This field controls how air exchange is modeled across this boundary.
air_exchange_method.title: Air Exchange Method

simple_mixing_air_changes_per_hour.description: If the Air Exchange Method is SimpleMixing then this field specifies the air changes per hour using the volume of the smaller zone as the basis. If an AirflowNetwork simulation is active this field is ignored.
simple_mixing_air_changes_per_hour.title: Simple Mixing Air Changes Per Hour

simple_mixing_schedule_name.description: If the Air Exchange Method is SimpleMixing then this field specifies the air exchange schedule. If this field is blank, the schedule is always 1.0. If an AirflowNetwork simulation is active this field is ignored.
simple_mixing_schedule_name.title: Simple Mixing Schedule Name

c_factor.description: Enter C-Factor without film coefficients or soil
c_factor.title: C Factor

height.description: Enter height of the underground wall
height.title: Height

solar_optical_complex_back_reflectance_m.title: Solar Optical Complex Back Reflectance Matrix Name

outside_layer_directional_back_absoptanc.title: Outside Layer Directional Back Absoptance Matrix Name

cfs_gap_1_directional_back_absoptance_ma.description: Reserved for future use. Leave it blank for this version

gap_2_directional_back_absoptance_matrix.title: Gap 2 Directional Back Absoptance Matrix Name

layer_3_directional_front_absoptance_mat.title: Layer 3 Directional Front Absoptance Matrix Name

layer_3_directional_back_absoptance_matr.title: Layer 3 Directional Back Absoptance Matrix Name

gap_3_directional_front_absoptance_matri.description: Reserved for future use. Leave it blank for this version
gap_3_directional_front_absoptance_matri.title: Gap 3 Directional Front Absoptance Matrix Name

layer_5_directional_front_absoptance_mat.title: Layer 5 Directional Front Absoptance Matrix Name

layer_5_directional_back_absoptance_matr.title: Layer 5 Directional Back Absoptance Matrix Name

perimeterexposed.description: Enter exposed perimeter of the floor
perimeterexposed.title: Perimeterexposed

file_name.description: default file name is "Window5DataFile.dat" limit on this field is 100 characters.
file_name.title: File Name

availability_schedule_name.description: If this field is blank, the controller uses the values from the associated Controller:OutdoorAir. Schedule values greater than 0 indicate mechanical ventilation is enabled
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

actuator_node_name.description: Outdoor air inlet node entering the first pre-treat component if any
actuator_node_name.title: Actuator Node Name

minimum_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: If there is a Mechanical Ventilation Controller (Controller:MechanicalVentilation), note that this value times the Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule is a hard minimum that may override DCV or other advanced OA controls.
minimum_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate

economizer_maximum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for FixedDryBulb economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative. Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Dry Bulb Temperature

economizer_maximum_limit_enthalpy.description: Enter the maximum outdoor enthalpy limit for FixedEnthalpy economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_enthalpy.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy

economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dewpoint temperature limit for FixedDewPointAndDryBulb economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative. Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature

electronic_enthalpy_limit_curve_name.description: Enter the name of a quadratic or cubic curve which defines the maximum outdoor humidity ratio (function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature) for ElectronicEnthalpy economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
electronic_enthalpy_limit_curve_name.title: Electronic Enthalpy Limit Curve Name

economizer_minimum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.description: Enter the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for economizer control. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_minimum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.title: Economizer Minimum Limit Dry Bulb Temperature

minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Schedule values multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate
minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name

minimum_fraction_of_outdoor_air_schedule.description: schedule values multiply the design/mixed air flow rate
minimum_fraction_of_outdoor_air_schedule.title: Minimum Fraction Of Outdoor Air Schedule Name

maximum_fraction_of_outdoor_air_schedule.description: schedule values multiply the design/mixed air flow rate
maximum_fraction_of_outdoor_air_schedule.title: Maximum Fraction Of Outdoor Air Schedule Name

mechanical_ventilation_controller_name.description: Enter the name of a Controller:MechanicalVentilation object. Optional field for defining outdoor ventilation air based on flow rate per unit floor area and flow rate per person. Simplified method of demand-controlled ventilation.
mechanical_ventilation_controller_name.title: Mechanical Ventilation Controller Name

time_of_day_economizer_control_schedule_.description: Optional schedule to simulate "push-button" type economizer control. Schedule values greater than 0 indicate time-of-day economizer control is enabled. Economizer control may be used with or without the high humidity control option. When used together, high humidity control has priority over economizer control. If the field Economizer Control Type = NoEconomizer, then this option is disabled.
time_of_day_economizer_control_schedule_.title: Time Of Day Economizer Control Schedule Name

high_humidity_control.description: Optional field to enable modified outdoor air flow rates based on zone relative humidity. Select Yes to modify outdoor air flow rate based on a zone humidistat. Select No to disable this feature. If the field Economizer Control Type = NoEconomizer, then this option is disabled.
high_humidity_control.title: High Humidity Control

humidistat_control_zone_name.description: Enter the name of the zone where the humidistat is located. This field is only used when the field High Humidity Control = Yes.
humidistat_control_zone_name.title: Humidistat Control Zone Name

high_humidity_outdoor_air_flow_ratio.description: Enter the ratio of outdoor air to the maximum outdoor air flow rate when modified air flow rates are active based on high indoor humidity. The minimum value must be greater than 0. This field is only used when the field High Humidity Control = Yes.
high_humidity_outdoor_air_flow_ratio.title: High Humidity Outdoor Air Flow Ratio

control_high_indoor_humidity_based_on_ou.description: If No is selected, the outdoor air flow rate is modified any time indoor relative humidity is above the humidistat setpoint. If Yes is selected, the outdoor air flow rate is modified any time the indoor relative humidity is above the humidistat setpoint and the outdoor humidity ratio is less than the indoor humidity ratio. This field is only used when the field High Humidity Control = Yes.
control_high_indoor_humidity_based_on_ou.title: Control High Indoor Humidity Based On Outdoor Humidity Ratio

heat_recovery_bypass_control_type.description: BypassWhenWithinEconomizerLimits specifies that heat recovery is active only when the economizer is off because conditions are outside the economizer control limits BypassWhenOAFlowGreaterThanMinimum specifies enhanced economizer controls to allow heat recovery when economizer is active (within limits) but the outdoor air flow rate is at the minimum.
heat_recovery_bypass_control_type.title: Heat Recovery Bypass Control Type

control_variable.description: keys HumidityRatio or TemperatureAndHumidityRatio requires a ZoneControl:Humidistat object along with SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Maximum, SetpointManager:MultiZone:MaximumHumidity:Average, or SetpointManager:Multizone:Humidity:Maximum object
control_variable.title: Control Variable

action.description: Leave blank to have this automatically selected from coil type. Chilled water coils should be reverse action Hot water coils should be normal action
action.title: Action

minimum_system_timestep.description: 0 sets the minimum to the zone timestep (ref: Timestep) 1 is normal (ratchet down to 1 minute) setting greater than zone timestep (in minutes) will effectively set to zone timestep
minimum_system_timestep.title: Minimum System Timestep

minimum_plant_iterations.description: Controls the minimum number of plant system solver iterations within a single HVAC iteration Larger values will increase runtime but might improve solution accuracy for complicated plant systems Complex plants include: several interconnected loops, heat recovery, thermal load following generators, etc.
minimum_plant_iterations.title: Minimum Plant Iterations

maximum_plant_iterations.description: Controls the maximum number of plant system solver iterations within a single HVAC iteration Smaller values might decrease runtime but could decrease solution accuracy for complicated plant systems
maximum_plant_iterations.title: Maximum Plant Iterations

minimum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Minimum valid inlet air wet-bulb temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
minimum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Minimum Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

maximum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Maximum valid inlet air wet-bulb temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Maximum Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

minimum_approach_temperature.description: Minimum valid approach temperature for this correlation.
minimum_approach_temperature.title: Minimum Approach Temperature

maximum_approach_temperature.description: Maximum valid approach temperature for this correlation.
maximum_approach_temperature.title: Maximum Approach Temperature

minimum_water_flow_rate_ratio.description: Minimum valid water flow rate ratio for this approach temperature correlation.
minimum_water_flow_rate_ratio.title: Minimum Water Flow Rate Ratio

maximum_water_flow_rate_ratio.description: Maximum valid water flow rate ratio for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_water_flow_rate_ratio.title: Maximum Water Flow Rate Ratio

minimum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Minimum valid inlet air wet-bulb temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
minimum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Minimum Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

maximum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Maximum valid inlet air wet-bulb temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Maximum Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

minimum_range_temperature.description: Minimum valid range temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
minimum_range_temperature.title: Minimum Range Temperature

maximum_range_temperature.description: Maximum valid range temperature for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_range_temperature.title: Maximum Range Temperature

minimum_approach_temperature.description: Minimum valid approach temperature for this correlation.
minimum_approach_temperature.title: Minimum Approach Temperature

maximum_approach_temperature.description: Maximum valid approach temperature for this correlation.
maximum_approach_temperature.title: Maximum Approach Temperature

minimum_water_flow_rate_ratio.description: Minimum valid water flow rate ratio for this approach temperature correlation.
minimum_water_flow_rate_ratio.title: Minimum Water Flow Rate Ratio

maximum_water_flow_rate_ratio.description: Maximum valid water flow rate ratio for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_water_flow_rate_ratio.title: Maximum Water Flow Rate Ratio

maximum_liquid_to_gas_ratio.description: Maximum liquid (water) to gas (air) ratio for this approach temperature correlation.
maximum_liquid_to_gas_ratio.title: Maximum Liquid To Gas Ratio

water_inlet_node_name.description: Name of tower water inlet node
water_inlet_node_name.title: Water Inlet Node Name

water_outlet_node_name.description: Name of tower water outlet node
water_outlet_node_name.title: Water Outlet Node Name

design_water_flow_rate.description: Leave field blank if tower performance input method is NominalCapacity
design_water_flow_rate.title: Design Water Flow Rate

design_fan_power.description: This is the fan motor electric input power
design_fan_power.title: Design Fan Power

design_u_factor_times_area_value.description: Leave field blank if tower performance input method is NominalCapacity
design_u_factor_times_area_value.title: Design U Factor Times Area Value

free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate.title: Free Convection Regime Air Flow Rate

free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate_siz.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate.
free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate_siz.title: Free Convection Regime Air Flow Rate Sizing Factor

free_convection_regime_u_factor_times_ar.title: Free Convection Regime U Factor Times Area Value

free_convection_u_factor_times_area_valu.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate and the Performance Input Method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate
free_convection_u_factor_times_area_valu.title: Free Convection U Factor Times Area Value Sizing Factor

performance_input_method.description: User can define tower thermal performance by specifying the tower UA, the Design Air Flow Rate and the Design Water Flow Rate, or by specifying the tower nominal capacity
performance_input_method.title: Performance Input Method

heat_rejection_capacity_and_nominal_capa.title: Heat Rejection Capacity And Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio

nominal_capacity.description: Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt (3 gpm/ton). Nominal tower capacity times (1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
nominal_capacity.title: Nominal Capacity

free_convection_capacity.description: Tower capacity in free convection regime with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt of nominal tower capacity (3 gpm/ton). Tower free convection capacity times (1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
free_convection_capacity.title: Free Convection Capacity

free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate
free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.title: Free Convection Nominal Capacity Sizing Factor

design_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temperature.description: Enter the tower's design inlet air dry-bulb temperature
design_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temperature.title: Design Inlet Air Dry Bulb Temperature

design_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Enter the tower's design inlet air wet-bulb temperature
design_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Design Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

design_approach_temperature.description: Enter the approach temperature corresponding to the design inlet air wet-bulb temperature and design range temperature. Design approach temp = outlet water temperature minus inlet air wet-bulb temperature at design conditions. Autosized to 3.9 deltaC.
design_approach_temperature.title: Design Approach Temperature

design_range_temperature.description: Enter the range temperature corresponding to the design inlet air wet-bulb temperature and design approach temperature. Design range = inlet water temperature minus outlet water temperature at design conditions. Autosized to 5.5 deltaC.
design_range_temperature.title: Design Range Temperature

basin_heater_capacity.description: This heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when water is not flowing through the tower.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

evaporation_loss_factor.description: Rate of water evaporation from the cooling tower and lost to the outdoor air [%/K] Evaporation loss is calculated as percentage of the circulating condenser water rate Value entered here is percent-per-degree K of temperature drop in the condenser water Typical values are from 0.15 to 0.27 [%/K].
evaporation_loss_factor.title: Evaporation Loss Factor

drift_loss_percent.description: Rate of drift loss as a percentage of circulating condenser water flow rate Typical values are between 0.002 and 0.2% The default value is 0.008%
drift_loss_percent.title: Drift Loss Percent

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the cooling tower. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the tower in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. Typical values for tower operation are 3 to 5. The default value is 3.
blowdown_concentration_ratio.title: Blowdown Concentration Ratio

blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.description: Makeup water usage due to blowdown results from occasionally draining a small amount of water in the tower basin to purge scale or other contaminants to reduce their concentration in order to maintain an acceptable level of water quality. Schedule values should reflect water usage in m3/s.
blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.title: Blowdown Makeup Water Usage Schedule Name

outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Inlet Node Name
