cell_maximum_water_flow_rate_fraction.description: The allowable maximal fraction of the nominal flow rate per cell
cell_maximum_water_flow_rate_fraction.title: Cell Maximum Water Flow Rate Fraction

high_fan_speed_fan_power.title: High Fan Speed Fan Power

high_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_value.description: Leave field blank if Tower Performance Input Method is NominalCapacity
high_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_value.title: High Fan Speed U Factor Times Area Value

low_fan_speed_air_flow_rate.description: Low speed air flow rate must be less than high speed air flow rate Low speed air flow rate must be greater than free convection air flow rate

low_fan_speed_air_flow_rate_sizing_facto.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate.

low_fan_speed_fan_power.description: This is the fan motor electric input power at low speed

low_fan_speed_fan_power_sizing_factor.title: Low Fan Speed Fan Power Sizing Factor

low_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_value.description: Leave field blank if tower Performance Input Method is NominalCapacity Low speed tower UA must be less than high speed tower UA Low speed tower UA must be greater than free convection tower UA
low_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_value.title: Low Fan Speed U Factor Times Area Value

low_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_sizing.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate and the Performance Input Method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate
low_fan_speed_u_factor_times_area_sizing.title: Low Fan Speed U Factor Times Area Sizing Factor

free_convection_regime_u_factor_times_ar.title: Free Convection Regime U Factor Times Area Value

free_convection_u_factor_times_area_valu.title: Free Convection U Factor Times Area Value Sizing Factor

performance_input_method.description: User can define tower thermal performance by specifying the tower UA, the Design Air Flow Rate and the Design Water Flow Rate, or by specifying the tower nominal capacity
performance_input_method.title: Performance Input Method

heat_rejection_capacity_and_nominal_capa.title: Heat Rejection Capacity And Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio

high_speed_nominal_capacity.description: Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature, with the tower fan operating at high speed. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt(3 gpm/ton). Nominal tower capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
high_speed_nominal_capacity.title: High Speed Nominal Capacity

low_speed_nominal_capacity.description: Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature, with the tower fan operating at low speed. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt of tower high-speed nominal capacity (3 gpm/ton). Nominal tower capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
low_speed_nominal_capacity.title: Low Speed Nominal Capacity

low_speed_nominal_capacity_sizing_factor.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate
low_speed_nominal_capacity_sizing_factor.title: Low Speed Nominal Capacity Sizing Factor

free_convection_nominal_capacity.description: Tower capacity in free convection regime with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt of tower high-speed nominal capacity (3 gpm/ton). Tower free convection capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25)  gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions
free_convection_nominal_capacity.title: Free Convection Nominal Capacity

free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate
free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.title: Free Convection Nominal Capacity Sizing Factor

design_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temperature.description: Enter the tower's design inlet air dry-bulb temperature
design_inlet_air_dry_bulb_temperature.title: Design Inlet Air Dry Bulb Temperature

design_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Enter the tower's design inlet air wet-bulb temperature
design_inlet_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Design Inlet Air Wet Bulb Temperature

design_approach_temperature.description: Enter the approach temperature corresponding to the design inlet air wet-bulb temperature and design range temperature. Design approach temp = outlet water temperature minus inlet air wet-bulb temperature at design conditions. Autosized to 3.9 deltaC.
design_approach_temperature.title: Design Approach Temperature

design_range_temperature.description: Enter the range temperature corresponding to the design inlet air wet-bulb temperature and design approach temperature. Design range = inlet water temperature minus outlet water temperature at design conditions. Autosized to 5.5 deltaC.
design_range_temperature.title: Design Range Temperature

basin_heater_capacity.description: This heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when water is not flowing through the tower.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

evaporation_loss_factor.description: Rate of water evaporated from the cooling tower and lost to the outdoor air [%/K] Evaporation loss is calculated as percentage of the circulating condenser water rate Value entered here is percent-per-degree K of temperature drop in the condenser water Typical values are from 0.15 to 0.27 [%/K].
evaporation_loss_factor.title: Evaporation Loss Factor

drift_loss_percent.description: Rate of drift loss as a percentage of circulating condenser water flow rate Typical values are between 0.002 and 0.2% The default value is 0.008%
drift_loss_percent.title: Drift Loss Percent

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the cooling tower. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the tower in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. Typical values for tower operation are 3 to 5. The default value is 3.
blowdown_concentration_ratio.title: Blowdown Concentration Ratio

blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.description: Makeup water usage due to blowdown results from occasionally draining some amount of water in the tower basin to purge scale or other contaminants to reduce their concentration in order to maintain an acceptable level of water quality. Schedule values should reflect water usage in m3/s.
blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.title: Blowdown Makeup Water Usage Schedule Name

outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Inlet Node Name

model_coefficient_name.title: Model Coefficient Name

design_range_temperature.description: Enter the range temperature corresponding to the design inlet air wet-bulb temperature and design approach temperature. Design range = inlet water temperature minus outlet water temperature at design conditions.
design_range_temperature.title: Design Range Temperature

design_water_flow_rate.description: Water flow rate through the tower at design conditions
design_water_flow_rate.title: Design Water Flow Rate

design_air_flow_rate.description: Design (maximum) air flow rate through the tower
design_air_flow_rate.title: Design Air Flow Rate

design_fan_power.description: Enter the fan motor electric input power at design (max) air flow through the tower Standard conversion for horsepower is 1 HP = 745.7 W
design_fan_power.title: Design Fan Power

fan_power_ratio_function_of_air_flow_rat.description: FPR = a + b*AFR + c*AFR**2 + d*AFR**3 FPR = fraction of the design fan power AFR = fraction of the design air flow rate If left blank, then fan power is assumed to be proportional to (air flow rate ratio)^3
fan_power_ratio_function_of_air_flow_rat.title: Fan Power Ratio Function Of Air Flow Rate Ratio Curve Name

minimum_air_flow_rate_ratio.description: Enter the minimum air flow rate ratio. This is typically determined by the variable speed drive that controls the fan motor speed. Valid entries are from 0.2 to 0.5.
minimum_air_flow_rate_ratio.title: Minimum Air Flow Rate Ratio

fraction_of_tower_capacity_in_free_conve.description: Enter the fraction of tower capacity in the free convection regime. This is the fraction of the tower capacity, at the current inlet air wet-bulb temperature, that is available when the tower fan is off. Manufacturers typically estimate the free convection capacity at approximately 10-15%. Values are entered as a fraction and can range from 0 to 0.2.
fraction_of_tower_capacity_in_free_conve.title: Fraction Of Tower Capacity In Free Convection Regime

water_outlet_node_name.title: Water Outlet Node Name

performance_input_method.description: User can define tower thermal performance by specifying the tower UA, the Design Air Flow Rate and the Design Water Flow Rate, or by specifying the tower nominal capacity
performance_input_method.title: Performance Input Method

heat_rejection_capacity_and_nominal_capa.title: Heat Rejection Capacity And Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio

nominal_capacity.description: Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature, with the tower fan operating at Design Air Flow Rate (full speed). Design water flow rate is as set in Design Water Flow Rate per Unit of Nominal Capacity. Nominal tower capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
nominal_capacity.title: Nominal Capacity

free_convection_nominal_capacity.description: required field when performance method is NominalCapacity Tower capacity in free convection regime with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate is as set in Design Water Flow Rate per Unit of Nominal Capacity. Tower free convection capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25)  gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions
free_convection_nominal_capacity.title: Free Convection Nominal Capacity

free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate
free_convection_nominal_capacity_sizing_.title: Free Convection Nominal Capacity Sizing Factor

design_water_flow_rate_per_unit_of_nomin.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to autocalculate and performance input method is NominalCapacity
design_water_flow_rate_per_unit_of_nomin.title: Design Water Flow Rate Per Unit Of Nominal Capacity

design_air_flow_rate.description: This is the air flow rate at full fan speed
design_air_flow_rate.title: Design Air Flow Rate

design_air_flow_rate_per_unit_of_nominal.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to autocalculate When field is left blank the default scaling factor is adjusted for elevation to increase volume flow at altitude When field has a value the scaling factor is used without adjusting for elevation
design_air_flow_rate_per_unit_of_nominal.title: Design Air Flow Rate Per Unit Of Nominal Capacity

minimum_air_flow_rate_ratio.description: Enter the minimum air flow rate ratio. This is typically determined by the variable speed drive that controls the fan motor speed. Valid entries are from 0.1 to 0.5.
minimum_air_flow_rate_ratio.title: Minimum Air Flow Rate Ratio

design_fan_power.description: This is the fan motor electric input power at high speed
design_fan_power.title: Design Fan Power

design_fan_power_per_unit_of_nominal_cap.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to autocalculate [W/W] Watts of fan power per Watt of tower nominal capacity
design_fan_power_per_unit_of_nominal_cap.title: Design Fan Power Per Unit Of Nominal Capacity

fan_power_modifier_function_of_air_flow_.description: Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used cubic curve = a + b*AFR + c*AFR**2 + d*AFR**3 quartic curve = a + b*AFR + c*AFR**2 + d*AFR**3 + e*AFR**4 x = AFR = Ratio of current operating air flow rate to Design Air Flow Rate
fan_power_modifier_function_of_air_flow_.title: Fan Power Modifier Function Of Air Flow Rate Ratio Curve Name

free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate.title: Free Convection Regime Air Flow Rate

free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate_siz.description: This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate.
free_convection_regime_air_flow_rate_siz.title: Free Convection Regime Air Flow Rate Sizing Factor

design_air_flow_rate_u_factor_times_area.description: required field when performance method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate when performance method is NominalCapacity the program will solve for this UA
design_air_flow_rate_u_factor_times_area.title: Design Air Flow Rate U Factor Times Area Value

free_convection_regime_u_factor_times_ar.description: required field when performance input method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate Leave field blank if performance input method is NominalCapacity
free_convection_regime_u_factor_times_ar.title: Free Convection Regime U Factor Times Area Value

free_convection_u_factor_times_area_valu.description: required field when performance input method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate This field is only used if the previous field is set to autocalculate and the performance input method is UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate
free_convection_u_factor_times_area_valu.title: Free Convection U Factor Times Area Value Sizing Factor

u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.description: This curve describes how tower's design UA changes with variable air flow rate Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used cubic curve = a + b*AFR + c*AFR**2 + d*AFR**3 quartic curve = a + b*AFR + c*AFR**2 + d*AFR**3 + e*AFR**4 x = AFR = Ratio of current operating air flow rate to Design Air Flow Rate
u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.title: U Factor Times Area Modifier Function Of Air Flow Ratio Curve Name

u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.description: curve describes how tower UA changes with outdoor air wet-bulb temperature difference from design wet-bulb Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used cubic curve = a + b*DeltaWB + c*DeltaWB**2 + d*DeltaWB**3 quartic curve = a + b*DeltaWB + c*DeltaWB**2 + d*DeltaWB**3 + e*DeltaWB**4 x = DeltaWB = (design wet-bulb temperature in C - current wet-bulb temperature in C) where design wet-bulb temperature of entering air is 25.56C (78F)
u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.title: U Factor Times Area Modifier Function Of Wetbulb Temperature Difference Curve Name

u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.description: curve describes how tower UA changes with the flow rate of condenser water through the tower Any curve or table with one independent variable can be used cubic curve = a + b*WFR + c*WFR**2 + d*WFR**3 quartic curve = a + b*WFR + c*WFR**2 + d*WFR**3 + e*WFR**4 x = WFR = Ratio of current operating water flow rate to Design Water Flow Rate
u_factor_times_area_modifier_function_of.title: U Factor Times Area Modifier Function Of Water Flow Ratio Curve Name

height_of_well.description: Distance from Bottom of Window to Bottom of Well
height_of_well.title: Height Of Well

inside_shelf_name.description: This must refer to a BuildingSurface:Detailed or equivalent object This surface must be its own Surface for other side boundary conditions.
inside_shelf_name.title: Inside Shelf Name

outside_shelf_name.description: This must refer to a Shading:Zone:Detailed object
outside_shelf_name.title: Outside Shelf Name

outside_shelf_construction_name.description: Required if outside shelf is specified
outside_shelf_construction_name.title: Outside Shelf Construction Name

dome_name.description: This must refer to a subsurface object of type TubularDaylightDome
dome_name.title: Dome Name

diffuser_name.description: This must refer to a subsurface object of type TubularDaylightDiffuser Delivery zone is specified in the diffuser object
diffuser_name.title: Diffuser Name

total_length.description: The exterior exposed length is the difference between total and sum of zone lengths
total_length.title: Total Length

effective_thermal_resistance.description: R value between TubularDaylightDome and TubularDaylightDiffuser
effective_thermal_resistance.title: Effective Thermal Resistance

minimum_input_power_fraction_for_continu.title: Minimum Input Power Fraction For Continuous Or Continuousoff Dimming Control

minimum_light_output_fraction_for_contin.title: Minimum Light Output Fraction For Continuous Or Continuousoff Dimming Control

number_of_stepped_control_steps.description: The number of steps, excluding off, in a stepped lighting control system. If Lighting Control Type is Stepped, this field must be greater than zero. The steps are assumed to be equally spaced.
number_of_stepped_control_steps.title: Number Of Stepped Control Steps

probability_lighting_will_be_reset_when_.title: Probability Lighting Will Be Reset When Needed In Manual Stepped Control

glare_calculation_daylighting_reference_.title: Glare Calculation Daylighting Reference Point Name

glare_calculation_azimuth_angle_of_view_.title: Glare Calculation Azimuth Angle Of View Direction Clockwise From Zone Y Axis

maximum_allowable_discomfort_glare_index.description: The default is for general office work
maximum_allowable_discomfort_glare_index.title: Maximum Allowable Discomfort Glare Index

delight_gridding_resolution.description: Maximum surface area for nodes in gridding all surfaces in the DElight zone. All reflective and transmitting surfaces will be subdivided into approximately square nodes that do not exceed this maximum. Higher resolution subdivisions require greater calculation times, but generally produce more accurate results.
delight_gridding_resolution.title: Delight Gridding Resolution

complex_fenestration_type.description: Used to select the appropriate Complex Fenestration BTDF data
complex_fenestration_type.title: Complex Fenestration Type

building_surface_name.description: This is a reference to a valid surface object (such as BuildingSurface:Detailed) hosting this complex fenestration, analogous to the base surface Name field for subsurfaces such as Windows.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

window_name.description: This is a reference to a valid FenestrationSurface:Detailed window object used to account for the geometry, and the solar and thermal gains/losses, of the Complex Fenestration
window_name.title: Window Name

fenestration_rotation.description: In-plane counter-clockwise rotation angle of the Complex Fenestration optical reference direction and the base edge of the Complex Fenestration. The Rotation will typically be zero when the host and CFS surfaces are rectangular and height and width edges are aligned.
fenestration_rotation.title: Fenestration Rotation

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

process_air_inlet_node_name.description: This is the node entering the process side of the desiccant wheel.
process_air_inlet_node_name.title: Process Air Inlet Node Name

process_air_outlet_node_name.description: This is the node leaving the process side of the desiccant wheel.
process_air_outlet_node_name.title: Process Air Outlet Node Name

regeneration_air_inlet_node_name.description: This is the node entering the regeneration side of the desiccant wheel after the regeneration coil.
regeneration_air_inlet_node_name.title: Regeneration Air Inlet Node Name

regeneration_fan_inlet_node_name.description: Node for air entering the regeneration fan, mass flow is set by the desiccant dehumidifier module.
regeneration_fan_inlet_node_name.title: Regeneration Fan Inlet Node Name

control_type.description: Type of setpoint control: LeavingMaximumHumidityRatioSetpoint means that the unit is controlled to deliver air at the Leaving Max Humidity Ratio Setpoint (see below), SystemNodeMaximumHumidityRatioSetpoint means that the leaving humidity ratio setpoint is the System Node Humidity Ratio Max property of the Process Air Outlet Node. A Setpoint object must be used to control this setpoint. Both control types use bypass dampers to prevent over drying.
control_type.title: Control Type

leaving_maximum_humidity_ratio_setpoint.description: Fixed setpoint for maximum process air leaving humidity ratio Applicable only when Control Type = LeavingMaximumHumidityRatioSetpoint.
leaving_maximum_humidity_ratio_setpoint.title: Leaving Maximum Humidity Ratio Setpoint

nominal_process_air_flow_rate.description: Process air flow rate at nominal conditions
nominal_process_air_flow_rate.title: Nominal Process Air Flow Rate

nominal_process_air_velocity.description: Process air velocity at nominal flow When using Performance Model Type of Default, must be 2.032 to 4.064 m/s (400 to 800 fpm)
nominal_process_air_velocity.title: Nominal Process Air Velocity

rotor_power.description: Power input to wheel rotor motor
rotor_power.title: Rotor Power

regeneration_coil_object_type.description: heating coil type works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
regeneration_coil_object_type.title: Regeneration Coil Object Type

regeneration_coil_name.description: Name of heating coil object for regeneration air
regeneration_coil_name.title: Regeneration Coil Name

regeneration_fan_object_type.description: Type of fan object for regeneration air. When using the Default Performance Model Type (see below), only Fan:VariableVolume or Fan:SystemModel are valid.
regeneration_fan_object_type.title: Regeneration Fan Object Type

regeneration_fan_name.description: Name of fan object for regeneration air
regeneration_fan_name.title: Regeneration Fan Name

performance_model_type.description: Specifies whether the default performance model or user-specified curves should be used to model the performance. The default model is a generic solid desiccant wheel using performance curves of the form: curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*vel + C7*vel**2 + C8*edb*ew + C9*edb**2*ew**2 + C10*edb*vel + C11*edb**2*vel**2 + C12*ew*vel + C13*ew**2*vel**2 + C14*ALOG(edb) + C15*ALOG(ew) + C16*ALOG(vel) edb = process entering dry-bulb temperature [C] ew  = process entering humidity ratio [kgWater/kgDryAir] vel = process air velocity [m/s] If UserCurves are specified, then performance is calculated as follows: Leaving Dry-Bulb = (Leaving Dry-Bulb fTW Curve) * (Leaving Dry-Bulb fV Curve) Leaving Humidity Ratio = (Leaving Humidity Ratio fTW Curve) * (Leaving Humidity Ratio fV Curve) Regen Energy = (Regen Energy fTW Curve) * (Regen Energy fV Curve) Regen Velocity = (Regen Velocity fTW Curve) * (Regen Velocity fV Curve)
performance_model_type.title: Performance Model Type

leaving_dry_bulb_function_of_entering_dr.description: Leaving dry-bulb of process air as a function of entering dry-bulb and entering humidity ratio, biquadratic curve curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*edb*ew edb = process entering dry-bulb temperature [C] ew  = process entering humidity ratio [kgWater/kgDryAir]
leaving_dry_bulb_function_of_entering_dr.title: Leaving Dry Bulb Function Of Entering Dry Bulb And Humidity Ratio Curve Name

leaving_dry_bulb_function_of_air_velocit.description: Leaving dry-bulb of process air as a function of air velocity, quadratic curve. curve = C1 + C2*v + C3*v**2 v = process air velocity [m/s]
leaving_dry_bulb_function_of_air_velocit.title: Leaving Dry Bulb Function Of Air Velocity Curve Name

leaving_humidity_ratio_function_of_enter.description: Leaving humidity ratio of process air as a function of entering dry-bulb and entering humidity ratio, biquadratic curve curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*edb*ew edb = process entering dry-bulb temperature [C] ew  = process entering humidity ratio [kgWater/kgDryAir]
leaving_humidity_ratio_function_of_enter.title: Leaving Humidity Ratio Function Of Entering Dry Bulb And Humidity Ratio Curve Name

leaving_humidity_ratio_function_of_air_v.description: Leaving humidity ratio of process air as a function of process air velocity, quadratic curve. curve = C1 + C2*v + C3*v**2 v = process air velocity [m/s]
leaving_humidity_ratio_function_of_air_v.title: Leaving Humidity Ratio Function Of Air Velocity Curve Name

regeneration_energy_function_of_entering.description: Regeneration energy [J/kg of water removed] as a function of entering dry-bulb and entering humidity ratio, biquadratic curve curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*edb*ew edb = process entering dry-bulb temperature [C] ew  = process entering humidity ratio [kgWater/kgDryAir]
regeneration_energy_function_of_entering.title: Regeneration Energy Function Of Entering Dry Bulb And Humidity Ratio Curve Name

regeneration_energy_function_of_air_velo.description: Regeneration energy [J/kg of water removed] as a function of process air velocity, quadratic curve. curve = C1 + C2*v + C3*v**2 v = process air velocity [m/s]
regeneration_energy_function_of_air_velo.title: Regeneration Energy Function Of Air Velocity Curve Name

regeneration_velocity_function_of_enteri.description: Regeneration velocity [m/s] as a function of entering dry-bulb and entering humidity ratio, biquadratic curve curve = C1 + C2*edb + C3*edb**2 + C4*ew + C5*ew**2 + C6*edb*ew edb = process entering dry-bulb temperature [C] ew  = process entering humidity ratio [kgWater/kgDryAir]
regeneration_velocity_function_of_enteri.title: Regeneration Velocity Function Of Entering Dry Bulb And Humidity Ratio Curve Name

regeneration_velocity_function_of_air_ve.description: Regeneration velocity [m/s] as a function of process air velocity, quadratic curve. curve = C1 + C2*v + C3*v**2 v = process air velocity [m/s]
regeneration_velocity_function_of_air_ve.title: Regeneration Velocity Function Of Air Velocity Curve Name

nominal_regeneration_temperature.description: Nominal regen temperature upon which the regen energy modifier curve is based. Not used if Default if chosen for the field Performance Mode Type. 121 C is a commonly used value.
nominal_regeneration_temperature.title: Nominal Regeneration Temperature

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

regeneration_air_heater_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils. For autosizing the regeneration air heating coil the Design Coil Inlet Air Condition used is the outdoor air condition if the desiccant system is on the primary air loop, or else if the desiccant system is on outdoor air system then it is the return air condition. The Design Coil Outlet Air Temperature is the Regeneration Inlet Air Setpoint Temperature specified in the input field below.
regeneration_air_heater_object_type.title: Regeneration Air Heater Object Type

regeneration_inlet_air_setpoint_temperat.description: This value is also used as regeneration air heater design coil air outlet temperature for autosizing calculation of the heater.
regeneration_inlet_air_setpoint_temperat.title: Regeneration Inlet Air Setpoint Temperature

companion_cooling_coil_upstream_of_dehum.description: Select Yes if the companion cooling coil is located directly upstream of the desiccant heat exchanger's process air inlet node.
companion_cooling_coil_upstream_of_dehum.title: Companion Cooling Coil Upstream Of Dehumidifier Process Inlet

exhaust_fan_power_curve_name.description: Curve object type must be Curve:Quadratic or Curve:Cubic
exhaust_fan_power_curve_name.title: Exhaust Fan Power Curve Name

billing_period_schedule_name.description: This field should reference the same schedule as the month schedule name field of the UtilityCost:Tariff object, if used. If blank, defaults to regular divisions between months.
billing_period_schedule_name.title: Billing Period Schedule Name

peak_period_schedule_name.description: This field should reference the same schedule as the period schedule name field of the UtilityCost:Tariff object, if used. If blank, defaults to always on peak.
peak_period_schedule_name.title: Peak Period Schedule Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

minimum_limit_duration.description: If blank, duration defaults to the timestep
minimum_limit_duration.title: Minimum Limit Duration

rotation_duration.description: If blank, duration defaults to the timestep
rotation_duration.title: Rotation Duration

availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

minimum_limit_duration.title: Minimum Limit Duration

rotation_duration.title: Rotation Duration

minimum_reset_duration.title: Minimum Reset Duration

rotation_duration.title: Rotation Duration

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this demand manager. Schedule value > 0 means the demand manager is available. If this field is blank, the DR is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

minimum_limit_duration.description: If blank, duration defaults to the timestep
minimum_limit_duration.title: Minimum Limit Duration

fixed_rate.description: Used in case when Limit strategy is set to FixedRate
fixed_rate.title: Fixed Rate

reduction_ratio.description: Used in case when Limit Control is set to ReductionRatio
reduction_ratio.title: Reduction Ratio

rotation_duration.description: If blank, duration defaults to the timestep
rotation_duration.title: Rotation Duration

fraction_of_design_cooling_load.description: The fraction of the design sensible cooling load to be met by this terminal unit. This fraction is applied after the Zone Cooling Sizing Factor (see Sizing:Zone).
fraction_of_design_cooling_load.title: Fraction Of Design Cooling Load

cooling_design_supply_air_temperature_di.description: This ratio adjusts the supply air temperature difference used to calculate the cooling design supply air flow rate for this terminal unit.
cooling_design_supply_air_temperature_di.title: Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference Ratio

fraction_of_design_heating_load.description: The fraction of the design sensible heating load to be met by this terminal unit. This fraction is applied after the Zone Heating Sizing Factor (see Sizing:Zone).
fraction_of_design_heating_load.title: Fraction Of Design Heating Load

heating_design_supply_air_temperature_di.description: This ratio adjusts the supply air temperature difference used to calculate the heating design supply air flow rate for this terminal unit.
heating_design_supply_air_temperature_di.title: Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference Ratio

fraction_of_minimum_outdoor_air_flow.description: The fraction of the zone minimum outdoor air requirement to be met by this terminal unit.
fraction_of_minimum_outdoor_air_flow.title: Fraction Of Minimum Outdoor Air Flow

outdoor_air_method.description: Flow/Person => Outdoor Air Flow per Person * Occupancy = Design Flow Rate, Flow/Area => Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area * Zone Floor Area = Design Flow Rate, Flow/Zone => Outdoor Air Flow per Zone = Design Flow Rate, AirChanges/Hour => Outdoor Air Flow Air Changes per Hour * Zone Volume adjusted for m3/s = Design Flow Rate
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_per_person.description: 0.00944 m3/s is equivalent to 20 cfm per person This input is only used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum For sizing, the design number of occupants is used. For outdoor air flow control, the use of design occupants or current occupants depends on the component and DCV options. AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:NoReheat, AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:Reheat use the DCV flag specified in Controller:MechanicalVentilation AirTerminal:DualDuct:VAV:OutdoorAir and ZoneHVAC:IdealLoadsAirSystem have their own DCV control input. ZoneHVAC:FourPipeFanCoil always uses current occupants.
outdoor_air_flow_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_per_zone_floor_area.description: This input is only used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_per_zone_floor_area.title: Outdoor Air Flow Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_per_zone.description: This input is only used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Per Zone

outdoor_air_flow_air_changes_per_hour.description: This input is only used if the field Outdoor Air Method is AirChanges/Hour, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_air_changes_per_hour.title: Outdoor Air Flow Air Changes Per Hour

outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Schedule values are multiplied by the Outdoor Air Flow rate calculated using the previous four inputs. Schedule values are limited to 0 to 1. If left blank, the schedule defaults to 1.0. This schedule is ignored during sizing. All other components which reference this design specification use the current schedule value to calculate the current outdoor air requirement. This includes AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:NoReheat, AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:Reheat, AirTerminal:DualDuct:VAV:OutdoorAir, ZoneHVAC:FourPipeFanCoil, and ZoneHVAC:IdealLoadsAirSystem. This schedule will also be applied by Controller:MechanicalVentilation for all System Outdoor Air Methods.
outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Outdoor Air Schedule Name

proportional_control_minimum_outdoor_air.description: This input is only used to calculate the minimum outdoor air flow rate when the field System Outdoor Air Method = ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOARate in Controller:MechanicalVentilation.
proportional_control_minimum_outdoor_air.title: Proportional Control Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate Schedule Name

zone_air_distribution_effectiveness_in_c.title: Zone Air Distribution Effectiveness In Cooling Mode

zone_air_distribution_effectiveness_in_h.title: Zone Air Distribution Effectiveness In Heating Mode

zone_air_distribution_effectiveness_sche.description: optionally used to replace Zone Air Distribution Effectiveness in Cooling and Heating Mode
zone_air_distribution_effectiveness_sche.title: Zone Air Distribution Effectiveness Schedule Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the cooling supply air volume flow rate. None is used when a cooling coil is not included in the Zone HVAC Equip or this field may be blank. SupplyAirFlowRate => selected when the magnitude of the supply air volume flow rate is specified. FlowPerFloorArea => selected when the supply air volume flow rate is determined from total floor area served by the Zone HVAC unit and Flow Per Floor Area value specified. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from a user specified fraction and the autosized cooling supply air flow rate value determined by the simulation. FlowPerCoolingCapacity => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from user specified flow per Cooling Capacity and Cooling Capacity determined by the simulation.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_method.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the magnitude of supply air volume flow rate during cooling operation. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is SupplyAirFlowRate. This field may be blank if a cooling coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.description: Enter the cooling supply air volume flow rate per total conditioned floor area. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerFloorArea. This field may be blank if a cooling coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Per Floor Area

cooling_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the cooling supply air flow rate. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow. This field may be blank if a cooling coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
cooling_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.title: Cooling Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_co.description: Enter the cooling supply air volume flow rate unit cooling capacity. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerCoolingCapacity. This field may be blank if a cooling coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_co.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Per Unit Cooling Capacity

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the supply air volume flow rate When No Cooling or Heating is Required. None is used when a cooling or heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC Equipment or this field may be blank. SupplyAirFlowRate => selected when the magnitude of the supply air volume flow rate is specified. FlowPerFloorArea => selected when the supply air volume flow rate is determined from total floor area served by the Zone HVAC unit and Flow Per Floor Area is specified. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from a user specified fraction and the Autosized cooling supply air flow rate value determined by the simulation. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from a user specified fraction and the Autosized heating supply air flow rate value determined by the simulation.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_method.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Method

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the magnitude of the supply air volume flow rate during when no cooling or heating is required. Required field when No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Method is SupplyAirFlowRate.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate per total floor area. Required field when No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerFloorArea.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Per Floor Area

no_load_fraction_of_cooling_supply_air_f.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the cooling supply air flow rate. Required field when No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow.
no_load_fraction_of_cooling_supply_air_f.title: No Load Fraction Of Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_fraction_of_heating_supply_air_f.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the heating supply air flow rate. Required field when No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow.
no_load_fraction_of_heating_supply_air_f.title: No Load Fraction Of Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the heating supply air volume flow rate. None is used when a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC Equipment or this field may be blank. SupplyAirFlowRate => selected when the magnitude of the heating supply air volume flow rate is specified. FlowPerFloorArea => selected when the supply air volume flow rate is determined from total floor area served by a Zone HVAC unit and user specified value of Flow Per Floor Area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from a user specified fraction and the Autosized heating supply air flow rate value determined by the simulation. FlowPerHeatingCapacity => is selected when the supply air volume is determined from user specified flow per Heating Capacity and Heating Capacity determined by the simulation.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate_method.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Enter the magnitude of the supply air volume flow rate during heating operation. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is SupplyAirFlowRate. This field may be blank if a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.description: Enter the heating supply air volume flow rate per total conditioned floor area. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerFloorArea. This field may be blank if a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Per Floor Area

heating_fraction_of_heating_supply_air_f.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the heating supply air flow rate. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow. This field may be blank if a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
heating_fraction_of_heating_supply_air_f.title: Heating Fraction Of Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_he.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate per unit heating capacity. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerHeatingCapacity. This field may be blank if a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC equipment.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_he.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Per Unit Heating Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the cooling design capacity for scalable sizing. None is used when a cooling coils is not included in the Zone HVAC Equipment or this field may be blank. If this input field is left blank, then the design cooling capacity is set to zero. CoolingDesignCapacity => selected when the design cooling capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design cooling capacity is determine from user specified cooling capacity per floor area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity => is selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design cooling capacity.
cooling_design_capacity_method.title: Cooling Design Capacity Method

cooling_design_capacity.description: Enter the design cooling capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method CoolingDesignCapacity.
cooling_design_capacity.title: Cooling Design Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the cooling design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Cooling Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized cooling design capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the heating design capacity for scalable sizing. None is used when a heating coil is not included in the Zone HVAC Equipment or this field may be blank. If this input field is left blank, then the design heating capacity is set to zero. HeatingDesignCapacity => selected when the design heating capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design cooling capacity is determine from user specified heating capacity per flow area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity => is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity.description: Enter the design heating capacity. Required field when the heating design capacity method HeatingDesignCapacity.
heating_design_capacity.title: Heating Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized heating design capacity. Required field when capacity the heating design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

capacity_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule values are multiplied by Nominal Capacity for current capacity
capacity_fraction_schedule_name.title: Capacity Fraction Schedule Name

capacity_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule values are multiplied by Nominal Capacity for current capacity
capacity_fraction_schedule_name.title: Capacity Fraction Schedule Name

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Door is on (i.e., Base Surface) Door assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Door starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Door starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Door is on (i.e., Base Surface) Door assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Specify a surface name in an adjacent zone for known interior doors. Specify a zone name of an adjacent zone to automatically generate the interior door in the adjacent zone. a blank field will set up a Window in an adjacent zone (same zone as adjacent to base surface)
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Door starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Door starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: units in schedule should be fraction applied to design level of electric equipment, generally (0.0 - 1.0)
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_level_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of electric equipment for this set of attributes Choices: EquipmentLevel => Equipment Level -- simply enter watts of equipment Watts/Area => Watts per Zone Floor Area -- enter the number to apply. Value * Floor Area = Equipment Level Watts/Person => Watts per Person -- enter the number to apply. Value * Occupants = Equipment Level
design_level_calculation_method.title: Design Level Calculation Method

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

zone_or_space_name.description: ZoneList and SpaceList names are not allowed.
zone_or_space_name.title: Zone Or Space Name

air_flow_calculation_method.description: The specified method is used to calculate the IT inlet temperature and zone return air temperature. If FlowFromSystem is chosen, the zone is assumed to be well-mixed. If FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures is chosen, Supply and Return approach temperature should be defined to indicate the temperature difference due to the air distribution. When FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures is chosen, the inputs of Air Inlet Connection Type, Design Recirculation Fraction and Recirculation Function of Loading and Supply Temperature Curve Name are ignored. For multiple ITE objects defined for one zone, the same calculation method should apply. The FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures only applies to ITE zones with single duct VAV terminal unit. Other return air heat gains from window or lights are not allowed when FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures is chosen.
air_flow_calculation_method.title: Air Flow Calculation Method

design_power_input_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to specify the design power input Watts/Unit => Watts per Unit -- Design Power = Watts per Unit * Number of Units Watts/Area => Watts per Zone Floor Area -- Design Power = Watts per Zone Floor Area * Floor Area
design_power_input_calculation_method.title: Design Power Input Calculation Method

design_power_input_schedule_name.description: Operating schedule for this equipment, fraction applied to the design power input, generally (0.0 - 1.0) If this field is blank, the schedule is assumed to always be 1.0.
design_power_input_schedule_name.title: Design Power Input Schedule Name

cpu_loading_schedule_name.description: CPU loading schedule for this equipment as a fraction from 0.0 (idle) to 1.0 (full load). If this field is blank, the schedule is assumed to always be 1.0.
cpu_loading_schedule_name.title: Cpu Loading Schedule Name

cpu_power_input_function_of_loading_and_.description: The name of a two-variable curve or table lookup object which modifies the CPU power input as a function of CPU loading (x) and air inlet node temperature (y). This curve (table) should equal 1.0 at design conditions (CPU loading = 1.0 and Design Entering Air Temperature).
cpu_power_input_function_of_loading_and_.title: Cpu Power Input Function Of Loading And Air Temperature Curve Name

design_fan_power_input_fraction.description: The fraction of the total power input at design conditions which is for the cooling fan(s)
design_fan_power_input_fraction.title: Design Fan Power Input Fraction

design_fan_air_flow_rate_per_power_input.description: The cooling fan air flow rate per total electric power input at design conditions
design_fan_air_flow_rate_per_power_input.title: Design Fan Air Flow Rate Per Power Input

air_flow_function_of_loading_and_air_tem.description: The name of a two-variable curve or table lookup object which modifies the cooling air flow rate as a function of CPU loading (x) and air inlet node temperature (y). This curve (table) should equal 1.0 at design conditions (CPU loading = 1.0 and Design Entering Air Temperature).
air_flow_function_of_loading_and_air_tem.title: Air Flow Function Of Loading And Air Temperature Curve Name

fan_power_input_function_of_flow_curve_n.description: The name of a single-variable curve or table lookup object which modifies the cooling fan power as a function of flow fraction (x). This curve (table) should equal 1.0 at a flow fraction of 1.0.
fan_power_input_function_of_flow_curve_n.title: Fan Power Input Function Of Flow Curve Name

design_entering_air_temperature.description: The entering air temperature at design conditions.
design_entering_air_temperature.title: Design Entering Air Temperature

environmental_class.description: Specifies the allowable operating conditions for the air inlet conditions. Used for reporting time outside allowable conditions.
environmental_class.title: Environmental Class

air_inlet_connection_type.description: Specifies the type of connection between the zone and the ITE air inlet node. AdjustedSupply = ITE inlet temperature will be the current Supply Air Node temperature adjusted by the current recirculation fraction. All heat output is added to the zone air heat balance as a convective gain. ZoneAirNode = ITE air inlet condition is  the average zone condition. All heat output is added to the zone air heat balance as a convective gain. RoomAirModel = ITE air inlet and outlet are connected to room air model nodes. This field is only used when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
air_inlet_connection_type.title: Air Inlet Connection Type

air_inlet_room_air_model_node_name.description: Name of a RoomAir:Node object which is connected to the ITE air inlet.
air_inlet_room_air_model_node_name.title: Air Inlet Room Air Model Node Name

air_outlet_room_air_model_node_name.description: Name of a RoomAir:Node object which is connected to the ITE air outlet.
air_outlet_room_air_model_node_name.title: Air Outlet Room Air Model Node Name

supply_air_node_name.description: Name of the supply air inlet node serving this ITE. Required if the Air Node Connection Type = AdjustedSupply. Also required if Calculation Method = FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures. Also required if reporting of Supply Heat Index is desired.
supply_air_node_name.title: Supply Air Node Name

design_recirculation_fraction.description: The recirculation fraction for this equipment at design conditions. This field is used only if the Air Node Connection Type = AdjustedSupply. The default is 0.0 (no recirculation). This field is only used when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
design_recirculation_fraction.title: Design Recirculation Fraction

recirculation_function_of_loading_and_su.description: The name of a two-variable curve or table lookup object which modifies the recirculation fractionas a function of CPU loading (x) and supply air node temperature (y). This curve (table) should equal 1.0 at design conditions (CPU loading = 1.0 and Design Entering Air Temperature).This field is used only if the Air Node Connection Type = AdjustedSupply. If this curve is left blank, then the curve is assumed to always equal 1.0. This field is only used when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
recirculation_function_of_loading_and_su.title: Recirculation Function Of Loading And Supply Temperature Curve Name

design_electric_power_supply_efficiency.description: The efficiency of the power supply system serving this ITE
design_electric_power_supply_efficiency.title: Design Electric Power Supply Efficiency

electric_power_supply_efficiency_functio.description: The name of a single-variable curve or table lookup object which modifies the electric power supply efficiency as a function of part-load ratio (x). This curve (table) should equal 1.0 at full load (PLR = 1.0). If this curve is left blank, then the curve is assumed to always equal 1.0.
electric_power_supply_efficiency_functio.title: Electric Power Supply Efficiency Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

fraction_of_electric_power_supply_losses.description: Fraction of the electric power supply losses which are a heat gain to the zone If this field is <1.0, the remainder of the losses are assumed to be lost to the outdoors.
fraction_of_electric_power_supply_losses.title: Fraction Of Electric Power Supply Losses To Zone

cpu_end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
cpu_end_use_subcategory.title: Cpu End Use Subcategory

fan_end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
fan_end_use_subcategory.title: Fan End Use Subcategory

electric_power_supply_end_use_subcategor.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
electric_power_supply_end_use_subcategor.title: Electric Power Supply End Use Subcategory

supply_temperature_difference.description: The difference of the IT inlet temperature from the AHU supply air temperature. Either Supply Temperature Difference or Supply Temperature Difference Schedule is required if Air Flow Calculation Method is set to FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures. This field is ignored when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
supply_temperature_difference.title: Supply Temperature Difference

supply_temperature_difference_schedule.description: The difference schedule of the IT inlet temperature from the AHU supply air temperature. Either Supply Temperature Difference or Supply Temperature Difference Schedule is required if Air Flow Calculation Method is set to FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures. This field is ignored when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
supply_temperature_difference_schedule.title: Supply Temperature Difference Schedule

return_temperature_difference.description: The difference of the the actual AHU return air temperature to the IT equipment outlet temperature. Either Return Temperature Difference or Return Temperature Difference Schedule is required if Air Flow Calculation Method is set to FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures. This field is ignored when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
return_temperature_difference.title: Return Temperature Difference

return_temperature_difference_schedule.description: The difference schedule of the actual AHU return air temperature to the IT equipment outlet temperature. Either Return Temperature Difference or Return Temperature Difference Schedule is required if Air Flow Calculation Method is set to FlowControlWithApproachTemperatures. This field is ignored when Air Flow Calculation Method is FlowFromSystem.
return_temperature_difference_schedule.title: Return Temperature Difference Schedule

generator_operation_scheme_type.description: Determines how generators are to be controlled Required if Generator List is entered.
generator_operation_scheme_type.title: Generator Operation Scheme Type

generator_demand_limit_scheme_purchased_.title: Generator Demand Limit Scheme Purchased Electric Demand Limit

generator_track_schedule_name_scheme_sch.description: required when Generator Operation Scheme Type=TrackSchedule schedule values in Watts
generator_track_schedule_name_scheme_sch.title: Generator Track Schedule Name Scheme Schedule Name

generator_track_meter_scheme_meter_name.description: required when Generator Operation Scheme Type=TrackMeter
generator_track_meter_scheme_meter_name.title: Generator Track Meter Scheme Meter Name

inverter_name.description: required when Electrical Buss Type=DirectCurrentWithInverter, DirectCurrentWithInverterDCStorage, or DirectCurrentWithInverterACStorage
inverter_name.title: Inverter Name

electrical_storage_object_name.description: required when Electrical Buss Type=AlternatingCurrentWithStorage, DirectCurrentWithInverterDCStorage, or DirectCurrentWithInverterACStorage
electrical_storage_object_name.title: Electrical Storage Object Name

transformer_object_name.description: required when power needs to be output from on-site generation or storage to the grid via transformer
transformer_object_name.title: Transformer Object Name

storage_operation_scheme.description: Select method to govern how storage charge and discharge is controlled TrackFacilityElectricDemandStoreExcessOnSite indicates that storage control will follow the facility power demand while accounting for any on-site generation. Only excess on site generation  gets stored (legacy behavior). TrackMeterDemandStoreExcessOnSite indicates that storage discharge control will follow an electric meter named in the field called Storage Control Track Meter Name. This scheme is similiar to TrackFacilityElectricDemandStoreExcessOnSite except that instead of the main facility electric meter, the control is based off of a user-selected meter. TrackChargeDischargeSchedules indicates that control will follow the charging and discharging power and schedules defined in the fields called Maximum Storage Charge Grid Supply Power, Storage Charge Grid Supply Power Fraction Schedule Name, Design Storage Discharge Grid Export Power, and Storage Discharge Grid Export Fraction Schedule Name. FacilityDemandLeveling indicates that storage control will attempt to control the facility's power demand drawn from the utility service to a prescribed level. The target utility demand is entered in the fields called Storage Control Utility Demand Limit and Storage Control Utility Demand Limit Fraction Schedule Name This scheme first accounts for any on-site generation and during times of high use will discharge storage to reduce facility grid demand to meet the target level and during times of low use will charge storage from the grid to increase facility grid demand to meet the target level.
storage_operation_scheme.title: Storage Operation Scheme

storage_control_track_meter_name.description: required when Storage Operation Scheme is set to TrackMeterDemandStoreExcessOnSite.
storage_control_track_meter_name.title: Storage Control Track Meter Name

storage_converter_object_name.description: Name of an ElectricLoadCenter:Storage:Converter used to convert AC to DC when charging DC storage from grid supply. A converter is expected when using Storage Operation Schemes FacilityDemandLeveling or TrackChargeDischargeSchedules A single bidirectional device will reference both an inverter object (DC to AC) and a converter object (AC to DC).
storage_converter_object_name.title: Storage Converter Object Name

maximum_storage_state_of_charge_fraction.description: Fraction of storage capacity used as upper limit for controlling charging, for all storage operation schemes.
maximum_storage_state_of_charge_fraction.title: Maximum Storage State Of Charge Fraction

minimum_storage_state_of_charge_fraction.description: Fraction of storage capacity used as lower limit for controlling discharging, for all storage operation schemes.
minimum_storage_state_of_charge_fraction.title: Minimum Storage State Of Charge Fraction

design_storage_control_charge_power.description: Maximum rate that electric power can be charged into storage. Storage charging adjusted downward for conversion losses. Rate is modified by fractional values in the schedule named in the next field. Required field when using Storage Operation Schemes FacilityDemandLeveling or TrackChargeDischargeSchedules.
design_storage_control_charge_power.title: Design Storage Control Charge Power

storage_charge_power_fraction_schedule_n.description: Controls timing and magnitude of charging storage. Required field if Storage Operation Scheme is set to TrackChargeDischargeSchedules. Schedule values should be fractions from 0.0 to 1.0, inclusive.
storage_charge_power_fraction_schedule_n.title: Storage Charge Power Fraction Schedule Name

design_storage_control_discharge_power.description: Maximum rate that electric power can be discharged from storage. Rate is modified by fractional values in the schedule named in the next field. Required field when using Storage Operation Schemes FacilityDemandLeveling or TrackChargeDischargeSchedules.
design_storage_control_discharge_power.title: Design Storage Control Discharge Power

storage_discharge_power_fraction_schedul.description: Controls timing and magnitude of discharging storage Required field if Storage Operation Scheme is set to TrackChargeDischargeSchedules. Schedule values should be fractions from 0.0 to 1.0, inclusive.
storage_discharge_power_fraction_schedul.title: Storage Discharge Power Fraction Schedule Name

storage_control_utility_demand_target.description: Target utility service demand power for discharge control. Storage draws are adjusted upwards for conversion losses. Required field for FacilityDemandLeveling storage operation scheme
storage_control_utility_demand_target.title: Storage Control Utility Demand Target

storage_control_utility_demand_target_fr.description: Modifies the target utility service demand power over time. Schedule values should be fractions from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive. if omitted a schedule value of 1.0 is used. Negative values indicate export to grid Schedule is used if Storage Operation Scheme is set to FacilityDemandLeveling.
storage_control_utility_demand_target_fr.title: Storage Control Utility Demand Target Fraction Schedule Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Enter name of zone to receive inverter losses as heat if blank then inverter is assumed to be outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

efficiency_function_of_power_curve_name.description: curve describes efficiency as a function of power curve is normalized relative to rated power in next field
efficiency_function_of_power_curve_name.title: Efficiency Function Of Power Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Enter name of zone to receive inverter losses as heat if blank then inverter is assumed to be outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

efficiency_at_10_power_and_nominal_volta.title: Efficiency At 10 Power And Nominal Voltage

efficiency_at_20_power_and_nominal_volta.title: Efficiency At 20 Power And Nominal Voltage

efficiency_at_30_power_and_nominal_volta.title: Efficiency At 30 Power And Nominal Voltage

efficiency_at_50_power_and_nominal_volta.title: Efficiency At 50 Power And Nominal Voltage

efficiency_at_75_power_and_nominal_volta.title: Efficiency At 75 Power And Nominal Voltage

efficiency_at_100_power_and_nominal_volt.title: Efficiency At 100 Power And Nominal Voltage

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: enter name of zone to receive inverter losses as heat if blank then inverter is assumed to be outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Enter name of zone to receive electrical storage losses as heat if blank then electrical storage losses are dissipated to outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

number_of_battery_modules_in_parallel.description: A module usually consists of several cells. The total number of modules in the battery bank is equal to number of modules in parallel times number of modules in series.
number_of_battery_modules_in_parallel.title: Number Of Battery Modules In Parallel

number_of_battery_modules_in_series.description: A module usually consists of several cells. The total number of modules in the battery bank is equal to number of modules in parallel times number of modules in series.
number_of_battery_modules_in_series.title: Number Of Battery Modules In Series

maximum_module_capacity.description: The capacity is for each module. A model parameter from manufacturer's data or test data.
maximum_module_capacity.title: Maximum Module Capacity

initial_fractional_state_of_charge.description: The state of charge is evaluated based on the maximum capacity defined in the next field.
initial_fractional_state_of_charge.title: Initial Fractional State Of Charge

fraction_of_available_charge_capacity.description: A model parameter usually derived from test data by curve fitting.
fraction_of_available_charge_capacity.title: Fraction Of Available Charge Capacity

change_rate_from_bound_charge_to_availab.description: A model parameter usually derived from test data by curve fitting.
change_rate_from_bound_charge_to_availab.title: Change Rate From Bound Charge To Available Charge

fully_charged_module_open_circuit_voltag.description: The voltage is for each battery module.
fully_charged_module_open_circuit_voltag.title: Fully Charged Module Open Circuit Voltage

fully_discharged_module_open_circuit_vol.description: The voltage is for each battery module.
fully_discharged_module_open_circuit_vol.title: Fully Discharged Module Open Circuit Voltage

voltage_change_curve_name_for_charging.description: Determines how the open circuit voltage change with state of charge relative to the fully discharged state.
voltage_change_curve_name_for_charging.title: Voltage Change Curve Name For Charging

voltage_change_curve_name_for_dischargin.description: Determines how the open circuit voltage change with state of charge relative to the fully charged state.
voltage_change_curve_name_for_dischargin.title: Voltage Change Curve Name For Discharging

module_internal_electrical_resistance.description: A model parameter from manufacture or derived from test data. Internal resistance is assumed to be constant. The internal resistance is for each battery module.
module_internal_electrical_resistance.title: Module Internal Electrical Resistance

maximum_module_discharging_current.description: The constraint on discharging current is for each battery module.
maximum_module_discharging_current.title: Maximum Module Discharging Current

module_cut_off_voltage.description: The voltage constraint is for each battery module.
module_cut_off_voltage.title: Module Cut Off Voltage

module_charge_rate_limit.description: units 1/hr Charge rate limit is the division between charging current the remaining capacity. The constraint on charging current is for each module.
module_charge_rate_limit.title: Module Charge Rate Limit

number_of_cycle_bins.description: Only required when battery life calculation is activated
number_of_cycle_bins.title: Number Of Cycle Bins

battery_life_curve_name.description: Determines the number of cycles to failure in relation to cycle range. Only required when battery life calculation is activated.
battery_life_curve_name.title: Battery Life Curve Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the converter is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

power_conversion_efficiency_method.description: SimpleFixed indicates power conversion losses are based on Simple Fixed Efficiency FunctionOfPower indicates power conversion losses are a function of normalized power using a curve or table.
power_conversion_efficiency_method.title: Power Conversion Efficiency Method

simple_fixed_efficiency.description: Constant efficiency for conversion of AC to DC at all power levels. Field is only used when Power Conversion Efficiency Method is set to SimpleFixed.
simple_fixed_efficiency.title: Simple Fixed Efficiency

design_maximum_continuous_input_power.description: Required field when Power Conversion Efficiency Method is set to FunctionOfPower.
design_maximum_continuous_input_power.title: Design Maximum Continuous Input Power

efficiency_function_of_power_curve_name.description: Curve or table with a single independent variable that describes efficiency as a function of normalized power. The "x" input for curve or table is the ratio of current input power divided by design power in the previous field Required field when Power Conversion Efficiency Method is set to FunctionOfPower.
efficiency_function_of_power_curve_name.title: Efficiency Function Of Power Curve Name

ancillary_power_consumed_in_standby.description: Optional standby power consumed when converter is available but no power is being conditioned.
ancillary_power_consumed_in_standby.title: Ancillary Power Consumed In Standby

zone_name.description: enter name of zone to receive converter losses as heat if blank then converter is assumed to be outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

radiative_fraction.description: fraction of zone heat gains treated as thermal radiation
radiative_fraction.title: Radiative Fraction

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Enter name of zone to receive electrical storage losses as heat if blank then electrical storage losses are dissipated to outdoors
zone_name.title: Zone Name

number_of_cells_in_series.description: Battery voltage is calculated by multiplying this field by the nominal cell voltage (N13, default 3.342V)
number_of_cells_in_series.title: Number Of Cells In Series

number_of_strings_in_parallel.description: Capacity (Ah) is determined by multiplying this field by the cell capacity (N14, default 3.2 Ah)
number_of_strings_in_parallel.title: Number Of Strings In Parallel

initial_fractional_state_of_charge.description: The state of charge is evaluated based on the maximum capacity defined in the next field.
initial_fractional_state_of_charge.title: Initial Fractional State Of Charge

heat_transfer_coefficient_between_batter.title: Heat Transfer Coefficient Between Battery And Ambient

fully_charged_cell_voltage.description: Most users should not need to change this value.
