availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

cooler_design_effectiveness.description: effectiveness with respect to wet-bulb depression
cooler_design_effectiveness.title: Cooler Design Effectiveness

effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifier_curve_.description: this curve modifies the design effectiveness in the previous field by multiplying the value by the result of this curve. The effectiveness flow modifier curve is a function of flow fraction. Flow fraction is the ratio of current primary air flow rate to the primary air design flow rate. If this input field is left blank then, the effectiveness is assumed to be constant.
effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifier_curve_.title: Effectiveness Flow Ratio Modifier Curve Name

recirculating_water_pump_design_power.description: This is the design water pump or spray for evaporation at the primary air design air flow rates and cooler design effectiveness
recirculating_water_pump_design_power.title: Recirculating Water Pump Design Power

water_pump_power_sizing_factor.description: This field is used when the previous field is set to autosize. The pump power is scaled with Primary Air Design Air Flow Rate. This value was backed out from inputs in energy plus example files. Average Pump Power sizing factor was estimated from pump power and primary air design flow rates inputs from energyplus example files is about 90.0 [W/(m3/s)] (=90.0 ~ Pump Power / Primary Air Design Flow Rate). The factor ranges from 55.0 to 150.0 [W/(m3/s)]. The pump power can be sized to zero by setting this factor to zero.
water_pump_power_sizing_factor.title: Water Pump Power Sizing Factor

water_pump_power_modifier_curve_name.description: this curve modifies the pump power in the previous field by multiplying the design power by the result of this curve. x = ff = flow fraction on the primary air. The flow fraction is the primary air flow rate during current operation divided by Primary Air Design Flow Rate
water_pump_power_modifier_curve_name.title: Water Pump Power Modifier Curve Name

drift_loss_fraction.description: Rate of drift loss as a fraction of evaporated water flow rate
drift_loss_fraction.title: Drift Loss Fraction

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the evaporative cooler. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the cooler in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. A typical value is 3. If left blank then there is no blowdown.
blowdown_concentration_ratio.title: Blowdown Concentration Ratio

evaporative_operation_minimum_drybulb_te.description: This numeric field defines the evaporative cooler air inlet node drybulb temperature minimum limit in degrees Celsius. The evaporative cooler will be turned off when the evaporator cooler air inlet node dry-bulb temperature falls below this limit. The typical minimum value is 16degC. Users are allowed to specify their own limits. If this field is left blank, then there is no drybulb lower temperature limit for evaporative cooler operation.
evaporative_operation_minimum_drybulb_te.title: Evaporative Operation Minimum Drybulb Temperature

evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_wetb.description: when outdoor wetbulb temperature rises above this limit the cooler shuts down. This numeric field defines the evaporative cooler air inlet node wet-bulb temperature maximum limit in degrees Celsius. The evaporative cooler will be turned off when the evaporative cooler air inlet node wet-bulb temperature exceeds this limit. The typical maximum value is 24degC. Users are allowed to specify their own limits. If this field is left blank, then there is no upper wetbulb temperature limit for evaporative cooler operation.
evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_wetb.title: Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Wetbulb Temperature

evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_dryb.description: This numeric field defines the evaporative cooler air inlet node dry-bulb temperature maximum limit in degrees Celsius. The evaporative cooler will be turned off when its air inlet node drybulb temperature exceeds this limit. The typical maximum value is 26degC. Users are allowed to specify their own limits. If this field is left blank, then there is no upper temperature limit for evaporative cooler operation.
evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_dryb.title: Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Drybulb Temperature

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

control_type.description: This field is not currently used and can be left blank
control_type.title: Control Type

secondary_air_inlet_node_name.description: Enter the name of an outdoor air node
secondary_air_inlet_node_name.title: Secondary Air Inlet Node Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

cooler_wetbulb_design_effectiveness.description: wet operation effectiveness with respect to wetbulb depression this is the nominal design wetbulb effectiveness at design air flow rates and water rate
cooler_wetbulb_design_effectiveness.title: Cooler Wetbulb Design Effectiveness

wetbulb_effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifie.description: this curve modifies the wetbulb effectiveness in the previous field (eff_wb_design) by multiplying the value by the result of this curve, eff_wb = eff_wb_design * func(HXFlowRatio) x = HXFlowRatio = sum of the primary and secondary flow rates divided by the sum of the design flow rates. If this input field is left blank, constant cooler wetbulb effectiveness is assumed. This input field is required in order to use operating range control based on the following three input fields: Evaporative Operation Minimum Limit Secondary Air Drybulb Temperature, Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Wetbulb Temperature, and Dry Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Drybulb Temperature
wetbulb_effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifie.title: Wetbulb Effectiveness Flow Ratio Modifier Curve Name

cooler_drybulb_design_effectiveness.description: dry operation effectiveness with respect to drybulb temperature difference this is the nominal design dryblub effectiveness at design air flow rates, no evaporation water active
cooler_drybulb_design_effectiveness.title: Cooler Drybulb Design Effectiveness

drybulb_effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifie.description: this curve modifies the drybulb effectiveness in the previous field (eff_db_design) by multiplying the value by the result of this curve, eff_db = eff_db_design * f(HXFlowRatio) x = HXFlowRatio = sum of the primary and secondary flow rates divided by the sum of the design flow rates. If this input field is left blank, constant cooler drybulb effectiveness is assumed. This input field is required in order to use operating range control based on the following three input fields: Evaporative Operation Minimum Limit Secondary Air Drybulb Temperature, Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Wetbulb Temperature, and Dry Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Drybulb Temperature
drybulb_effectiveness_flow_ratio_modifie.title: Drybulb Effectiveness Flow Ratio Modifier Curve Name

recirculating_water_pump_design_power.description: This is the nominal design pump power of water recirculation and spray for evaporation at design air flow rates and cooler design effectiveness
recirculating_water_pump_design_power.title: Recirculating Water Pump Design Power

water_pump_power_sizing_factor.description: This field is used when the previous field is set to autosize. The pump power is scaled with Secondary Air Design Air Flow Rate. This value was backed out from inputs in energy plus example files. Average Pump Power sizing factor was estimated from pump power and secondary air design flow rates inputs from energyplus example files is about 90.0 [W/(m3/s)] (=90.0 ~ Pump Power / Secondary Air Design Flow Rate). The factor ranges from 55.0 to 150.0 [W/(m3/s)] were noted. The pump power can be sized to zero by setting this factor to zero.
water_pump_power_sizing_factor.title: Water Pump Power Sizing Factor

water_pump_power_modifier_curve_name.description: this curve modifies the pump power in the previous field by multiplying the design power by the result of this curve. x = ff = flow fraction on the secondary side, secondary air flow rate during operation divided by Secondary Air Design Air Flow Rate. If this input field is left blank, pump power is assumed to be proportional to part load ratio.
water_pump_power_modifier_curve_name.title: Water Pump Power Modifier Curve Name

secondary_air_flow_scaling_factor.description: This field is used when the previous field is set to autoize. The Primary Design Air Flow Rate is scaled using this factor to calculate the secondary design air flow rate.
secondary_air_flow_scaling_factor.title: Secondary Air Flow Scaling Factor

secondary_air_fan_design_power.description: This is the fan design power at Secondary Design Air Flow Rate. This is the nominal design power at full speed.
secondary_air_fan_design_power.title: Secondary Air Fan Design Power

secondary_air_fan_sizing_specific_power.description: This field is used when the previous field is set to autosize. The fan power is scaled with Secondary Air Design Flow Rate. The default value is estimated from 125 Pa fan total pressure and fan total efficiency of 50.0% (250.0 = 125/0.5).
secondary_air_fan_sizing_specific_power.title: Secondary Air Fan Sizing Specific Power

secondary_air_fan_power_modifier_curve_n.description: this curve modifies the design fan power in the previous field by multiplying the value by the result of this curve. It should have a value of 1.0 at a x = 1.0. x = ff = flow fraction on the secondary side, secondary air flow rate during operation divided by Secondary Air Design Air Flow Rate. If this input field is left blank, the secondary fan power is assumed to be proportional to part load ratio.
secondary_air_fan_power_modifier_curve_n.title: Secondary Air Fan Power Modifier Curve Name

drift_loss_fraction.description: Rate of drift loss as a fraction of evaporated water flow rate. If this input field is left blank, then zero drift loss is assumed.
drift_loss_fraction.title: Drift Loss Fraction

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the evaporative cooler. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the cooler in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. A typical value is 3. If left blank then there is no blowdown.
blowdown_concentration_ratio.title: Blowdown Concentration Ratio

evaporative_operation_minimum_limit_seco.description: This input field value defines the secondary air inlet node drybulb temperature limits in degreeCelsius. When the secondary side entering air dry bulb temperature drops below this limit, then the evaporative cooler operation mode changes to dry heat exchanger. Users specify their own limits. If this field is left blank, then there is no drybulb temperature lower limit for evaporative cooler operation. If operating range control is desired then this input field and the next two input fields should be specified or all the three should be left blank or left out. If no minimum drybulb temperature limit is desired while there are maximum drybulb and wetbulb temperature limits then specify very low minimum temperature limit value (e.g. -99.0C).
evaporative_operation_minimum_limit_seco.title: Evaporative Operation Minimum Limit Secondary Air Drybulb Temperature

evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_outd.description: This input field value defines the secondary air inlet node wetbulb temperature limits in degree Celsius. When the secondary side entering air wet bulb temperature exceeds this limit, then the evaporative cooler urns off and does not attempt to do any cooling. If this field is left blank, then there is no wetbulb temperature upper limit for evaporative cooler wet operation mode. If this input field is left blank then, the previous and the next input fields should also be left blank. If no maximum wetbulb temperature limits is desired while there are minimum drybulb and maximum drybulb upper temperature limits then specify very high maximum wetbulb temperature limit value (e.g. 99.0 C).
evaporative_operation_maximum_limit_outd.title: Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Wetbulb Temperature

dry_operation_maximum_limit_outdoor_dryb.description: This input field value defines the secondary air inlet node drybulb temperature limits in degree Celsius. When the secondary side entering air drybulb temperature exceeds this limit, then the evaporative cooler will not run in dry operation mode or may be turned off depending on its wetbulb temperature. If this field is left blank, then there is no drybulb temperature maximum limit for evaporative cooler operation. If this input field is left blank then, the previous and the next input fields should also be left blank. If no maximum drybulb temperature limit is desired while there are minimum drybulb and maximum wetbulb upper temperature limits then specify very high maximum drybulb temperature limit value (e.g. 99.0 C).
dry_operation_maximum_limit_outdoor_dryb.title: Dry Operation Maximum Limit Outdoor Drybulb Temperature

availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

standard_design_capacity.description: Standard design capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt (3 gpm/ton). Standard design capacity times the Heat Rejection Capacity and Nominal Capacity Sizing Ratio (e.g. 1.25) gives the actual fluid cooler heat rejection at these operating conditions. Only used for Performance Input Method = StandardDesignCapacity; for other input methods, this field is ignored. The standard conditions mentioned above for Standard design capacity are already specified in the EnergyPlus. So the input fields such as design entering water temp., design entering air wet-bulb and dry-bulb temp. and design water flow rate, if provided in the input, will be ignored for the StandardDesignCapacity performance input method. Also, the standard conditions are for water as a fluid type so this performance input method can only be used with water as a fluid type (as specified in CondenserLoop object).
standard_design_capacity.title: Standard Design Capacity

design_air_flow_rate_u_factor_times_area.description: Only used for Performance Input Method = UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate; for other Performance Input Methods, this field is ignored.
design_air_flow_rate_u_factor_times_area.title: Design Air Flow Rate U Factor Times Area Value

design_water_flow_rate.description: Input value is ignored if fluid cooler Performance Input Method= StandardDesignCapacity.
design_water_flow_rate.title: Design Water Flow Rate

user_specified_design_capacity.description: Only used for Performance Input Method = UserSpecifiedDesignCapacity; for other Performance Input Methods, this field is ignored.
user_specified_design_capacity.title: User Specified Design Capacity

design_entering_water_temperature.description: Only used for Performance Input Method = UserSpecifiedDesignCapacity; for other Performance Input Methods, this field is ignored. Design Entering Water Temperature must be greater than Design Entering Air Temperature.
design_entering_water_temperature.title: Design Entering Water Temperature

design_entering_air_temperature.description: Only used for Performance Input Method = UserSpecifiedDesignCapacity; for other Performance Input Methods, this field is ignored. Design Entering Air Temperature must be greater than Design Entering Air Wet-bulb Temperature.
design_entering_air_temperature.title: Design Entering Air Temperature

design_entering_air_wet_bulb_temperature.description: Only used for Performance Input Method = UserSpecifiedDesignCapacity; for other Performance Input Methods, this field is ignored. Design Entering Air Wet-bulb Temperature must be less than Design Entering Air Temperature.
design_entering_air_wet_bulb_temperature.title: Design Entering Air Wet Bulb Temperature

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

evaporation_loss_factor.description: Rate of water evaporation from the Fluid Cooler and lost to the outdoor air [%/K] Empirical correlation is used to calculate default loss factor if it not explicitly provided.
evaporation_loss_factor.title: Evaporation Loss Factor

drift_loss_percent.description: Rate of drift loss as a percentage of circulating spray water flow rate Default value for this field is under investigation. For now Cooling tower's drift loss percent default value is taken here.
drift_loss_percent.title: Drift Loss Percent

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the Evaporative Fluid Cooler. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the basin in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. Default value for this field is under investigation. For now Cooling tower's Blowdown Concentration Ratio percent default value is taken here.
blowdown_concentration_ratio.title: Blowdown Concentration Ratio

blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.description: Makeup water usage due to blowdown results from occasionally draining a small amount of water in the Fluid Cooler basin to purge scale or other contaminants to reduce their concentration in order to maintain an acceptable level of water quality. Schedule values should reflect water usage in m3/s.
blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.title: Blowdown Makeup Water Usage Schedule Name

blowdown_concentration_ratio.description: Characterizes the rate of blowdown in the Evaporative Fluid Cooler. Blowdown is water intentionally drained from the Evaporative Fluid Cooler in order to offset the build up of solids in the water that would otherwise occur because of evaporation. Ratio of solids in the blowdown water to solids in the make up water. Default value is under investigation. For now cooling tower's default value is taken.

blowdown_makeup_water_usage_schedule_nam.description: Makeup water usage due to blowdown results from occasionally draining some amount of water in the Evaporative Fluid Cooler basin to purge scale or other contaminants to reduce their concentration in order to maintain an acceptable level of water quality. Schedule values should reflect water usage in m3/s.

schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_level_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of gas equipment for this set of attributes Choices: EquipmentLevel => Design Level -- simply enter power input of equipment Watts/Area or Power/Area => Power per Zone Floor Area -- enter the number to apply. Value * Floor Area = Equipment Level Watts/Person or Power/Person => Power per Person -- enter the number to apply. Value * Occupants = Equipment Level
design_level_calculation_method.title: Design Level Calculation Method

carbon_dioxide_generation_rate.description: CO2 generation rate per unit of power input The default value assumes the equipment is fully vented. For unvented equipment, a suggested value is 3.45E-8 m3/s-W. This value is converted from a natural gas CO2 emission rate of 117 lbs CO2 per million Btu. The maximum value assumes to be 10 times of the recommended value.
carbon_dioxide_generation_rate.title: Carbon Dioxide Generation Rate

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.

electrical_power_function_of_temperature.description: curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*Elev + e*Elev**2 + f*T*Elev T = combustion air inlet temperature (C) Elev = elevation (m)
electrical_power_function_of_temperature.title: Electrical Power Function Of Temperature And Elevation Curve Name

electrical_efficiency_function_of_temper.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 Cubic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*T**3 T = combustion air inlet temperature (C)
electrical_efficiency_function_of_temper.title: Electrical Efficiency Function Of Temperature Curve Name

electrical_efficiency_function_of_part_l.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 Cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = ratio of Generator Load to steady state Electrical Power Output at current operating conditions
electrical_efficiency_function_of_part_l.title: Electrical Efficiency Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

standby_power.description: Electric power consumed when the generator is available but not being called by the Electric Load Center.
standby_power.title: Standby Power

ancillary_power.description: Electric power consumed by ancillary equipment (e.g., external fuel pressurization pump). Set to zero if Reference Electrical Power Output is the 'net' value (ancillary power already deducted). Input value is positive, but indicates negative electric generation.
ancillary_power.title: Ancillary Power

ancillary_power_function_of_fuel_input_c.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*mdot + c*mdot**2 mdot = fuel mass flow rate (kg/s) If left blank, model assumes ancillary power defined in previous field is constant whenever the generator is operating.
ancillary_power_function_of_fuel_input_c.title: Ancillary Power Function Of Fuel Input Curve Name

heat_recovery_water_inlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Water Inlet Node Name

heat_recovery_water_outlet_node_name.title: Heat Recovery Water Outlet Node Name

reference_thermal_efficiency_using_lower.description: Reference thermal efficiency (heat recovery to water) based on the Lower Heating Value (LHV) of the fuel.
reference_thermal_efficiency_using_lower.title: Reference Thermal Efficiency Using Lower Heat Value

heat_recovery_water_flow_operating_mode.description: PlantControl means the heat recovery water flow rate is determined by the plant, but the user needs to supply a heat recovery water flow rate. InternalControl means the heat recovery water flow rate is controlled by this generator. If 'InternalControl' is selected, then the user needs to supply a reference heat recovery water flow rate and optionally the name of a heat recovery flow rate modifier curve.
heat_recovery_water_flow_operating_mode.title: Heat Recovery Water Flow Operating Mode

reference_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Reference Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

heat_recovery_water_flow_rate_function_o.description: curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*Pnet + e*Pnet + f*T*Pnet T = heat recovery inlet water temperature Pnet = net power output = electric power output - ancillary power If left blank, model assumes the heat recovery water flow rate is constant whenever the generator is operating, at the Reference HR Water Flow Rate defined in the previous field.
heat_recovery_water_flow_rate_function_o.title: Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate Function Of Temperature And Power Curve Name

thermal_efficiency_function_of_temperatu.description: Bicubic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*Elev + e*Elev**2 + f*T*Elev + g*T**3 + h*Elev**3 + i*T**2*Elev + j*T*Elev**2 Biquadratic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*Elev + e*Elev**2 + f*T*Elev T = combustion air inlet temperature (C) Elev = elevation (m) If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
thermal_efficiency_function_of_temperatu.title: Thermal Efficiency Function Of Temperature And Elevation Curve Name

heat_recovery_rate_function_of_part_load.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 Cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = ratio of Generator Load to steady state Electrical Power Output at current operating conditions If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
heat_recovery_rate_function_of_part_load.title: Heat Recovery Rate Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

heat_recovery_rate_function_of_inlet_wat.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 T = inlet water temperature (C) If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
heat_recovery_rate_function_of_inlet_wat.title: Heat Recovery Rate Function Of Inlet Water Temperature Curve Name

heat_recovery_rate_function_of_water_flo.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*Flow + c*Flow**2 Flow = flow rate of water through the heat exchanger (m3/s) If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
heat_recovery_rate_function_of_water_flo.title: Heat Recovery Rate Function Of Water Flow Rate Curve Name

minimum_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Minimum Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

maximum_heat_recovery_water_flow_rate.title: Maximum Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate

combustion_air_inlet_node_name.description: Must be an outdoor air node.
combustion_air_inlet_node_name.title: Combustion Air Inlet Node Name

reference_exhaust_air_mass_flow_rate.title: Reference Exhaust Air Mass Flow Rate

exhaust_air_flow_rate_function_of_temper.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 Cubic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*T**3 T = combustion air inlet temperature (C) If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
exhaust_air_flow_rate_function_of_temper.title: Exhaust Air Flow Rate Function Of Temperature Curve Name

exhaust_air_flow_rate_function_of_part_l.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 Cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = ratio of Generator Load to steady state Electrical Power Output at current operating conditions. If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
exhaust_air_flow_rate_function_of_part_l.title: Exhaust Air Flow Rate Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

nominal_exhaust_air_outlet_temperature.description: Exhaust air outlet temperature at reference conditions.
nominal_exhaust_air_outlet_temperature.title: Nominal Exhaust Air Outlet Temperature

exhaust_air_temperature_function_of_temp.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 Cubic curve = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*T**3 T = combustion air inlet temperature (C) If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
exhaust_air_temperature_function_of_temp.title: Exhaust Air Temperature Function Of Temperature Curve Name

exhaust_air_temperature_function_of_part.description: Quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 Cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = ratio of Generator Load to steady state Electrical Power Output at current operating conditions. If field is left blank, model assumes this modifier equals 1 for entire simulation.
exhaust_air_temperature_function_of_part.title: Exhaust Air Temperature Function Of Part Load Ratio Curve Name

dc_system_capacity.description: Nameplate rated DC system capacity in watts
dc_system_capacity.title: Dc System Capacity

array_geometry_type.description: TiltAzimuth - The tilt and azimuth angles are specified in the next two fields. An unshaded array is assumed. Surface - The array geometry (tilt and azimuth) as well as shading is determined from surface referenced.
array_geometry_type.title: Array Geometry Type

tilt_angle.description: The tilt angle is the angle from horizontal of the photovoltaic modules in the array.
tilt_angle.title: Tilt Angle

azimuth_angle.description: For a fixed array, the azimuth angle is the angle clockwise from true north describing the direction that the array faces. For an array with one-axis tracking, the azimuth angle is the angle clockwise from true north of the axis of rotation.
azimuth_angle.title: Azimuth Angle

ground_coverage_ratio.description: Applies only to arrays with one-axis tracking and is the ratio of module surface area to area of the ground or roof occupied by the array.
ground_coverage_ratio.title: Ground Coverage Ratio

number_of_series_strings_in_parallel.description: number of series-wired strings of PV modules that are in parallel
number_of_series_strings_in_parallel.title: Number Of Series Strings In Parallel

number_of_modules_in_series.description: Number of PV modules wired in series for each string.
number_of_modules_in_series.title: Number Of Modules In Series

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

rotor_type.description: allowed values are: Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine or Vertical Axis Wind Turbine
rotor_type.title: Rotor Type

power_control.description: Constant power output is obtained in the last three control types when the wind speed exceeds the rated wind speed. allowed values are: Fixed Speed Fixed Pitch, Fixed Speed Variable Pitch, Variable Speed Fixed Pitch or Variable Speed Variable Pitch
power_control.title: Power Control

rotor_diameter.description: This field is the diameter of the perpendicular circle of the Vertical Axis Wind Turbine system from the upright pole on the ground.
rotor_diameter.title: Rotor Diameter

overall_height.description: This field is the height of the hub for the Horizontal Axis Wind Turbines and of the pole for the Vertical Axis Wind Turbines.
overall_height.title: Overall Height

rated_power.description: This field is the nominal power at the rated wind speed. Users should input maximum power in case of Fixed Speed Fixed Pitch control type.
rated_power.title: Rated Power

maximum_power_coefficient.description: This field should be input if the rotor type is Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine
maximum_power_coefficient.title: Maximum Power Coefficient

height_for_local_average_wind_speed.title: Height For Local Average Wind Speed

blade_drag_coefficient.description: This field is only for Vertical Axis Wind Turbine.. The user must input this field if the rotor type is Vertical Axis Wind Turbine.
blade_drag_coefficient.title: Blade Drag Coefficient

blade_lift_coefficient.description: This field is only for Vertical Axis Wind Turbine.. The user must input this field if the rotor type is Vertical Axis Wind Turbine.
blade_lift_coefficient.title: Blade Lift Coefficient

power_coefficient_c1.description: This field is only available for Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine. The user should input all six parameters so that the analytic approximation is assumed. The simple approximation will be assumed, if any field C1 through C6 is not input. Leave this field blank, if the manufacturer's data is unavailable so that the simple approximation will be assumed.
power_coefficient_c1.title: Power Coefficient C1

current_aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio of building as described in idf
current_aspect_ratio.title: Current Aspect Ratio

new_aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio to transform to during run
new_aspect_ratio.title: New Aspect Ratio

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Door is on (i.e., Base Surface) Door assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

frame_and_divider_name.description: Enter the name of a WindowProperty:FrameAndDivider object Used only for exterior windows (rectangular) and glass doors. Unused for triangular windows. If not specified (blank), window or glass door has no frame or divider and no beam solar reflection from reveal surfaces.
frame_and_divider_name.title: Frame And Divider Name

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Door starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Door starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Door is on (i.e., Base Surface) Door assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Specify a surface name in an adjacent zone for known interior doors. Specify a zone name of an adjacent zone to automatically generate the interior door in the adjacent zone. a blank field will set up a Window in an adjacent zone (same zone as adjacent to base surface)
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Door starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Door starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

starting_vertex_position.description: Specified as entry for a 4 sided surface/rectangle Surfaces are specified as viewed from outside the surface Shading surfaces as viewed from behind. (towards what they are shading)
starting_vertex_position.title: Starting Vertex Position

coordinate_system.description: Relative -- coordinates are entered relative to zone origin World -- all coordinates entered are "absolute" for this facility
coordinate_system.title: Coordinate System

daylighting_reference_point_coordinate_s.description: Relative -- coordinates are entered relative to zone origin World -- all coordinates entered are "absolute" for this facility
daylighting_reference_point_coordinate_s.title: Daylighting Reference Point Coordinate System

rectangular_surface_coordinate_system.description: Relative -- Starting corner is entered relative to zone origin World -- Starting corner is entered in "absolute"
rectangular_surface_coordinate_system.title: Rectangular Surface Coordinate System

trench_length_in_pipe_axial_direction.description: This is the total pipe axial length of the heat exchanger If all pipe trenches are parallel, this is the length of a single trench. If a single, long run of pipe is used with one trench, this is the full length of the pipe run.
trench_length_in_pipe_axial_direction.title: Trench Length In Pipe Axial Direction

number_of_trenches.description: This is the number of horizontal legs that will be used in the entire heat exchanger, one pipe per trench
number_of_trenches.title: Number Of Trenches

horizontal_spacing_between_pipes.description: This represents the average horizontal spacing between any two trenches for heat exchangers that have multiple trenches
horizontal_spacing_between_pipes.title: Horizontal Spacing Between Pipes

burial_depth.description: This is the burial depth of the pipes, or the trenches containing the pipes
burial_depth.title: Burial Depth

soil_moisture_content_percent_at_saturat.title: Soil Moisture Content Percent At Saturation

evapotranspiration_ground_cover_paramete.description: This specifies the ground cover effects during evapotranspiration calculations. The value roughly represents the following cases: = 0   : concrete or other solid, non-permeable ground surface material = 0.5 : short grass, much like a manicured lawn = 1   : standard reference state (12 cm grass) = 1.5 : wild growth
evapotranspiration_ground_cover_paramete.title: Evapotranspiration Ground Cover Parameter

heat_exchanger_configuration.description: This is the orientation of the heat exchanger
heat_exchanger_configuration.title: Heat Exchanger Configuration

coil_diameter.description: This is the diameter of the heat exchanger coil
coil_diameter.title: Coil Diameter

coil_pitch.description: This is the center-to-center distance between coils
coil_pitch.title: Coil Pitch

trench_depth.description: This is the distance from the ground surface to the trench bottom
trench_depth.title: Trench Depth

trench_length.description: This is the total length of a single trench This assumes the heat exchanger runs the full length of the trench
trench_length.title: Trench Length

number_of_trenches.description: This is the number of parallel trenches that has a heat exchanger, one per trench
number_of_trenches.title: Number Of Trenches

horizontal_spacing_between_pipes.description: This represents the average horizontal spacing between any two trenches for heat exchangers that have multiple trenches
horizontal_spacing_between_pipes.title: Horizontal Spacing Between Pipes

number_of_boreholes_in_x_direction.title: Number Of Boreholes In X Direction

number_of_boreholes_in_y_direction.title: Number Of Boreholes In Y Direction

clearance_distance_from_outside_of_wall_.title: Clearance Distance From Outside Of Wall To Edge

slabx_x_dimension_of_the_building_slab.title: Slabx X Dimension Of The Building Slab

slaby_y_dimension_of_the_building_slab.title: Slaby Y Dimension Of The Building Slab

concagheight_height_of_the_foundation_wa.title: Concagheight Height Of The Foundation Wall Above Grade

slabdepth_thickness_of_the_floor_slab.title: Slabdepth Thickness Of The Floor Slab

basedepth_depth_of_the_basement_wall_bel.title: Basedepth Depth Of The Basement Wall Below Grade

dgravxy_width_of_gravel_pit_beside_basem.title: Dgravxy Width Of Gravel Pit Beside Basement Wall

dgravzn_gravel_depth_extending_above_the.title: Dgravzn Gravel Depth Extending Above The Floor Slab

dgravzp_gravel_depth_below_the_floor_sla.title: Dgravzp Gravel Depth Below The Floor Slab

clearance_distance_from_outside_of_wall_.title: Clearance Distance From Outside Of Wall To Edge Of 3 D Ground Domain

slabdepth_thickness_of_the_floor_slab.title: Slabdepth Thickness Of The Floor Slab

basedepth_depth_of_the_basement_wall_bel.title: Basedepth Depth Of The Basement Wall Below Grade

apratio_the_area_to_perimeter_ratio_for_.title: Apratio The Area To Perimeter Ratio For This Slab

equivsizing_flag.description: Will the dimensions of an equivalent slab be calculated (TRUE) or will the dimensions be input directly? (FALSE)] Only advanced special simulations should use FALSE.
equivsizing_flag.title: Equivsizing Flag

rext_r_value_of_any_exterior_insulation.title: Rext R Value Of Any Exterior Insulation

insfull_flag_is_the_wall_fully_insulated.description: True for full insulation False for insulation half way down side wall from grade line
insfull_flag_is_the_wall_fully_insulated.title: Insfull Flag Is The Wall Fully Insulated

cond_flag_is_the_basement_conditioned_.description: for EnergyPlus this should be TRUE
cond_flag_is_the_basement_conditioned_.title: Cond Flag Is The Basement Conditioned

hin_downward_convection_only_heat_transf.title: Hin Downward Convection Only Heat Transfer Coefficient

hin_upward_convection_only_heat_transfer.title: Hin Upward Convection Only Heat Transfer Coefficient

hin_horizontal_convection_only_heat_tran.title: Hin Horizontal Convection Only Heat Transfer Coefficient

hin_downward_combined_convection_and_rad.title: Hin Downward Combined Convection And Radiation Heat Transfer Coefficient

hin_upward_combined_convection_and_radia.title: Hin Upward Combined Convection And Radiation Heat Transfer Coefficient

hin_horizontal_combined_convection_and_r.title: Hin Horizontal Combined Convection And Radiation Heat Transfer Coefficient

ny_number_of_cells_in_the_y_direction_20.title: Ny Number Of Cells In The Y Direction 20

nzbg_number_of_cells_in_z_direction_belo.title: Nzbg Number Of Cells In Z Direction Below Grade 10 35

ibase_x_direction_cell_indicator_of_slab.title: Ibase X Direction Cell Indicator Of Slab Edge 5 20

jbase_y_direction_cell_indicator_of_slab.title: Jbase Y Direction Cell Indicator Of Slab Edge 5 20

kbase_z_direction_cell_indicator_of_the_.title: Kbase Z Direction Cell Indicator Of The Top Of The Floor Slab 5 20

nmat_number_of_materials_in_this_domain.title: Nmat Number Of Materials In This Domain

f_multiplier_for_the_adi_solution.description: 0<F<1.0, typically 0.1 (0.3 for high k soil - saturated sand is about 2.6 w/m-K)
f_multiplier_for_the_adi_solution.title: F Multiplier For The Adi Solution

iyrs_maximum_number_of_yearly_iterations.title: Iyrs Maximum Number Of Yearly Iterations

albedo_surface_albedo_for_no_snow_condit.title: Albedo Surface Albedo For No Snow Conditions

albedo_surface_albedo_for_snow_condition.title: Albedo Surface Albedo For Snow Conditions

veght_surface_roughness_no_snow_conditio.title: Veght Surface Roughness No Snow Conditions

slabx_x_dimension_of_the_building_slab.title: Slabx X Dimension Of The Building Slab

slaby_y_dimension_of_the_building_slab.title: Slaby Y Dimension Of The Building Slab

slabdepth_thickness_of_slab_on_grade.title: Slabdepth Thickness Of Slab On Grade

clearance_distance_from_edge_of_slab_to_.title: Clearance Distance From Edge Of Slab To Domain Edge

zclearance_distance_from_bottom_of_slab_.title: Zclearance Distance From Bottom Of Slab To Domain Bottom

iyrs_number_of_years_to_iterate.description: This field specifies the number of years to iterate. Either the ground heat transfer calculations come to an an annual steady periodic condition by converging to a tolerance (see ConvTol field) or it runs for this number of years. A ten year maximum is usually sufficient.
iyrs_number_of_years_to_iterate.title: Iyrs Number Of Years To Iterate

shape_slab_shape.description: Use only the value 0 here. Only a rectangular shape is implemented.
shape_slab_shape.title: Shape Slab Shape

hbldg_building_height.description: This field supplies the building height. This is used to calculate the building shadowing on the ground. typical value= 0-20
hbldg_building_height.title: Hbldg Building Height

tin1_january_indoor_average_temperature_.description: see memo on object for more information
tin1_january_indoor_average_temperature_.title: Tin1 January Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin2_february_indoor_average_temperature.description: see memo on object for more information
tin2_february_indoor_average_temperature.title: Tin2 February Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin3_march_indoor_average_temperature_se.description: see memo on object for more information
tin3_march_indoor_average_temperature_se.title: Tin3 March Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin4_april_indoor_average_temperature_se.description: see memo on object for more information
tin4_april_indoor_average_temperature_se.title: Tin4 April Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin5_may_indoor_average_temperature_setp.description: see memo on object for more information
tin5_may_indoor_average_temperature_setp.title: Tin5 May Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin6_june_indoor_average_temperature_set.description: see memo on object for more information
tin6_june_indoor_average_temperature_set.title: Tin6 June Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin7_july_indoor_average_temperature_set.description: see memo on object for more information
tin7_july_indoor_average_temperature_set.title: Tin7 July Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin8_august_indoor_average_temperature_s.description: see memo on object for more information
tin8_august_indoor_average_temperature_s.title: Tin8 August Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin9_september_indoor_average_temperatur.description: see memo on object for more information
tin9_september_indoor_average_temperatur.title: Tin9 September Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin10_october_indoor_average_temperature.description: see memo on object for more information
tin10_october_indoor_average_temperature.title: Tin10 October Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin11_november_indoor_average_temperatur.description: see memo on object for more information
tin11_november_indoor_average_temperatur.title: Tin11 November Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tin12_december_indoor_average_temperatur.description: see memo on object for more information
tin12_december_indoor_average_temperatur.title: Tin12 December Indoor Average Temperature Setpoint

tinamp_daily_indoor_sine_wave_variation_.description: This field permits imposing a daily sinusoidal variation in the indoor setpoint temperature to simulate the effect of a setback profile. The value specified is the amplitude of the sine wave.
tinamp_daily_indoor_sine_wave_variation_.title: Tinamp Daily Indoor Sine Wave Variation Amplitude

convtol_convergence_tolerance.description: This field specifies the convergence tolerance used to control the iteration. When the temperature change of all nodes is less than the convergence value, iteration ceases.
convtol_convergence_tolerance.title: Convtol Convergence Tolerance

evtr_is_surface_evapotranspiration_model.description: This field specifies whether or not to use the evapotransporation model. The inclusion of evapotransporation in the calculation has the greatest effect in warm dry climates, primarily on the ground surface temperature. This field can be used to turn the evapotransporation off and on to check sensitivity to it.
evtr_is_surface_evapotranspiration_model.title: Evtr Is Surface Evapotranspiration Modeled

fixbc_is_the_lower_boundary_at_a_fixed_t.description: This field permits using a fixed temperature at the lower surface of the model instead of a zero heat flux condition. This change normally has a very small effect on the results. FALSE selects the zero flux lower boundary condition
fixbc_is_the_lower_boundary_at_a_fixed_t.title: Fixbc Is The Lower Boundary At A Fixed Temperature

tdeepin.description: User input lower boundary temperature if FIXBC is TRUE Blank for FIXBC FALSE or to use the calculated 1-D deep ground temperature.
tdeepin.title: Tdeepin

usrhflag_is_the_ground_surface_h_specifi.description: This field flags the use of a user specified heat transfer coefficient on the ground surface. This condition is used primarily for testing. For normal runs (USPHflag is FALSE) and the program calculates the heat transfer coefficient using the weather conditions.
usrhflag_is_the_ground_surface_h_specifi.title: Usrhflag Is The Ground Surface H Specified By The User

userh_user_specified_ground_surface_heat.description: Used only if USRHflag is TRUE and the heat transfer coefficient value is specified in this field.
userh_user_specified_ground_surface_heat.title: Userh User Specified Ground Surface Heat Transfer Coefficient

apratio_the_area_to_perimeter_ratio_for_.description: Equivalent square slab is simulated,  side is 4*APRatio.
apratio_the_area_to_perimeter_ratio_for_.title: Apratio The Area To Perimeter Ratio For This Slab

slabdepth_thickness_of_slab_on_grade.description: This field specifies the thickness of the slab. The slab top surface is level with the ground surface, so this is the depth into the ground. The slab depth has a significant effect on the temperature calculation, and it is also important for the auto-grid process. The finite difference grids are set in such a way that they use the slab thickness to determine the vertical grid spacing. Autogridding will fail if the slab thickness is specified larger than 0.25 meters.
slabdepth_thickness_of_slab_on_grade.title: Slabdepth Thickness Of Slab On Grade

clearance_distance_from_edge_of_slab_to_.description: This field specifies the distance from the slab to the edge of the area that will be modeled with the grid system. It is the basic size dimension that is used to set the horizontal extent of the domain. 15 meters is a reasonable value.
clearance_distance_from_edge_of_slab_to_.title: Clearance Distance From Edge Of Slab To Domain Edge

zclearance_distance_from_bottom_of_slab_.description: This field specifies the vertical distance from the slab to the bottom edge of the area that will be modeled with the grid system. 15 meters is a reasonable value.
zclearance_distance_from_bottom_of_slab_.title: Zclearance Distance From Bottom Of Slab To Domain Bottom

rins_r_value_of_under_slab_insulation.description: This field provides the thermal resistance value of the under slab insulation. It should be zero if the vertical insulation configuration is selected. typical value= 0-2.0
rins_r_value_of_under_slab_insulation.title: Rins R Value Of Under Slab Insulation

dins_width_of_strip_of_under_slab_insula.description: This specifies the width of the perimeter strip of insulation under the slab. It should be zero if for the vertical insulation configuration is selected. typical value= 0-2.0
dins_width_of_strip_of_under_slab_insula.title: Dins Width Of Strip Of Under Slab Insulation

rvins_r_value_of_vertical_insulation.description: This field specifies the thermal resistance of the vertical insulation. It should be zero if the under slab insulation configuration is selected. typical value= 0-3.0
rvins_r_value_of_vertical_insulation.title: Rvins R Value Of Vertical Insulation

zvins_depth_of_vertical_insulation.description: This field specifies the depth of the vertical insulation into the ground in meters. It starts at the slab upper surface and extends into the ground. It should be zero if the under slab insulation configuration is selected. only use values= .2 .4 .6 .8 1.0 1.5 2.0 2.5 3.0
zvins_depth_of_vertical_insulation.title: Zvins Depth Of Vertical Insulation

ivins_flag_is_there_vertical_insulation.description: Specifies if the vertical insulation configuration is being used. values: 1=yes vertical insulation 0=no under-slab insulation
ivins_flag_is_there_vertical_insulation.title: Ivins Flag Is There Vertical Insulation

nx_number_of_cells_in_the_x_direction.title: Nx Number Of Cells In The X Direction

ny_number_of_cells_in_the_y_direction.title: Ny Number Of Cells In The Y Direction

nz_number_of_cells_in_the_z_direction.title: Nz Number Of Cells In The Z Direction

ibox_x_direction_cell_indicator_of_slab_.title: Ibox X Direction Cell Indicator Of Slab Edge

jbox_y_direction_cell_indicator_of_slab_.title: Jbox Y Direction Cell Indicator Of Slab Edge

nmat_number_of_materials.description: This field specifies the number of different materials that will be used in the model. Typically only a ground material and a slab material are used. (2 materials)
nmat_number_of_materials.title: Nmat Number Of Materials

albedo_surface_albedo_no_snow.description: Two fields specify the albedo value of the surface: first for no snow coverage days; second for days with snow coverage. The albedo is the solar reflectivity of the surface, and can vary from 0.05 for blacktop to 0.95 for fresh snow. Typical values for North America reported by Bahnfleth range from 0.16 to 0.4.
albedo_surface_albedo_no_snow.title: Albedo Surface Albedo No Snow

epslw_surface_emissivity_no_snow.description: EPSLW (No Snow and Snow) specifies the long wavelength (thermal) emissivity of the ground surface. primarily important for nighttime radiation to sky. typical value .95
epslw_surface_emissivity_no_snow.title: Epslw Surface Emissivity No Snow

z0_surface_roughness_no_snow.description: fields Z0 (No Snow and Snow) describe the height at which an experimentally velocity profile goes to zero. typical value= .75 cm
z0_surface_roughness_no_snow.title: Z0 Surface Roughness No Snow

hin_indoor_hconv_downward_flow.description: These fields specify the combined convective and radiative heat transfer coefficient between the slab top inside surface and the room air for the cases where heat is flowing downward, and upward. The program toggles between the two if the direction of the heat flux changes. Typical values can be found in the ASHRAE Handbook of Fundamentals, but should be about 6 W/(m2-K) for downward heat flow and 9 W/(m2-K) for upward heat flow. typical value= 4-10
hin_indoor_hconv_downward_flow.title: Hin Indoor Hconv Downward Flow

rho_slab_material_density.description: Density of Slab Material typical value= 2300.0
rho_slab_material_density.title: Rho Slab Material Density

rho_soil_density.description: Density of Soil Material typical value= 1200.0
rho_soil_density.title: Rho Soil Density

cp_slab_cp.description: Specific Heat of Slab Material typical value=650.0
cp_slab_cp.title: Cp Slab Cp

cp_soil_cp.description: Specific Heat of Soil Material typical value= 1200.0
cp_soil_cp.title: Cp Soil Cp

tcon_slab_k.description: Conductivity of Slab Material typical value= .9
tcon_slab_k.title: Tcon Slab K

tcon_soil_k.description: Conductivity of Soil Material typical value= 1.0
tcon_soil_k.title: Tcon Soil K

number_of_iterations_before_algorithm_sw.description: This field is used when RegulaFalsiThenBisection or BisectionThenRegulaFalsi is entered. When iteration number is greater than the value, algorithm switches.
number_of_iterations_before_algorithm_sw.title: Number Of Iterations Before Algorithm Switch

efficiency.description: Not applicable  if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater
efficiency.title: Efficiency

fuel_type.description: Not applicable  if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater
fuel_type.title: Fuel Type

priority.description: If Hot Water Plant Operation Scheme Type=Default in HVACTemplate:Plant:HotWaterLoop, then equipment operates in priority order, 1, 2, 3, etc.
priority.title: Priority

sizing_factor.description: Multiplies the autosized capacity and flow rates
sizing_factor.title: Sizing Factor

template_plant_loop_type.description: Specifies if this boiler serves a template hot water loop or mixed water loop If left blank, will serve a hot water loop if present, or a mixed water loop (if no hot water loop is present).
template_plant_loop_type.title: Template Plant Loop Type

boiler_name.description: The name of the detailed boiler object.
boiler_name.title: Boiler Name

priority.description: If Hot Water Plant Operation Scheme Type=Default in HVACTemplate:Plant:HotWaterLoop or MixedWaterLoop, then equipment operates in Priority order, 1, 2, 3, etc.
priority.title: Priority

template_plant_loop_type.description: Specifies if this boiler serves a template hot water loop or mixed water loop If left blank, will serve a hot water loop if present, or a mixed water loop (if no hot water loop is present).
template_plant_loop_type.title: Template Plant Loop Type

pump_schedule_name.description: If blank, always available Applies to both chilled water and condenser loop pumps
pump_schedule_name.title: Pump Schedule Name

pump_control_type.description: Applies to both chilled water and condenser loop pumps
pump_control_type.title: Pump Control Type

chiller_plant_operation_scheme_type.description: Default operation type makes all equipment available at all times operating in order of Priority specified in HVACTemplate:Plant:Chiller objects.
chiller_plant_operation_scheme_type.title: Chiller Plant Operation Scheme Type

chiller_plant_equipment_operation_scheme.description: Name of a PlantEquipmentOperationSchemes object Ignored if Chiller Plant Operation Scheme Type = Default
chiller_plant_equipment_operation_scheme.title: Chiller Plant Equipment Operation Schemes Name

chilled_water_design_setpoint.description: Used for sizing and as constant setpoint if no Chilled Water Setpoint Schedule Name is specified.
chilled_water_design_setpoint.title: Chilled Water Design Setpoint

chilled_water_pump_configuration.description: VariablePrimaryNoSecondary - variable flow to chillers and coils ConstantPrimaryNoSecondary - constant flow to chillers and coils, excess bypassed ConstantPrimaryVariableSecondary - constant flow to chillers, variable flow to coils VariablePrimaryConstantSecondary - currently unsupported - variable flow to chillers, constant flow to coils
chilled_water_pump_configuration.title: Chilled Water Pump Configuration

primary_chilled_water_pump_rated_head.title: Primary Chilled Water Pump Rated Head

secondary_chilled_water_pump_rated_head.title: Secondary Chilled Water Pump Rated Head

condenser_plant_operation_scheme_type.description: Default operation type makes all equipment available at all times operating in order of Priority specified in HVACTemplate:Plant:Tower objects. May be left blank if not serving any water cooled chillers
condenser_plant_operation_scheme_type.title: Condenser Plant Operation Scheme Type

condenser_equipment_operation_schemes_na.description: Name of a CondenserEquipmentOperationSchemes object Ignored if Condenser Plant Operation Scheme Type = Default May be left blank if not serving any water cooled chillers
condenser_equipment_operation_schemes_na.title: Condenser Equipment Operation Schemes Name

condenser_water_temperature_control_type.description: May be left blank if not serving any water cooled chillers
condenser_water_temperature_control_type.title: Condenser Water Temperature Control Type

condenser_water_setpoint_schedule_name.description: Leave blank if constant setpoint May be left blank if not serving any water cooled chillers
condenser_water_setpoint_schedule_name.title: Condenser Water Setpoint Schedule Name

condenser_water_design_setpoint.description: Used for sizing and as constant setpoint if no Condenser Water Setpoint Schedule Name is specified. May be left blank if not serving any water cooled chillers
condenser_water_design_setpoint.title: Condenser Water Design Setpoint

high_speed_nominal_capacity.description: Applicable for tower type SingleSpeed and TwoSpeed Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature, with the tower fan operating at high speed. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt(3 gpm/ton). Nominal tower capacity times (1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
high_speed_nominal_capacity.title: High Speed Nominal Capacity

high_speed_fan_power.description: Applicable for tower type SingleSpeed and TwoSpeed
high_speed_fan_power.title: High Speed Fan Power

low_speed_nominal_capacity.description: Applicable only for Tower Type TwoSpeed Nominal tower capacity with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature, with the tower fan operating at low speed. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt of tower high-speed nominal capacity (3 gpm/ton). Nominal tower capacity times (1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
low_speed_nominal_capacity.title: Low Speed Nominal Capacity

low_speed_fan_power.description: Applicable only for Tower Type TwoSpeed
low_speed_fan_power.title: Low Speed Fan Power

free_convection_capacity.description: Applicable for Tower Type SingleSpeed and TwoSpeed Tower capacity in free convection regime with entering water at 35C (95F), leaving water at 29.44C (85F), entering air at 25.56C (78F) wet-bulb temperature and 35C (95F) dry-bulb temperature. Design water flow rate assumed to be 5.382E-8 m3/s per watt of tower high-speed nominal capacity (3 gpm/ton). Tower free convection capacity times (1.25) gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions.
free_convection_capacity.title: Free Convection Capacity
