supply_fan_motor_in_air_stream_fraction.title: Supply Fan Motor In Air Stream Fraction

number_of_speeds_for_cooling.description: Used only for Cooling Coil Type = MultiSpeedDX.
number_of_speeds_for_cooling.title: Number Of Speeds For Cooling

dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capaci.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat Rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capaci.title: Dx Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity

dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_hea.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) Sensible and total capacities do not include effect of supply fan heat
dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_hea.title: Dx Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electric power input
dx_cooling_coil_gross_rated_cop.title: Dx Cooling Coil Gross Rated Cop

number_of_speeds_or_stages_for_heating.description: Used only for Heating Coil Type = MultiSpeedDXHeatPumpAirSource), MultiStageElectric, or MultiStageGas.
number_of_speeds_or_stages_for_heating.title: Number Of Speeds Or Stages For Heating

heating_coil_gross_rated_capacity.description: Rated heating capacity excluding the effect of supply air fan heat Rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C Rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C
heating_coil_gross_rated_capacity.title: Heating Coil Gross Rated Capacity

gas_heating_coil_parasitic_electric_load.title: Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load

heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_cop.description: Heating Coil Rated Capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply air fan heat or supply air fan electrical energy. Rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C Rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C Applies only to DX coils
heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_cop.title: Heat Pump Heating Coil Gross Rated Cop

heat_pump_heating_minimum_outdoor_dry_bu.title: Heat Pump Heating Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature

heat_pump_defrost_maximum_outdoor_dry_bu.title: Heat Pump Defrost Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature

heat_pump_defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode only applicable if Timed defrost control is specified
heat_pump_defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Heat Pump Defrost Time Period Fraction

supplemental_heating_or_reheat_coil_type.title: Supplemental Heating Or Reheat Coil Type

supplemental_heating_or_reheat_coil_avai.title: Supplemental Heating Or Reheat Coil Availability Schedule Name

supplemental_heating_or_reheat_coil_capa.title: Supplemental Heating Or Reheat Coil Capacity

supplemental_heating_or_reheat_coil_maxi.description: Supplemental heater will not operate when outdoor temperature exceeds this value.
supplemental_heating_or_reheat_coil_maxi.title: Supplemental Heating Or Reheat Coil Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature

supplemental_gas_heating_or_reheat_coil_.description: Applies only if Supplemental Heating Coil Type is Gas
supplemental_gas_heating_or_reheat_coil_.title: Supplemental Gas Heating Or Reheat Coil Efficiency

supplemental_gas_heating_or_reheat_coil_.description: Applies only if Supplemental Heating Coil Type is Gas
supplemental_gas_heating_or_reheat_coil_.title: Supplemental Gas Heating Or Reheat Coil Parasitic Electric Load

minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Schedule values multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate If blank, multiplier is always one
minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name

economizer_maximum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for FixedDryBulb economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative. Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Dry Bulb Temperature

economizer_maximum_limit_enthalpy.description: Enter the maximum outdoor enthalpy limit for FixedEnthalpy economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_enthalpy.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy

economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dewpoint temperature limit for FixedDewPointAndDryBulb economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative. Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature

economizer_minimum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.description: Enter the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for economizer control. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_minimum_limit_dry_bulb_temper.title: Economizer Minimum Limit Dry Bulb Temperature

supply_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Supply plenum serves all zones on this system. Blank if none.
supply_plenum_name.title: Supply Plenum Name

return_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Return plenum serves all zones on this system. Blank if none.
return_plenum_name.title: Return Plenum Name

latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.description: Applicable only if Heat Recovery Type is Enthalpy.
latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.title: Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint, reheat with reheat coil If no reheat coil specified, cold supply temps may occur. Multimode = activate enhanced dehumidification mode as needed and meet sensible load. Valid only for Cooling Coil Type = TwoStageHumidityControlDX or HeatExchangerAssistedDX
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

dehumidification_relative_humidity_setpo.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100) Ignored if Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule specified below
dehumidification_relative_humidity_setpo.title: Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint

dehumidification_relative_humidity_setpo.description: Leave blank to use constant setpoint specified in Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint above. Schedule values must be in percent relative humidity (0 to 100).
dehumidification_relative_humidity_setpo.title: Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name

humidifier_rated_capacity.description: Moisture output rate at full rated power input. The humidifier does not currently autosize, so the default is very large to allow for adequate capacity.
humidifier_rated_capacity.title: Humidifier Rated Capacity

humidifier_rated_electric_power.description: Electric power input at rated capacity moisture output. Power consumption is proportional to moisture output with no part-load penalty.
humidifier_rated_electric_power.title: Humidifier Rated Electric Power

humidifier_control_zone_name.description: Zone name where humidistat is located
humidifier_control_zone_name.title: Humidifier Control Zone Name

humidifier_relative_humidity_setpoint.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100). Ignored if Humidifier Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule specified below
humidifier_relative_humidity_setpoint.title: Humidifier Relative Humidity Setpoint

humidifier_relative_humidity_setpoint_sc.description: Leave blank to use constant setpoint specified in Humidifier Relative Humidity Setpoint above. Schedule values must be in percent relative humidity (0 to 100).
humidifier_relative_humidity_setpoint_sc.title: Humidifier Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name

sizing_option.description: Select whether autosized system supply flow rate is the sum of Coincident or NonCoincident zone air flow rates.
sizing_option.title: Sizing Option

return_fan.description: Specifies if the system has a return fan.
return_fan.title: Return Fan

return_fan_motor_in_air_stream_fraction.title: Return Fan Motor In Air Stream Fraction

system_availability_schedule_name.description: If blank, always on; VAV System always on. Schedule is used in availability manager and fan scheduling. Also see "Night Cycle Control" field.
system_availability_schedule_name.title: System Availability Schedule Name

supply_fan_maximum_flow_rate.description: This field may be set to "autosize". If a value is entered, it will *not* be multiplied by any sizing factor or by zone multipliers. If using zone multipliers a value entered here must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.
supply_fan_maximum_flow_rate.title: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate

supply_fan_minimum_flow_rate.description: This field is only used to set a minimum part load on the VAV fan power curve. Autosize or zero is recommended.
supply_fan_minimum_flow_rate.title: Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate

supply_fan_motor_in_air_stream_fraction.title: Supply Fan Motor In Air Stream Fraction

cooling_coil_design_setpoint.description: Used for sizing and as constant setpoint if no Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name is specified.
cooling_coil_design_setpoint.title: Cooling Coil Design Setpoint

heating_coil_design_setpoint.description: Used for sizing and as constant setpoint if no Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name is specified.
heating_coil_design_setpoint.title: Heating Coil Design Setpoint

gas_heating_coil_parasitic_electric_load.title: Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load

preheat_coil_design_setpoint.description: Used for sizing and as constant setpoint if no Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule Name specified.
preheat_coil_design_setpoint.title: Preheat Coil Design Setpoint

gas_preheat_coil_parasitic_electric_load.title: Gas Preheat Coil Parasitic Electric Load

minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Schedule values multiply the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate If blank, multiplier is always one
minimum_outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name

economizer_upper_temperature_limit.description: Outdoor temperature above which economizer is disabled and heat recovery is enabled (if available). Blank means no limit.
economizer_upper_temperature_limit.title: Economizer Upper Temperature Limit

economizer_lower_temperature_limit.description: Outdoor temperature below which economizer is disabled and heat recovery is enabled (if available). Blank means no limit.
economizer_lower_temperature_limit.title: Economizer Lower Temperature Limit

economizer_upper_enthalpy_limit.description: Outdoor enthalpy above which economizer is disabled and heat recovery is enabled (if available). Blank means no limit.
economizer_upper_enthalpy_limit.title: Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit

economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dewpoint temperature limit for FixedDewPointAndDryBulb economizer control type. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative. Limit is applied regardless of economizer control type.
economizer_maximum_limit_dewpoint_temper.title: Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature

supply_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Supply plenum serves all zones on this system. Blank if none.
supply_plenum_name.title: Supply Plenum Name

return_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Supply plenum serves all zones on this system. Blank if none.
return_plenum_name.title: Return Plenum Name

supply_fan_part_load_power_coefficients.description: This field selects a predefined set of fan power coefficients. The ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients are from TABLE G3.1.3.15, Method 2. The other sets of coefficients are from the EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, Fan Coefficient Values table.
supply_fan_part_load_power_coefficients.title: Supply Fan Part Load Power Coefficients

night_cycle_control_zone_name.description: Applicable only if Night Cycle Control is Cycle On Control Zone.
night_cycle_control_zone_name.title: Night Cycle Control Zone Name

cooling_coil_setpoint_reset_type.description: Overrides Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name None = no reset, control to Cooling Coil Design Setpoint Temperature or Schedule Warmest = reset as warm as possible yet meet all zone cooling loads at max supply air flow rate OutdoorAirTemperatureReset = reset based on outdoor air temperature (18.0C at 15.6C ODB, to the Cooling Design Setpoint at 26.7C) WarmestTemperatureFirst = reset as warm as possible yet meet all zone cooling loads at min supply air flow rate
cooling_coil_setpoint_reset_type.title: Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type

heating_coil_setpoint_reset_type.description: Overrides Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name None = no reset, control to Heating Coil Design Setpoint Temperature or Schedule OutdoorAirTemperatureReset = reset based on outdoor air temperature (Heating Design Setpoint at -6.7C ODB to Heating Design Setpoint minus 5.2C at 10C ODB) min supply air flow rate
heating_coil_setpoint_reset_type.title: Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type

dehumidification_control_type.description: None = meet sensible load only CoolReheat = cool beyond the dry-bulb setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

dehumidification_control_zone_name.description: Zone name where humidistat is located
dehumidification_control_zone_name.title: Dehumidification Control Zone Name

dehumidification_setpoint.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100)
dehumidification_setpoint.title: Dehumidification Setpoint

humidifier_rated_capacity.description: Moisture output rate at full rated power input. The humidifier does not currently autosize, so the default is very large to allow for adequate capacity.
humidifier_rated_capacity.title: Humidifier Rated Capacity

humidifier_rated_electric_power.description: Electric power input at rated capacity moisture output. Power consumption is proportional to moisture output with no part-load penalty.
humidifier_rated_electric_power.title: Humidifier Rated Electric Power

humidifier_control_zone_name.description: Zone name where humidistat is located
humidifier_control_zone_name.title: Humidifier Control Zone Name

humidifier_setpoint.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100)
humidifier_setpoint.title: Humidifier Setpoint

sizing_option.description: Select whether autosized system supply flow rate is the sum of Coincident or NonCoincident zone air flow rates.
sizing_option.title: Sizing Option

return_fan.description: Specifies if the system has a return fan.
return_fan.title: Return Fan

return_fan_motor_in_air_stream_fraction.title: Return Fan Motor In Air Stream Fraction

return_fan_part_load_power_coefficients.description: This field selects a predefined set of fan power coefficients. The ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients are from TABLE G3.1.3.15, Method 2. The other sets of coefficients are from the EnergyPlus Input Output Reference, Fan Coefficient Values table.
return_fan_part_load_power_coefficients.title: Return Fan Part Load Power Coefficients

system_availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
system_availability_schedule_name.title: System Availability Schedule Name

gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.description: Enter the total cooling capacity in watts at rated conditions or set to autosize. Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_total_cooling_capacity.title: Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity

gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Enter the coefficient of performance at rated conditions or leave blank to use default. COP includes compressor and condenser fan electrical energy input COP does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electric power input
gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Gross Rated Cooling Cop

minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_cooling_m.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation. Cooling is disabled below this temperature.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_cooling_m.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature In Cooling Mode

maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_cooling_m.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for cooling operation. Cooling is disabled above this temperature.
maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_cooling_m.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature In Cooling Mode

gross_rated_heating_capacity.description: Enter the heating capacity in watts at rated conditions or set to autosize. Heating capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat
gross_rated_heating_capacity.title: Gross Rated Heating Capacity

rated_heating_capacity_sizing_ratio.description: If the Gross Rated Heating Capacity is autosized, the heating capacity is sized to be equal to the cooling capacity multiplied by this sizing ratio. The zone terminal unit heating coils are also sized using this ratio unless the sizing ratio input in the ZoneHVAC:TerminalUnit:VariableRefrigerantFlow object is entered.
rated_heating_capacity_sizing_ratio.title: Rated Heating Capacity Sizing Ratio

gross_rated_heating_cop.description: COP includes compressor and condenser fan electrical energy input COP does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
gross_rated_heating_cop.title: Gross Rated Heating Cop

minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heating_m.description: Enter the minimum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heating_m.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature In Heating Mode

maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heating_m.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation.
maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heating_m.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature In Heating Mode

minimum_heat_pump_part_load_ratio.description: Enter the minimum heat pump part-load ratio (PLR). When the cooling or heating PLR is below this value, the heat pump compressor will cycle to meet the cooling or heating demand.
minimum_heat_pump_part_load_ratio.title: Minimum Heat Pump Part Load Ratio

zone_name_for_master_thermostat_location.description: Enter the name of the zone where the master thermostat is located.
zone_name_for_master_thermostat_location.title: Zone Name For Master Thermostat Location

master_thermostat_priority_control_type.description: Choose a thermostat control logic scheme. If these control types fail to control zone temperature within a reasonable limit, consider using multiple VRF systems
master_thermostat_priority_control_type.title: Master Thermostat Priority Control Type

thermostat_priority_schedule_name.description: this field is required if Master Thermostat Priority Control Type is Scheduled. Schedule values of 0 denote cooling, 1 for heating, and all other values disable the system.
thermostat_priority_schedule_name.title: Thermostat Priority Schedule Name

heat_pump_waste_heat_recovery.description: This field is reserved for future use. The only valid choice is No.
heat_pump_waste_heat_recovery.title: Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery

equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.description: Enter the equivalent length of the farthest terminal unit from the condenser
equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.title: Equivalent Piping Length Used For Piping Correction Factor In Cooling Mode

vertical_height_used_for_piping_correcti.description: Enter the height difference between the highest and lowest terminal unit
vertical_height_used_for_piping_correcti.title: Vertical Height Used For Piping Correction Factor

equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.description: Enter the equivalent length of the farthest terminal unit from the condenser
equivalent_piping_length_used_for_piping.title: Equivalent Piping Length Used For Piping Correction Factor In Heating Mode

crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.description: Enter the value of the resistive heater located in the compressor(s). This heater is used to warm the refrigerant and oil when the compressor is off.
crankcase_heater_power_per_compressor.title: Crankcase Heater Power Per Compressor

number_of_compressors.description: Enter the total number of compressor. This input is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
number_of_compressors.title: Number Of Compressors

ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.description: Enter the ratio of the first stage compressor to total compressor capacity. All other compressors are assumed to be equally sized. This inputs is used only for crankcase heater calculations.
ratio_of_compressor_size_to_total_compre.title: Ratio Of Compressor Size To Total Compressor Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which the crankcase heaters are disabled.
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Crankcase Heater

defrost_strategy.description: Select a defrost strategy. Reverse cycle reverses the operating mode from heating to cooling to melt frost formation on the condenser coil. The resistive strategy uses a resistive heater to melt the frost.
defrost_strategy.title: Defrost Strategy

defrost_control.description: Choose a defrost control type. Either use a fixed Timed defrost period or select OnDemand to defrost only when necessary.
defrost_control.title: Defrost Control

defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode. Only applicable if timed defrost control is specified.
defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Defrost Time Period Fraction

resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.description: Enter the size of the resistive defrost heating element. Only applicable if resistive defrost strategy is specified
resistive_defrost_heater_capacity.title: Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.description: Enter the maximum outdoor temperature above which defrost operation is disabled.
maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Defrost Operation

condenser_type.description: Select either an air cooled or evaporatively cooled condenser.
condenser_type.title: Condenser Type

water_condenser_volume_flow_rate.description: Only used when Condenser Type = WaterCooled.
water_condenser_volume_flow_rate.title: Water Condenser Volume Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.description: Enter the effectiveness of the evaporatively cooled condenser. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.title: Evaporative Condenser Effectiveness

evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.description: Rated power consumed by the evaporative condenser's water pump. This field is only used when the Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_pump_rated_power_c.title: Evaporative Condenser Pump Rated Power Consumption

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the basin heater is available (field Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater maintains the basin water temperature at the basin heater setpoint temperature when the outdoor air temperature falls below the setpoint temperature. The basin heater only operates when the DX coil is off.
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature when the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 allow the basin heater to operate whenever the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature is below the basin heater setpoint temperature. If a schedule name is not entered, the basin heater is allowed to operate throughout the entire simulation.
basin_heater_operating_schedule_name.title: Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name

minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.description: The minimum outdoor temperature below which heat recovery mode will not operate.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.description: The maximum outdoor temperature above which heat recovery mode will not operate.
maximum_outdoor_temperature_in_heat_reco.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature In Heat Recovery Mode

heating_setpoint_schedule_name.description: Leave blank if constant setpoint specified below, must enter schedule or constant setpoint
heating_setpoint_schedule_name.title: Heating Setpoint Schedule Name

constant_heating_setpoint.description: Ignored if schedule specified above, must enter schedule or constant setpoint
constant_heating_setpoint.title: Constant Heating Setpoint

cooling_setpoint_schedule_name.description: Leave blank if constant setpoint specified below, must enter schedule or constant setpoint
cooling_setpoint_schedule_name.title: Cooling Setpoint Schedule Name

constant_cooling_setpoint.description: Ignored if schedule specified above, must enter schedule or constant setpoint
constant_cooling_setpoint.title: Constant Cooling Setpoint

zone_name.description: Zone name must match a building zone name
zone_name.title: Zone Name

template_thermostat_name.description: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object. If blank, then it is assumed that standard thermostat objects have been defined for this zone.
template_thermostat_name.title: Template Thermostat Name

zone_heating_sizing_factor.description: If blank, value from Sizing:Parameters will be used.
zone_heating_sizing_factor.title: Zone Heating Sizing Factor

dedicated_outdoor_air_system_name.description: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object if this zone is served by a separate dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS). Leave field blank if no DOAS serves this zone.
dedicated_outdoor_air_system_name.title: Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name

outdoor_air_method.description: Flow/Person, Flow/Zone, Flow/Area, Sum, and Maximum use the values in the next three fields: Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person, Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area, and Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone. DetailedSpecification ignores these three Outdoor Air Flow Rate fields and instead references design specification objects named in the fields Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name.
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.description: Default 0.00944 is 20 cfm per person This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: This field is used only when Outdoor Air Method=DetailedSpecification.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

design_specification_zone_air_distributi.description: This field is used only when Outdoor Air Method=DetailedSpecification.
design_specification_zone_air_distributi.title: Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name

zone_name.description: Zone name must match a building zone name
zone_name.title: Zone Name

template_constant_volume_system_name.description: Name of a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume object serving this zone
template_constant_volume_system_name.title: Template Constant Volume System Name

template_thermostat_name.description: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object. If blank, then it is assumed that standard thermostat objects have been defined for this zone.
template_thermostat_name.title: Template Thermostat Name

supply_air_maximum_flow_rate.description: This field may be set to "autosize". If a value is entered, it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.
supply_air_maximum_flow_rate.title: Supply Air Maximum Flow Rate

zone_heating_sizing_factor.description: If blank, value from Sizing:Parameters will be used.
zone_heating_sizing_factor.title: Zone Heating Sizing Factor

zone_cooling_sizing_factor.description: If blank, value from Sizing:Parameters will be used.
zone_cooling_sizing_factor.title: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor

outdoor_air_method.description: Flow/Person, Flow/Zone, Flow/Area, Sum, and Maximum use the values in the next three fields: Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person, Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area, and Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone. DetailedSpecification ignores these three Outdoor Air Flow Rate fields and instead references design specification objects named in the fields Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name.
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.description: Default 0.00944 is 20 cfm per person This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: This field is used only when Outdoor Air Method=DetailedSpecification.

maximum_reheat_air_temperature.description: Specifies the maximum allowable supply air temperature leaving the reheat coil. If left blank, there is no limit and no default. If unknown, 35C (95F) is recommended.

return_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Return plenum runs through only this zone. Blank if none.

zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference

zone_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: This field is the Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction specified as a fraction of the maximum air flow rate. This field is ignored if the system serving this zone is constant volume.
zone_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction

outdoor_air_method.description: Flow/Person, Flow/Zone, Flow/Area, Sum, and Maximum use the values in the next three fields: Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person, Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area, and Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone. DetailedSpecification ignores these three Outdoor Air Flow Rate fields and instead references design specification objects named in the fields Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name.
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.description: Default 0.00944 is 20 cfm per person This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: This field is used only when Outdoor Air Method=DetailedSpecification. Note that this field is used only for specifying the design outdoor air flow rate used for sizing. The field Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name for Control (see above) is used to actively control the VAV terminal air flow rate.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name For Sizing

design_specification_zone_air_distributi.description: This field is used only when Outdoor Air Method=DetailedSpecification.
design_specification_zone_air_distributi.title: Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the terminal unit will increase flow as needed to meet this outdoor air requirement. If Outdoor Air Flow per Person is non-zero, then the outdoor air requirement will be computed based on the current number of occupants in the zone. At no time will the supply air flow rate exceed the value for Maximum Air Flow Rate. If this field is blank, then the terminal unit will not be controlled for outdoor air flow. Note that this field is used only for specifying the design outdoor air flow rate used for control. The field Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name for Sizing (see below) is used to specify the design outdoor air flow rate.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name For Control

cold_supply_plenum_name.description: Plenum zone name. Cold supply plenum that serves only this zone. Blank if none.
cold_supply_plenum_name.title: Cold Supply Plenum Name

low_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.title: Low Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio

medium_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.description: Medium Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio should be greater than Low Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio
medium_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.title: Medium Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio

outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Value of schedule multiplies maximum outdoor air flow rate This schedule is ignored if this zone is served by an HVACTemplate dedicated outdoor air system.

minimum_cooling_supply_air_humidity_rati.title: Minimum Cooling Supply Air Humidity Ratio

maximum_heating_air_flow_rate.description: This field is ignored if Heating Limit = NoLimit If this field is blank, there is no limit.
maximum_heating_air_flow_rate.title: Maximum Heating Air Flow Rate

maximum_sensible_heating_capacity.description: This field is ignored if Heating Limit = NoLimit If this field is blank, there is no limit.
maximum_sensible_heating_capacity.title: Maximum Sensible Heating Capacity

maximum_cooling_air_flow_rate.description: This field is ignored if Cooling Limit = NoLimit This field is required if Outdoor Air Economizer Type is anything other than NoEconomizer.
maximum_cooling_air_flow_rate.title: Maximum Cooling Air Flow Rate

maximum_total_cooling_capacity.description: This field is ignored if Cooling Limit = NoLimit
maximum_total_cooling_capacity.title: Maximum Total Cooling Capacity

heating_availability_schedule_name.description: If blank, heating is always available.
heating_availability_schedule_name.title: Heating Availability Schedule Name

cooling_availability_schedule_name.description: If blank, cooling is always available.
cooling_availability_schedule_name.title: Cooling Availability Schedule Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: ConstantSensibleHeatRatio means that the ideal loads system will be controlled to meet the sensible cooling load, and the latent cooling rate will be computed using a constant sensible heat ratio (SHR) Humidistat means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to satisfy the humidistat. None means that there is no dehumidification. ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio means that during cooling the supply air will always be at the Minimum Cooling Supply Humidity Ratio.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

cooling_sensible_heat_ratio.description: This field is applicable only when Dehumidification Control Type is ConstantSensibleHeatRatio
cooling_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio

dehumidification_setpoint.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100)
dehumidification_setpoint.title: Dehumidification Setpoint

humidification_control_type.description: None means that there is no humidification. Humidistat means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to satisfy the humidistat. ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio means that during heating the supply air will always be at the Maximum Heating Supply Humidity Ratio.
humidification_control_type.title: Humidification Control Type

humidification_setpoint.description: Zone relative humidity setpoint in percent (0 to 100)
humidification_setpoint.title: Humidification Setpoint

outdoor_air_method.description: None means there is no outdoor air and all related fields will be ignored Flow/Person, Flow/Zone, Flow/Area, Sum, and Maximum use the values in the next three fields: Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person, Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area, and Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone. DetailedSpecification ignores these three Outdoor Air Flow Rate fields and instead references design specification objects named in the fields Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name.
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.description: Default 0.00944 is 20 cfm per person This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the minimum outdoor air flow rate will be computed using these specifications. The outdoor air flow rate will also be affected by the next two fields. If this field is blank, there will be no outdoor air and the remaining fields will be ignored.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

demand_controlled_ventilation_type.description: This field controls how the minimum outdoor air flow rate is calculated. None means that design occupancy will be used to compute the minimum outdoor air flow rate OccupancySchedule means that current occupancy level will be used. CO2Setpoint means that the design occupancy will be used to compute the minimum outdoor air flow rate and the outdoor air flow rate may be increased if necessary to maintain the indoor air carbon dioxide setpoint defined in a ZoneControl:ContaminantController object.
demand_controlled_ventilation_type.title: Demand Controlled Ventilation Type

outdoor_air_economizer_type.description: DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy will increase the outdoor air flow rate when there is a cooling load and the outdoor air temperature or enthalpy is below the zone exhaust air temperature or enthalpy.
outdoor_air_economizer_type.title: Outdoor Air Economizer Type

latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.description: Applicable only if Heat Recovery Type is Enthalpy.
latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.title: Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness

zone_name.description: Zone name must match a building zone name
zone_name.title: Zone Name

template_thermostat_name.description: Enter the name of a HVACTemplate:Thermostat object. If blank, then it is assumed that standard thermostat objects have been defined for this zone.
template_thermostat_name.title: Template Thermostat Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Supply air flow rate during cooling operation This field may be set to "autosize". If a value is entered, it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Supply air flow rate during heating operation This field may be set to "autosize". If a value is entered, it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Supply air flow rate when no cooling or heating is needed Only used when heat pump fan operating mode is continuous. This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the DX coil compressor is off. If this field is left blank or zero, the supply air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used. A value entered in this field will *not* be multiplied by the sizing factor or by zone multipliers. It is best to autosize or leave blank when using zone multipliers.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

zone_heating_sizing_factor.description: If blank, value from Sizing:Parameters will be used.
zone_heating_sizing_factor.title: Zone Heating Sizing Factor

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

supply_fan_operating_mode_schedule_name.description: Refers to a schedule to specify unitary supply fan operating mode. Schedule Name values of 0 indicate cycling fan (auto) Schedule values of 1 indicate continuous fan (on) If this field is left blank, a schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.
supply_fan_operating_mode_schedule_name.title: Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capacity.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat Rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capacity.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity

cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_heat_r.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) Sensible and total capacities do not include effect of supply fan heat
cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_heat_r.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

cooling_coil_gross_rated_cooling_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
cooling_coil_gross_rated_cooling_cop.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Cooling Cop

gas_heating_coil_efficiency.description: Applies only if Heating Coil Type is Gas

gas_heating_coil_parasitic_electric_load.description: Applies only if Heating Coil Type is Gas

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

supply_fan_operating_mode_schedule_name.description: Refers to a schedule to specify unitary supply fan operating mode. Schedule values of 0 indicate cycling fan (auto) Schedule values of 1 indicate continuous fan (on) If this field is left blank, a schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.
supply_fan_operating_mode_schedule_name.title: Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capacity.description: Total cooling capacity not accounting for the effect of supply air fan heat Rating point: air entering the cooling coil at 26.7 C dry-bulb/19.4 C wet-bulb, and air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35 C dry-bulb/23.9 C wet-bulb
cooling_coil_gross_rated_total_capacity.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity

cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_heat_r.description: Rated sensible heat ratio (gross sensible capacity/gross total capacity) Sensible and total capacities do not include effect of supply fan heat
cooling_coil_gross_rated_sensible_heat_r.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio

cooling_coil_gross_rated_cop.description: Gross cooling capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, does not include supply fan heat or supply fan electrical energy input
cooling_coil_gross_rated_cop.title: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Cop

heat_pump_heating_coil_availability_sche.title: Heat Pump Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name

heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_capac.description: Capacity excluding supply air fan heat Rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C Rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C
heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_capac.title: Heat Pump Heating Coil Gross Rated Capacity

heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_cop.description: Heat Pump Heating Coil Rated Capacity divided by power input to the compressor and outdoor fan, Does not include supply air fan heat or supply air fan electrical energy Rating point outdoor dry-bulb temp 8.33 C, outdoor wet-bulb temp 6.11 C Rating point heating coil entering air dry-bulb 21.11 C, coil entering wet-bulb 15.55 C
heat_pump_heating_coil_gross_rated_cop.title: Heat Pump Heating Coil Gross Rated Cop

heat_pump_heating_minimum_outdoor_dry_bu.title: Heat Pump Heating Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature

heat_pump_defrost_maximum_outdoor_dry_bu.title: Heat Pump Defrost Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature

heat_pump_defrost_time_period_fraction.description: Fraction of time in defrost mode only applicable if Timed defrost control is specified
heat_pump_defrost_time_period_fraction.title: Heat Pump Defrost Time Period Fraction

supplemental_heating_coil_availability_s.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name

supplemental_heating_coil_maximum_outdoo.description: Supplemental heater will not operate when outdoor temperature exceeds this value.

zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.description: Constant = Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow Rate) FixedFlowRate = Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate (a fixed minimum air volume flow rate) Scheduled = Scheduled Minimum Air Flow Fraction (a fraction of Maximum Air Flow
zone_minimum_air_flow_input_method.title: Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method

constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Constant If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional. If a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the following field are entered, the larger result is used.
constant_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction

fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is FixedFlowRate. If the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled, then this field is optional. If a value is entered, then it is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils. If both this field and the previous field are entered, the larger result is used.
fixed_minimum_air_flow_rate.title: Fixed Minimum Air Flow Rate

minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.description: This field is used if the field Zone Minimum Air Flow Input Method is Scheduled Schedule values are fractions, 0.0 to 1.0. If the field Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction is blank, then the average of the minimum and maximum schedule values is used for sizing normal-action reheat coils.
minimum_air_flow_fraction_schedule_name.title: Minimum Air Flow Fraction Schedule Name

outdoor_air_method.description: Flow/Person, Flow/Zone, Flow/Area, Sum, and Maximum use the values in the next three fields: Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person, Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area, and Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone. DetailedSpecification ignores these three Outdoor Air Flow Rate fields and instead references design specification objects named in the fields Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name.
outdoor_air_method.title: Outdoor Air Method

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.description: Default 0.00944 is 20 cfm per person This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Person, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_person.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Person

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone_floor_are.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone Floor Area

outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.description: This input is used if the field Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone, Sum, or Maximum
outdoor_air_flow_rate_per_zone.title: Outdoor Air Flow Rate Per Zone

maximum_flow_per_zone_floor_area_during_.description: Used only when Reheat Coil Object Type = Coil:Heating:Water and Damper Heating Action = Reverse When autocalculating, the maximum flow per zone is set to 0.002032 m3/s-m2 (0.4 cfm/sqft) This optional field limits the maximum flow allowed in reheat mode. If this field and the following field are left blank, the maximum flow will not be limited. At no time will the maximum flow rate calculated here exceed the value of Maximum Air Flow Rate.
maximum_flow_per_zone_floor_area_during_.title: Maximum Flow Per Zone Floor Area During Reheat

maximum_flow_fraction_during_reheat.description: Used only when Reheat Coil Object Type = Coil:Heating:Water and Damper Heating Action = Reverse When autocalculating, the maximum flow fraction is set to the ratio of 0.002032 m3/s-m2 (0.4 cfm/sqft) multiplied by the zone floor area and the Maximum Air Flow Rate. This optional field limits the maximum flow allowed in reheat mode. If this field and the previous field are left blank, the maximum flow will not be limited. At no time will the maximum flow rate calculated here exceed the value of Maximum Air Flow Rate.
maximum_flow_fraction_during_reheat.title: Maximum Flow Fraction During Reheat

maximum_reheat_air_temperature.description: Specifies the maximum allowable supply air temperature leaving the reheat coil. If left blank, there is no limit and no default. If unknown, 35C (95F) is recommended.
maximum_reheat_air_temperature.title: Maximum Reheat Air Temperature

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the terminal unit will increase flow as needed to meet this outdoor air requirement. If Outdoor Air Flow per Person is non-zero, then the outdoor air requirement will be computed based on the current number of occupants in the zone. At no time will the supply air flow rate exceed the value for Maximum Air Flow Rate. If this field is blank, then the terminal unit will not be controlled for outdoor air flow. Note that this field is used only for specifying the design outdoor air flow rate used for control. The field Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name for Sizing (see below) is used to specify the design outdoor air flow rate.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name For Control

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: This field may be set to "autosize". If a value is entered, it will be multiplied by the Supply Air Sizing Factor and by zone multipliers.

Design Power Consumption = Design Maximum Flow Rate * Design Pump Head * scaling factor / Motor Efficiency

schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_level_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of hot water equipment for this set of attributes Choices: EquipmentLevel => Design Level -- simply enter power input of equipment Watts/Area or Power/Area => Power per Zone Floor Area -- enter the number to apply. Value * Floor Area = Equipment Level Watts/Person or Power/Person => Power per Person -- enter the number to apply. Value * Occupants = Equipment Level
design_level_calculation_method.title: Design Level Calculation Method

end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

rated_capacity.description: Capacity is m3/s of water at 5.05 C
rated_capacity.title: Rated Capacity

rated_power.description: if autosized the rated power is calculated from the rated capacity and enthalpy rise of water from 20.0C to 100.0C steam and assumes electric to thermal energy conversion efficiency of 100.0%
rated_power.title: Rated Power

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

rated_capacity.description: Capacity is m3/s of water at 5.05 C The nominal full capacity water addition rate in m3/s of water at 5.05 C
rated_capacity.title: Rated Capacity

rated_gas_use_rate.description: if auto-sized, the rated gas use rate is calculated from the rated capacity and enthalpy rise of water from 20.0C to 100.0C steam and user input thermal efficiency value specified in the next input field. If this input field is hard-sized and Inlet Water Temperature Option input field is selected as FixedInletWaterTemperature, then the thermal efficiency input field will not be used or else if the Inlet Water Temperature Option input field is selected as VariableInletWaterTemperature, then the thermal efficiency input value is overridden by a value calculated from the capacity, rated gas use rate and design condition.
rated_gas_use_rate.title: Rated Gas Use Rate

thermal_efficiency.description: Based on the higher heating value of fuel. If "Rated Gas Use Rate" in the field above is not auto-sized and the Inlet Water Temperature Option input field is specified as FixedInletWaterTemperature, then the thermal efficiency specified will not be used in the calculation, or else if the Inlet Water Temperature Option input field is selected as VariableInletWaterTemperature, then the thermal efficiency value is overridden by a value calculated from the capacity, rated gas use rate and design condition.
thermal_efficiency.title: Thermal Efficiency

thermal_efficiency_modifier_curve_name.description: Linear, Quadratic and Cubic efficiency curves are solely a function of PLR. Linear = C1 + C2*PLR Quadratic = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 Cubic = C1 + C2*PLR + C3*PLR^2 + C4*PLR^3 This is thermal efficiency modifier curve name of gas fired steam humidifier. This curve is normalized, i.e., curve output value at rated condition is 1.0.
thermal_efficiency_modifier_curve_name.title: Thermal Efficiency Modifier Curve Name

rated_fan_power.description: The nominal full capacity electric power input to the blower fan in Watts. If no blower fan is required to inject the dry steam to the supply air stream, then this input field is set to zero.
rated_fan_power.title: Rated Fan Power

auxiliary_electric_power.description: The auxiliary electric power input in watts. This amount of power will be consumed whenever the unit is available (as defined by the availability schedule). This electric power is used for control purpose only.
auxiliary_electric_power.title: Auxiliary Electric Power

inlet_water_temperature_option.description: The inlet water temperature can be fixed at 20C as it is done for electric steam humidifier or it can be allowed to vary with temperature of the water source. Currently allowed water sources are main water or water storage tank in water use objects. if FixedInletWaterTemperature is specified, then a fixed 20C water temperature will be used, or else if VariableInletWaterTemperature is specified, then inlet water will vary depending the source water temperature. If this input field is left blank, then fixed inlet water temperature of 20C will be assumed.
inlet_water_temperature_option.title: Inlet Water Temperature Option

calculate_zone_internal_thermal_mass.description: Use measured zone air temperature to calculate zone internal thermal mass. If set to Yes, the measured zone air temperature should be provided to calculate the thermal mass. If set to No, the inverse calculation of thermal mass will not be activated.
calculate_zone_internal_thermal_mass.title: Calculate Zone Internal Thermal Mass

calculate_zone_air_infiltration_rate.description: Use measured temperature data (temperature, humidity ratio, or CO2 concentration) to calculate zone air infiltration air flow rate. Only one of field Calculate Zone Internal Thermal Mass, Calculate Zone Air Infiltration Rate, and Calculate Zone People Count can be set to YES at a time. By default, this field is set to NO. When set to NO, the inverse calculation of the zone air infiltration rate will not be activated. If this field is set to YES, one of the following fields (combinations) should be provided: 1. Measurements were conducted when HVAC is free-floating: 1.1 Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name 1.2 Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name 1.3 Zone Measured Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name 2. Measurements were conducted when HVAC is on: 2.1 Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name 2.2 Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name 2.3 Zone Measured Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name
calculate_zone_air_infiltration_rate.title: Calculate Zone Air Infiltration Rate

calculate_zone_people_count.description: Use measured humidity ratio data (temperature, humidity ratio, or CO2 concentration) to calculate zone people count. Only one of field Calculate Zone Internal Thermal Mass, Calculate Zone Air Infiltration Rate, and Calculate Zone People Count can be set to YES at a time. By default, this field is set to NO. When set to NO, the inverse calculation of the zone people count will not be activated. If this field is set to YES, one of the following fields (combinations) should be provided: 1. Measurements were conducted when HVAC is free-floating: 1.1 Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name 1.2 Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name 1.3 Zone Measured Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name 2. Measurements were conducted when HVAC is on: 2.1 Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name 2.2 Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name 2.3 Zone Measured Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name, Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name, and Zone Input Supply Air CO2 Concentration Schedule Name Field Zone Input People Activity Schedule Name, Zone Input People Sensible Heat Fraction Schedule Name, Zone Input People Radiant Heat Fraction Schedule Name, Zone Input People CO2 Generation Rate Schedule Name are optional. If provided, the default people activity level (130W), sensible heat generation rate (78W), latent heat generation (52W) rate, and CO2 generation rate (0.0000000382 [m3/(s*W)]) will be overwritten correspondingly.
calculate_zone_people_count.title: Calculate Zone People Count

zone_measured_air_temperature_schedule_n.title: Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name

zone_measured_air_humidity_ratio_schedul.title: Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name

zone_measured_air_co2_concentration_sche.title: Zone Measured Air Co2 Concentration Schedule Name

zone_input_people_activity_schedule_name.description: When this field is provided and valid, the default people activity level (used to calculate people count) will be overwritten. from Schedule:File
zone_input_people_activity_schedule_name.title: Zone Input People Activity Schedule Name

zone_input_people_sensible_heat_fraction.description: When this field is provided and valid, the default sensible heat fraction from people (used to calculate people count) will be overwritten. from Schedule:File
zone_input_people_sensible_heat_fraction.title: Zone Input People Sensible Heat Fraction Schedule Name

zone_input_people_radiant_heat_fraction_.description: When this field is provided and valid, the default radiant heat portion of the sensible heat from people (used to calculate people count) will be overwritten. from Schedule:File
zone_input_people_radiant_heat_fraction_.title: Zone Input People Radiant Heat Fraction Schedule Name

zone_input_people_co2_generation_rate_sc.description: When this field is provided and valid, the default people CO2 generation rate (used to calculate people count) will be overwritten. from Schedule:File
zone_input_people_co2_generation_rate_sc.title: Zone Input People Co2 Generation Rate Schedule Name

zone_input_supply_air_temperature_schedu.title: Zone Input Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name

zone_input_supply_air_mass_flow_rate_sch.title: Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name

zone_input_supply_air_humidity_ratio_sch.title: Zone Input Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_or_zonelist_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of. used to be Interior Environment
zone_or_zonelist_name.title: Zone Or Zonelist Name

space_or_spacelist_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details). This field is ignored when a ZoneList Name is specified for Zone or ZoneList Name.
space_or_spacelist_name.title: Space Or Spacelist Name

cost.description: Enter the non-recurring cost value. For construction and other capital costs the value entered is typically a positive value. For salvage costs the value entered is typically a negative value which represents the money paid to the investor for the equipment at the end of the study period.
cost.title: Cost

start_of_costs.description: Enter when the costs start. The First Year of Cost is based on the number of years past the Start of Costs. For most non-recurring costs the Start of Costs should be Base Period which begins at the base month and year.
start_of_costs.title: Start Of Costs

years_from_start.description: This field and the Months From Start field together represent the time from either the start of the Service Period on the service month and year or start of the Base Period on the base month and year (depending on the Start of Cost field) that the costs start to occur. Only integers should be entered representing whole years.
years_from_start.title: Years From Start

months_from_start.description: This field and the Years From Start field together represent the time from either the start of the Service Period on the service month and year or start of the Base Period on the base month and year (depending on the Start of Cost field) that the costs start to occur. Only integers should be entered representing whole months. The Years From Start (times 12) and Months From Start are added together.
months_from_start.title: Months From Start

discounting_convention.description: The field specifies if the discounting of future costs should be computed as occurring at the end of each year or the middle of each year or the beginning of each year. The most common discounting convention uses the end of each year.
discounting_convention.title: Discounting Convention

inflation_approach.description: This field is used to determine if the analysis should use constant dollars or current dollars which is related to how inflation is treated. If ConstantDollar is selected then the Real Discount Rate input is used and it excludes the rate of inflation. If CurrentDollar is selected then the Nominal Discount Rate input is used and it includes the rate of inflation.
inflation_approach.title: Inflation Approach

real_discount_rate.description: Enter the real discount rate as a decimal. For a 3% rate enter the value 0.03. This input is used when the Inflation Approach is ConstantDollar. The real discount rate reflects the interest rates needed to make current and future expenditures have comparable equivalent values when general inflation is ignored. When Inflation Approach is set to CurrentDollar this input is ignored.
real_discount_rate.title: Real Discount Rate

nominal_discount_rate.description: Enter the nominal discount rate as a decimal. For a 5% rate enter the value 0.05. This input is used when the Inflation Approach is CurrentDollar. The real discount rate reflects the interest rates needed to make current and future expenditures have comparable equivalent values when general inflation is included. When Inflation Approach is set to ConstantDollar this input is ignored.
nominal_discount_rate.title: Nominal Discount Rate

inflation.description: Enter the rate of inflation for general goods and services as a decimal. For a 2% rate enter the value 0.02.
inflation.title: Inflation

base_date_month.description: Enter the month that is the beginning of study period also known as the beginning of the base period.
base_date_month.title: Base Date Month

base_date_year.description: Enter the four digit year that is the beginning of study period such as 2010. The study period is also known as the base period.
base_date_year.title: Base Date Year

service_date_month.description: Enter the month that is the beginning of building occupancy. Energy costs computed by EnergyPlus are assumed to occur during the year following the service date. The service date must be the same or later than the Base Date. This field could also be referred to as part of beneficial occupancy date.
service_date_month.title: Service Date Month

service_date_year.description: Enter the four digit year that is the beginning of occupancy such as 2010.
service_date_year.title: Service Date Year

length_of_study_period_in_years.description: Enter the number of years of the study period. It is the number of years that the study continues based on the start at the base date. The default value is 25 years. Only integers may be used indicating whole years.
length_of_study_period_in_years.title: Length Of Study Period In Years

tax_rate.description: Enter the overall marginal tax rate for the project costs. This does not include energy or water taxes. The tax rate entered should be based on the marginal tax rate for the entity and not the average tax rate. Enter the tax rate results in present value calculations after taxes. Most analyses do not factor in the impact of taxes and assume that all options under consideration have roughly the same tax impact. Due to this many times the tax rate can be left to default to zero and the present value results before taxes are used to make decisions. The value should be entered as a decimal value. For 15% enter 0.15. For an analysis that does not include tax impacts enter 0.0.
tax_rate.title: Tax Rate

depreciation_method.description: For an analysis that includes income tax impacts this entry describes how capital costs are depreciated. Only one depreciation method may be used for an analysis and is applied to all capital expenditures.
depreciation_method.title: Depreciation Method

cost.description: Enter the cost in dollars (or the appropriate monetary unit) for the recurring costs. Enter the cost for each time it occurs. For example if the annual maintenance cost is 500 dollars enter 500 here.
cost.title: Cost

start_of_costs.description: Enter when the costs start. The First Year of Cost is based on the number of years past the Start of Costs. For most maintenance costs the Start of Costs should be Service Period.
start_of_costs.title: Start Of Costs

years_from_start.description: This field and the Months From Start field together represent the time from either the start of the Service Period on the service month and year or start of the Base Period on the base month and year (depending on the Start of Costs field) that the costs start to occur. Only integers should be entered representing whole years.
years_from_start.title: Years From Start

months_from_start.description: This field and the Years From Start field together represent the time from either the start of the Service Period on the service month and year or start of the Base Period on the base month and year (depending on the Start of Costs field) that the costs start to occur. Only integers should be entered representing whole months. The Years From Start (times 12) and Months From Start are added together.
months_from_start.title: Months From Start

repeat_period_years.description: This field and the Repeat Period Months field indicate how much time elapses between re-occurrences of the cost. For costs that occur every year such the Repeat Period Years should be 1 and Repeat Period Months should be 0. Only integers should be entered representing whole years.
repeat_period_years.title: Repeat Period Years

repeat_period_months.description: This field and the Repeat Period Years field indicate how much time elapses between re-occurrences of the cost. Only integers should be entered representing whole years. The Repeat Period Years (times 12) and Repeat Period Months are added together.
repeat_period_months.title: Repeat Period Months

annual_escalation_rate.description: Enter the annual escalation rate as a decimal. For a 1% rate enter the value 0.01. This input is used when the Inflation Approach is CurrentDollar. When Inflation Approach is set to ConstantDollar this input is ignored.
annual_escalation_rate.title: Annual Escalation Rate

lcc_price_escalation_name.description: The identifier used for the object. The name usually identifies the location (such as the state or region or country or census area) that the escalations apply to. In addition the name should identify the building class such as residential or commercial or industrial and the use type such as electricity or natural gas or water.
lcc_price_escalation_name.title: Lcc Price Escalation Name

escalation_start_year.description: This field and the Escalation Start Month define the time that corresponds to Year 1 Escalation such as 2010 when the escalation rates are applied. This field and the Escalation Start Month define the time that escalation begins.
escalation_start_year.title: Escalation Start Year

escalation_start_month.description: This field and the Escalation Start Year define the time that corresponds to Year 1 Escalation such as 2010 when the escalation rates are applied. This field and the Escalation Start Year define the time that escalation begins.
escalation_start_month.title: Escalation Start Month

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: units in schedule should be fraction applied to design level of lights, generally (0.0 - 1.0)
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_level_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of lights for this set of attributes Choices: LightingLevel => Lighting Level -- simply enter watts of lights Watts/Area => Watts per Zone Floor Area -- enter the number to apply. Value * Floor Area = Lights Watts/Person => Watts per Person -- enter the number to apply. Value * Occupants = Lights
design_level_calculation_method.title: Design Level Calculation Method

return_air_fraction.description: Used only for sizing calculation if return-air-fraction coefficients are specified.
return_air_fraction.title: Return Air Fraction

fraction_replaceable.description: For Daylighting:Controls must be 0 or 1:  0 = no dimming control, 1 = full dimming control
fraction_replaceable.title: Fraction Replaceable

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

return_air_fraction_calculated_from_plen.title: Return Air Fraction Calculated From Plenum Temperature

return_air_fraction_function_of_plenum_t.description: Used only if Return Air Fraction Is Calculated from Plenum Temperature = Yes Equation is Return Air Fraction = Coefficient#1 - Coefficient#2 X PlenumTemp(degC)
return_air_fraction_function_of_plenum_t.title: Return Air Fraction Function Of Plenum Temperature Coefficient 1

return_air_fraction_function_of_plenum_t.description: Used only if Return Air Fraction Is Calculated from Plenum Temperature = Yes Equation is Return Air Fraction = Coefficient#1 - Coefficient#2 X PlenumTemp(degC)
return_air_fraction_function_of_plenum_t.title: Return Air Fraction Function Of Plenum Temperature Coefficient 2

return_air_heat_gain_node_name.description: Name of the return air node for this heat gain. If left blank, defaults to the first return air node for the zone. Leave this field blank when using a ZoneList name.
return_air_heat_gain_node_name.title: Return Air Heat Gain Node Name

exhaust_air_heat_gain_node_name.description: Name of the exhaust air node for this heat gain. If the node name is entered, return heat gain will be shared by both return and exhaust air nodes. The air properties of both nodes are weighted by both node mass flow rates.
exhaust_air_heat_gain_node_name.title: Exhaust Air Heat Gain Node Name
