non_charging_chilled_water_temperature.description: Single temperature for chiller outlet when not in cooling season or during on-peak cooling (discharge)
non_charging_chilled_water_temperature.title: Non Charging Chilled Water Temperature

charging_chilled_water_temperature.description: Single temperature for chiller outlet when off-peak during cooling season (charging)
charging_chilled_water_temperature.title: Charging Chilled Water Temperature

component_1_object_type.description: This field is the type of object and should either be a chiller or some ice storage equipment.
component_1_object_type.title: Component 1 Object Type

component_1_name.description: This field is the name of either the chiller or ice storage equipment on the loop.
component_1_name.title: Component 1 Name

component_1_demand_calculation_node_name.description: This field is the name of the inlet node for the component defined in the two previous input fields.
component_1_demand_calculation_node_name.title: Component 1 Demand Calculation Node Name

component_1_setpoint_node_name.description: This field is the name of the outlet node for the component listed above.
component_1_setpoint_node_name.title: Component 1 Setpoint Node Name

component_1_flow_rate.description: This field is the flow rate for the component listed above.
component_1_flow_rate.title: Component 1 Flow Rate

component_1_operation_type.description: This field is the operation type for the component listed above. For this plant equipment operation scheme, "Cooling" should be selected for chiller equipment while ice storage equipment should be defined as "Dual".
component_1_operation_type.title: Component 1 Operation Type

main_model_program_calling_manager_name.title: Main Model Program Calling Manager Name

user_defined_fluid_type.description: This field is only required when Fluid Type is UserDefinedFluidType
user_defined_fluid_type.title: User Defined Fluid Type

common_pipe_simulation.description: Specifies a primary-secondary loop configuration. The plant side is the primary loop, and the demand side is the secondary loop. A secondary supply pump is required on the demand side. None = Primary-only, no secondary simulation CommonPipe = Primary-secondary with no temperature control at primary-secondary interface TwoWayCommonPipe = Primary-secondary with control of secondary supply temperature or primary return temperature (requires a setpoint be placed on the plant side or demand side inlet node).
common_pipe_simulation.title: Common Pipe Simulation

loop_circulation_time.description: This field is only used to autocalulate the Plant Loop Volume. Loop Volume = Loop Circulation Time * Maximum Loop Flow Rate
loop_circulation_time.title: Loop Circulation Time

design_power_consumption.description: When autosized the type of scaling factor is chosen in the input field Design Power Sizing Method
design_power_consumption.title: Design Power Consumption

motor_efficiency.description: This is the motor efficiency only. When the Design Power Consumption is autosized using PowerPerFlowPerPressure, the Design Shaft Power per Unit Flow Rate per Unit Head is used in addition to the motor efficiency.
motor_efficiency.title: Motor Efficiency

fraction_of_motor_inefficiencies_to_flui.title: Fraction Of Motor Inefficiencies To Fluid Stream

pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.description: Modifies the rated flow rate of the pump on a time basis. Default is that the pump is on and runs according to its other operational requirements specified above. The schedule is for special pump operations.
pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.title: Pump Flow Rate Schedule Name

pump_curve_name.description: This references any single independent variable polynomial curve in order to do pressure vs. flow calculations for this pump. The available types are then: Linear, Quadratic, Cubic, and Quartic The non-dimensional pump pressure relationship is of the following form: (psi = C4*phi^4 + C3*phi^3 + C2*phi^2 + C1*phi + C0) Where the non-dimensional variables are defined as: delP = rho * ((N/60)^2) * (D^2) * psi mdot = rho * (N/60) * (D^3) * phi
pump_curve_name.title: Pump Curve Name

impeller_diameter.description: "D" in above expression in field A6
impeller_diameter.title: Impeller Diameter

rotational_speed.description: "N" in above expression in field A6
rotational_speed.title: Rotational Speed

zone_name.description: optional, if used pump losses transfered to zone as internal gains
zone_name.title: Zone Name

skin_loss_radiative_fraction.description: optional. If zone identified in previous field then this determines the split between convection and radiation for the skin losses
skin_loss_radiative_fraction.title: Skin Loss Radiative Fraction

design_power_sizing_method.description: Used to indicate which sizing factor is used to calculate Design Power Consumption. PowerPerFlow indicates that Design Electric Power per Unit Flow Rate is used as scaling factor. Design Power Consumption = Design Maximum Flow Rate * scaling factor PowerPerFlowPerPressure indicates that Design Shaft Power per Unit Flow Rate per Unit Head is used as scaling factor. Design Power Consumption = Design Maximum Flow Rate * Design Pump Head * scaling factor / Motor Efficiency
design_power_sizing_method.title: Design Power Sizing Method

design_electric_power_per_unit_flow_rate.description: Used to size Design Power Consumption from design flow rate
design_electric_power_per_unit_flow_rate.title: Design Electric Power Per Unit Flow Rate

design_shaft_power_per_unit_flow_rate_pe.description: Used to size Design Power Consumption from design flow rate for head and motor efficiency
design_shaft_power_per_unit_flow_rate_pe.title: Design Shaft Power Per Unit Flow Rate Per Unit Head

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

design_power_consumption.description: When autosized the type of scaling factor is chosen in the input field Design Power Sizing Method
design_power_consumption.title: Design Power Consumption

motor_efficiency.description: This is the motor efficiency only. When the Design Power Consumption is autosized using PowerPerFlowPerPressure, the Design Shaft Power per Unit Flow Rate per Unit Head is used in addition to the motor efficiency.
motor_efficiency.title: Motor Efficiency

fraction_of_motor_inefficiencies_to_flui.title: Fraction Of Motor Inefficiencies To Fluid Stream

coefficient_1_of_the_part_load_performan.title: Coefficient 1 Of The Part Load Performance Curve

coefficient_2_of_the_part_load_performan.title: Coefficient 2 Of The Part Load Performance Curve

coefficient_3_of_the_part_load_performan.title: Coefficient 3 Of The Part Load Performance Curve

coefficient_4_of_the_part_load_performan.title: Coefficient 4 Of The Part Load Performance Curve

design_minimum_flow_rate.description: When autosized the scaling factor is the input field Design Minimum Flow Rate Fraction
design_minimum_flow_rate.title: Design Minimum Flow Rate

pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.description: Modifies the rated flow rate of the pump on a time basis. Default is that the pump is on and runs according to its other operational requirements specified above. The schedule is for special pump operations.
pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.title: Pump Flow Rate Schedule Name

pump_curve_name.description: This references any single independent variable polynomial curve in order to do pressure vs. flow calculations for this pump. pump_curve_name.title: Pump Curve Name

impeller_diameter.title: Impeller Diameter

pump_rpm_schedule_name.description: Modifies the rpm of the pump on a time basis. Default is that the pump is on and runs according to its other operational requirements specified above. The schedule is for special pump operations.
pump_rpm_schedule_name.title: Pump Rpm Schedule Name

zone_name.title: Zone Name

skin_loss_radiative_fraction.description: optional. If zone identified in previous field then this determines the split between convection and radiation for the skin losses
skin_loss_radiative_fraction.title: Skin Loss Radiative Fraction

end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

design_steam_volume_flow_rate.title: Design Steam Volume Flow Rate

design_power_consumption.description: When autosized the type of scaling factor is chosen in the input field Design Power Sizing Method
design_power_consumption.title: Design Power Consumption

motor_efficiency.description: This is the motor efficiency only. When the Design Power Consumption is autosized using PowerPerFlowPerPressure, the Design Shaft Power per Unit Flow Rate per Unit Head is used in addition to the motor efficiency.

zone_name.title: Zone Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

run_during_warmup_days.description: If this field is enabled, the plugin will be executed during warmup days, otherwise it will only be executed once warmup is completed and the actual run period begins
run_during_warmup_days.title: Run During Warmup Days

python_module_name.description: This is the name of the Python file, without a file extension. For "plugin_b.py", use just "plugin_b". The Python plugin file must be on the plugin system search path to be found during a simulation Additional directories can be added to the search path using the PythonPlugin:SearchPaths object
python_module_name.title: Python Module Name

plugin_class_name.description: This is the name of the class to be executed as a plugin during a simulation The class must inherit the EnergyPlusPlugin base class
plugin_class_name.title: Plugin Class Name

python_plugin_variable_name.description: Must be listed in the PythonPlugin:Variables object
python_plugin_variable_name.title: Python Plugin Variable Name

type_of_data_in_variable.description: If Metered is selected, the variable is automatically set to a "Summed" type, and the Resource Type, Group Type, and End-Use Subcategory fields on this object are required
type_of_data_in_variable.title: Type Of Data In Variable

units.description: optional but will result in dimensionless units for blank EnergyPlus units are standard SI units
units.title: Units

resource_type.description: This field is optional for regular output variables with "Type of Data in Variable" set to either Averaged or Summed. For Metered variables, this field is required. Choose the type of fuel, water, electricity, pollution or heat rate that should be metered.
resource_type.title: Resource Type

group_type.description: This field is optional for regular output variables with "Type of Data in Variable" set to either Averaged or Summed. For Metered variables, this field is required. Choose a general classification, building (internal services), HVAC (air systems), or plant (hydronic systems), or system
group_type.title: Group Type

end_use_category.description: This field is optional for regular output variables with "Type of Data in Variable" set to either Averaged or Summed. For Metered variables, this field is required. Choose how the metered output should be classified for end-use category
end_use_category.title: End Use Category

end_use_subcategory.description: This field is always optional. For regular output variables with "Type of Data in Variable" set to either Averaged or Summed, this field is completely ignored. For Metered variables, this field is optional, but allows custom categorization of the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table. Enter a user-defined subcategory for this metered output
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

add_current_working_directory_to_search_.description: Adding the current working directory allows Python to find plugin scripts in the current directory.
add_current_working_directory_to_search_.title: Add Current Working Directory To Search Path

add_input_file_directory_to_search_path.description: Enabling this will allow Python to find plugin scripts in the same directory as the running input file, even if that is not the current working directory.
add_input_file_directory_to_search_path.title: Add Input File Directory To Search Path

add_epin_environment_variable_to_search_.description: The "epin" environment variable is set by some EnergyPlus interfaces in order to let EnergyPlus find external files in special locations. If this is enabled, and that variable is set, the value of the variable will be added to the Python search path.
add_epin_environment_variable_to_search_.title: Add Epin Environment Variable To Search Path

name_of_a_python_plugin_variable.title: Name Of A Python Plugin Variable

number_of_timesteps_to_be_logged.title: Number Of Timesteps To Be Logged

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

capacity_rating_type.description: In each case, select the rating option that corresponds to the expected service conditions. For example, U.S. manufacturers quote a separate Unit Load Factor for wet or frosted coils. If the evaporating temperature is less than 0C, input the frosted coil value. Within the European convention, select SC1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending upon the expected evaporating temperature.
capacity_rating_type.title: Capacity Rating Type

rated_unit_load_factor.description: The sensible cooling capacity in watts (W/C) at rated conditions. The value entered for this field must be greater than zero, with no default value. This value is only used if the Capacity Rating Type is UnitLoadFactorSensibleOnly. The value given must be based upon the difference between the chiller inlet and outlet air temperatures, not on the difference between the zone mean temperature and the outlet air temperature
rated_unit_load_factor.title: Rated Unit Load Factor

rated_capacity.description: This value is only used if the Capacity Rating Type is NOT UnitLoadFactorSensibleOnly. For CapacityTotalSpecificConditions, this capacity includes both sensible and latent at the conditions given in the next two fields. Note that the European Standard ratings are sensible only and the European Nominal ratings include latent capacity as well. The value given here must correspond to the capacity rating type given previously
rated_capacity.title: Rated Capacity

rated_relative_humidity.description: This field is ONLY used if the Capacity Rating Type is CapacityTotalSpecificConditions and represents the relative humidity at rated conditions. The default is 85.
rated_relative_humidity.title: Rated Relative Humidity

rated_cooling_source_temperature.description: If DXEvaporator, use evaporating temperature (saturated suction temperature) If BrineCoil, use Brine entering temperature used to set minimum suction pressure for DX systems and minimum brine temp for secondary systems
rated_cooling_source_temperature.title: Rated Cooling Source Temperature

rated_temperature_difference_dt1.description: The rated difference between the air entering the refrigeration chiller and the cooling source temperature in degC.
rated_temperature_difference_dt1.title: Rated Temperature Difference Dt1

maximum_temperature_difference_between_i.description: The maximum difference between the air entering the refrigeration chiller and the cooling source temperature in degC used to limit capacity during pull-down. defaults to 1.3 times the Rated Temperature Difference DT1
maximum_temperature_difference_between_i.title: Maximum Temperature Difference Between Inlet Air And Evaporating Temperature

coil_material_correction_factor.description: This is the manufacturer's correction factor for coil material corresponding to rating
coil_material_correction_factor.title: Coil Material Correction Factor

refrigerant_correction_factor.description: This is the manufacturer's correction factor for refrigerant corresponding to rating
refrigerant_correction_factor.title: Refrigerant Correction Factor

capacity_correction_curve_type.description: In each case, select the correction curve type that corresponds to the rating type. default LinearSHR60 unless Capacity Rating Type = CapacityTotalSpecificConditions
capacity_correction_curve_type.title: Capacity Correction Curve Type

capacity_correction_curve_name.description: Should be blank for LinearSHR60 correction curve type
capacity_correction_curve_name.title: Capacity Correction Curve Name

shr60_correction_factor.description: only used when the capacity correction curve type is LinearSHR60
shr60_correction_factor.title: Shr60 Correction Factor

rated_total_heating_power.description: Include total for all heater power Do not include defrost heater power
rated_total_heating_power.title: Rated Total Heating Power

heating_power_schedule_name.description: Values will be used to multiply the total heating power Values in the schedule should be between 0.0 and 1.0 Defaults to always on if schedule name left blank.
heating_power_schedule_name.title: Heating Power Schedule Name

minimum_fan_air_flow_ratio.description: Minimum air flow fraction through fan
minimum_fan_air_flow_ratio.title: Minimum Fan Air Flow Ratio

defrost_type.description: HotFluid includes either hot gas defrost for a DX system or Hot Brine defrost if this walk in is cooled by brine from a secondary chiller
defrost_type.title: Defrost Type

defrost_schedule_name.description: The schedule values should be 0 (off) or 1 (on)
defrost_schedule_name.title: Defrost Schedule Name

defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.description: The schedule values should be 0 (off) or 1 (on) The start time for each defrost period in this drip-down schedule should coincide with the start time for each defrost period in the defrost schedule (previous input field). The length of each defrost drip-down period must be greater than or equal to the corresponding defrost period specified in the defrost schedule. This extra time allows the melted frost to drip from the coil before refrigeration is restarted.
defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.title: Defrost Drip Down Schedule Name

defrost_power.description: needed for all defrost types except none and offcycle
defrost_power.title: Defrost Power

temperature_termination_defrost_fraction.description: This is the portion of the defrost energy that is available to melt frost Needed only for defrost control type TemperatureTermination defaults to 0.7 for electric defrost and to 0.3 for hot fluid defrost
temperature_termination_defrost_fraction.title: Temperature Termination Defrost Fraction To Ice

average_refrigerant_charge_inventory.description: This value is only used if the Cooling Source Type is DXEvaporator
average_refrigerant_charge_inventory.title: Average Refrigerant Charge Inventory

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: This must be a controlled zone and appear in a ZoneHVAC:EquipmentConnections object.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

rated_total_cooling_capacity_per_unit_le.title: Rated Total Cooling Capacity Per Unit Length

standard_case_fan_power_per_unit_length.title: Standard Case Fan Power Per Unit Length

operating_case_fan_power_per_unit_length.title: Operating Case Fan Power Per Unit Length

standard_case_lighting_power_per_unit_le.title: Standard Case Lighting Power Per Unit Length

installed_case_lighting_power_per_unit_l.description: default set equal to Standard Case Lighting Power per Unit Length
installed_case_lighting_power_per_unit_l.title: Installed Case Lighting Power Per Unit Length

fraction_of_lighting_energy_to_case.title: Fraction Of Lighting Energy To Case

case_anti_sweat_heater_power_per_unit_le.title: Case Anti Sweat Heater Power Per Unit Length

minimum_anti_sweat_heater_power_per_unit.description: This field is only applicable to the Linear, Dewpoint Method, and Heat Balance Method anti-sweat heater control types
minimum_anti_sweat_heater_power_per_unit.title: Minimum Anti Sweat Heater Power Per Unit Length

humidity_at_zero_anti_sweat_heater_energ.description: This field is only applicable to Linear AS heater control type Zone relative humidity (%) where anti-sweat heater energy is zero
humidity_at_zero_anti_sweat_heater_energ.title: Humidity At Zero Anti Sweat Heater Energy

case_height.description: This field only applicable to Heat Balance Method AS heater control type Height must be greater than zero if Heat Balance Method AS heater control is selected
case_height.title: Case Height

fraction_of_anti_sweat_heater_energy_to_.title: Fraction Of Anti Sweat Heater Energy To Case

case_defrost_power_per_unit_length.description: Used to evaluate load on case as well as power or heat consumption
case_defrost_power_per_unit_length.title: Case Defrost Power Per Unit Length

case_defrost_schedule_name.description: A case defrost schedule name is required unless case defrost type = None
case_defrost_schedule_name.title: Case Defrost Schedule Name

case_defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.description: If left blank, the defrost schedule will be used The start time for each defrost period in this drip-down schedule should coincide with the start time for each defrost period in the case defrost schedule (previous input field). The length of each defrost drip-down period must be greater than or equal to the corresponding defrost period specified in the case defrost schedule. This extra time allows the melted frost to drip from the coil before refrigeration is restarted.
case_defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.title: Case Defrost Drip Down Schedule Name

defrost_energy_correction_curve_type.description: Case Temperature, Relative Humidity, and Dewpoint Method are applicable to case defrost types with temperature termination only.
defrost_energy_correction_curve_type.title: Defrost Energy Correction Curve Type

defrost_energy_correction_curve_name.description: Defrost Energy Correction Curve Name is applicable to case defrost types with temperature termination only.
defrost_energy_correction_curve_name.title: Defrost Energy Correction Curve Name

under_case_hvac_return_air_fraction.title: Under Case Hvac Return Air Fraction

refrigerated_case_restocking_schedule_na.description: Schedule values should be in units of Watts per unit case length (W/m) Leave this field blank if no restocking is to be modeled
refrigerated_case_restocking_schedule_na.title: Refrigerated Case Restocking Schedule Name

case_credit_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be from 0 to 1 Leave this field blank if no case credit fraction is to be applied
case_credit_fraction_schedule_name.title: Case Credit Fraction Schedule Name

design_evaporator_temperature_or_brine_i.description: Required for detailed refrigeration system, not for compressor rack For a DX system, enter the saturated temperature for refrigerant pressure leaving case For a brine-cooled cooled (secondary system) case, enter the brine inlet temperature Default is 5 C less than case operating temperature
design_evaporator_temperature_or_brine_i.title: Design Evaporator Temperature Or Brine Inlet Temperature

under_case_hvac_return_air_node_name.description: Name of the return air node for this case. If left blank, defaults to the first return air node for this zone.
under_case_hvac_return_air_node_name.title: Under Case Hvac Return Air Node Name

refrigeration_compressor_power_curve_nam.description: the input order for the Curve:Bicubic does not match the ARI 540-2004 Eq. 1 coefficient order N1 is ARI_C1, N2 is ARI_C2, N3 is ARI_C4, N4 is ARI_C3, N5 is ARI_C6, N6 is ARI_C5, N7 is ARI_C7, N8 is ARI_C10, N9 is ARI_C8, N10 is ARI_C9, N11 is Minimum Suction dewpoint temperature, N12 is Maximum Suction dewpoint temperature, N13 is Minimum Discharge dewpoint temperature, N14 is Maximum Discharge dewpoint temperature
refrigeration_compressor_power_curve_nam.title: Refrigeration Compressor Power Curve Name

refrigeration_compressor_capacity_curve_.description: the input order for the Curve:Bicubic does not match the ARI 540-2004 Eq. 1 coefficient order N1 is ARI_C1, N2 is ARI_C2, N3 is ARI_C4, N4 is ARI_C3, N5 is ARI_C6, N6 is ARI_C5, N7 is ARI_C7, N8 is ARI_C10, N9 is ARI_C8, N10 is ARI_C9, N11 is Minimum Suction dewpoint temperature, N12 is Maximum Suction dewpoint temperature, N13 is Minimum Discharge dewpoint temperature, N14 is Maximum Discharge dewpoint temperature
refrigeration_compressor_capacity_curve_.title: Refrigeration Compressor Capacity Curve Name

rated_superheat.description: Use this input field OR the next, not both This is used if the compressor rating is based upon degrees of superheat
rated_superheat.title: Rated Superheat

rated_return_gas_temperature.description: Use this input field OR the previous, not both This is used if the compressor rating is based upon rated return gas temperature (Rated Suction Temperature)
rated_return_gas_temperature.title: Rated Return Gas Temperature

rated_liquid_temperature.description: Use this input field OR the next, not both This is used if the compressor rating is based upon rated liquid temperature at the expansion valve
rated_liquid_temperature.title: Rated Liquid Temperature

rated_subcooling.description: Use this input field OR the previous, not both This is used if the compressor rating is based upon degrees of subcooling
rated_subcooling.title: Rated Subcooling

end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

compressor_rack_cop_function_of_temperat.description: It is important that this COP curve correspond to the lowest saturated suction temperature needed to serve all refrigeration loads
compressor_rack_cop_function_of_temperat.title: Compressor Rack Cop Function Of Temperature Curve Name

condenser_fan_power_function_of_temperat.title: Condenser Fan Power Function Of Temperature Curve Name

condenser_type.description: Applicable only when Heat Rejection Location is Outdoors.
condenser_type.title: Condenser Type

water_cooled_condenser_inlet_node_name.title: Water Cooled Condenser Inlet Node Name

water_cooled_condenser_outlet_node_name.title: Water Cooled Condenser Outlet Node Name

water_cooled_loop_flow_type.title: Water Cooled Loop Flow Type

water_cooled_condenser_outlet_temperatur.description: Applicable only when loop Flow type is VariableFlow.
water_cooled_condenser_outlet_temperatur.title: Water Cooled Condenser Outlet Temperature Schedule Name

water_cooled_condenser_design_flow_rate.description: Applicable only when loop flow type is ConstantFlow.

water_cooled_condenser_maximum_water_out.title: Water Cooled Condenser Maximum Water Outlet Temperature

water_cooled_condenser_minimum_water_inl.title: Water Cooled Condenser Minimum Water Inlet Temperature

evaporative_condenser_availability_sched.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Schedule values greater than 0 indicate that evaporative cooling of the condenser is available. This schedule allows the user to define seasonal shutdown/draining of the water cooling system in cold climate applications. For periods with schedule values of 0, the condenser operates as AirCooled.
evaporative_condenser_availability_sched.title: Evaporative Condenser Availability Schedule Name

evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.description: Applicable only for Condenser Type = EvaporativlyCooled.
evaporative_condenser_effectiveness.title: Evaporative Condenser Effectiveness

evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.description: Applicable only for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Used to calculate evaporative condenser water use.
evaporative_condenser_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate

basin_heater_capacity.description: This field is only used for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled and for periods when the evaporatively cooled condenser is available (field Evaporative Condenser Availability Schedule Name). For this situation, the heater heats the basin water when the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature falls below the setpoint temperature, but only when the condenser fans are off (i.e., no refrigerated case load).
basin_heater_capacity.title: Basin Heater Capacity

basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.description: Enter the outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the basin heater turns on.
basin_heater_setpoint_temperature.title: Basin Heater Setpoint Temperature

design_evaporative_condenser_water_pump_.description: Design recirc water pump power for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled. Applicable only for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
design_evaporative_condenser_water_pump_.title: Design Evaporative Condenser Water Pump Power

evaporative_water_supply_tank_name.description: If blank, water supply is from Mains. Applicable only for Condenser Type = EvaporativelyCooled.
evaporative_water_supply_tank_name.title: Evaporative Water Supply Tank Name

condenser_air_inlet_node_name.description: Applicable only when Heat Rejection Location is Outdoors and Condenser Type is not WaterCooled; otherwise, leave field blank. If field is left blank with Heat Rejection Location = Outdoors, then the model assumes that the Inlet Air conditions are the outdoor air conditions for the current timestep (e.g., no adjustment for height above ground).
condenser_air_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Air Inlet Node Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

refrigeration_case_name_or_walkin_name_o.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:Case or Refrigeration:Walkin or Refrigeration:CaseAndWalkinList object.
refrigeration_case_name_or_walkin_name_o.title: Refrigeration Case Name Or Walkin Name Or Caseandwalkinlist Name

heat_rejection_zone_name.description: This must be a controlled zone and appear in a ZoneHVAC:EquipmentConnections object. Required only if walk-in[s] are connected to this rack AND the heat rejection location is "Zone"
heat_rejection_zone_name.title: Heat Rejection Zone Name

rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.description: Rating as per ARI 460 Be sure the rating corresponds to the correct refrigerant HeatRejection(W)=C1 +C2(Condensing Temp - Entering Air Temp, deg C) Will be adjusted for elevation automatically
rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.title: Rated Effective Total Heat Rejection Rate Curve Name

rated_subcooling_temperature_difference.description: must correspond to rating given for total heat rejection effect

minimum_fan_air_flow_ratio.title: Minimum Fan Air Flow Ratio

air_inlet_node_name_or_zone_name.description: If field is left blank, then the model assumes that the inlet air conditions are the outdoor air conditions for the current timestep (e.g., no adjustment for height above ground). If the condenser rejects heat to a conditioned zone, enter the zone name here.
air_inlet_node_name_or_zone_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name Or Zone Name

rated_approach_temperature_difference.description: This is the difference between the condensing and evaporating temperatures
rated_approach_temperature_difference.title: Rated Approach Temperature Difference

rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.description: used for identification and rough system size error checking
rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.title: Rated Effective Total Heat Rejection Rate

condensing_temperature_control_type.description: Fixed keeps condensing temperature constant Float sets the condensing temperature according to the other loads on the higher temperature system

rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.description: Rating as per ARI 490 Be sure the rating corresponds to the correct refrigerant
rated_effective_total_heat_rejection_rat.title: Rated Effective Total Heat Rejection Rate

rated_subcooling_temperature_difference.description: must correspond to rating given for total heat rejection effect
rated_subcooling_temperature_difference.title: Rated Subcooling Temperature Difference

rated_fan_power.description: Power for condenser fan(s) corresponding to rated total heat rejection effect.
rated_fan_power.title: Rated Fan Power

minimum_fan_air_flow_ratio.description: Minimum air flow fraction through condenser fan

For this situation, the heater heats the basin water when the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature falls below the set point temperature, but only when the condenser fans are off (i.e., no refrigerated case load).

evaporative_water_supply_tank_name.title: Evaporative Water Supply Tank Name

For periods with schedule values of 0, the condenser operates as Air Cooled.

end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

minimum_fan_air_flow_ratio.title: Minimum Fan Air Flow Ratio

transition_temperature.description: Temperature at which system transitions between subcritical and transcritical operation.
transition_temperature.title: Transition Temperature

transcritical_approach_temperature.description: Temperature difference between the CO2 exiting the gas cooler and the air entering the gas cooler during transcritical operation.
transcritical_approach_temperature.title: Transcritical Approach Temperature

subcritical_temperature_difference.description: Temperature difference between the saturated condensing temperature and the air temperature during subcritical operation.
subcritical_temperature_difference.title: Subcritical Temperature Difference

minimum_condensing_temperature.description: Minimum saturated condensing temperature during subcritical operation.
minimum_condensing_temperature.title: Minimum Condensing Temperature

gas_cooler_refrigerant_operating_charge_.title: Gas Cooler Refrigerant Operating Charge Inventory

gas_cooler_outlet_piping_refrigerant_inv.title: Gas Cooler Outlet Piping Refrigerant Inventory

refrigerated_case_or_walkin_or_caseandwa.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:Case or Refrigeration:WalkIn object. If there is more than one refrigerated case or walk-in served by this secondary system, enter the name of a Refrigeration:CaseAndWalkInList object.
refrigerated_case_or_walkin_or_caseandwa.title: Refrigerated Case Or Walkin Or Caseandwalkinlist Name

circulating_fluid_type.description: If "FluidAlwaysLiquid" is selected, the fluid properties must be input using the objects: FluidProperties:Name, FluidProperties:GlycolConcentration, and, if user defined fluid type, FluidProperties:Temperatures and FluidProperties:Concentration. Many sets of fluid properties can be found in GlycolPropertiesRefData.idf. If "FluidPhaseChange" is selected, the refrigerant properties must be input using the objects: (if user defined fluid type): FluidProperties:Name, FluidProperties:Temperatures, FluidProperties:Saturated, and FluidProperties:Superheated. Many sets of refrigerant data can be found in FluidPropertiesRefData.idf.
circulating_fluid_type.title: Circulating Fluid Type

circulating_fluid_name.description: This must correspond to a name in the FluidProperties:Name object.
circulating_fluid_name.title: Circulating Fluid Name

evaporator_capacity.description: For "FluidAlwaysLiquid", at least one of the two, Evaporator Capacity OR Evaporator Flow Rate for Secondary Fluid, is required. For "FluidPhaseChange", the default capacity is the sum of the rated capacities of the Cases and Walk-ins served by the secondary loop.
evaporator_capacity.title: Evaporator Capacity

evaporator_flow_rate_for_secondary_fluid.description: For "FluidAlwaysLiquid", at least one of the two, Evaporator Capacity OR Evaporator Flow Rate for Secondary Fluid, is required. For "FluidPhaseChange" loops, this input is not used. (see PhaseChange Circulating Rate)
evaporator_flow_rate_for_secondary_fluid.title: Evaporator Flow Rate For Secondary Fluid

evaporator_evaporating_temperature.description: This is the evaporating temperature in the heat exchanger used to chill or condense the secondary loop circulating fluid. It is NOT the temperature in any cases or walk-ins served by the secondary loop.
evaporator_evaporating_temperature.title: Evaporator Evaporating Temperature

evaporator_approach_temperature_differen.description: For "FluidAlwaysLiquid", this is the rated difference between the temperature of the circulating fluid leaving the heat exchanger and the heat exchanger's rated evaporating temperature. For "FluidPhaseChange", this is the difference between the temperature of the evaporating and condensing temperatures in the heat exchanger.
evaporator_approach_temperature_differen.title: Evaporator Approach Temperature Difference

evaporator_range_temperature_difference.description: For "FluidAlwaysLiquid", this is the rated difference between the temperature of the circulating fluid entering the heat exchanger and the temperature of the circulating fluid leaving the heat exchanger, and is Required. For "FluidPhaseChange", this input is not used.
evaporator_range_temperature_difference.title: Evaporator Range Temperature Difference

total_pump_flow_rate.description: For "FluidAlwaysLiquid",if not input, Evaporator Flow Rate for Secondary Fluid will be used. For "FluidPhaseChange", if not input, this will be calculated using the PhaseChange Circulating Rate.
total_pump_flow_rate.title: Total Pump Flow Rate

total_pump_power.description: Either the Total Pump Power or the Total Pump Head is required.
total_pump_power.title: Total Pump Power

total_pump_head.description: Either the Total Pump Power or the Total Pump Head is required.
total_pump_head.title: Total Pump Head

phasechange_circulating_rate.description: This is the total mass flow at the pump divided by the gaseous mass flow leaving the refrigeration load.
phasechange_circulating_rate.title: Phasechange Circulating Rate

variable_speed_pump_cubic_curve_name.description: Variable Speed Pump Curve Name is applicable to variable speed pumps only.
variable_speed_pump_cubic_curve_name.title: Variable Speed Pump Cubic Curve Name

pump_motor_heat_to_fluid.description: This is the portion of the pump motor heat added to secondary circulating fluid and is equal to the motor efficiency for non-hermetic motor. Enter 1.0 for a semi-hermetic motor.
pump_motor_heat_to_fluid.title: Pump Motor Heat To Fluid

sum_ua_distribution_piping.description: Use only if you want to include distribution piping heat gain in refrigeration load.
sum_ua_distribution_piping.title: Sum Ua Distribution Piping

distribution_piping_zone_name.description: This will be used to determine the temperature used for distribution piping heat gain. The pipe heat gains are also counted as cooling credit for the zone. Required only if Sum UA Distribution Piping >0.0
distribution_piping_zone_name.title: Distribution Piping Zone Name

sum_ua_receiver_separator_shell.description: Use only if you want to include Receiver/Separator Shell heat gain in refrigeration load.
sum_ua_receiver_separator_shell.title: Sum Ua Receiver Separator Shell

receiver_separator_zone_name.description: This will be used to determine the temperature used for Receiver/Separator Shell heat gain. The shell heat gains are also counted as cooling credit for the zone. Required only if Sum UA Receiver/Separator Shell >0.0
receiver_separator_zone_name.title: Receiver Separator Zone Name

evaporator_refrigerant_inventory.description: This value refers to the refrigerant circulating within the primary system providing cooling to the chiller for the secondary loop, not to the fluid circulating within the secondary loop itself.
evaporator_refrigerant_inventory.title: Evaporator Refrigerant Inventory

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

subcooler_type.description: plan to add ambient subcoolers at future time
subcooler_type.title: Subcooler Type

liquid_suction_design_subcooling_tempera.description: Applicable only and required for liquid suction heat exchangers design liquid suction subcooling
liquid_suction_design_subcooling_tempera.title: Liquid Suction Design Subcooling Temperature Difference

design_liquid_inlet_temperature.description: design inlet temperature on liquid side Applicable only and required for liquid suction heat exchangers (LSHX)
design_liquid_inlet_temperature.title: Design Liquid Inlet Temperature

design_vapor_inlet_temperature.description: design inlet temperature on vapor side Applicable only and required for liquid suction heat exchangers (LSHX) Design vapor inlet temperature must be less than or equal to the Liquid inlet design temp
design_vapor_inlet_temperature.title: Design Vapor Inlet Temperature

capacity_providing_system.description: Name of the Detailed Refrigeration System providing cooling capacity Applicable only and required for mechanical subcoolers
capacity_providing_system.title: Capacity Providing System

outlet_control_temperature.description: Control Temperature Out for subcooled liquid Applicable only and required for mechanical subcoolers
outlet_control_temperature.title: Outlet Control Temperature

refrigerated_case_or_walkin_or_caseandwa.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:Case or Refrigeration:WalkIn object. If there is more than one refrigerated case or walk-in served by this system, enter the name of a Refrigeration:CaseAndWalkInList object. Only cases and walkins served directly by the system should be included in this list. Any cases served indirectly via a secondary chiller should NOT be included in this list
refrigerated_case_or_walkin_or_caseandwa.title: Refrigerated Case Or Walkin Or Caseandwalkinlist Name

refrigeration_transfer_load_or_transferl.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:SecondarySystem object OR a Refrigeration:Condenser:Cascade object OR, a Refrigeration:TransferLoadList object. A transfer load is identified as one which moves the load from one system to another. So if you have more than one such load (including cascade condensers and secondary loops) served by the same system, use a TransferLoadList object.
refrigeration_transfer_load_or_transferl.title: Refrigeration Transfer Load Or Transferload List Name

minimum_condensing_temperature.description: related to the proper operation of the thermal expansion valves and compressors
minimum_condensing_temperature.title: Minimum Condensing Temperature

refrigeration_system_working_fluid_type.description: Fluid property data for the refrigerant must be entered. The fluid property data, including the objects: FluidProperties:Name, FluidProperties:Temperatures, FluidProperties:Saturated and FluidProperties:Superheated can be copied from the FluidPropertiesRefData.idf dataset
refrigeration_system_working_fluid_type.title: Refrigeration System Working Fluid Type

mechanical_subcooler_name.description: Optional Field Recipient of refrigeration capacity, that is receives cool liquid from another refrigeration system to help meet aggregate case loads
mechanical_subcooler_name.title: Mechanical Subcooler Name

liquid_suction_heat_exchanger_subcooler_.description: Optional Field Liquid Suction Heat Exchanger Name, or leave blank
liquid_suction_heat_exchanger_subcooler_.title: Liquid Suction Heat Exchanger Subcooler Name

sum_ua_suction_piping.description: Use only if you want to include suction piping heat gain in refrigeration load
sum_ua_suction_piping.title: Sum Ua Suction Piping

suction_piping_zone_name.description: This will be used to determine the temperature used for distribution piping heat gain and the pipe heat gains  as cooling credit for the zone. Required only if Sum UA Distribution Piping >0.0
suction_piping_zone_name.title: Suction Piping Zone Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

high_stage_compressor_or_compressorlist_.title: High Stage Compressor Or Compressorlist Name

medium_temperature_refrigerated_case_or_.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:Case or Refrigeration:WalkIn object. If there is more than one refrigerated case or walk-in served by this system, enter the name of a Refrigeration:CaseAndWalkInList object. Only medium temperature cases and walk-ins served directly by the system should be included in this list.
medium_temperature_refrigerated_case_or_.title: Medium Temperature Refrigerated Case Or Walkin Or Caseandwalkinlist Name

low_temperature_refrigerated_case_or_wal.description: Enter the name of a Refrigeration:Case or Refrigeration:WalkIn object. Only low temperature cases and walkins served directly by the system should be included in this list.
low_temperature_refrigerated_case_or_wal.title: Low Temperature Refrigerated Case Or Walkin Or Caseandwalkinlist Name

high_pressure_compressor_or_compressorli.title: High Pressure Compressor Or Compressorlist Name

low_pressure_compressor_or_compressorlis.title: Low Pressure Compressor Or Compressorlist Name

refrigeration_system_working_fluid_type.description: Fluid property data for the refrigerant must be entered. The fluid property data, including the objects: FluidProperties:Name, FluidProperties:Temperatures, FluidProperties:Saturated and FluidProperties:Superheated can be copied from the FluidPropertiesRefData.idf dataset
refrigeration_system_working_fluid_type.title: Refrigeration System Working Fluid Type

sum_ua_suction_piping_for_medium_tempera.description: Use only if you want to include suction piping heat gain in refrigeration load
sum_ua_suction_piping_for_medium_tempera.title: Sum Ua Suction Piping For Medium Temperature Loads

medium_temperature_suction_piping_zone_n.description: This will be used to determine the temperature used for distribution piping heat gain and the pipe heat gains as cooling credit for the zone. Required only if Sum UA Distribution Piping for Medium Temperature Loads > 0.0
medium_temperature_suction_piping_zone_n.title: Medium Temperature Suction Piping Zone Name

sum_ua_suction_piping_for_low_temperatur.description: Use only if you want to include suction piping heat gain in refrigeration load
sum_ua_suction_piping_for_low_temperatur.title: Sum Ua Suction Piping For Low Temperature Loads

low_temperature_suction_piping_zone_name.description: This will be used to determine the temperature used for distribution piping heat gain and the pipe heat gains as cooling credit for the zone. Required only if Sum UA Distribution Piping for Low Temperature Loads > 0.0
low_temperature_suction_piping_zone_name.title: Low Temperature Suction Piping Zone Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

rated_cooling_source_temperature.description: If DXEvaporator, use evaporating temperature (saturated suction temperature) If BrineCoil, use Brine entering temperature used to set minimum suction pressure for DX systems and minimum brine temp for secondary systems
rated_cooling_source_temperature.title: Rated Cooling Source Temperature

rated_total_heating_power.description: Include total for all anti-sweat, door, drip-pan, and floor heater power Do not include defrost heater power
rated_total_heating_power.title: Rated Total Heating Power

heating_power_schedule_name.description: Values will be used to multiply the total heating power Values in the schedule should be between 0.0 and 1.0 For example, this could be used if display door antisweat heaters are turned off at night Defaults to always on if schedule name left blank.
heating_power_schedule_name.title: Heating Power Schedule Name

rated_total_lighting_power.description: Enter the total (display + task) installed lighting power.
rated_total_lighting_power.title: Rated Total Lighting Power

lighting_schedule_name.description: The schedule should contain values between 0 and 1 Defaults to always on if schedule name left blank.
lighting_schedule_name.title: Lighting Schedule Name

defrost_type.description: HotFluid includes either hot gas defrost for a DX system or Hot Brine defrost if this walk in is cooled by brine from a secondary chiller
defrost_type.title: Defrost Type

defrost_schedule_name.description: The schedule values should be 0 (off) or 1 (on)
defrost_schedule_name.title: Defrost Schedule Name

defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.description: The schedule values should be 0 (off) or 1 (on) The start time for each defrost period in this drip-down schedule should coincide with the start time for each defrost period in the defrost schedule (previous input field). The length of each defrost drip-down period must be greater than or equal to the corresponding defrost period specified in the defrost schedule. This extra time allows the melted frost to drip from the coil before refrigeration is restarted.
defrost_drip_down_schedule_name.title: Defrost Drip Down Schedule Name

defrost_power.description: needed for all defrost types except none and offcycle
defrost_power.title: Defrost Power

temperature_termination_defrost_fraction.description: This is the portion of the defrost energy that is available to melt frost Needed only for defrost control type TemperatureTermination defaults to 0.7 for electric defrost and to 0.3 for hot fluid defrost
temperature_termination_defrost_fraction.title: Temperature Termination Defrost Fraction To Ice

restocking_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be in units of Watts Leave this field blank if no restocking is to be modeled
restocking_schedule_name.title: Restocking Schedule Name

average_refrigerant_charge_inventory.description: This value is only used if the Cooling Source Type is DXEvaporator
average_refrigerant_charge_inventory.title: Average Refrigerant Charge Inventory

insulated_floor_u_value.description: The default value corresponds to R18 [ft2-F-hr/Btu] To convert other IP R-values to U, divide 5.678 by the R-value Some examples: R15 is U 0.3785 W/m2-K R5 is U 1.136 W/m2-K
insulated_floor_u_value.title: Insulated Floor U Value

view_factor_to_ground.title: View Factor To Ground

number_of_vertices.description: shown with 10 vertex coordinates -- extensible object "extensible" -- duplicate last set of x,y,z coordinates, renumbering please (and changing z terminator to a comma "," for all but last one which needs a semi-colon ";") vertices are given in GlobalGeometryRules coordinates -- if relative, all surface coordinates are "relative" to the Zone Origin. If world, then building and zone origins are used for some internal calculations, but all coordinates are given in an "absolute" system.

room_air_modeling_type.description: Mixing = Complete mixing air model UserDefined = UserDefined Room Air Temperature Patterns needs RoomAir:TemperaturePattern:UserDefined object referencing this Zone OneNodeDisplacementVentilation = Mundt roomair model for displacement ventilation with single floor air node needs RoomAirSettings:OneNodeDisplacementVentilation object referencing this Zone ThreeNodeDisplacementVentilation = RoomAir modeling using UCSD three-node displacement ventilation model needs RoomAirSettings:ThreeNodeDisplacementVentilation object referencing this Zone CrossVentilation = RoomAir modeling using UCSD two-zone cross ventilation model needs RoomAirSettings:CrossVentilation object referencing this Zone UnderFloorAirDistributionInterior = 2-Node UFAD model for interior zones needs RoomAirSettings:UnderFloorAirDistributionInterior object referencing this Zone UnderFloorAirDistributionExterior = RoomAir modeling using 2-Node UFAD model for exterior zones needs RoomAirSettings:UnderFloorAirDistributionExterior object referencing this Zone AirflowNetwork = RoomAir modeling using AirflowNetwork needs RoomAirSettings:AirflowNetwork object referencing this Zone
room_air_modeling_type.title: Room Air Modeling Type

use_weather_file_holidays_and_special_da.description: If yes or blank, use holidays as specified on Weatherfile. If no, do not use the holidays specified on the Weatherfile. Note: You can still specify holidays/special days using the RunPeriodControl:SpecialDays object(s).

first_hour_interpolation_starting_values.description: When the weather data timestep is longer than the simulation timestep, weather data is interpolated. This same interpolation will be used for repeated warmup days.
first_hour_interpolation_starting_values.title: First Hour Interpolation Starting Values

end_date.description: Dates can be several formats: <number>/<number>  (month/day) <number> <Month> <Month> <number> <Nth> <Weekday> in <Month) Last <WeekDay> in <Month> <Month> can be January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December Months can be the first 3 letters of the month <Weekday> can be Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday <Nth> can be 1 or 1st, 2 or 2nd, etc. up to 5(?)

start_date.description: Dates can be several formats: <number>/<number>  (month/day) <number> <Month> <Month> <number> <Nth> <Weekday> in <Month) Last <WeekDay> in <Month> <Month> can be January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December Months can be the first 3 letters of the month <Weekday> can be Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday <Nth> can be 1 or 1st, 2 or 2nd, etc. up to 5(?)

strategy.description: For TemperatureFirst the manager tries to find the highest setpoint temperature that will satisfy all the zone cooling loads at minimum supply air flow rate. If this setpoint temperature is less than the minimum, the setpoint temperature is set to the minimum, and the supply air flow rate is increased to meet the loads. For FlowFirst the manager tries to find the lowest supply air flow rate that will satisfy all the zone cooling loads at the maximum setpoint temperature. If this flow is greater than the maximum, the flow is set to the maximum and the setpoint temperature is reduced to satisfy the cooling loads.
strategy.title: Strategy

shading_calculation_method.description: Select between CPU-based polygon clipping method, the GPU-based pixel counting method, or importing from external shading data. If PixelCounting is selected and GPU hardware (or GPU emulation) is not available, a warning will be displayed and EnergyPlus will revert to PolygonClipping. If Scheduled is chosen, the External Shading Fraction Schedule Name is required in SurfaceProperty:LocalEnvironment. If Imported is chosen, the Schedule:File:Shading object is required.

disable_self_shading_within_shading_zone.description: If Yes, self-shading will be disabled from all exterior surfaces in a given Shading Zone Group to surfaces within the same Shading Zone Group. If both Disable Self-Shading Within Shading Zone Groups and Disable Self-Shading From Shading Zone Groups to Other Zones = Yes, then all self-shading from exterior surfaces will be disabled. If only one of these fields = Yes, then at least one Shading Zone Group must be specified, or this field will be ignored. Shading from Shading:* surfaces, overhangs, fins, and reveals will not be disabled.
disable_self_shading_within_shading_zone.title: Disable Self Shading Within Shading Zone Groups

disable_self_shading_from_shading_zone_g.description: If Yes, self-shading will be disabled from all exterior surfaces in a given Shading Zone Group to all other zones in the model. If both Disable Self-Shading Within Shading Zone Groups and Disable Self-Shading From Shading Zone Groups to Other Zones = Yes, then all self-shading from exterior surfaces will be disabled. If only one of these fields = Yes, then at least one Shading Zone Group must be specified, or this field will be ignored. Shading from Shading:* surfaces, overhangs, fins, and reveals will not be disabled.
disable_self_shading_from_shading_zone_g.title: Disable Self Shading From Shading Zone Groups To Other Zones

ground_reflected_solar_modifier.description: Value for modifying the "normal" ground reflectance when Snow is on ground when calculating the "Ground Reflected Solar Radiation Value" a value of 1.0 here uses the "normal" ground reflectance Ground Reflected Solar = (BeamSolar*CosSunZenith + DiffuseSolar)*GroundReflectance This would be further modified by the Snow Ground Reflectance Modifier when Snow was on the ground When Snow on ground, effective GroundReflectance is normal GroundReflectance*"Ground Reflectance Snow Modifier" Ground Reflectance achieved in this manner will be restricted to [0.0,1.0]

daylighting_ground_reflected_solar_modif.title: Daylighting Ground Reflected Solar Modifier

dry_bulb_temperature_range_modifier_type.description: Type of modifier to the dry-bulb temperature calculated for the timestep
