dry_bulb_temperature_range_modifier_day_.description: Only used when previous field is "MultiplierSchedule", "DifferenceSchedule" or "TemperatureProfileSchedule". For type "MultiplierSchedule"  the hour/time interval values should specify the fraction (0-1) of the dry-bulb temperature range to be subtracted from the maximum dry-bulb temperature for each timestep in the day For type "DifferenceSchedule" the values should specify a number to be subtracted from the maximum dry-bulb temperature for each timestep in the day. Note that numbers in the difference schedule cannot be negative as that would result in a higher maximum than the maximum previously specified. For type "TemperatureProfileSchedule" the values should specify the actual dry-bulb temperature for each timestep in the day.
dry_bulb_temperature_range_modifier_day_.title: Dry Bulb Temperature Range Modifier Day Schedule Name

humidity_condition_type.description: values/schedules indicated here and in subsequent fields create the humidity values in the 24 hour design day conditions profile.
humidity_condition_type.title: Humidity Condition Type

wetbulb_or_dewpoint_at_maximum_dry_bulb.description: Wetbulb or dewpoint temperature coincident with the maximum temperature. Required only if field Humidity Condition Type is "Wetbulb", "Dewpoint", "WetBulbProfileMultiplierSchedule", "WetBulbProfileDifferenceSchedule", or "WetBulbProfileDefaultMultipliers"
wetbulb_or_dewpoint_at_maximum_dry_bulb.title: Wetbulb Or Dewpoint At Maximum Dry Bulb

humidity_condition_day_schedule_name.description: Only used when Humidity Condition Type is "RelativeHumiditySchedule", "WetBulbProfileMultiplierSchedule", or "WetBulbProfileDifferenceSchedule" For type "RelativeHumiditySchedule", the hour/time interval values should specify relative humidity (percent) from 0.0 to 100.0. For type "WetBulbProfileMultiplierSchedule" the hour/time interval values should specify the fraction (0-1) of the wet-bulb temperature range to be subtracted from the maximum wet-bulb temperature for each timestep in the day (units = Fraction) For type "WetBulbProfileDifferenceSchedule" the values should specify a number to be subtracted from the maximum wet-bulb temperature for each timestep in the day. (units = deltaC)
humidity_condition_day_schedule_name.title: Humidity Condition Day Schedule Name

humidity_ratio_at_maximum_dry_bulb.description: Humidity ratio coincident with the maximum temperature (constant humidity ratio throughout day). Required only if field Humidity Condition Type is "HumidityRatio".
humidity_ratio_at_maximum_dry_bulb.title: Humidity Ratio At Maximum Dry Bulb

enthalpy_at_maximum_dry_bulb.description: Enthalpy coincident with the maximum temperature. Required only if field Humidity Condition Type is "Enthalpy".
enthalpy_at_maximum_dry_bulb.title: Enthalpy At Maximum Dry Bulb

daily_wet_bulb_temperature_range.description: Required only if Humidity Condition Type = "WetbulbProfileMultiplierSchedule" or "WetBulbProfileDefaultMultipliers"
daily_wet_bulb_temperature_range.title: Daily Wet Bulb Temperature Range

barometric_pressure.description: This field's value is also checked against the calculated "standard barometric pressure" for the location. If out of range (>10%) or blank, then is replaced by standard value.
barometric_pressure.title: Barometric Pressure

wind_direction.description: North=0.0 East=90.0 0 and 360 are the same direction.
wind_direction.title: Wind Direction

rain_indicator.description: Yes is raining (all day), No is not raining
rain_indicator.title: Rain Indicator

snow_indicator.description: Yes is Snow on Ground, No is no Snow on Ground
snow_indicator.title: Snow Indicator

daylight_saving_time_indicator.description: Yes -- use schedules modified for Daylight Saving Time Schedules. No - do not use schedules modified for Daylight Saving Time Schedules
daylight_saving_time_indicator.title: Daylight Saving Time Indicator

beam_solar_day_schedule_name.description: if Solar Model Indicator = Schedule, then beam schedule name (for day)
beam_solar_day_schedule_name.title: Beam Solar Day Schedule Name

diffuse_solar_day_schedule_name.description: if Solar Model Indicator = Schedule, then diffuse schedule name (for day)
diffuse_solar_day_schedule_name.title: Diffuse Solar Day Schedule Name

ashrae_clear_sky_optical_depth_for_beam_.description: Required if Solar Model Indicator = ASHRAETau or ASHRAETau2017 ASHRAETau2017 solar model can be used with 2013 and 2017 HOF matching taub
ashrae_clear_sky_optical_depth_for_beam_.title: Ashrae Clear Sky Optical Depth For Beam Irradiance Taub

ashrae_clear_sky_optical_depth_for_diffu.description: Required if Solar Model Indicator = ASHRAETau or ASHRAETau2017 ASHRAETau2017 solar model can be used with 2013 and 2017 HOF matching taud
ashrae_clear_sky_optical_depth_for_diffu.title: Ashrae Clear Sky Optical Depth For Diffuse Irradiance Taud

sky_clearness.description: Used if Sky Model Indicator = ASHRAEClearSky or ZhangHuang 0.0 is totally unclear, 1.0 is totally clear
sky_clearness.title: Sky Clearness

maximum_number_warmup_days.description: If used this design day will be run with a custom limit on the maximum number of days that are repeated for warmup. Limiting the number of warmup days can improve run time.
maximum_number_warmup_days.title: Maximum Number Warmup Days

begin_environment_reset_mode.description: If used this can control if you want the thermal history to be reset at the beginning of the design day. When using a series of similiar design days, this field can be used to retain warmup state from the previous design day.
begin_environment_reset_mode.title: Begin Environment Reset Mode

period_selection.description: Following is a list of all possible types of Extreme and Typical periods that might be identified in the Weather File. Not all possible types are available for all weather files.
period_selection.title: Period Selection

day_of_week_for_start_day.description: =[|Sunday|Monday|Tuesday|Wednesday|Thursday|Friday|Saturday|SummerDesignDay|WinterDesignDay| |CustomDay1|CustomDay2]; if you use SummerDesignDay or WinterDesignDay or the CustomDays then this will apply to the whole period; other days (i.e., Monday) will signify a start day and normal sequence of subsequent days
day_of_week_for_start_day.title: Day Of Week For Start Day

use_weather_file_daylight_saving_period.description: If yes or blank, use daylight saving period as specified on Weatherfile. If no, do not use the daylight saving period as specified on the Weatherfile.
use_weather_file_daylight_saving_period.title: Use Weather File Daylight Saving Period

use_weather_file_rain_and_snow_indicator.title: Use Weather File Rain And Snow Indicators

day_of_week_for_start_day.description: =[|Sunday|Monday|Tuesday|Wednesday|Thursday|Friday|Saturday|SummerDesignDay|WinterDesignDay| |CustomDay1|CustomDay2]; if you use SummerDesignDay or WinterDesignDay or the CustomDays then this will apply to the whole period; other days (i.e., Monday) will signify a start day and normal sequence of subsequent days
day_of_week_for_start_day.title: Day Of Week For Start Day

use_weather_file_daylight_saving_period.description: If yes or blank, use daylight saving period as specified on Weatherfile. If no, do not use the daylight saving period as specified on the Weatherfile.
use_weather_file_daylight_saving_period.title: Use Weather File Daylight Saving Period

use_weather_file_rain_and_snow_indicator.title: Use Weather File Rain And Snow Indicators

timesteps_in_averaging_window.description: blank => set the timesteps in averaging window to Number of Timesteps per Hour resulting in a 1 hour averaging window default is number of timesteps for 1 hour averaging window If the PerformancePrecisionTradeoffs Override Mode is set to non-Normal, this field will be overwritten to 1
timesteps_in_averaging_window.title: Timesteps In Averaging Window

plant_or_condenser_loop_name.description: Enter the name of a PlantLoop or a CondenserLoop object
plant_or_condenser_loop_name.title: Plant Or Condenser Loop Name

sizing_option.description: if Coincident is chosen, then sizing is based on HVAC Sizing Simulations and the input field called Do HVAC Sizing Simulation for Sizing Periods in SimulationControl must be set to Yes
sizing_option.title: Sizing Option

zone_timesteps_in_averaging_window.description: this is used in the coincident sizing algorithm to apply a running average to peak flow rates that occur during HVAC Sizing Simulations
zone_timesteps_in_averaging_window.title: Zone Timesteps In Averaging Window

coincident_sizing_factor_mode.description: this is used to adjust the result for coincident sizing by applying a sizing factor
coincident_sizing_factor_mode.title: Coincident Sizing Factor Mode

type_of_load_to_size_on.description: Specifies the basis for sizing the system supply air flow rate Sensible and Total use the zone design air flow rates to size the system supply air flow rate The cooling coil will then be sized at either the peak Sensible or Total flow rate and conditions The heating coil is always sized at the peak sensible heating load. Latent uses the larger of the zone sensible and latent design air flow rates for system sizing. VentilationRequirement uses the system ventilation requirement
type_of_load_to_size_on.title: Type Of Load To Size On

central_heating_maximum_system_air_flow_.title: Central Heating Maximum System Air Flow Ratio

central_cooling_design_supply_air_temper.title: Central Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature

central_heating_design_supply_air_temper.title: Central Heating Design Supply Air Temperature

type_of_zone_sum_to_use.title: Type Of Zone Sum To Use

central_cooling_design_supply_air_humidi.title: Central Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

central_heating_design_supply_air_humidi.title: Central Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_method.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: This input is used if Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is Flow/System This value will *not* be multiplied by any sizing factor or by zone multipliers. If using zone multipliers, this value must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.description: Enter the cooling supply air volume flow rate per total conditioned floor area. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerFloorArea.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Per Floor Area

cooling_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the cooling supply air flow rate. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow.
cooling_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.title: Cooling Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_co.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate per unit cooling capacity. Required field when Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerCoolingCapacity.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_co.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate Per Unit Cooling Capacity

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_method.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is Flow/System This value will *not* be multiplied by any sizing factor or by zone multipliers. If using zone multipliers, this value must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.description: Enter the heating supply air volume flow rate per total conditioned floor area. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerFloorArea.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_floor_a.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Per Floor Area

heating_fraction_of_autosized_heating_su.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the heating supply air flow rate. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow.
heating_fraction_of_autosized_heating_su.title: Heating Fraction Of Autosized Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.description: Enter the supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the cooling supply air flow rate. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow.
heating_fraction_of_autosized_cooling_su.title: Heating Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_he.description: Enter the heating supply air volume flow rate per unit heating capacity. Required field when Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is FlowPerHeatingCapacity.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate_per_unit_he.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Per Unit Heating Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the system cooling design capacity for scalable sizing. None is used when a cooling coils is not included in an airloop or this field may be blank. If this input field is left blank, then the design cooling capacity is set to zero. CoolingDesignCapacity => selected when the design cooling capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from user specified cooling capacity per floor area and total floor area of cooled zones served by an airloop. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity => is selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design cooling capacity of the system.
cooling_design_capacity_method.title: Cooling Design Capacity Method

cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the cooling design capacity per total floor area of cooled zones served by an airloop. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Cooling Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized cooling design capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the heating design capacity for scalable sizing. None is used when a heating coil not included in an airloop or this field may be blank. If this input field is left blank, then the design heating capacity is set to zero. HeatingDesignCapacity => selected when the design heating capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design heating capacity is determined from user specified heating capacity per flow area and total floor area of heated zones served by an airloop. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity => is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity of the system.
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized heating design capacity. Required field when capacity the heating design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

central_cooling_capacity_control_method.description: Method used to control the coil's output
central_cooling_capacity_control_method.title: Central Cooling Capacity Control Method

occupant_diversity.description: The Occupant Diversity is used to determine a multi-zone system's outdoor air intake when the System Outdoor Air Method is Standard62.1VentilationRateProcedure or the Standard62.1SimplifiedProcedure. If set to be autosized, it will be calculated using the information in the People objects assigned to each zone attached to this system/airloop.
occupant_diversity.title: Occupant Diversity

zone_cooling_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method

zone_cooling_design_supply_air_temperatu.description: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature is only used when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method = SupplyAirTemperature
zone_cooling_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature

zone_cooling_design_supply_air_temperatu.description: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature is only used when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method = TemperatureDifference The absolute value of this field will be subtracted from the zone temperature at peak load to calculate the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature.
zone_cooling_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference

zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method

zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.description: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature is only used when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method = SupplyAirTemperature
zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature

zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.description: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature is only used when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method = TemperatureDifference The absolute value of this field will be added to the zone temperature at peak load to calculate the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature.
zone_heating_design_supply_air_temperatu.title: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference

zone_cooling_design_supply_air_humidity_.title: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

zone_heating_design_supply_air_humidity_.title: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: Specify the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object to specify one set of requirements for the Zone. Use a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object name to specify different requirements for Spaces within the Zone.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

zone_heating_sizing_factor.description: if blank or zero, global heating sizing factor from Sizing:Parameters is used.
zone_heating_sizing_factor.title: Zone Heating Sizing Factor

zone_cooling_sizing_factor.description: if blank or zero, global cooling sizing factor from Sizing:Parameters is used.
zone_cooling_sizing_factor.title: Zone Cooling Sizing Factor

cooling_design_air_flow_rate.description: This input is used if Cooling Design Air Flow Method is Flow/Zone This value will be multiplied by the global or zone sizing factor and by zone multipliers.
cooling_design_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Design Air Flow Rate

cooling_minimum_air_flow_per_zone_floor_.description: default is .15 cfm/ft2 This input is used if Cooling Design Air Flow Method is DesignDayWithLimit
cooling_minimum_air_flow_per_zone_floor_.title: Cooling Minimum Air Flow Per Zone Floor Area

cooling_minimum_air_flow.description: This input is used if Cooling Design Air Flow Method is DesignDayWithLimit
cooling_minimum_air_flow.title: Cooling Minimum Air Flow

cooling_minimum_air_flow_fraction.description: fraction of the Cooling design Air Flow Rate This input is currently used in sizing the VAV air terminal unit and fan minimum flow rate It does not currently affect other component autosizing.
cooling_minimum_air_flow_fraction.title: Cooling Minimum Air Flow Fraction

heating_design_air_flow_rate.description: This input is used if Heating Design Air Flow Method is Flow/Zone. This value will be multiplied by the global or zone sizing factor and by zone multipliers.
heating_design_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Design Air Flow Rate

heating_maximum_air_flow_per_zone_floor_.description: default is .40 cfm/ft2 This field is used to size the heating design flow rate when Heating Design Air Flow Method = Flow/Zone. This input is used for autosizing components when Heating Design Air Flow Method = DesignDayWithLimit.
heating_maximum_air_flow_per_zone_floor_.title: Heating Maximum Air Flow Per Zone Floor Area

heating_maximum_air_flow.description: default is 300 cfm This input is used for autosizing components when Heating Design Air Flow Method = DesignDayWithLimit.
heating_maximum_air_flow.title: Heating Maximum Air Flow

heating_maximum_air_flow_fraction.description: fraction of the Heating Design Air Flow Rate This input is used for autosizing components when Heating Design Air Flow Method = DesignDayWithLimit.
heating_maximum_air_flow_fraction.title: Heating Maximum Air Flow Fraction

design_specification_zone_air_distributi.title: Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name

account_for_dedicated_outdoor_air_system.description: account for effect of dedicated outdoor air system supplying air directly to the zone
account_for_dedicated_outdoor_air_system.title: Account For Dedicated Outdoor Air System

dedicated_outdoor_air_system_control_str.description: 1)supply neutral ventilation air; 2)supply neutral dehumidified and reheated ventilation air; 3)supply cold ventilation air
dedicated_outdoor_air_system_control_str.title: Dedicated Outdoor Air System Control Strategy

dedicated_outdoor_air_low_setpoint_tempe.title: Dedicated Outdoor Air Low Setpoint Temperature For Design

dedicated_outdoor_air_high_setpoint_temp.title: Dedicated Outdoor Air High Setpoint Temperature For Design

zone_load_sizing_method.default: Sensible Load Only No Latent Load
zone_load_sizing_method.description: Specifies the basis for sizing the zone supply air flow rate. Zone latent loads will not be used during sizing only when Zone Load Sizing Method = Sensible Load Only No Latent Load. For this case the zone humidity level will float according to the fields Cooling and Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio. For all other choices the zone humidity level will be controlled. Sensible Load will use zone sensible air flow rate for zone component sizing. Latent loads will also be reported during sizing. Latent Load will use zone latent air flow rate for zone component sizing. Sensible loads will also be reported during sizing. Sensible and Latent Load will use the larger of sensible and latent load to choose air flow rate for zone component sizing. Sensible Load Only No Latent Load or leaving this field blank will disable zone latent sizing and reporting. Latent loads will not be reported during sizing (reported as 0's).
enum: Sensible Load Only No Latent Load
zone_load_sizing_method.title: Zone Load Sizing Method

zone_latent_cooling_design_supply_air_hu.description: Use SupplyAirHumidityRatio to enter the humidity ratio when zone dehumidification is required. The supply air humidity ratio should be less than the zone humidity ratio at the zone thermostat and humidistat set point condition. Use HumidityRatioDifference to enter the difference in humidity ratio from the  zone thermostat and humidistat set point condition.
zone_latent_cooling_design_supply_air_hu.title: Zone Latent Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method

zone_dehumidification_design_supply_air_.description: Zone Dehumidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio is only used when Zone Latent Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method = SupplyAirHumidityRatio. This input must be less than the zone humidity ratio at the humidistat set point so that dehumidification can occur.
zone_dehumidification_design_supply_air_.title: Zone Dehumidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

zone_cooling_design_supply_air_humidity_.description: Zone Dehumidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Difference is only used when Zone Latent Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method = HumidityRatioDifference. This input is a positive value and defines the difference between the zone humidity ratio at the thermostat and humidistat set point condition and the supply air humidity ratio entering the zone.
zone_cooling_design_supply_air_humidity_.title: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Difference

zone_latent_heating_design_supply_air_hu.description: Use SupplyAirHumidityRatio to enter the humidity ratio when zone humidification is required. The supply air humidity ratio should be greater than the zone humidity ratio at the zone thermostat and humidistat set point condition. Use HumidityRatioDifference to enter the difference in humidity ratio from the  zone thermostat and humidistat set point condition.
zone_latent_heating_design_supply_air_hu.title: Zone Latent Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method

zone_humidification_design_supply_air_hu.description: Zone Humidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio is only used when Zone Latent Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method = SupplyAirHumidityRatio. This input must be greater than the zone humidity ratio at the humidistat set point so that humidification can occur.
zone_humidification_design_supply_air_hu.title: Zone Humidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio

zone_humidification_design_supply_air_hu.description: Zone Humidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio is only used when Zone Latent Heating Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method = HumidityRatioDifference. This input is a positive value and defines the difference between the zone humidity ratio at the thermostat and humidistat set point condition and the supply air humidity ratio entering the zone.
zone_humidification_design_supply_air_hu.title: Zone Humidification Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Difference

zone_humidistat_dehumidification_set_poi.description: Enter the zone relative humidity schedule used for zone latent cooling calculations. A zone humidistat will take priority over this input. This field is not used if Zone Load Sizing Method = Sensible Load Only No Latent Load or a zone humidistat is present. A default of 50.0 will be used if no schedule is provided and no humidistat is associated with this zone.
zone_humidistat_dehumidification_set_poi.title: Zone Humidistat Dehumidification Set Point Schedule Name

zone_humidistat_humidification_set_point.description: Enter the zone relative humidity schedule used for zone latent heating calculations. A zone humidistat will take priority over this input. This field is not used if Zone Load Sizing Method = Sensible Load Only No Latent Load or a zone humidistat is present. A default of 50.0 will be used if no schedule is provided and no humidistat is associated with this zone.
zone_humidistat_humidification_set_point.title: Zone Humidistat Humidification Set Point Schedule Name

ics_collector_type.description: Currently only RectangularTank ICS collector type is available.
ics_collector_type.title: Ics Collector Type

bottom_heat_loss_conductance.description: Heat loss conductance of the collector bottom insulation
bottom_heat_loss_conductance.title: Bottom Heat Loss Conductance

side_heat_loss_conductance.description: heat loss conductance of the collector side insulation
side_heat_loss_conductance.title: Side Heat Loss Conductance

aspect_ratio.description: This value is ratio of the width (short side) to length (long side of) of the collector. Used to calculate the perimeter of the collector
aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio

collector_side_height.description: This value is used to estimate collector side area for the heat loss calculation through the collector side
collector_side_height.title: Collector Side Height

thermal_mass_of_absorber_plate.description: Calculated from the specific heat, density and thickness of the absorber plate.
thermal_mass_of_absorber_plate.title: Thermal Mass Of Absorber Plate

number_of_covers.description: Number of transparent covers. Common practice is to use low-iron glass as the outer cover and very thin transparent sheet such as Teflon as the inner cover.
number_of_covers.title: Number Of Covers

cover_spacing.description: The gap between the transparent covers and between the inner cover and the absorber plate
cover_spacing.title: Cover Spacing

refractive_index_of_outer_cover.description: Refractive index of outer cover. Typically low-iron glass is used as the outer cover material, and used as the default outer cover with a value of 1.526.
refractive_index_of_outer_cover.title: Refractive Index Of Outer Cover

extinction_coefficient_times_thickness_o.description: Clear glass has extinction coefficient of about 15 [1/m] and with thickness of 3.0mm, the product of the extinction coefficient and thickness becomes 0.045 (=15 * 0.003)
extinction_coefficient_times_thickness_o.title: Extinction Coefficient Times Thickness Of Outer Cover

emissivity_of_outer_cover.description: Thermal emissivity of the outer cover, commonly glass is used as the out collector cover material.
emissivity_of_outer_cover.title: Emissivity Of Outer Cover

refractive_index_of_inner_cover.description: Typical material is very thin sheet of Teflon (PTFE). The default value is refractive index of Teflon.
refractive_index_of_inner_cover.title: Refractive Index Of Inner Cover

extinction_coefficient_times_thickness_o.description: Default inner cover is very thin sheet of Teflon with extinction coefficient of approximately 40.0 and a thickness 0.2mm yields a default value of 0.008.
extinction_coefficient_times_thickness_o.title: Extinction Coefficient Times Thickness Of The Inner Cover

emissivity_of_inner_cover.description: Thermal emissivity of the inner cover material
emissivity_of_inner_cover.title: Emissivity Of Inner Cover

absorptance_of_absorber_plate.description: The absorber plate solar absorptance. Copper is assumed as the default absorber plate.
absorptance_of_absorber_plate.title: Absorptance Of Absorber Plate

emissivity_of_absorber_plate.description: Thermal emissivity of the absorber plate
emissivity_of_absorber_plate.title: Emissivity Of Absorber Plate

backing_material_normal_transmittance_ab.title: Backing Material Normal Transmittance Absorptance Product

fraction_of_pv_cell_area_to_pv_module_ar.title: Fraction Of Pv Cell Area To Pv Module Area

fraction_of_surface_area_with_active_the.title: Fraction Of Surface Area With Active Thermal Collector

thermal_conversion_efficiency_input_mode.title: Thermal Conversion Efficiency Input Mode Type

boundary_conditions_model_name.description: Enter the name of a SurfaceProperty:OtherSideConditionsModel object

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this collector. Schedule value > 0 means it is available. If this field is blank, the collector is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

setpoint_node_name.description: This node is where the mixed air setpoint is determined. required field if no SolarCollector:UnglazedTranspired:Multisystem
setpoint_node_name.title: Setpoint Node Name

zone_node_name.description: This node is used to identify the affected zone required field if no SolarCollector:UnglazedTranspired:Multisystem
zone_node_name.title: Zone Node Name

effective_gap_thickness_of_plenum_behind.title: Effective Gap Thickness Of Plenum Behind Collector

effective_cross_section_area_of_plenum_b.title: Effective Cross Section Area Of Plenum Behind Collector

ratio_of_actual_collector_surface_area_t.description: This parameter is used to help account for corrugations in the collector
ratio_of_actual_collector_surface_area_t.title: Ratio Of Actual Collector Surface Area To Projected Surface Area

collector_thickness.description: Collector thickness is not required for Kutscher correlation Collector thickness is required for Van Decker et al. correlation
collector_thickness.title: Collector Thickness

effectiveness_for_perforations_with_resp.title: Effectiveness For Perforations With Respect To Wind

discharge_coefficient_for_openings_with_.title: Discharge Coefficient For Openings With Respect To Buoyancy Driven Flow

solar_collector_name.description: Enter the name of a SolarCollector:UnglazedTranspired object.
solar_collector_name.title: Solar Collector Name

ceiling_height.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the average height of the space is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used. Note that the Space Ceiling Height is the distance from the Floor to the Ceiling in the Space, not an absolute height from the ground.
ceiling_height.title: Ceiling Height

volume.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the volume of the space is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used.
volume.title: Volume

floor_area.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the floor area of the space is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used.
floor_area.title: Floor Area

space_type.description: Space type is used to tag spaces by activity type, such as office, classroom, storage, etc.
space_type.title: Space Type

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: units in Schedule should be fraction applied to design level of steam equipment, generally (0.0 - 1.0)
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_level_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of steam equipment for this set of attributes Choices: EquipmentLevel => Design Level -- simply enter power input of equipment Watts/Area or Power/Area => Power per Zone Floor Area -- enter the number to apply. Value * Floor Area = Equipment Level Watts/Person or Power/Person => Power per Person -- enter the number to apply. Value * Occupants = Equipment Level
design_level_calculation_method.title: Design Level Calculation Method

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Initial Emission Rate. When the value is equal to 1.0, the time will be reset to zero.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

henry_adsorption_constant_or_partition_c.title: Henry Adsorption Constant Or Partition Coefficient

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Initial Emission Rate. When the value is equal to 1.0, the time will be reset to zero.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

generation_schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Design Generation Rate Coefficient
generation_schedule_name.title: Generation Schedule Name

algorithm.description: Simple = constant value natural convection (ASHRAE) TARP = variable natural convection based on temperature difference (ASHRAE, Walton) CeilingDiffuser = ACH-based forced and mixed convection correlations for ceiling diffuser configuration with simple natural convection limit AdaptiveConvectionAlgorithm = dynamic selection of convection models based on conditions ASTMC1340 = mixed convection correlations based on heat flow direction, surface tilt angle, surface characteristic length, and air speed past the surface.
algorithm.title: Algorithm

hc_function_of_temperature_difference_cu.title: Hc Function Of Temperature Difference Curve Name

hc_function_of_temperature_difference_di.description: Curve's "x" is absolute value of delta-T/Height (Surface temp minus Air temp)/(vertical length scale), (C/m) when used for an inside face the vertical length scale is the zone's interior height

hc_function_of_air_system_volume_flow_ra.title: Hc Function Of Air System Volume Flow Rate Divided By Zone Perimeter Length Curve Name

algorithm.description: SimpleCombined = Combined radiation and convection coefficient using simple ASHRAE model TARP = correlation from models developed by ASHRAE, Walton, and Sparrow et. al. MoWiTT = correlation from measurements by Klems and Yazdanian for smooth surfaces DOE-2 = correlation from measurements by Klems and Yazdanian for rough surfaces AdaptiveConvectionAlgorithm = dynamic selection of correlations based on conditions

natural_convection_stable_horizontal_equ.title: Natural Convection Stable Horizontal Equation User Curve Name

natural_convection_unstable_horizontal_e.title: Natural Convection Unstable Horizontal Equation Source

natural_convection_unstable_horizontal_e.description: The SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Outside:UserCurve named in this field is used when the previous field is set to UserCurve
natural_convection_unstable_horizontal_e.title: Natural Convection Unstable Horizontal Equation User Curve Name

hf_function_of_wind_speed_curve_name.description: Curve's "x" is wind speed of the type determined in the previous field (m/s)
hf_function_of_wind_speed_curve_name.title: Hf Function Of Wind Speed Curve Name

hn_function_of_temperature_difference_cu.description: Curve's "x" is absolute value of delta-T (Surface temperature minus air temperature, (C))
hn_function_of_temperature_difference_cu.title: Hn Function Of Temperature Difference Curve Name

hn_function_of_temperature_difference_di.description: Curve's "x" is absolute value of delta-T/Height (Surface temp minus Air temp)/(vertical length scale), (C/m) when used for an outside face the vertical length scale is the exterior facade's overall height
hn_function_of_temperature_difference_di.title: Hn Function Of Temperature Difference Divided By Height Curve Name

convection_coefficient_1.description: used if Convection Type=Value, min and max limits are set in HeatBalanceAlgorithm object. Default limits are Minimum >= 0.1 and Maximum <= 1000
convection_coefficient_1.title: Convection Coefficient 1

convection_coefficient_1_schedule_name.description: used if Convection Type=Schedule,  min and max limits are set in HeatBalanceAlgorithm object. Default limits are Minimum >= 0.1 and Maximum <= 1000
convection_coefficient_1_schedule_name.title: Convection Coefficient 1 Schedule Name

convection_coefficient_2.description: used if Convection Type=Value, min and max limits are set in HeatBalanceAlgorithm object. Default limits are Minimum >= 0.1 and Maximum <= 1000
convection_coefficient_2.title: Convection Coefficient 2

convection_coefficient_2_schedule_name.title: Convection Coefficient 2 Schedule Name

convection_coefficient_1.title: Convection Coefficient 1

convection_coefficient_2_schedule_name.title: Convection Coefficient 2 Schedule Name

exposed_perimeter_calculation_method.description: Choices: TotalExposedPerimeter => total exposed perimeter in meters ExposedPerimeterFraction => fraction of total perimeter that is exposed. Value * Fraction = Total exposed perimeter BySegment => define whether the segment between each set of consecutive vertices of the floor surface is exposed. SUM(exposed segement lengths) = Total exposed perimeter
exposed_perimeter_calculation_method.title: Exposed Perimeter Calculation Method

boundary_conditions_model_name.description: Enter the name of a SurfaceProperty:OtherSideConditionsModel object
boundary_conditions_model_name.title: Boundary Conditions Model Name

thermal_emissivity_of_exterior_baffle_ma.title: Thermal Emissivity Of Exterior Baffle Material

height_scale_for_buoyancy_driven_ventila.title: Height Scale For Buoyancy Driven Ventilation

effective_thickness_of_cavity_behind_ext.title: Effective Thickness Of Cavity Behind Exterior Baffle

ratio_of_actual_surface_area_to_projecte.description: this parameter is used to help account for corrugations in the collector
ratio_of_actual_surface_area_to_projecte.title: Ratio Of Actual Surface Area To Projected Surface Area

effectiveness_for_perforations_with_resp.title: Effectiveness For Perforations With Respect To Wind

discharge_coefficient_for_openings_with_.title: Discharge Coefficient For Openings With Respect To Buoyancy Driven Flow

inside_face_heat_source_term_schedule_na.description: The value of this schedule is the source term value for the inside face of this surface If this field is left blank, no inside surface source term will be applied. The schedule values are heat rate per surface area (W/m2), when positive schedule values indicate heat gain and negative values indicates loss.
inside_face_heat_source_term_schedule_na.title: Inside Face Heat Source Term Schedule Name

outside_face_heat_source_term_schedule_n.description: The value of this schedule is the source term value for the outside face of this surface If this field is left blank, no outside surface source term will be applied. The schedule values are heat rate per surface area (W/m2), when positive schedule values indicate heat gain and negative values indicates loss.
outside_face_heat_source_term_schedule_n.title: Outside Face Heat Source Term Schedule Name

surface_name.description: Enter the name of an exterior window outside surface object
surface_name.title: Surface Name

incident_solar_multiplier.description: a constant multiplier for window solar transmittance and visible transmittance. If the Shading Multiplier Schedule Name is defined, the product of these two will be the final shading multiplier.
incident_solar_multiplier.title: Incident Solar Multiplier

incident_solar_multiplier_schedule_name.description: The schedule values should be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1.
incident_solar_multiplier_schedule_name.title: Incident Solar Multiplier Schedule Name

exterior_surface_name.description: Enter the name of an exterior surface object
exterior_surface_name.title: Exterior Surface Name

external_shading_fraction_schedule_name.description: Enter the name of a Schedule object
external_shading_fraction_schedule_name.title: External Shading Fraction Schedule Name

surrounding_surfaces_object_name.description: Enter the name of a SurfaceProperty:SurroundingSurfaces object
surrounding_surfaces_object_name.title: Surrounding Surfaces Object Name

outdoor_air_node_name.description: Enter the name of an OutdoorAir:Node object
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

ground_surfaces_object_name.description: Enter the name of a SurfaceProperty:GroundSurfaces object
ground_surfaces_object_name.title: Ground Surfaces Object Name

combined_convective_radiative_film_coeff.description: if>0, this field becomes the exterior convective/radiative film coefficient and the other fields are used to calculate the outdoor air temperature then exterior surface temperature based on outdoor air and specified coefficient if<=0, then remaining fields calculate the outside surface temperature The following fields are used in the equation: OtherSideTemp=N2*N3 + N4*OutdoorDry-bulb + N5*GroundTemp + N6*WindSpeed*OutdoorDry-bulb + N7*TempZone + N9*TempPrev
combined_convective_radiative_film_coeff.title: Combined Convective Radiative Film Coefficient

constant_temperature.description: This parameter will be overwritten by the values from the Constant Temperature Schedule Name (below) if one is present
constant_temperature.title: Constant Temperature

constant_temperature_coefficient.description: This coefficient is used even with a Schedule. It should normally be 1.0 in that case. This field is ignored if Sinusoidal Variation of Constant Temperature Coefficient = Yes.
constant_temperature_coefficient.title: Constant Temperature Coefficient

constant_temperature_schedule_name.description: Name of schedule for values of constant temperature. Schedule values replace any value specified in the field Constant Temperature.
constant_temperature_schedule_name.title: Constant Temperature Schedule Name

sinusoidal_variation_of_constant_tempera.description: Optionally used to vary Constant Temperature Coefficient with unitary sine wave
sinusoidal_variation_of_constant_tempera.title: Sinusoidal Variation Of Constant Temperature Coefficient

period_of_sinusoidal_variation.description: Use with sinusoidal variation to define the time period
period_of_sinusoidal_variation.title: Period Of Sinusoidal Variation

previous_other_side_temperature_coeffici.description: This coefficient multiplies the other side temperature result from the previous zone timestep
previous_other_side_temperature_coeffici.title: Previous Other Side Temperature Coefficient

minimum_other_side_temperature_limit.description: This field specifies a lower limit for the other side temperature result. Blank indicates no limit
minimum_other_side_temperature_limit.title: Minimum Other Side Temperature Limit

maximum_other_side_temperature_limit.description: This field specifies an upper limit for the other side temperature result. Blank indicates no limit
maximum_other_side_temperature_limit.title: Maximum Other Side Temperature Limit

type_of_modeling.description: GapConvectionRadiation provides boundary conditions for convection and linearized thermal radiation across a gap or cavity on the other side of the surface that are modeled separately. UndergroundPipingSystemSurface provides boundary conditions for surfaces in contact with PipingSystem:Underground domains GroundCoupledSurface provides boundary conditions for surfaces in contact with GroundDomain objects ConvectiveUnderwater provides a connection between a surface and an underwater boundary condition defined using a SurfaceProperty:Underwater object
type_of_modeling.title: Type Of Modeling

inside_surface_incident_sun_solar_radiat.description: Values in schedule are expected to be in W/m2
inside_surface_incident_sun_solar_radiat.title: Inside Surface Incident Sun Solar Radiation Schedule Name

sky_temperature_schedule_name.description: Schedule values are real numbers, -100.0 to 100.0, units C optional
sky_temperature_schedule_name.title: Sky Temperature Schedule Name

ground_temperature_schedule_name.description: Schedule values are real numbers, -100.0 to 100.0, units C optional
ground_temperature_schedule_name.title: Ground Temperature Schedule Name

distance_from_surface_centroid_to_leadin.description: This is the distance from the leading edge of the boundary layer development to the centroid of the surface of interest. The value of this field is used as the distance in the Reynolds number for evaluating the local convection coefficient.
distance_from_surface_centroid_to_leadin.title: Distance From Surface Centroid To Leading Edge Of Boundary Layer

surface_name.description: Name of the floor surface where the pool is located.
surface_name.title: Surface Name

make_up_water_supply_schedule_name.title: Make Up Water Supply Schedule Name

pool_heating_system_maximum_water_flow_r.title: Pool Heating System Maximum Water Flow Rate

pool_miscellaneous_equipment_power.description: Power input per pool water flow rate
pool_miscellaneous_equipment_power.title: Pool Miscellaneous Equipment Power

ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.description: required when field Ambient Temperature Indicator=Outdoors
ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.title: Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name

heat_gain_coefficient_from_ambient_tempe.title: Heat Gain Coefficient From Ambient Temperature

use_side_availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for use side. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
use_side_availability_schedule_name.title: Use Side Availability Schedule Name

source_side_availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for source side. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
source_side_availability_schedule_name.title: Source Side Availability Schedule Name

tank_recovery_time.description: Parameter for autosizing design flow rates for indirectly cooled water tanks time required to lower temperature of entire tank from 14.4C to 9.0C
tank_recovery_time.title: Tank Recovery Time

tank_height.description: Height is measured in the axial direction for horizontal cylinders
tank_height.title: Tank Height

tank_perimeter.description: Only used if Tank Shape is Other
tank_perimeter.title: Tank Perimeter

ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.title: Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name

uniform_skin_loss_coefficient_per_unit_a.title: Uniform Skin Loss Coefficient Per Unit Area To Ambient Temperature

use_side_heat_transfer_effectiveness.description: The use side effectiveness in the stratified tank model is a simplified analogy of a heat exchanger's effectiveness. This effectiveness is equal to the fraction of use mass flow rate that directly mixes with the tank fluid. And one minus the effectiveness is the fraction that bypasses the tank. The use side mass flow rate that bypasses the tank is mixed with the fluid or water leaving the stratified tank.
use_side_heat_transfer_effectiveness.title: Use Side Heat Transfer Effectiveness

use_side_availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for use side. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
use_side_availability_schedule_name.title: Use Side Availability Schedule Name

source_side_heat_transfer_effectiveness.description: The source side effectiveness in the stratified tank model is a simplified analogy of a heat exchanger's effectiveness. This effectiveness is equal to the fraction of source mass flow rate that directly mixes with the tank fluid. And one minus the effectiveness is the fraction that bypasses the tank. The source side mass flow rate that bypasses the tank is mixed with the fluid or water leaving the stratified tank.
source_side_heat_transfer_effectiveness.title: Source Side Heat Transfer Effectiveness

source_side_availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for use side. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
source_side_availability_schedule_name.title: Source Side Availability Schedule Name

tank_recovery_time.description: Parameter for autosizing design flow rates for indirectly cooled water tanks time required to lower temperature of entire tank from 14.4C to 9.0C
tank_recovery_time.title: Tank Recovery Time

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

capacity.description: This includes only the latent storage capacity
capacity.title: Capacity

tank_loss_coefficient.description: This is the fraction the total storage capacity that is lost or melts each hour
tank_loss_coefficient.title: Tank Loss Coefficient

freezing_temperature_of_storage_medium.description: This temperature is typically 0C for water. Simply changing this temperature without adjusting the performance parameters input above is inappropriate and not advised.
freezing_temperature_of_storage_medium.title: Freezing Temperature Of Storage Medium

thaw_process_indicator.description: This field determines whether the system uses internal or external melt during discharging. This will then have an impact on charging performance.
thaw_process_indicator.title: Thaw Process Indicator

ice_storage_type.description: IceOnCoilInternal = Ice-on-Coil, internal melt IceOnCoilExternal = Ice-on-Coil, external melt
ice_storage_type.title: Ice Storage Type

fanger_thermal_comfort_heating_schedule_.description: Schedule values should be Predicted Mean Vote (PMV)
fanger_thermal_comfort_heating_schedule_.title: Fanger Thermal Comfort Heating Schedule Name

fanger_thermal_comfort_cooling_schedule_.description: Schedule values should be Predicted Mean Vote (PMV)
fanger_thermal_comfort_cooling_schedule_.title: Fanger Thermal Comfort Cooling Schedule Name

fanger_thermal_comfort_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be Predicted Mean Vote (PMV)
fanger_thermal_comfort_schedule_name.title: Fanger Thermal Comfort Schedule Name

fanger_thermal_comfort_schedule_name.title: Fanger Thermal Comfort Schedule Name

fanger_thermal_comfort_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be Predicted Mean Vote (PMV)
fanger_thermal_comfort_schedule_name.title: Fanger Thermal Comfort Schedule Name

number_of_timesteps_per_hour.description: Number in hour: normal validity 4 to 60: 6 suggested Must be evenly divisible into 60 Allowable values include 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20, 30, and 60 Normal 6 is minimum as lower values may cause inaccuracies A minimum value of 20 is suggested for both ConductionFiniteDifference and CombinedHeatAndMoistureFiniteElement surface heat balance algorithms A minimum of 12 is suggested for simulations involving a Vegetated Roof (Material:RoofVegetation).
number_of_timesteps_per_hour.title: Number Of Timesteps Per Hour

number_of_speeds_for_heating.description: Used only for Multi speed coils Enter the number of the following sets of data for air flow rates.
number_of_speeds_for_heating.title: Number Of Speeds For Heating

number_of_speeds_for_cooling.description: Used only for Multi speed coils Enter the number of the following sets of data for air flow rates.
number_of_speeds_for_cooling.title: Number Of Speeds For Cooling

single_mode_operation.description: Controls coil operation during each HVAC timestep. This choice does not apply to speed 1 operation. Yes = operate at the highest speed possible without exceeding the current load. No = allow operation at the average of two adjacent speeds to match the current load.
single_mode_operation.title: Single Mode Operation

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_ratio.description: Used to define the no load operating air flow rate when the system fan is specified to operate continuously.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate_ratio.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Ratio

utility_cost_charge_block_name.description: Charge Variable Name This is the name associated with the UtilityCost:Charge:Block object and will appear in the report. In addition the results of the UtilityCost:Charge:Block are stored in a variable with the same name. That way the results may be used for further calculation.
utility_cost_charge_block_name.title: Utility Cost Charge Block Name

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Charge:Block.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

source_variable.description: The name of the source used by the UtilityCost:Charge:Block. This is usually the name of the variable holding the energy or demand but may also be the name of any variable including the subtotal or basis if other charges are based on those. Typical values include totalEnergy totalDemand EnergyCharges DemandCharges ServiceCharges Basis Adjustments Surcharges Subtotal Taxes and Total. If it is a time-of-use rate then peakEnergy peakDemand shoulderEnergy shoulderDemand offPeakEnergy offPeakDemand midPeakEnergy and midPeakDemand. In addition see the Tariff Report to see other native variables that may be available. Also you can create additional user defined variables to model complex tariffs.
source_variable.title: Source Variable

season.description: If this is set to annual the calculations are performed for the UtilityCost:Charge:Block for the entire year (all months) otherwise it is calculated only for those months in the season defined.
season.title: Season

category_variable_name.description: This field shows where the charge should be added. The reason to enter this field appropriately is so that the charge gets reported in a reasonable category. The charge automatically gets added to the variable that is the category.
category_variable_name.title: Category Variable Name

remaining_into_variable.description: If the blocks do not use all of the energy or demand from the source some energy and demand remains then the remaining amount should be assigned to a variable. If no variable is assigned and some amount of energy or demand is not used in the block structure a warning will be issued.
remaining_into_variable.title: Remaining Into Variable

block_size_multiplier_value_or_variable_.description: The sizes of the blocks are usually used directly but if a value or a variable is entered here the block sizes entered in the rest of the charge are first multiplied by the entered value prior to being used. This is common for rates that are kWh/kW rates and in that case the variable that holds the monthly total electric demand would be entered. If no value is entered a default value of one is assumed so that the block sizes remain exactly as entered. This field is unusual for the EnergyPlus syntax because it can be either a number or a name of a variable.
block_size_multiplier_value_or_variable_.title: Block Size Multiplier Value Or Variable Name

block_size_1_value_or_variable_name.description: The size of the block of the charges is entered here. For most rates that use multiple blocks this will be the value for the block size. Using remaining may be used when the remaining amount should be included in that block. This field is unusual because it can be either a number or a name of a variable.
block_size_1_value_or_variable_name.title: Block Size 1 Value Or Variable Name

block_1_cost_per_unit_value_or_variable_.description: The cost of the block. This field is unusual for the EnergyPlus syntax because it can be either a number or a name of a variable.
block_1_cost_per_unit_value_or_variable_.title: Block 1 Cost Per Unit Value Or Variable Name
