Using remaining may be used when the remaining amount should be included in that block. This field is unusual because it can be either a number or a name of a variable.
block_size_15_value_or_variable_name.title: Block Size 15 Value Or Variable Name

block_15_cost_per_unit_value_or_variable.description: The cost of the block. This field is unusual for the EnergyPlus syntax because it can be either a number or a name of a variable.
block_15_cost_per_unit_value_or_variable.title: Block 15 Cost Per Unit Value Or Variable Name

utility_cost_charge_simple_name.description: Charge Variable Name This is the name associated with the UtilityCost:Charge:Simple object and will appear in the report. In addition the results of the UtilityCost:Charge:Simple calculation are stored in a variable with the same name. That way the results may be used for further calculation. Spaces are not significant in Charge variable names. They are removed during the utility bill calculation process.
utility_cost_charge_simple_name.title: Utility Cost Charge Simple Name

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Charge:Simple.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

source_variable.description: The name of the source used by the UtilityCost:Charge:Simple. This is usually the name of the variable holding the energy or demand but may also be the name of any variable including the subtotal or basis if other charges are based on those. Typical values include totalEnergy totalDemand EnergyCharges DemandCharges ServiceCharges Basis Adjustments Surcharges Subtotal Taxes and Total. If it is a time-of-use rate then peakEnergy peakDemand shoulderEnergy shoulderDemand offPeakEnergy offPeakDemand midPeakEnergy and midPeakDemand. In addition see the Tariff Report to see other native variables that may be available. Also you can create additional user defined variables to model complex tariffs.
source_variable.title: Source Variable

season.description: If this is set to annual the calculations are performed for the UtilityCost:Charge:Simple for the entire year (all months) otherwise it is calculated only for those months in the season defined.
season.title: Season

category_variable_name.description: This field shows where the charge should be added. The reason to enter this field appropriately is so that the charge gets reported in a reasonable category. The charge automatically gets added to the variable that is the category.
category_variable_name.title: Category Variable Name

cost_per_unit_value_or_variable_name.description: This field contains either a single number or the name of a variable. The number is multiplied with all of the energy or demand or other source that is specified in the source field. If a variable is used then the monthly values of the variable are multiplied against the variable specified in the source field. This field makes it easy to include a simple charge without specifying block sizes. This is a good way to include a tax or cost adjustment.
cost_per_unit_value_or_variable_name.title: Cost Per Unit Value Or Variable Name

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Variable.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

compute_step_1.description: Contain a simple language that describes the steps used in the computation process similar to a programming language.
compute_step_1.title: Compute Step 1

utility_cost_qualify_name.description: Displayed in the report if the tariff does not qualify
utility_cost_qualify_name.title: Utility Cost Qualify Name

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Qualify.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

variable_name.description: The name of the variable used. For energy and demand the automatically created variables totalEnergy and totalDemand should be used respectively.
variable_name.title: Variable Name

threshold_value_or_variable_name.description: The minimum or maximum value for the qualify. If the variable has values that are less than this value when the qualify type is minimum then the tariff may be disqualified. If the variable has values that are greater than this value when the qualify type is maximum then the tariff may be disqualified.
threshold_value_or_variable_name.title: Threshold Value Or Variable Name

season.description: If the UtilityCost:Qualify only applies to a season enter the season name. If this field is left blank it defaults to Annual.
season.title: Season

threshold_test.description: Uses the number in Number of Months in one of two different ways depending on the Threshold  Test. If the Threshold Test is set to Count then the qualification is based on the count of the total number of months per year. If the Threshold Test is set to consecutive then the qualification is based on a consecutive number of months.
threshold_test.title: Threshold Test

number_of_months.description: A number from 1 to 12. If no value entered 12 is assumed when the qualify type is minimum and 1 when the qualify type is maximum. This is the number of months that the threshold test applies to determine if the rate qualifies or not. If the season is less than 12 months (if it is not annual) then the value is automatically reduced to the number of months of the season.
number_of_months.title: Number Of Months

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Ratchet.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

baseline_source_variable.description: When the ratcheted value exceeds the baseline value for a month the ratcheted value is used but when the baseline value is greater then the ratcheted value the baseline value is used. Usually the electric demand charge is used. The baseline source variable can be the results of another ratchet object. This allows utility tariffs that have multiple ratchets to be modeled.
baseline_source_variable.title: Baseline Source Variable

adjustment_source_variable.description: The variable that the ratchet is calculated from. It is often but not always the same as the baseline source variable. The ratcheting calculations using offset and multiplier are using the values from the adjustment source variable. If left blank the adjustment source variable is the same as the baseline source variable.
adjustment_source_variable.title: Adjustment Source Variable

season_from.description: The name of the season that is being examined. The maximum value for all of the months in the named season is what is used with the multiplier and offset. This is most commonly Summer or Annual. When Monthly is used the adjustment source variable is used directly for all months.
season_from.title: Season From

season_to.description: The name of the season when the ratchet would be calculated. This is most commonly Winter. The ratchet only is applied to the months in the named season. The resulting variable for months not in the Season To selection will contain the values as appear in the baseline source variable.
season_to.title: Season To

multiplier_value_or_variable_name.description: Often the ratchet has a clause such as "the current month demand or 90% of the summer month demand". For this case a value of 0.9 would be entered here as the multiplier. This value may be left blank if no multiplier is needed and a value of one will be used as a default.
multiplier_value_or_variable_name.title: Multiplier Value Or Variable Name

offset_value_or_variable_name.description: A less common strategy is to say that the ratchet must be all demand greater than a value in this case an offset that is added to the demand may be entered here. If entered it is common for the offset value to be negative representing that the demand be reduced. If no value is entered it is assumed to be zero and not affect the ratchet.
offset_value_or_variable_name.title: Offset Value Or Variable Name

output_meter_name.description: The name of any standard meter or custom meter or but usually set to either Electricity:Facility or Gas:Facility
output_meter_name.title: Output Meter Name

conversion_factor_choice.description: A choice that allows several different predefined conversion factors to be used; otherwise user defined conversion factors are used as defined in the next two fields. If left blank m3 is used for water meters and kWh are used for all other meters.
conversion_factor_choice.title: Conversion Factor Choice

energy_conversion_factor.description: Is a multiplier used to convert energy into the units specified by the utility in their tariff. If left blank it defaults to 1 (no conversion). This field should will be used only if Conversion Factor Choice is set to UserDefined. Within EnergyPlus energy always has units of J (joules). For conversion from J to kWh use the value of 0.0000002778. This is also used for all objects that reference the UtilityCost:Tariff.
energy_conversion_factor.title: Energy Conversion Factor

demand_conversion_factor.description: Is a multiplier used to convert demand into the units specified by the utility in their tariff. If left blank it defaults to 1 (no conversion). This field should will be used only if Conversion Factor Choice is set to UserDefined. Within EnergyPlus demand always has units of J/s (joules/sec) which equivalent to W (watts). For conversion from W to kW use the value of 0.001. This is also used for all objects that reference the UtilityCost:Tariff.
demand_conversion_factor.title: Demand Conversion Factor

time_of_use_period_schedule_name.description: The name of the schedule that defines the time-of-use periods that occur each day. The values for the different variables are: 1 for Peak. 2 for Shoulder. 3 for OffPeak. 4 for MidPeak. The following variables are created automatically if these different periods are used in the schedule and include: TotalEnergy, TotalDemand, PeakEnergy, PeakDemand, ShoulderEnergy, ShoulderDemand, OffPeakEnergy, OffPeakDemand, MidPeakEnergy, MidPeakDemand Some special variables are created that include: PeakExceedsOffPeak, OffPeakExceedsPeak, PeakExceedsMidPeak, MidPeakExceedsPeak, PeakExceedsShoulder, ShoulderExceedsPeak, Others include: PeakAndShoulderEnergy, PeakAndShoulderDemand, PeakAndMidPeakEnergy, PeakAndMidPeakDemand, ShoulderAndOffPeakEnergy, ShoulderAndOffPeakDemand, PeakAndOffPeakEnergy, PeakAndOffPeakDemand, RealTimePriceCosts, AboveCustomerBaseCosts, BelowCustomerBaseCosts, AboveCustomerBaseEnergy, BelowCustomerBaseEnergy
time_of_use_period_schedule_name.title: Time Of Use Period Schedule Name

season_schedule_name.description: The name of a schedule that defines the seasons. The schedule values are: 1 for Winter. 2 for Spring. 3 for Summer. 4 for Autumn. Variables are automatically created if a season schedule is used. These variables are set to 1 within the season and 0 for the months that are not in the season. The variables are: IsWinter, IsNotWinter, IsSpring, IsNotSpring, IsSummer, IsNotSummer, IsAutumn, IsNotAutumn.
season_schedule_name.title: Season Schedule Name

month_schedule_name.description: The name of the schedule that defines the billing periods of the year. Normally this entry is allowed to default and a schedule will be internally used that has the breaks between billing periods occurring at the same time as the breaks between months i.e. at midnight prior to the first day of the month. If other billing periods are used such as two month cycles or a single bill for an entire season such as some natural gas companies do in the summer then the month schedule may be used to redefine it. Make sure that the month schedule and season schedule are consistent otherwise an error will be issued.
month_schedule_name.title: Month Schedule Name

demand_window_length.description: The determination of demand can vary by utility. Some utilities use the peak instantaneous demand measured but most use a fifteen minute average demand or a one hour average demand. Some gas utilities measure demand as the use during the peak day or peak week.
demand_window_length.title: Demand Window Length

monthly_charge_or_variable_name.description: The fixed monthly service charge that many utilities have. The entry may be numeric and gets added to the ServiceCharges variable or if a variable name is entered here its values for each month are used.
monthly_charge_or_variable_name.title: Monthly Charge Or Variable Name

minimum_monthly_charge_or_variable_name.description: The minimum total charge for the tariff or if a variable name is entered here its values for each month are used.
minimum_monthly_charge_or_variable_name.title: Minimum Monthly Charge Or Variable Name

real_time_pricing_charge_schedule_name.description: Used with real time pricing rates. The name of a schedule that contains the cost of energy for that particular time period of the year. Real time rates can be modeled using a charge schedule with the actual real time prices entered in the schedule.
real_time_pricing_charge_schedule_name.title: Real Time Pricing Charge Schedule Name

customer_baseline_load_schedule_name.description: Used with real time pricing rates. The name of a schedule that contains the baseline energy use for the customer. Many real time rates apply the charges as a credit or debit only to the difference between the baseline use and the actual use.
customer_baseline_load_schedule_name.title: Customer Baseline Load Schedule Name

group_name.description: The group name of the tariff such as distribution transmission supplier etc. If more than one tariff with the same group name is present and qualifies only the lowest cost tariff is used. Usually the group name field is left blank which results in all tariffs using the same meter variable being compared and the lowest cost one being selected.
group_name.title: Group Name

buy_or_sell.description: Sets whether the tariff is used for buying selling or both to the utility. This should be allowed to default to buyFromUtility unless a power generation system is included in the building that may generate more power than the building needs during the year
buy_or_sell.title: Buy Or Sell

tariff_name.description: The name of the UtilityCost:Tariff that is associated with this UtilityCost:Variable.
tariff_name.title: Tariff Name

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

azimuth_angle.description: Facing direction of outside of wall (S=180,N=0,E=90,W=270)
azimuth_angle.title: Azimuth Angle

starting_x_coordinate.description: Starting (x,y,z) coordinate is the Lower Left Corner of the Wall
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Non-blank only if the field Outside Boundary Condition is Surface, Zone, OtherSideCoefficients or OtherSideConditionsModel If Surface, specify name of corresponding surface in adjacent zone or specify current surface name for internal partition separating like zones If Zone, specify the name of the corresponding zone and the program will generate the corresponding interzone surface If Foundation, specify the name of the corresponding Foundation object and If OtherSideCoefficients, specify name of SurfaceProperty:OtherSideCoefficients If OtherSideConditionsModel, specify name of SurfaceProperty:OtherSideConditionsModel
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

view_factor_to_ground.description: From the exterior of the surface Unused if one uses the "reflections" options in Solar Distribution in Building input unless a DaylightingDevice:Shelf or DaylightingDevice:Tubular object has been specified. autocalculate will automatically calculate this value from the tilt of the surface
view_factor_to_ground.title: View Factor To Ground

number_of_vertices.description: shown with 10 vertex coordinates -- extensible object "extensible" -- duplicate last set of x,y,z coordinates, renumbering please (and changing z terminator to a comma "," for all but last one which needs a semi-colon ";") vertices are given in GlobalGeometryRules coordinates -- if relative, all surface coordinates are "relative" to the Zone Origin. If world, then building and zone origins are used for some internal calculations, but all coordinates are given in an "absolute" system.
number_of_vertices.title: Number Of Vertices

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

azimuth_angle.description: Facing direction of outside of wall (S=180,N=0,E=90,W=270)
azimuth_angle.title: Azimuth Angle

starting_x_coordinate.description: Starting (x,y,z) coordinate is the Lower Left Corner of the Wall
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone for the inside face of the surface.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space for the inside face of the surface (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Specify a surface name in an adjacent zone for known interior walls. Specify a zone name of an adjacent zone to automatically generate the interior wall in the adjacent zone.
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

azimuth_angle.description: Facing direction of outside of wall (S=180,N=0,E=90,W=270)
azimuth_angle.title: Azimuth Angle

starting_x_coordinate.description: Starting (x,y,z) coordinate is the Lower Left Corner of the Wall
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file. If the construction is type "Construction:CfactorUndergroundWall", then the GroundFCfactorMethod will be used.
construction_name.title: Construction Name

zone_name.description: Zone the surface is a part of.
zone_name.title: Zone Name

space_name.description: Space the surface is a part of (optional, see description of Space object for more details).
space_name.title: Space Name

azimuth_angle.description: Facing direction of outside of wall (S=180,N=0,E=90,W=270)
azimuth_angle.title: Azimuth Angle

starting_x_coordinate.description: Starting (x,y,z) coordinate is the Lower Left Corner of the Wall
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Schedule values of 0 denote the heat pump compressor is off and the parasitic electric energy is also off.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

compressor_setpoint_temperature_schedule.description: Defines the cut-out temperature where the heat pump compressor turns off. The heat pump compressor setpoint temperature should always be greater than the water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature.
compressor_setpoint_temperature_schedule.title: Compressor Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

dead_band_temperature_difference.description: Setpoint temperature minus the dead band temperature difference defines the cut-in temperature where the heat pump compressor turns on. The water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature should always be less than the heat pump compressor cut-in temperature.
dead_band_temperature_difference.title: Dead Band Temperature Difference

condenser_water_inlet_node_name.description: Should match the field Source Outlet Node Name in the water heater tank object. Should also match the Condenser Water Inlet Node Name in the associated DX coil object.
condenser_water_inlet_node_name.title: Condenser Water Inlet Node Name

condenser_water_outlet_node_name.description: Should match the field Source Inlet Node Name in water heater tank object. Should also match the Condenser Water Outlet Node Name in the associated DX Coil object.
condenser_water_outlet_node_name.title: Condenser Water Outlet Node Name

condenser_water_flow_rate.description: Actual water flow rate through the heat pump's water coil (condenser). If autocalculated, the water flow rate is set equal to 4.487E-8 m3/s/W times the rated heating capacity of the heat pump's DX coil.
condenser_water_flow_rate.title: Condenser Water Flow Rate

evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Actual air flow rate across the heat pump's air coil (evaporator). If autocalculated, the air flow rate is set equal to 5.035E-5 m3/s/W times the rated heating capacity of the heat pump's DX coil.
evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporator Air Flow Rate

inlet_air_configuration.description: Defines the configuration of the airflow path through the air coil and fan section.
inlet_air_configuration.title: Inlet Air Configuration

air_inlet_node_name.description: Zone air exhaust node name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule. Otherwise, leave field blank.
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

air_outlet_node_name.description: Zone Air Inlet Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule. Otherwise, leave field blank.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

outdoor_air_node_name.description: Outdoor air node name if inlet air configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir or OutdoorAirOnly, otherwise leave field blank.
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

exhaust_air_node_name.description: Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir or OutdoorAirOnly, otherwise leave field blank.
exhaust_air_node_name.title: Exhaust Air Node Name

inlet_air_temperature_schedule_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule, otherwise leave blank. Schedule values should be degrees C.
inlet_air_temperature_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Temperature Schedule Name

inlet_air_humidity_schedule_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule, otherwise leave blank. Schedule values are entered as a fraction (e.g. 0.5 is equal to 50%RH)
inlet_air_humidity_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Humidity Schedule Name

inlet_air_zone_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Otherwise, leave field blank.
inlet_air_zone_name.title: Inlet Air Zone Name

tank_object_type.description: Specify the type of water heater tank used by this heat pump water heater.
tank_object_type.title: Tank Object Type

tank_name.description: Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object.
tank_name.title: Tank Name

tank_use_side_inlet_node_name.description: Used only when the heat pump water heater is connected to a plant loop, otherwise leave blank. Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object when connected to a plant loop.
tank_use_side_inlet_node_name.title: Tank Use Side Inlet Node Name

tank_use_side_outlet_node_name.description: Used only when the heat pump water heater is connected to a plant loop, otherwise leave blank. Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object when connected to a plant loop.
tank_use_side_outlet_node_name.title: Tank Use Side Outlet Node Name

dx_coil_object_type.description: Specify the type of DX coil used by this heat pump water heater. The only valid choice is Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:Pumped and Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed, and CoilSystem:IntegratedHeatPump:AirSource
dx_coil_object_type.title: Dx Coil Object Type

dx_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:* object, or CoilSystem:IntegratedHeatPump:AirSource
dx_coil_name.title: Dx Coil Name

minimum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.description: Heat pump compressor will not operate when the inlet air dry-bulb temperature is below this value.
minimum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.title: Minimum Inlet Air Temperature For Compressor Operation

maximum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.description: Heat pump compressor will not operate when the inlet air dry-bulb temperature is above this value.
maximum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.title: Maximum Inlet Air Temperature For Compressor Operation

compressor_location.description: If Zone is selected, Inlet Air Configuration must be ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. If Schedule is selected, then you must provide a Compressor Ambient Temperature Schedule Name below.
compressor_location.title: Compressor Location

compressor_ambient_temperature_schedule_.description: Used only if Compressor Location is Schedule, otherwise leave field blank.
compressor_ambient_temperature_schedule_.title: Compressor Ambient Temperature Schedule Name

fan_object_type.description: Specify the type of fan used by this heat pump water heater. The only valid choices are Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff.
fan_object_type.title: Fan Object Type

fan_name.description: Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff object.
fan_name.title: Fan Name

fan_placement.description: BlowThrough means the fan is located before the air coil (upstream). DrawThrough means the fan is located after the air coil (downstream).
fan_placement.title: Fan Placement

on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the heat pump compressor operates. Does not contribute to water heating but can impact the zone air heat balance.
on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: On Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the heat pump compressor is off. Does not contribute to water heating but can impact the zone air heat balance. Off-cycle parasitic power is 0 when the availability schedule is 0.
off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

parasitic_heat_rejection_location.description: This field determines if the parasitic electric load impacts the zone air heat balance. If Zone is selected, Inlet Air Configuration must be ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir.
parasitic_heat_rejection_location.title: Parasitic Heat Rejection Location

inlet_air_mixer_node_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank.
inlet_air_mixer_node_name.title: Inlet Air Mixer Node Name

outlet_air_splitter_node_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank.
outlet_air_splitter_node_name.title: Outlet Air Splitter Node Name

inlet_air_mixer_schedule_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank. Schedule values define whether the heat pump draws its inlet air from the zone, outdoors or a combination of zone and outdoor air. A schedule value of 0 denotes inlet air is drawn only from the zone. A schedule value of 1 denotes inlet air is drawn only from outdoors. Schedule values between 0 and 1 denote a mixture of zone and outdoor air proportional to the schedule value (i.e. 0.4 = 40% outdoor air, 60% zone air).
inlet_air_mixer_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Mixer Schedule Name

tank_element_control_logic.description: MutuallyExclusive means that once the tank heating element is active the heat pump is shut down until setpoint is reached. Simultaneous (default) means that both the tank heating element and heat pump are used at the same time recover the tank temperature.
tank_element_control_logic.title: Tank Element Control Logic

control_sensor_1_height_in_stratified_ta.description: Used to indicate height of control sensor for Tank Object Type = WaterHeater:Stratified If left blank, it will default to the height of Heater1
control_sensor_1_height_in_stratified_ta.title: Control Sensor 1 Height In Stratified Tank

control_sensor_1_weight.description: Weight to give Control Sensor 1 temperature The weight of Control Sensor 2 will be 1 - (wt. of control sensor 1)
control_sensor_1_weight.title: Control Sensor 1 Weight

control_sensor_2_height_in_stratified_ta.description: Used to indicate height of control sensor for Tank Object Type = WaterHeater:Stratified If left blank, it will default to the height of Heater2
control_sensor_2_height_in_stratified_ta.title: Control Sensor 2 Height In Stratified Tank

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Schedule values of 0 denote the heat pump compressor is off and the parasitic electric energy is also off.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

compressor_setpoint_temperature_schedule.description: Defines the cut-out temperature where the heat pump compressor turns off. The heat pump compressor setpoint temperature should always be greater than the water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature.
compressor_setpoint_temperature_schedule.title: Compressor Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

dead_band_temperature_difference.description: Setpoint temperature minus the dead band temperature difference defines the cut-in temperature where the heat pump compressor turns on. The water tank's heater (element or burner) setpoint temperature should always be less than the heat pump compressor cut-in temperature.
dead_band_temperature_difference.title: Dead Band Temperature Difference

condenser_bottom_location.description: Distance from the bottom of the tank to the bottom of the wrapped condenser.
condenser_bottom_location.title: Condenser Bottom Location

condenser_top_location.description: Distance from the bottom of the tank to the top of the wrapped condenser.
condenser_top_location.title: Condenser Top Location

evaporator_air_flow_rate.description: Actual air flow rate across the heat pump's air coil (evaporator). If autocalculated, the air flow rate is set equal to 5.035E-5 m3/s/W times the rated heating capacity of the heat pump's DX coil.
evaporator_air_flow_rate.title: Evaporator Air Flow Rate

inlet_air_configuration.description: Defines the configuration of the airflow path through the air coil and fan section.
inlet_air_configuration.title: Inlet Air Configuration

air_inlet_node_name.description: Zone air exhaust node name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule. Otherwise, leave field blank.
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

air_outlet_node_name.description: Zone Air Inlet Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule. Otherwise, leave field blank.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

outdoor_air_node_name.description: Outdoor air node name if inlet air configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir or OutdoorAirOnly, otherwise leave field blank.
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

exhaust_air_node_name.description: Simply a unique Node Name if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir or OutdoorAirOnly, otherwise leave field blank.
exhaust_air_node_name.title: Exhaust Air Node Name

inlet_air_temperature_schedule_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule, otherwise leave blank. Schedule values should be degrees C.
inlet_air_temperature_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Temperature Schedule Name

inlet_air_humidity_schedule_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is Schedule, otherwise leave blank. Schedule values are entered as a fraction (e.g. 0.5 is equal to 50%RH)
inlet_air_humidity_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Humidity Schedule Name

inlet_air_zone_name.description: Used only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. Otherwise, leave field blank.
inlet_air_zone_name.title: Inlet Air Zone Name

tank_object_type.description: Specify the type of water heater tank used by this heat pump water heater.
tank_object_type.title: Tank Object Type

tank_name.description: Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object. Must be a WaterHeater:Stratified tank.
tank_name.title: Tank Name

tank_use_side_inlet_node_name.description: Used only when the heat pump water heater is connected to a plant loop, otherwise leave blank. Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object when connected to a plant loop.
tank_use_side_inlet_node_name.title: Tank Use Side Inlet Node Name

tank_use_side_outlet_node_name.description: Used only when the heat pump water heater is connected to a plant loop, otherwise leave blank. Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Water Heater object when connected to a plant loop.
tank_use_side_outlet_node_name.title: Tank Use Side Outlet Node Name

dx_coil_object_type.description: Specify the type of DX coil used by this heat pump water heater. The only valid choice is Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:Wrapped
dx_coil_object_type.title: Dx Coil Object Type

dx_coil_name.description: Must match the name used in the corresponding Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:Wrapped object.
dx_coil_name.title: Dx Coil Name

minimum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.description: Heat pump compressor will not operate when the inlet air dry-bulb temperature is below this value.
minimum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.title: Minimum Inlet Air Temperature For Compressor Operation

maximum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.description: Heat pump compressor will not operate when the inlet air dry-bulb temperature is above this value.
maximum_inlet_air_temperature_for_compre.title: Maximum Inlet Air Temperature For Compressor Operation

compressor_location.description: If Zone is selected, Inlet Air Configuration must be ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir. If Schedule is selected, then you must provide a Compressor Ambient Temperature Schedule Name below.
compressor_location.title: Compressor Location

compressor_ambient_temperature_schedule_.description: Used only if Compressor Location is Schedule, otherwise leave field blank.
compressor_ambient_temperature_schedule_.title: Compressor Ambient Temperature Schedule Name

fan_object_type.description: Specify the type of fan used by this heat pump water heater. The only valid choices are Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff.
fan_object_type.title: Fan Object Type

fan_name.description: Needs to match the name used in the corresponding Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff object.
fan_name.title: Fan Name

fan_placement.description: BlowThrough means the fan is located before the air coil (upstream). DrawThrough means the fan is located after the air coil (downstream).
fan_placement.title: Fan Placement

on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the heat pump compressor operates. Does not contribute to water heating but can impact the zone air heat balance.
on_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: On Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the heat pump compressor is off. Does not contribute to water heating but can impact the zone air heat balance. Off-cycle parasitic power is 0 when the availability schedule is 0.
off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

parasitic_heat_rejection_location.description: This field determines if the parasitic electric load impacts the zone air heat balance. If Zone is selected, Inlet Air Configuration must be ZoneAirOnly or ZoneAndOutdoorAir.
parasitic_heat_rejection_location.title: Parasitic Heat Rejection Location

inlet_air_mixer_node_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank.
inlet_air_mixer_node_name.title: Inlet Air Mixer Node Name

outlet_air_splitter_node_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank.
outlet_air_splitter_node_name.title: Outlet Air Splitter Node Name

inlet_air_mixer_schedule_name.description: Required only if Inlet Air Configuration is ZoneAndOutdoorAir, otherwise leave field blank. Schedule values define whether the heat pump draws its inlet air from the zone, outdoors or a combination of zone and outdoor air. A schedule value of 0 denotes inlet air is drawn only from the zone. A schedule value of 1 denotes inlet air is drawn only from outdoors. Schedule values between 0 and 1 denote a mixture of zone and outdoor air proportional to the schedule value.
inlet_air_mixer_schedule_name.title: Inlet Air Mixer Schedule Name

tank_element_control_logic.description: MutuallyExclusive means that once the tank heating element is active the heat pump is shut down until setpoint is reached. Simultaneous (default) means that both the tank heating element and heat pump are used at the same time recover the tank temperature.
tank_element_control_logic.title: Tank Element Control Logic

control_sensor_1_height_in_stratified_ta.description: Used to indicate height of control sensor if Tank Object Type is WaterHeater:Stratified If left blank, it will default to the height of Heater1
control_sensor_1_height_in_stratified_ta.title: Control Sensor 1 Height In Stratified Tank

control_sensor_1_weight.description: Weight to give Control Sensor 1 temperature
control_sensor_1_weight.title: Control Sensor 1 Weight

control_sensor_2_height_in_stratified_ta.description: Used to indicate height of control sensor if Tank Object Type is WaterHeater:Stratified If left blank, it will default to the height of Heater2 The weight of this control sensor will be 1 - (wt. of control sensor 1)
control_sensor_2_height_in_stratified_ta.title: Control Sensor 2 Height In Stratified Tank

heater_minimum_capacity.description: Only used when Heater Control Type is set to Modulate
heater_minimum_capacity.title: Heater Minimum Capacity

off_cycle_parasitic_fuel_consumption_rat.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Fuel Consumption Rate

off_cycle_parasitic_heat_fraction_to_tan.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Heat Fraction To Tank

on_cycle_parasitic_fuel_consumption_rate.title: On Cycle Parasitic Fuel Consumption Rate

on_cycle_parasitic_heat_fraction_to_tank.title: On Cycle Parasitic Heat Fraction To Tank

ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.title: Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name

off_cycle_loss_coefficient_to_ambient_te.title: Off Cycle Loss Coefficient To Ambient Temperature

off_cycle_loss_fraction_to_zone.title: Off Cycle Loss Fraction To Zone

on_cycle_loss_coefficient_to_ambient_tem.title: On Cycle Loss Coefficient To Ambient Temperature

on_cycle_loss_fraction_to_zone.title: On Cycle Loss Fraction To Zone

peak_use_flow_rate.description: Only used if Use Side Node connections are blank
peak_use_flow_rate.title: Peak Use Flow Rate

use_flow_rate_fraction_schedule_name.description: Only used if Use Side Node connections are blank
use_flow_rate_fraction_schedule_name.title: Use Flow Rate Fraction Schedule Name

cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.description: Only used if Use Side Node connections are blank Defaults to water temperatures calculated by Site:WaterMainsTemperature object
cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.title: Cold Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

indirect_water_heating_recovery_time.description: Parameter for autosizing design flow rates for indirectly heated water tanks Time required to raise temperature of entire tank from 14.4C to 57.2C
indirect_water_heating_recovery_time.title: Indirect Water Heating Recovery Time

source_side_flow_control_mode.description: StorageTank mode always requests flow unless tank is at its Maximum Temperature Limit IndirectHeatPrimarySetpoint mode requests flow whenever primary setpoint calls for heat IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint mode requests flow whenever alternate indirect setpoint calls for heat
source_side_flow_control_mode.title: Source Side Flow Control Mode

indirect_alternate_setpoint_temperature_.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint
indirect_alternate_setpoint_temperature_.title: Indirect Alternate Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

time_storage_can_meet_peak_draw.description: Only used for Design Mode = PeakDraw
time_storage_can_meet_peak_draw.title: Time Storage Can Meet Peak Draw

time_for_tank_recovery.description: Only used for Design Mode = PeakDraw
time_for_tank_recovery.title: Time For Tank Recovery

nominal_tank_volume_for_autosizing_plant.description: Only used if Design Mode = PeakDraw and the water heater also has autosized flow rates for connections on the demand side of a plant loop
nominal_tank_volume_for_autosizing_plant.title: Nominal Tank Volume For Autosizing Plant Connections

number_of_bedrooms.description: Only used for Design Mode = ResidentialHUD-FHAMinimum
number_of_bedrooms.title: Number Of Bedrooms

number_of_bathrooms.description: Only used for Design Mode = ResidentialHUD-FHAMinimum
number_of_bathrooms.title: Number Of Bathrooms

storage_capacity_per_person.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerPerson
storage_capacity_per_person.title: Storage Capacity Per Person

recovery_capacity_per_person.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerPerson
recovery_capacity_per_person.title: Recovery Capacity Per Person

storage_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerFloorArea
storage_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Storage Capacity Per Floor Area

recovery_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerFloorArea
recovery_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Recovery Capacity Per Floor Area

number_of_units.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerUnit
number_of_units.title: Number Of Units

storage_capacity_per_unit.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerUnit
storage_capacity_per_unit.title: Storage Capacity Per Unit

recovery_capacity_perunit.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerUnit
recovery_capacity_perunit.title: Recovery Capacity Perunit

storage_capacity_per_collector_area.description: Only used for Design Mode = PerSolarCollectorArea
storage_capacity_per_collector_area.title: Storage Capacity Per Collector Area

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

tank_height.description: Height is measured in the axial direction for horizontal cylinders
tank_height.title: Tank Height

tank_perimeter.description: Only used if Tank Shape is Other
tank_perimeter.title: Tank Perimeter

off_cycle_parasitic_fuel_consumption_rat.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Fuel Consumption Rate

off_cycle_parasitic_heat_fraction_to_tan.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Heat Fraction To Tank

on_cycle_parasitic_fuel_consumption_rate.title: On Cycle Parasitic Fuel Consumption Rate

on_cycle_parasitic_heat_fraction_to_tank.title: On Cycle Parasitic Heat Fraction To Tank

ambient_temperature_outdoor_air_node_nam.title: Ambient Temperature Outdoor Air Node Name

uniform_skin_loss_coefficient_per_unit_a.title: Uniform Skin Loss Coefficient Per Unit Area To Ambient Temperature

off_cycle_flue_loss_coefficient_to_ambie.title: Off Cycle Flue Loss Coefficient To Ambient Temperature

off_cycle_flue_loss_fraction_to_zone.title: Off Cycle Flue Loss Fraction To Zone

peak_use_flow_rate.description: Only used if Use Side Node connections are blank
peak_use_flow_rate.title: Peak Use Flow Rate

use_flow_rate_fraction_schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to 1.0 at all times Only used if use side node connections are blank
use_flow_rate_fraction_schedule_name.title: Use Flow Rate Fraction Schedule Name

cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.description: Only used if use side node connections are blank Defaults to water temperatures calculated by Site:WaterMainsTemperature object
cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.title: Cold Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

use_side_effectiveness.description: The use side effectiveness in the stratified tank model is a simplified analogy of a heat exchanger's effectiveness. This effectiveness is equal to the fraction of use mass flow rate that directly mixes with the tank fluid. And one minus the effectiveness is the fraction that bypasses the tank. The use side mass flow rate that bypasses the tank is mixed with the fluid or water leaving the stratified tank.
use_side_effectiveness.title: Use Side Effectiveness

source_side_effectiveness.description: The source side effectiveness in the stratified tank model is a simplified analogy of a heat exchanger's effectiveness. This effectiveness is equal to the fraction of source mass flow rate that directly mixes with the tank fluid. And one minus the effectiveness is the fraction that bypasses the tank. The source side mass flow rate that bypasses the tank is mixed with the fluid or water leaving the stratified tank.
source_side_effectiveness.title: Source Side Effectiveness

indirect_water_heating_recovery_time.description: Parameter for autosizing design flow rates for indirectly heated water tanks time required to raise temperature of entire tank from 14.4C to 57.2C
indirect_water_heating_recovery_time.title: Indirect Water Heating Recovery Time

source_side_flow_control_mode.description: StorageTank mode always requests flow unless tank is at its Maximum Temperature Limit IndirectHeatPrimarySetpoint mode requests flow whenever primary setpoint for heater 1 calls for heat IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint mode requests flow whenever alternate indirect setpoint calls for heat
source_side_flow_control_mode.title: Source Side Flow Control Mode

indirect_alternate_setpoint_temperature_.description: This field is only used if the previous is set to IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint
indirect_alternate_setpoint_temperature_.title: Indirect Alternate Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

supply_water_storage_tank_name.description: If blank, or tank is empty, defaults to fresh water from the mains
supply_water_storage_tank_name.title: Supply Water Storage Tank Name

hot_water_supply_temperature_schedule_na.description: Defaults to cold water supply temperature
hot_water_supply_temperature_schedule_na.title: Hot Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.description: Defaults to water temperatures calculated by Site:WaterMainsTemperature object
cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.title: Cold Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

drain_water_heat_exchanger_u_factor_time.title: Drain Water Heat Exchanger U Factor Times Area

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

target_temperature_schedule_name.description: Defaults to hot water supply temperature
target_temperature_schedule_name.title: Target Temperature Schedule Name

hot_water_supply_temperature_schedule_na.description: Defaults to cold water supply temperature
hot_water_supply_temperature_schedule_na.title: Hot Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.description: Defaults to water temperatures calculated by Site:WaterMainsTemperature object
cold_water_supply_temperature_schedule_n.title: Cold Water Supply Temperature Schedule Name

collection_loss_factor.description: this is the portion of rain that is lost in the process of collecting it the rain collected is one minus this factor
collection_loss_factor.title: Collection Loss Factor

type_of_supply_controlled_by_float_valve.title: Type Of Supply Controlled By Float Valve

float_valve_on_capacity.description: Lower range of target storage level e.g. float valve kicks on
float_valve_on_capacity.title: Float Valve On Capacity

float_valve_off_capacity.description: Upper range of target storage level e.g. float valve kicks off
float_valve_off_capacity.title: Float Valve Off Capacity

backup_mains_capacity.description: Lower range of secondary target storage level used to keep tanks at a minimum level using mains water if well can't keep up
backup_mains_capacity.title: Backup Mains Capacity

calculation_type.description: The field indicates that the sky temperature will be imported from external schedules or calculated by alternative methods other than default.
calculation_type.title: Calculation Type

schedule_name.description: if name matches a SizingPeriod:DesignDay, put in a day schedule of this name if name is for a SizingPeriod:WeatherFileDays, SizingPeriod:WeatherFileConditionType or RunPeriod, put in a full year schedule that covers the appropriate days. Required if Calculation Type is ScheduleValue, DifferenceScheduleDryBulbValue or DifferenceScheduleDewPointValue.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

use_weather_file_horizontal_ir.description: If yes or blank, use Horizontal IR values from weather file when present, otherwise use the specified sky model. If no, always use the specified sky model and ignore the horizontal IR values from the weather file. For Calculation Type = ScheduleValue, DifferenceScheduleDryBulbValue or DifferenceScheduleDewPointValue, this field is ignored and the scheduled values are used.
use_weather_file_horizontal_ir.title: Use Weather File Horizontal Ir

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Window is on (i.e., Base Surface) Window assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

frame_and_divider_name.description: Enter the name of a WindowProperty:FrameAndDivider object Used only for exterior windows (rectangular) and glass doors. Unused for triangular windows. If not specified (blank), window or glass door has no frame or divider and no beam solar reflection from reveal surfaces.
frame_and_divider_name.title: Frame And Divider Name

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Window starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Window starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

deflected_thickness.description: If left blank will be considered that gap has no deflection.
deflected_thickness.title: Deflected Thickness

slat_thickness.description: Distance between top and bottom surfaces of slat Slat is assumed to be rectangular in cross section and flat
slat_thickness.title: Slat Thickness

slat_angle.description: If WindowShadingControl referencing the window that incorporates this blind has Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = FixedSlatAngle, then this is the fixed value of the slat angle; If WindowShadingControl referencing the window that incorporates this blind has Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = BlockBeamSolar, then this is the slat angle when slat angle control is not in effect (e.g., when there is no beam solar on the blind); Not used if WindowShadingControl referencing the window that incorporates this blind has Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = ScheduledSlatAngle.
slat_angle.title: Slat Angle

front_side_slat_beam_solar_reflectance.title: Front Side Slat Beam Solar Reflectance

back_side_slat_beam_solar_reflectance.title: Back Side Slat Beam Solar Reflectance

front_side_slat_diffuse_solar_reflectanc.description: Must equal "Front Side Slat Beam Solar Reflectance"
front_side_slat_diffuse_solar_reflectanc.title: Front Side Slat Diffuse Solar Reflectance

back_side_slat_diffuse_solar_reflectance.description: Must equal "Back Side Slat Beam Solar Reflectance"
back_side_slat_diffuse_solar_reflectance.title: Back Side Slat Diffuse Solar Reflectance

front_side_slat_beam_visible_reflectance.title: Front Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance

back_side_slat_beam_visible_reflectance.title: Back Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance

slat_diffuse_visible_transmittance.description: Used only for detailed daylighting calculation Must equal "Slat Beam Visible Transmittance"
slat_diffuse_visible_transmittance.title: Slat Diffuse Visible Transmittance

front_side_slat_diffuse_visible_reflecta.description: Required for detailed daylighting calculation Must equal "Front Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance"
front_side_slat_diffuse_visible_reflecta.title: Front Side Slat Diffuse Visible Reflectance

back_side_slat_diffuse_visible_reflectan.description: Required for detailed daylighting calculation Must equal "Back Side Slat Beam Visible Reflectance"
back_side_slat_diffuse_visible_reflectan.title: Back Side Slat Diffuse Visible Reflectance

front_side_slat_infrared_hemispherical_e.title: Front Side Slat Infrared Hemispherical Emissivity

back_side_slat_infrared_hemispherical_em.title: Back Side Slat Infrared Hemispherical Emissivity

minimum_slat_angle.description: Used only if WindowShadingControl referencing the window that incorporates this blind varies the slat angle (i.e., WindowShadingControl with Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = ScheduledSlatAngle or BlockBeamSolar)
minimum_slat_angle.title: Minimum Slat Angle

maximum_slat_angle.description: Used only if WindowShadingControl referencing the window that incorporates this blind varies the slat angle (i.e., WindowShadingControl with Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = ScheduledSlatAngle or BlockBeamSolar)
maximum_slat_angle.title: Maximum Slat Angle

slat_crown.description: Perpendicular length between the cord and the curve. Slat is assumed to be rectangular in cross section and flat. Crown=0.0625x"Slat width"
slat_crown.title: Slat Crown

slat_angle.description: Slat angle is +ve if the tip of the slat front face is tilted upward, else the slat angle is -ve if the tip of the slat front face is tilted downward. The slat angle varies between -90 to +90. The default value is 45 degrees.
slat_angle.title: Slat Angle

front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_trans.description: The front side beam-diffuse solar transmittance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_trans.title: Front Side Slat Beam Diffuse Solar Transmittance

back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_transm.description: The back side beam-diffuse solar transmittance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_transm.title: Back Side Slat Beam Diffuse Solar Transmittance

front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_refle.description: The front side beam-diffuse solar reflectance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_refle.title: Front Side Slat Beam Diffuse Solar Reflectance

back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_reflec.description: The back side beam-diffuse solar reflectance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_solar_reflec.title: Back Side Slat Beam Diffuse Solar Reflectance

front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_tra.description: The front side beam-diffuse visible transmittance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_tra.title: Front Side Slat Beam Diffuse Visible Transmittance

back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_tran.description: The back side beam-diffuse visible transmittance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_tran.title: Back Side Slat Beam Diffuse Visible Transmittance

front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_ref.description: The front side beam-diffuse visible reflectance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_ref.title: Front Side Slat Beam Diffuse Visible Reflectance

back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_refl.description: The back side beam-diffuse visible reflectance of the slat at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_beam_diffuse_visible_refl.title: Back Side Slat Beam Diffuse Visible Reflectance

slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_transmittance.description: The beam-diffuse solar transmittance of the slat averaged over the entire solar spectrum of solar radiation.
slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_transmittance.title: Slat Diffuse Diffuse Solar Transmittance

front_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_re.description: The front side beam-diffuse solar reflectance of the slat averaged over the entire solar spectrum of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_re.title: Front Side Slat Diffuse Diffuse Solar Reflectance

back_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_ref.description: The back side beam-diffuse solar reflectance of the slat averaged over the entire solar spectrum of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_solar_ref.title: Back Side Slat Diffuse Diffuse Solar Reflectance

slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_transmittan.description: The beam-diffuse visible transmittance of the slat averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_transmittan.title: Slat Diffuse Diffuse Visible Transmittance

front_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_.description: The front side beam-diffuse visible reflectance of the slat averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
front_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_.title: Front Side Slat Diffuse Diffuse Visible Reflectance

back_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_r.description: The back side beam-diffuse visible reflectance of the slat averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.
back_side_slat_diffuse_diffuse_visible_r.title: Back Side Slat Diffuse Diffuse Visible Reflectance

slat_infrared_transmittance.description: Long-wave hemispherical transmittance of the slat material. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the slat.
slat_infrared_transmittance.title: Slat Infrared Transmittance

front_side_slat_infrared_emissivity.description: Front side long-wave hemispherical emissivity of the slat material.
front_side_slat_infrared_emissivity.title: Front Side Slat Infrared Emissivity

back_side_slat_infrared_emissivity.description: Back side long-wave hemispherical emissivity of the slat material.
back_side_slat_infrared_emissivity.title: Back Side Slat Infrared Emissivity

slat_angle_control.description: Used only if slat angle control is desired to either maximize solar gain (MaximizeSolar), maximize visibility while eliminating beam solar radiation (BlockBeamSolar), or fixed slate angle (FixedSlatAngle). If FixedSlatAngle is selected, the slat angle entered above is used.
slat_angle_control.title: Slat Angle Control

slat_thickness.description: Distance between top and bottom surfaces of slat Slat is assumed to be rectangular in cross section and flat
slat_thickness.title: Slat Thickness

slat_curve.description: this value represents curvature radius of the slat. if the slat is flat use zero. if this value is not zero, then it must be > SlatWidth/2.
slat_curve.title: Slat Curve

drape_beam_beam_solar_transmittance_at_n.description: The beam-beam solar transmittance at normal incidence. This value is the same as the openness area fraction of the drape fabric. Assumed to be same for front and back sides.
drape_beam_beam_solar_transmittance_at_n.title: Drape Beam Beam Solar Transmittance At Normal Incidence

front_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_tran.description: The front side beam-diffuse solar transmittance at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides.
front_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_tran.title: Front Side Drape Beam Diffuse Solar Transmittance

back_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_trans.description: The back side beam-diffuse solar transmittance at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides.
back_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_trans.title: Back Side Drape Beam Diffuse Solar Transmittance

front_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_refl.description: The front side beam-diffuse solar reflectance at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
front_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_refl.title: Front Side Drape Beam Diffuse Solar Reflectance

back_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_refle.description: The back side beam-diffuse solar reflectance at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation.
back_side_drape_beam_diffuse_solar_refle.title: Back Side Drape Beam Diffuse Solar Reflectance

drape_beam_beam_visible_transmittance.description: The beam-beam visible transmittance at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum of solar radiation. Assumed same for front and back sides.
drape_beam_beam_visible_transmittance.title: Drape Beam Beam Visible Transmittance

drape_beam_diffuse_visible_transmittance.description: The beam-diffuse visible transmittance at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides.
drape_beam_diffuse_visible_transmittance.title: Drape Beam Diffuse Visible Transmittance

drape_beam_diffuse_visible_reflectance.description: The beam-diffuse visible reflectance at normal incidence average over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides.

The gap types VentedIndoor and VentedOutdoor are used with gas type "Air" only.

If this field is zero or positive, then the value entered here will be used.

If this field is zero or positive, then the value entered here will be used. Front Side is side closest to outdoor air.

back_side_diffuse_diffuse_solar_reflecta.description: Used only when Optical Data Type = SpectralAverage If this field is autocalculate, then the back diffuse-diffuse solar reflectance is automatically estimated from other inputs and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is zero or positive, then the value entered here will be used. Back side is side closest to indoor air.

back_side_infrared_emissivity.title: Back Side Infrared Emissivity

thermal_resistance.description: This is the R-Value in SI for the glass. The default value is an approximation for a single layer of glass at 1/4" inch thickness. This field is used only for movable insulation defined with this material type.

infrared_hemispherical_emissivity.description: Emissivity of front and back side assumed equal

reflected_beam_transmittance_accounting_.title: Reflected Beam Transmittance Accounting Method

diffuse_solar_reflectance.description: Diffuse reflectance of the screen material over the entire solar radiation spectrum. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
diffuse_solar_reflectance.title: Diffuse Solar Reflectance

diffuse_visible_reflectance.description: Diffuse visible reflectance of the screen material averaged over the solar spectrum and weighted by the response of the human eye. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
diffuse_visible_reflectance.title: Diffuse Visible Reflectance

thermal_hemispherical_emissivity.description: Long-wave emissivity of the screen material. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
thermal_hemispherical_emissivity.title: Thermal Hemispherical Emissivity

conductivity.description: Thermal conductivity of the screen material. Default is for aluminum.
conductivity.title: Conductivity

screen_material_spacing.description: Spacing assumed to be the same in both directions.
screen_material_spacing.title: Screen Material Spacing

screen_material_diameter.description: Diameter assumed to be the same in both directions.
screen_material_diameter.title: Screen Material Diameter

screen_to_glass_distance.description: Distance from the window screen to the adjacent glass surface.
screen_to_glass_distance.title: Screen To Glass Distance

top_opening_multiplier.description: Effective area for air flow at the top of the screen divided by the perpendicular area between the glass and the top of the screen.
top_opening_multiplier.title: Top Opening Multiplier

bottom_opening_multiplier.description: Effective area for air flow at the bottom of the screen divided by the perpendicular area between the glass and the bottom of the screen.
bottom_opening_multiplier.title: Bottom Opening Multiplier

left_side_opening_multiplier.description: Effective area for air flow at the left side of the screen divided by the perpendicular area between the glass and the left side of the screen.
left_side_opening_multiplier.title: Left Side Opening Multiplier

right_side_opening_multiplier.description: Effective area for air flow at the right side of the screen divided by the perpendicular area between the glass and the right side of the screen.
right_side_opening_multiplier.title: Right Side Opening Multiplier

angle_of_resolution_for_screen_transmitt.description: Select the resolution of azimuth and altitude angles for the screen transmittance map. A value of 0 means no transmittance map will be generated. Valid values for this field are 0, 1, 2, 3 and 5.
angle_of_resolution_for_screen_transmitt.title: Angle Of Resolution For Screen Transmittance Output Map

screen_beam_beam_solar_transmittance.description: The beam-beam transmittance of the screen material at normal incidence. This input field is the same as the material openness area fraction and can be autocalculated from the wire spacing and wire and diameter. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.

screen_beam_diffuse_solar_transmittance.description: The beam-diffuse solar transmittance of the screen material at normal incidence averaged over the entire spectrum of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.

screen_beam_beam_visible_transmittance.description: The beam-beam visible transmittance of the screen material at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.

screen_beam_diffuse_visible_transmittanc.description: The beam-diffuse visible transmittance of the screen material at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
screen_beam_diffuse_visible_transmittanc.title: Screen Beam Diffuse Visible Transmittance

screen_beam_diffuse_visible_reflectance.description: Beam-diffuse visible reflectance of the screen material at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
screen_beam_diffuse_visible_reflectance.title: Screen Beam Diffuse Visible Reflectance

screen_infrared_transmittance.description: The long-wave hemispherical transmittance of the screen material. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.

screen_infrared_emissivity.description: The long-wave hemispherical emissivity of the screen material. Assumed to be the same for both sides of the screen.
screen_infrared_emissivity.title: Screen Infrared Emissivity

visible_reflectance.description: Assumed same for both sides Assumed independent of incidence angle

shade_beam_diffuse_visible_transmittance.description: The beam-diffuse visible transmittance at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides of the shade.

shade_beam_diffuse_visible_reflectance_a.description: The beam-diffuse visible reflectance at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides of the shade.
shade_beam_diffuse_visible_reflectance_a.title: Shade Beam Diffuse Visible Reflectance At Normal Incidence

shade_material_infrared_transmittance.description: The long-wave transmittance of the shade material at zero shade openness. Assumed to be the same for front and back sides of the shade.

airflow_destination.description: If ReturnAir is selected, the name of the Return Air Node may be specified below.

maximum_flow_rate.description: Above is m3/s per m of glazing width
maximum_flow_rate.title: Maximum Flow Rate

airflow_return_air_node_name.description: Name of the return air node for this airflow window if the Airflow Destination is ReturnAir. If left blank, defaults to the first return air node for the zone of the window surface.

frame_width.description: Width of frame in plane of window Frame width assumed the same on all sides of window

frame_inside_projection.description: Amount that frame projects inward from the inside face of the glazing

divider_solar_absorptance.description: Assumed same on outside and inside of divider

divider_visible_absorptance.description: Assumed same on outside and inside of divider

divider_thermal_hemispherical_emissivity.description: Assumed same on outside and inside of divider
divider_thermal_hemispherical_emissivity.title: Divider Thermal Hemispherical Emissivity

inside_reveal_depth.description: Distance from plane of inside surface of glazing to plane of inside surface of wall.
