month_that_storm_glass_layer_is_taken_of.title: Month That Storm Glass Layer Is Taken Off

day_of_month_that_storm_glass_layer_is_t.title: Day Of Month That Storm Glass Layer Is Taken Off

shading_control_sequence_number.description: If multiple WindowShadingControl objects are used than the order that they deploy the window shades can be set with this field. The first WindowShadingControl should be 1 and subsequent WindowShadingControl should 2 or 3 or higher. This is usually used when the Multiple Surface Control Type field is set to Group and groups of windows are being controlled in a certain order.
shading_control_sequence_number.title: Shading Control Sequence Number

construction_with_shading_name.description: Required if Shading Type = SwitchableGlazing Required if Shading Type = interior or exterior shade or blind, or exterior screen, and "Shading Device Material Name" is not specified. If both "Construction with Shading Name" and "Shading Device Material Name" are entered, the former takes precedence.
construction_with_shading_name.title: Construction With Shading Name

shading_control_type.description: OnIfScheduleAllows requires that Schedule Name be specified and Shading Control Is Scheduled = Yes. AlwaysOn, AlwaysOff and OnIfScheduleAllows are the only valid control types for ExteriorScreen. The following six control types are used primarily to reduce zone cooling load due to window solar gain Following entry should be used only if Shading Type = SwitchableGlazing and window is in a daylit zone The following three control types are used to reduce zone Heating load. They can be used with any Shading Type but are most appropriate for opaque interior or exterior shades with high insulating value ("opaque movable insulation") The following two control types are used to reduce zone heating and cooling load. They can be used with any Shading Type but are most appropriate for translucent interior or exterior shades with high insulating value ("translucent movable insulation") The following two control types are used to reduce zone Cooling load. They can be used with any Shading Type but are most appropriate for interior or exterior blinds,interior or exterior shades with low insulating value, or switchable glazing The following four control types require that both Setpoint and Setpoint2 be specified Setpoint will correspond to outdoor air temp or zone air temp (deg C) Setpoint2 will correspond to solar on window or horizontal solar (W/m2) The following three control types require that both Setpoint and Setpoint2 be specified Setpoint corresponds to solar radiation incident (W/m2) Setpoint2 corresponds to luminance (cd/m2) They can only be used in zones with daylighting controls. They are applicable to any Shading Type except ExteriorScreen.
shading_control_type.title: Shading Control Type

schedule_name.description: Required if Shading Control Is Scheduled = Yes. If schedule value = 1, shading control is active, i.e., shading can take place only if the control test passes. If schedule value = 0, shading is off whether or not the control test passes. Schedule Name is required if Shading Control Is Scheduled = Yes. If Schedule Name is not specified, shading control is assumed to be active at all times.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

setpoint.description: W/m2 for solar-based controls, W for cooling- or heating-based controls, deg C for temperature-based controls. Unused for Shading Control Type = AlwaysOn, AlwaysOff, OnIfScheduleAllows, OnIfHighGlare, Glare, and DaylightIlluminance
setpoint.title: Setpoint

shading_control_is_scheduled.description: If Yes, Schedule Name is required; if No, Schedule Name is not used. Shading Control Is Scheduled = Yes is required if Shading Control Type = OnIfScheduleAllows.
shading_control_is_scheduled.title: Shading Control Is Scheduled

glare_control_is_active.description: If Yes and window is in a daylit zone, shading is on if zone's discomfort glare index exceeds the maximum discomfort glare index specified in the Daylighting object referenced by the zone. The glare test is OR'ed with the test specified by Shading Control Type. Glare Control Is Active = Yes is required if Shading Control Type = OnIfHighGlare.
glare_control_is_active.title: Glare Control Is Active

shading_device_material_name.description: Enter the name of a WindowMaterial:Shade, WindowMaterial:Screen or WindowMaterial:Blind object. Required if "Construction with Shading Name" is not specified. Not used if Shading Control Type = SwitchableGlazing, BetweenGlassShade, or BetweenGlassBlind. If both "Construction with Shading Name" and "Shading Device Material Name" are entered, the former takes precedence.
shading_device_material_name.title: Shading Device Material Name

type_of_slat_angle_control_for_blinds.description: Used only if Shading Type = InteriorBlind, ExteriorBlind or BetweenGlassBlind. If choice is ScheduledSlatAngle then Slat Angle Schedule Name is required.
type_of_slat_angle_control_for_blinds.title: Type Of Slat Angle Control For Blinds

slat_angle_schedule_name.description: Used only if Shading Type = InteriorBlind, ExteriorBlind or BetweenGlassBlind. Required if Type of Slat Angle Control for Blinds = ScheduledSlatAngle Schedule values should be degrees (0 minimum, 180 maximum)
slat_angle_schedule_name.title: Slat Angle Schedule Name

setpoint_2.description: W/m2 for solar-based controls, deg C for temperature-based controls, cd/m2 for luminance based controls. Used only as the second setpoint for the following two-setpoint control types: OnIfHighOutdoorAirTempAndHighSolarOnWindow, OnIfHighOutdoorAirTempAndHighHorizontalSolar, OnIfHighZoneAirTempAndHighSolarOnWindow, OnIfHighZoneAirTempAndHighHorizontalSolar, OnIfHighSolarOrHighLuminanceTillMidnight, OnIfHighSolarOrHighLuminanceTillSunset, and OnIfHighSolarOrHighLuminanceTillNextMorning.
setpoint_2.title: Setpoint 2

daylighting_control_object_name.description: Reference to the Daylighting:Controls object that provides the glare and illuminance control to the zone.
daylighting_control_object_name.title: Daylighting Control Object Name

multiple_surface_control_type.description: When Sequential is used the list of fenestration surfaces are controlled individually in the order specified When Group is used the entire list is controlled simultaneously and if glare control is needed the entire group of window shades are deployed together a the same time
multiple_surface_control_type.title: Multiple Surface Control Type

initial_temperature.description: This is temperature in time of window fabrication
initial_temperature.title: Initial Temperature

initial_pressure.description: This is pressure in time of window fabrication
initial_pressure.title: Initial Pressure

construction_name.description: To be matched with a construction in this input file
construction_name.title: Construction Name

building_surface_name.description: Name of Surface (Wall, usually) the Window is on (i.e., Base Surface) Window assumes the azimuth and tilt angles of the surface it is on.
building_surface_name.title: Building Surface Name

outside_boundary_condition_object.description: Specify a surface name in an adjacent zone for known interior windows. Specify a zone name of an adjacent zone to automatically generate the interior window in the adjacent zone. a blank field will set up a Window in an adjacent zone (same zone as adjacent to base surface)
outside_boundary_condition_object.title: Outside Boundary Condition Object

multiplier.description: Used only for Surface Type = WINDOW, GLASSDOOR or DOOR Non-integer values will be truncated to integer
multiplier.title: Multiplier

starting_x_coordinate.description: Window starting coordinate is specified relative to the Base Surface origin.
starting_x_coordinate.title: Starting X Coordinate

starting_z_coordinate.description: How far up the wall the Window starts. (in 2-d, this would be a Y Coordinate)
starting_z_coordinate.title: Starting Z Coordinate

ceiling_height.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the average height of the zone is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used. Note that the Zone Ceiling Height is the distance from the Floor to the Ceiling in the Zone, not an absolute height from the ground.
ceiling_height.title: Ceiling Height

volume.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the volume of the zone is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used.
volume.title: Volume

floor_area.description: If this field is 0.0, negative or autocalculate, then the floor area of the zone is automatically calculated and used in subsequent calculations. If this field is positive, then the number entered here will be used.
floor_area.title: Floor Area

zone_inside_convection_algorithm.description: Will default to same value as SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Inside object setting this field overrides the default SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Inside for this zone Simple = constant natural convection (ASHRAE) TARP = variable natural convection based on temperature difference (ASHRAE) CeilingDiffuser = ACH based forced and mixed convection correlations for ceiling diffuser configuration with simple natural convection limit AdaptiveConvectionAlgorithm = dynamic selection of convection models based on conditions TrombeWall = variable natural convection in an enclosed rectangular cavity ASTMC1340 = mixed convection correlations specified for attic zone
zone_inside_convection_algorithm.title: Zone Inside Convection Algorithm

zone_outside_convection_algorithm.description: Will default to same value as SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Outside object setting this field overrides the default SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Outside for this zone SimpleCombined = Combined radiation and convection coefficient using simple ASHRAE model TARP = correlation from models developed by ASHRAE, Walton, and Sparrow et. al. MoWiTT = correlation from measurements by Klems and Yazdanian for smooth surfaces DOE-2 = correlation from measurements by Klems and Yazdanian for rough surfaces AdaptiveConvectionAlgorithm = dynamic selection of correlations based on conditions
zone_outside_convection_algorithm.title: Zone Outside Convection Algorithm

air_balance_method.description: None: Only perform simple calculations without using a combined zone outdoor air. Quadrature: A combined outdoor air is used in the quadrature sum.
air_balance_method.title: Air Balance Method

induced_outdoor_air_due_to_unbalanced_du.title: Induced Outdoor Air Due To Unbalanced Duct Leakage

induced_outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the fraction values applied to the Induced Outdoor Air given in the previous input field (0.0 - 1.0).
induced_outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Induced Outdoor Air Schedule Name

carbon_dioxide_concentration.description: If Yes, CO2 simulation will be performed.
carbon_dioxide_concentration.title: Carbon Dioxide Concentration

outdoor_carbon_dioxide_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be in parts per million (ppm)
outdoor_carbon_dioxide_schedule_name.title: Outdoor Carbon Dioxide Schedule Name

generic_contaminant_concentration.description: If Yes, generic contaminant simulation will be performed.
generic_contaminant_concentration.title: Generic Contaminant Concentration

outdoor_generic_contaminant_schedule_nam.description: Schedule values should be generic contaminant concentration in parts per million (ppm)
outdoor_generic_contaminant_schedule_nam.title: Outdoor Generic Contaminant Schedule Name

algorithm.description: Determines which algorithm will be used to solve the air heat balance.
algorithm.title: Algorithm

do_space_heat_balance_for_sizing.description: If yes, space heat balance will be calculated and reported during sizing.
do_space_heat_balance_for_sizing.title: Do Space Heat Balance For Sizing

do_space_heat_balance_for_simulation.description: If yes, space heat balance will be calculated and reported during simulation.
do_space_heat_balance_for_simulation.title: Do Space Heat Balance For Simulation

adjust_zone_mixing_and_return_for_air_ma.description: If "AdjustMixingOnly", zone mixing object flow rates are adjusted to balance the zone air mass flow and zone infiltration air flow may be increased or decreased if required in order to balance the zone air mass flow. If "AdjustReturnOnly", zone total return flow rate is adjusted to balance the zone air mass flow and zone infiltration air flow may be increased or decreased if required in order to balance the zone air mass flow. If "AdjustMixingThenReturn", first the zone mixing objects flow rates are adjusted to balance the zone air flow, second zone total return flow rate is adjusted and zone infiltration air flow may be increased or decreased if required in order to balance the zone air mass flow. If "AdjustReturnThenMixing", first zone total return flow rate is adjusted to balance the zone air flow, second the zone mixing object flow rates are adjusted and infiltration air flow may be increased or decreased if required in order to balance the zone air mass flow.
adjust_zone_mixing_and_return_for_air_ma.title: Adjust Zone Mixing And Return For Air Mass Flow Balance

infiltration_balancing_method.description: This input field allows user to choose how zone infiltration flow is treated during the zone air mass flow balance calculation. AddInfiltrationFlow may add infiltration to the base flow specified in the infiltration object to balance the zone air mass flow. The additional infiltration air mass flow is not self-balanced. The base flow is assumed to be self-balanced. AdjustInfiltrationFlow may adjust the base flow calculated using the base flow specified in the infiltration object to balance the zone air mass flow. If it If no adjustment is required, then the base infiltration is assumed to be self-balanced. None will make no changes to the base infiltration flow.
infiltration_balancing_method.title: Infiltration Balancing Method

infiltration_balancing_zones.description: This input field allows user to choose which zones are included in infiltration balancing. MixingSourceZonesOnly allows infiltration balancing only in zones which as source zones for mixing which also have an infiltration object defined. AllZones allows infiltration balancing in any zone which has an infiltration object defined.
infiltration_balancing_zones.title: Infiltration Balancing Zones

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: units in Schedule should be fraction applied to capacity of the baseboard heat equipment, generally (0.0 - 1.0)
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

end_use_subcategory.description: Any text may be used here to categorize the end-uses in the ABUPS End Uses by Subcategory table.
end_use_subcategory.title: End Use Subcategory

zone_or_zonelist_name.description: If this field is left blank, the multipliers are applied to all the zones not specified
zone_or_zonelist_name.title: Zone Or Zonelist Name

temperature_capacity_multiplier.description: Used to alter the capacitance of zone air with respect to heat or temperature
temperature_capacity_multiplier.title: Temperature Capacity Multiplier

humidity_capacity_multiplier.description: Used to alter the capacitance of zone air with respect to moisture or humidity ratio
humidity_capacity_multiplier.title: Humidity Capacity Multiplier

carbon_dioxide_capacity_multiplier.description: Used to alter the capacitance of zone air with respect to zone air carbon dioxide concentration
carbon_dioxide_capacity_multiplier.title: Carbon Dioxide Capacity Multiplier

generic_contaminant_capacity_multiplier.description: Used to alter the capacitance of zone air with respect to zone air generic contaminant concentration
generic_contaminant_capacity_multiplier.title: Generic Contaminant Capacity Multiplier

design_generation_rate.description: Positive values represent sources and negative values represent sinks.
design_generation_rate.title: Design Generation Rate

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Design Generation Rate
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

generation_schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Design Generation Rate
generation_schedule_name.title: Generation Schedule Name

removal_schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Design removal Coefficient
removal_schedule_name.title: Removal Schedule Name

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Design Generation Rate Coefficient
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

cutoff_generic_contaminant_at_which_emis.description: When the zone concentration level is greater than the cutoff level, emission stops, and the source level is zero.
cutoff_generic_contaminant_at_which_emis.title: Cutoff Generic Contaminant At Which Emission Ceases

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Initial Emission Rate. When the value is equal to 1.0, the time will be reset to zero.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

schedule_name.description: Value in this schedule should be a fraction (generally 0.0 - 1.0) applied to the Initial Emission Rate. When the value is equal to 1.0, the time will be reset to zero.
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

carbon_dioxide_control_availability_sche.description: Availability schedule name for CO2 controller. Schedule value > 0 means the CO2 controller is enabled. If this field is blank, then CO2 controller is always enabled.
carbon_dioxide_control_availability_sche.title: Carbon Dioxide Control Availability Schedule Name

carbon_dioxide_setpoint_schedule_name.description: Schedule values should be carbon dioxide concentration in parts per million (ppm)
carbon_dioxide_setpoint_schedule_name.title: Carbon Dioxide Setpoint Schedule Name

minimum_carbon_dioxide_concentration_sch.description: Schedule values should be carbon dioxide concentration in parts per million (ppm) This field is used when the field System Outdoor Air Method = ProportionalControlBasedOnOccupancySchedule or ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOccupancy, or ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOARate in Controller:MechanicalVentilation
minimum_carbon_dioxide_concentration_sch.title: Minimum Carbon Dioxide Concentration Schedule Name

maximum_carbon_dioxide_concentration_sch.description: Schedule values should be carbon dioxide concentration in parts per million (ppm) This field is used when the field System Outdoor Air Method = ProportionalControlBasedOnOccupancySchedule or ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOccupancy or ProportionalControlBasedOnDesignOARate.
maximum_carbon_dioxide_concentration_sch.title: Maximum Carbon Dioxide Concentration Schedule Name

generic_contaminant_control_availability.description: Availability schedule name for generic contaminant controller. Schedule value > 0 means the generic contaminant controller is enabled. If this field is blank, then generic contaminant controller is always enabled.
generic_contaminant_control_availability.title: Generic Contaminant Control Availability Schedule Name

generic_contaminant_setpoint_schedule_na.description: Schedule values should be generic contaminant concentration in parts per million (ppm) This field is used when the field System Outdoor Air Method = IndoorAirQualityProcedureGenericContaminant in Controller:MechanicalVentilation
generic_contaminant_setpoint_schedule_na.title: Generic Contaminant Setpoint Schedule Name

humidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint_s.description: hourly schedule values should be in Relative Humidity (percent)
humidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint_s.title: Humidifying Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name

dehumidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint.description: hourly schedule values should be in Relative Humidity (percent)
dehumidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint.title: Dehumidifying Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name

control_type_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains appropriate control types for thermostat. Control types are integers: 0 - Uncontrolled (floating, no thermostat), 1 = ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeating, 2 = ThermostatSetpoint:SingleCooling, 3 = ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeatingOrCooling, 4 = ThermostatSetpoint:DualSetpoint
control_type_schedule_name.title: Control Type Schedule Name

control_1_name.description: Control names are names of individual control objects (e.g. ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeating) Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
control_1_name.title: Control 1 Name

control_2_name.description: Control names are names of individual control objects (e.g. ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeating) Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
control_2_name.title: Control 2 Name

control_3_name.description: Control names are names of individual control objects (e.g. ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeating) Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
control_3_name.title: Control 3 Name

control_4_name.description: Control names are names of individual control objects (e.g. ThermostatSetpoint:SingleHeating) Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
control_4_name.title: Control 4 Name

temperature_difference_between_cutout_an.description: This optional choice field provides a temperature difference between cut-out temperature and setpoint. The difference is used to adjust to heating or cooling setpoint based on control types.
temperature_difference_between_cutout_an.title: Temperature Difference Between Cutout And Setpoint

thermostat_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneControl:Thermostat object. This object modifies a ZoneControl:Thermostat object to add a radiative fraction.
thermostat_name.title: Thermostat Name

radiative_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule values of 0.0 indicate no operative temperature control
radiative_fraction_schedule_name.title: Radiative Fraction Schedule Name

adaptive_comfort_model_type.description: the cooling setpoint temperature schedule of the referenced thermostat will be adjusted based on the selected adaptive comfort model type
adaptive_comfort_model_type.title: Adaptive Comfort Model Type

number_of_heating_stages.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for heating temperature offset
number_of_heating_stages.title: Number Of Heating Stages

stage_1_heating_temperature_offset.description: The heating temperature offset is used to determine heating stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the heating setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is less than Stage 1 value and greater than Stage 2 value, the stage number is 1.
stage_1_heating_temperature_offset.title: Stage 1 Heating Temperature Offset

stage_2_heating_temperature_offset.description: The heating temperature offset is used to determine heating stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the heating setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is less than Stage 2 value and greater than Stage 3 value, the stage number is 2. The value of this field has to be less the value at the previous field.
stage_2_heating_temperature_offset.title: Stage 2 Heating Temperature Offset

stage_3_heating_temperature_offset.description: The heating temperature offset is used to determine heating stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the heating setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is less than Stage 3 value and greater than Stage 4 value, the stage number is 3. The value of this field has to be less the value at the previous field.
stage_3_heating_temperature_offset.title: Stage 3 Heating Temperature Offset

stage_4_heating_temperature_offset.description: The heating temperature offset is used to determine heating stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the heating setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is less than Stage 4 value, the stage number is 4. The value of this field has to be less the value at the previous field.
stage_4_heating_temperature_offset.title: Stage 4 Heating Temperature Offset

number_of_cooling_stages.description: Enter the number of the following sets of data for cooling temperature offset
number_of_cooling_stages.title: Number Of Cooling Stages

cooling_temperature_setpoint_base_schedu.title: Cooling Temperature Setpoint Base Schedule Name

stage_1_cooling_temperature_offset.description: The cooling temperature offset is used to determine cooling stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the cooling setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is greater than Stage 1 value and less than Stage 2 value, the stage number is 1.
stage_1_cooling_temperature_offset.title: Stage 1 Cooling Temperature Offset

stage_2_cooling_temperature_offset.description: The cooling temperature offset is used to determine cooling stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the cooling setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is greater than Stage 2 value and less than Stage 3 value, the stage number is 2. The value of this field has to be greater than the value at the previous field.
stage_2_cooling_temperature_offset.title: Stage 2 Cooling Temperature Offset

stage_3_cooling_temperature_offset.description: The cooling temperature offset is used to determine cooling stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the cooling setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is greater than Stage 3 value and less than Stage 4 value, the stage number is 3. The value of this field has to be greater than the value at the previous field.
stage_3_cooling_temperature_offset.title: Stage 3 Cooling Temperature Offset

stage_4_cooling_temperature_offset.description: The cooling temperature offset is used to determine cooling stage number for multi stage equipment. When the temperature difference of the cooling setpoint and the controlled zone temperature at previous time step is greater than Stage 4 value, the stage number is 4. The value of this field has to be greater than the value at the previous field.
stage_4_cooling_temperature_offset.title: Stage 4 Cooling Temperature Offset

thermostat_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneControl:Thermostat object whose operation is to be modified to effect temperature control based on zone air humidity conditions. If the ZoneControl: Thermostat object references a ZoneList, simply enter the name of the ZoneControl:Thermostat object and this temperature and humidity thermostat control will be applied to all zones in the ZoneList. If the ZoneControl:Thermostat object references a ZoneList but it is desired that only a single zone within the ZoneList be controlled based on temperature and humidity control, then the name to be put here is <Zone Name> <Thermostat Name> where the Thermostat Name is the the name of the ZoneControl:Thermostat object.
thermostat_name.title: Thermostat Name

dehumidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint.description: Schedule values should be in Relative Humidity (percent)
dehumidifying_relative_humidity_setpoint.title: Dehumidifying Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name

overcool_constant_range.description: Maximum Overcool temperature range for cooling setpoint reduction. Used with Dehumidification Control Type = Overcool. A value of 0.0 indicates no zone temperature overcooling will be provided to gain additional dehumidification.
overcool_constant_range.title: Overcool Constant Range

overcool_range_schedule_name.description: Schedule values of 0.0 indicates no zone temperature overcooling will be provided to gain additional dehumidification. Schedule values should be >= 0 and <= 3 (deltaC).
overcool_range_schedule_name.title: Overcool Range Schedule Name

overcool_control_ratio.description: The value of this input field is used to adjust the cooling setpoint temperature (established by the associated ZoneControl:Thermostat object) downward based on the difference between the zone air relative humidity level and the dehumidifying relative humidity setpoint.
overcool_control_ratio.title: Overcool Control Ratio

averaging_method.description: The method used to calculate thermal comfort dry-bulb temperature setpoint for multiple people objects in a zone
averaging_method.title: Averaging Method

specific_people_name.description: Used only when Averaging Method = SpecificObject in the previous field.
specific_people_name.title: Specific People Name

thermal_comfort_control_type_schedule_na.description: The Thermal Comfort Control Type Schedule contains values that are appropriate control types. Thermal Comfort Control types are integers: 0 - Uncontrolled (floating), 1 = ThermostatSetpoint:ThermalComfort:Fanger:SingleHeating 2 = ThermostatSetpoint:ThermalComfort:Fanger:SingleCooling 3 = ThermostatSetpoint:ThermalComfort:Fanger:SingleHeatingOrCooling 4 = ThermostatSetpoint:ThermalComfort:Fanger:DualSetpoint
thermal_comfort_control_type_schedule_na.title: Thermal Comfort Control Type Schedule Name

thermal_comfort_control_1_name.description: Control type names are names for individual control type objects. Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
thermal_comfort_control_1_name.title: Thermal Comfort Control 1 Name

thermal_comfort_control_2_name.description: Control Type names are names for individual control type objects. Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
thermal_comfort_control_2_name.title: Thermal Comfort Control 2 Name

thermal_comfort_control_3_name.description: Control type names are names for individual control type objects. Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
thermal_comfort_control_3_name.title: Thermal Comfort Control 3 Name

thermal_comfort_control_4_name.description: Control type names are names for individual control type objects. Schedule values in these objects list actual setpoint temperatures for the control types
thermal_comfort_control_4_name.title: Thermal Comfort Control 4 Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

water_supply_storage_tank_name.description: In case of stand alone tank or underground water, leave this input blank
water_supply_storage_tank_name.title: Water Supply Storage Tank Name

flow_control_type.description: Water flow schedule should be selected when the water flow rate is known. Wind-driven flow should be selected when the water flow rate is unknown.
flow_control_type.title: Flow Control Type

effective_tower_height.description: This field is from either the spray or the wet pad to the top of the outlet.
effective_tower_height.title: Effective Tower Height

airflow_outlet_area.description: User have to specify effective area when outlet area is relatively bigger than the cross sectional area of cooltower. If the number of outlet is more than one, assume the air passes through only one.
airflow_outlet_area.title: Airflow Outlet Area

minimum_indoor_temperature.description: This field is to specify the indoor temperature below which cooltower is shutoff.
minimum_indoor_temperature.title: Minimum Indoor Temperature

zone_or_space_name.description: ZoneList and SpaceList names are not allowed.
zone_or_space_name.title: Zone Or Space Name

schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_flow_rate_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of ventilation for this set of attributes Choices: Flow/Zone => Design Flow Rate -- simply enter Design Flow Rate Flow/Area => Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area - Value * Floor Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate Flow/Person => Flow Rate per Person - Value * #people = Design Flow Rate AirChanges/Hour => Air Changes per Hour - Value * Floor Volume (zone) adjusted for m3/s = Design Volume Flow Rate "Vdesign" in Equation is the result.
design_flow_rate_calculation_method.title: Design Flow Rate Calculation Method

delta_temperature.description: This field contains the constant temperature differential between source and receiving zone or space below which mixing is shutoff. If a source zone is specified and it contains more than one space, the average source zone temperature will be used for control. This value must be greater than or equal to zero.
delta_temperature.title: Delta Temperature

delta_temperature_schedule_name.description: This scheulde contains the temperature differential between source and receiving zone or space below which mixing is shutoff. If a source zone is specified and it contains more than one space, the average source zone temperature will be used for control. Schedule values must be greater than or equal to zero.
delta_temperature_schedule_name.title: Delta Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.description: This schedule contains the receiving zone or space temperature versus time below which cross mixing is shutoff.
minimum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.title: Minimum Receiving Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.description: This schedule contains the receiving zone or space  temperature versus time above which cross mixing is shutoff.
maximum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.title: Maximum Receiving Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_source_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the source zone or space  temperature versus time below which cross mixing is shutoff.

rated_average_water_temperature.description: Rated average water temperature is the average of the inlet and outlet water temperatures at rated conditions.
rated_average_water_temperature.title: Rated Average Water Temperature

rated_water_mass_flow_rate.description: Standard is I=B=R Rating document where all baseboards are rated at either 0.063 kg/s (1 gpm) or 0.252 kg/s (4 gpm). It is recommended that users find data for the baseboard heater that corresponds to performance at 0.063 kg/s unless the flow rate is expected to be above 0.252 kg/s. If the flow rate is expected to be above 0.252 kg/s, this field should be 0.252 kg/s.
rated_water_mass_flow_rate.title: Rated Water Mass Flow Rate

heating_design_capacity.description: Enter the design heating capacity. Required field when the heating design capacity method HeatingDesignCapacity. This input field is rated heating capacity. Users must multiply the actual finned length published in the literature to determine the rated capacity. Rated Capacity is for an inlet air dry-bulb temperature of 18.0C, the Rated Water Mass Flow Rate of 0.063kg/s or 0.252kg/s, and the Rated Average Water Temperature between 32.2C and 115.6C.
heating_design_capacity.title: Heating Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the heating design capacity. HeatingDesignCapacity = > selected when the design heating capacity value or autosize is specified. CapacityPerFloorArea = > selected when the design heating capacity is determine from user specified heating capacity per floor area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity = > is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity.
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the cooling design capacity for scalable sizing. CoolingDesignCapacity => selected when the design cooling capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from user specified cooling capacity per floor area and total floor area of cooled zone served by the hydrolic unit. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity => is selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design cooling capacity of the system.
cooling_design_capacity_method.title: Cooling Design Capacity Method

cooling_design_capacity.description: Enter the design cooling capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method CoolingDesignCapacity.
cooling_design_capacity.title: Cooling Design Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the cooling design capacity per total floor area of cooled zones served by the unit. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Cooling Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized cooling design capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Design Capacity

control_type.description: Temperature on which unit is controlled
control_type.title: Control Type

fraction_of_radiant_energy_incident_on_p.title: Fraction Of Radiant Energy Incident On People

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Schedule values of 0 denote the unit is off. Schedule values >0.0 (usually 1.0) indicate that the dehumidifier is available to operate.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

air_inlet_node_name.description: Air inlet node for the dehumidifier must be a zone air exhaust node.
air_inlet_node_name.title: Air Inlet Node Name

air_outlet_node_name.description: Air outlet node for the dehumidifier must be a zone air inlet node.
air_outlet_node_name.title: Air Outlet Node Name

rated_water_removal.description: Rating point: air entering dehumidifier at 26.7 C (80 F) dry-bulb and 60% relative humidity.
rated_water_removal.title: Rated Water Removal

rated_energy_factor.description: Rating point: air entering dehumidifier at 26.7 C (80 F) dry-bulb and 60% relative humidity.
rated_energy_factor.title: Rated Energy Factor

water_removal_curve_name.description: Name of a curve that describes the water removal rate (normalized to rated conditions) as a function of the dry-bulb temperature and relative humidity of the air entering the dehumidifier. Curve output = (actual water removal/rated water removal) = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*RH + e*RH**2 + f*T*RH T = inlet air dry-bulb temperature (C) RH = inlet air RH (%)
water_removal_curve_name.title: Water Removal Curve Name

energy_factor_curve_name.description: Name of a curve that describes the energy factor (normalized to rated conditions) as a function of the dry-bulb temperature and relative humidity of the air entering the dehumidifier. Curve output = (actual energy factor/rated energy factor) = a + b*T + c*T**2 + d*RH + e*RH**2 + f*T*RH T = inlet air dry-bulb temperature (C) RH = inlet air RH (%)
energy_factor_curve_name.title: Energy Factor Curve Name

part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.description: Name of a curve that describes the part load fraction (PLF) of the system as a function of the part load ratio. Used to calculate dehumidifier run time fraction and electric power. quadratic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 cubic curve = a + b*PLR + c*PLR**2 + d*PLR**3 PLR = part load ratio (dehumidification load/steady state water removal capacity)
part_load_fraction_correlation_curve_nam.title: Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name

minimum_dry_bulb_temperature_for_dehumid.description: Dehumidifier shut off if inlet air (zone) temperature is below this value. This value must be less than the Maximum Dry-Bulb Temperature for Dehumidifier Operation.
minimum_dry_bulb_temperature_for_dehumid.title: Minimum Dry Bulb Temperature For Dehumidifier Operation

maximum_dry_bulb_temperature_for_dehumid.description: Dehumidifier shut off if inlet air (zone) temperature is above this value. This value must be greater than the Minimum Dry-Bulb Temperature for Dehumidifier Operation.
maximum_dry_bulb_temperature_for_dehumid.title: Maximum Dry Bulb Temperature For Dehumidifier Operation

off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.description: Parasitic electric power consumed when the dehumidifier is available to operate, but does not operate (i.e., no high humidity load to be met). Off cycle parasitic power is 0 when the availability schedule is 0. This electric load is considered as a heat gain to the zone air.
off_cycle_parasitic_electric_load.title: Off Cycle Parasitic Electric Load

condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.description: Name of storage tank used to collect water removed by the dehumidifier.
condensate_collection_water_storage_tank.title: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

heat_exchanger_name.description: Heat exchanger type must be HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent
heat_exchanger_name.title: Heat Exchanger Name

supply_air_flow_rate.description: This flow rate must match the supply fan's air flow rate.
supply_air_flow_rate.title: Supply Air Flow Rate

exhaust_air_flow_rate.description: This flow rate must match the supply fan air flow rate.
exhaust_air_flow_rate.title: Exhaust Air Flow Rate

supply_air_fan_name.description: Fan type must be Fan:OnOff or Fan:SystemModel
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

exhaust_air_fan_name.description: Fan type must be Fan:OnOff or Fan:SystemModel
exhaust_air_fan_name.title: Exhaust Air Fan Name

controller_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneHVAC:EnergyRecoveryVentilator:Controller object.
controller_name.title: Controller Name

ventilation_rate_per_unit_floor_area.description: 0.000508 m3/s-m2 corresponds to 0.1 ft3/min-ft2 Used only when supply and exhaust air flow rates are autosized.
ventilation_rate_per_unit_floor_area.title: Ventilation Rate Per Unit Floor Area

ventilation_rate_per_occupant.description: 0.00236 m3/s-person corresponds to 5 ft3/min-person Used only when supply and exhaust air flow rates are autosized.
ventilation_rate_per_occupant.title: Ventilation Rate Per Occupant

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

temperature_high_limit.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for economizer operation. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative
temperature_high_limit.title: Temperature High Limit

temperature_low_limit.description: Enter the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature limit for economizer operation. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative
temperature_low_limit.title: Temperature Low Limit

enthalpy_high_limit.description: Enter the maximum outdoor enthalpy limit for economizer operation. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative
enthalpy_high_limit.title: Enthalpy High Limit

dewpoint_temperature_limit.description: Enter the maximum outdoor dew point temperature limit for economizer operation. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative
dewpoint_temperature_limit.title: Dewpoint Temperature Limit

electronic_enthalpy_limit_curve_name.description: Enter the name of a quadratic or cubic curve which defines the maximum outdoor humidity ratio (function of outdoor dry-bulb temperature) for economizer operation. No input or blank input means this limit is not operative
electronic_enthalpy_limit_curve_name.title: Electronic Enthalpy Limit Curve Name

time_of_day_economizer_flow_control_sche.description: Schedule values greater than 0 indicate economizer operation is active. This schedule may be used with or without the High Humidity Control option. When used together, high humidity control has priority over economizer control.
time_of_day_economizer_flow_control_sche.title: Time Of Day Economizer Flow Control Schedule Name

high_humidity_control_flag.description: Select Yes to modify air flow rates based on a zone humidistat. Select No to disable this feature.
high_humidity_control_flag.title: High Humidity Control Flag

humidistat_control_zone_name.description: Enter the name of the zone where the humidistat is located.
humidistat_control_zone_name.title: Humidistat Control Zone Name

high_humidity_outdoor_air_flow_ratio.description: Enter the ratio of supply (outdoor) air to the maximum supply air flow rate when modified air flow rates are active based on high indoor humidity.
high_humidity_outdoor_air_flow_ratio.title: High Humidity Outdoor Air Flow Ratio

control_high_indoor_humidity_based_on_ou.description: If NO is selected, the air flow rate is modified any time indoor relative humidity is above humidistat setpoint. If YES is selected, outdoor air flow rate is modified any time indoor relative humidity is above the humidistat setpoint AND the outdoor humidity ratio is less than the indoor humidity ratio.
control_high_indoor_humidity_based_on_ou.title: Control High Indoor Humidity Based On Outdoor Humidity Ratio

zone_conditioning_equipment_list_name.description: Enter the name of a ZoneHVAC:EquipmentList object.
zone_conditioning_equipment_list_name.title: Zone Conditioning Equipment List Name

zone_air_inlet_node_or_nodelist_name.title: Zone Air Inlet Node Or Nodelist Name

zone_air_exhaust_node_or_nodelist_name.title: Zone Air Exhaust Node Or Nodelist Name

zone_return_air_node_or_nodelist_name.title: Zone Return Air Node Or Nodelist Name

zone_return_air_node_1_flow_rate_fractio.description: This schedule is multiplied times the base return air flow rate. If this field is left blank, the schedule defaults to 1.0 at all times.
zone_return_air_node_1_flow_rate_fractio.title: Zone Return Air Node 1 Flow Rate Fraction Schedule Name

zone_return_air_node_1_flow_rate_basis_n.description: The optional basis node(s) used to calculate the base return air flow rate for the first return air node in this zone. The return air flow rate is the sum of the flow rates at the basis node(s) multiplied by the Zone Return Air Flow Rate Fraction Schedule. If this  field is blank, then the base return air flow rate is the total supply inlet flow rate to the zone less the total exhaust node flow rate from the zone.
zone_return_air_node_1_flow_rate_basis_n.title: Zone Return Air Node 1 Flow Rate Basis Node Or Nodelist Name

outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.description: this is an outdoor air node
outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Inlet Node Name

cooler_outlet_node_name.description: this is a zone inlet node
cooler_outlet_node_name.title: Cooler Outlet Node Name

zone_relief_air_node_name.description: this is a zone exhaust node, optional if flow is being balanced elsewhere

throttling_range_temperature_difference.description: used for ZoneTemperatureDeadbandOnOffCycling hystersis range for thermostatic control
throttling_range_temperature_difference.title: Throttling Range Temperature Difference

cooling_load_control_threshold_heat_tran.description: Sign convention is that positive values indicate a cooling load
cooling_load_control_threshold_heat_tran.title: Cooling Load Control Threshold Heat Transfer Rate

second_evaporative_cooler_object_type.description: optional, used for direct/indirect configurations second cooler must be immediately downstream of first cooler, if present

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this exhaust system. Schedule value > 0 means it is available. If this field is blank, the exhaust system is always available. If the attached  AirLoopHVAC:ExhaustSystem is off, then the flow will be zero.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Zone the exhaust inlet node is part of
zone_name.title: Zone Name

inlet_node_name.description: Inlet node name for the exhaust. Must be a zone exhaust node.
inlet_node_name.title: Inlet Node Name

outlet_node_name.description: Outlet node name for the exhaust

flow_control_type.description: Control type of the zone exhaust flow

exhaust_flow_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule name of the exhaust flow fraction. Used only with Scheduled control type. If this field is blank, the flow fraction is always 1.0.

supply_node_or_nodelist_name.description: Used only with FollowSupply control type.

minimum_zone_temperature_limit_schedule_.description: Schedule name of the Minimum Zone Temperature Limit in degree Celsius If this field is blank, there is no limit.

minimum_exhaust_flow_fraction_schedule_n.description: Schedule name of the minimum exhaust flow fraction. Applied when the zone temperature falls below the Minimum Zone Temperature Limit.

balanced_exhaust_fraction_schedule_name.description: Schedule name of the Balanced Exhaust Fraction.

model_setup_and_sizing_program_calling_m.title: Model Setup And Sizing Program Calling Manager Name

primary_air_inlet_node_name.description: Air inlet node for the unit must be a zone air exhaust Node.

primary_air_outlet_node_name.description: Air outlet node for the unit must be a zone air inlet node.
primary_air_outlet_node_name.title: Primary Air Outlet Node Name

secondary_air_inlet_node_name.description: Inlet air used for heat rejection or air source
secondary_air_inlet_node_name.title: Secondary Air Inlet Node Name

secondary_air_outlet_node_name.description: Outlet air used for heat rejection or air source
secondary_air_outlet_node_name.title: Secondary Air Outlet Node Name

supply_inlet_water_storage_tank_name.description: Water use storage tank for alternate source of water consumed by device
