collection_outlet_water_storage_tank_nam.description: Water use storage tank for collection of condensate by device
collection_outlet_water_storage_tank_nam.title: Collection Outlet Water Storage Tank Name

ambient_zone_name.description: Used for modeling device losses to surrounding zone
ambient_zone_name.title: Ambient Zone Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

low_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.title: Low Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio

medium_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.description: Medium Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio should be greater than Low Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio
medium_speed_supply_air_flow_ratio.title: Medium Speed Supply Air Flow Ratio

outdoor_air_schedule_name.description: Value of schedule multiplies maximum outdoor air flow rate
outdoor_air_schedule_name.title: Outdoor Air Schedule Name

outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.description: Currently only one type OutdoorAir:Mixer object is available. This field should be left blank if the FanCoil is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through an AirTerminal:SingleDuct:Mixer object.
outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type

outdoor_air_mixer_name.description: If this field is blank, the OutdoorAir:Mixer is not used. This optional field specifies the name of the OutdoorAir:Mixer object. When used, this name needs to match name of the OutdoorAir:Mixer object. This field should be left blank if the FanCoil is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through an AirTerminal:SingleDuct:Mixer object.
outdoor_air_mixer_name.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Name

supply_air_fan_object_type.description: Fan type must be according to capacity control method (see I/O) For ConstantFanVariableFlow a Fan:OnOff or Fan:ConstantVolume is valid. For CyclingFan a Fan:OnOff is valid. For VariableFanVariableFlow or VariableFanConstantFlow a Fan:VariableVolume is valid. For ASHRAE90.1 a Fan:OnOff or Fan:VariableVolume is valid. Fan:SystemModel is valid for all capacity control methods. The fan's inlet node should be the same as the outdoor air mixer's mixed air node.
supply_air_fan_object_type.title: Supply Air Fan Object Type

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule that controls fan operation. Schedule Name values of 0 denote cycling fan operation (fan cycles with cooling coil). Schedule values greater than 0 denote constant fan operation (fan runs continually regardless of coil operation). The fan operating mode defaults to cycling fan operation if this field is left blank. This input field is currently used with MultiStageFan capacity control method
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

minimum_supply_air_temperature_in_coolin.description: For Capacity Control Method = ASHRAE90VariableFan, enter the minimum air temperature in cooling mode. Leave this field blank or enter 0 to control to the zone load per ASHRAE 90.1. In this case, a zone sizing simulation is required.
minimum_supply_air_temperature_in_coolin.title: Minimum Supply Air Temperature In Cooling Mode

maximum_supply_air_temperature_in_heatin.description: For Capacity Control Method = ASHRAE90VariableFan, enter the maximum air temperature in heating mode. Leave this field blank or enter 0 to control to the zone load per ASHRAE 90.1. In this case, a zone sizing simulation is required.
maximum_supply_air_temperature_in_heatin.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature In Heating Mode

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Name of zone system is serving
zone_name.title: Zone Name

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the maximum heating power input capacity. HeatingDesignCapacity = > selected when the design heating capacity value or autosize is specified. CapacityPerFloorArea = > selected when the design heating capacity is determine from user specified heating capacity per floor area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity = > is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity.
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity.description: Enter the design heating capacity. Required field when the heating design capacity method HeatingDesignCapacity.
heating_design_capacity.title: Heating Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of autosized heating design capacity. Required field when capacity the heating design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

combustion_efficiency.description: Not used for non-gas radiant heaters
combustion_efficiency.title: Combustion Efficiency

fraction_of_input_converted_to_radiant_e.description: Radiant+latent+lost fractions must sum to 1 or less, remainder is considered convective heat
fraction_of_input_converted_to_radiant_e.title: Fraction Of Input Converted To Radiant Energy

fraction_of_input_converted_to_latent_en.title: Fraction Of Input Converted To Latent Energy

fraction_of_input_that_is_lost.description: Fraction of input vented to outdoor environment
fraction_of_input_that_is_lost.title: Fraction Of Input That Is Lost

temperature_control_type.description: Temperature type used to control unit
temperature_control_type.title: Temperature Control Type

heating_setpoint_temperature_schedule_na.description: This setpoint is an "operative temperature" setpoint
heating_setpoint_temperature_schedule_na.title: Heating Setpoint Temperature Schedule Name

fraction_of_radiant_energy_incident_on_p.description: This will affect thermal comfort but from an energy balance standpoint this value gets added to the convective gains from the radiant heater
fraction_of_radiant_energy_incident_on_p.title: Fraction Of Radiant Energy Incident On People

availability_schedule_name.description: Enter the availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

minimum_supply_air_temperature_schedule_.description: Values in this schedule are used as a constraint in choosing the feasible settings for supply air flow rate and ouside air fraction in each operating mode. If this field is blank, no minimum is imposed.
minimum_supply_air_temperature_schedule_.title: Minimum Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_supply_air_temperature_schedule_.description: Values in this schedule are used as a constraint in choosing the feasible settings for supply air flow rate and outdoor air fraction in each operating mode. If this field is blank, no maximum is imposed.
maximum_supply_air_temperature_schedule_.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_supply_air_humidity_ratio_schedu.description: Values in this schedule are used as a constraint in choosing the feasible settings for supply air flow rate and outdoor air fraction in each operating mode. If this field is blank, no minimum is imposed.
minimum_supply_air_humidity_ratio_schedu.title: Minimum Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name

maximum_supply_air_humidity_ratio_schedu.description: Values in this schedule are used as a constraint in choosing the feasible settings for supply air flow rate and outdoor air fraction in each operating mode. If this field is blank, no maximum is imposed.
maximum_supply_air_humidity_ratio_schedu.title: Maximum Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name

method_to_choose_controlled_inputs_and_p.description: Select the method that will be used to choose operating mode(s), supply air flow rate(s), outdoor air fraction(s) and part runtime fraction(s) in each time step. "Automatic" = chooses controlled inputs and part runtime fraction(s) to minimize resource use within each time step while best satisfying requested sensible cooling, dehumidification and ventilation, and subject to constraints. "User Defined" = EMS will be used to choose controlled inputs and part runtime fraction(s) in each time step. If this field is blank, default to "Automatic".
method_to_choose_controlled_inputs_and_p.title: Method To Choose Controlled Inputs And Part Runtime Fraction

return_air_node_name.description: Return air node for the hybrid unit must be a zone exhaust node.
return_air_node_name.title: Return Air Node Name

outdoor_air_node_name.description: Outdoor air node for the hybrid unit must be an outdoor air node.
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

supply_air_node_name.description: Supply air node for the hybrid unit must be a zone air inlet node.
supply_air_node_name.title: Supply Air Node Name

relief_node_name.description: Relief node for the hybrid unit must be a zone exhaust node, unless flow is being balanced elsewhere.
relief_node_name.title: Relief Node Name

system_maximum_supply_air_flow_rate.description: The value in this field represents the maximum supply air volume flow rate among all operating modes. Values of extensive variables in lookup tables are normalized by the system maximum supply air mass flow rate that was used to build performance curves. The value in this field is used to rescale the output from exenstive variables to a desired system size.
system_maximum_supply_air_flow_rate.title: System Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate

external_static_pressure_at_system_maxim.description: Input the external static pressure when the system operates at maximum supply air flow rate. Fan affinity laws are used to scale supply fan power from the values tabulated in lookup tables, to values that match the external static pressure input to this field. If this field is blank, the supply fan power is not scaled from the values tabulated in lookup tables.
external_static_pressure_at_system_maxim.title: External Static Pressure At System Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate

fan_heat_included_in_lookup_tables.description: This field specifies if the fan heat is accounted for in the lookup tables.
fan_heat_included_in_lookup_tables.title: Fan Heat Included In Lookup Tables

fan_heat_gain_location.description: This field specifies where to add the fan heat in the air stream.
fan_heat_gain_location.title: Fan Heat Gain Location

fan_heat_in_air_stream_fraction.description: 0.0 means no fan heat is added to the air stream, 1.0 means all fan heat is added to the air stream.
fan_heat_in_air_stream_fraction.title: Fan Heat In Air Stream Fraction

scaling_factor.description: The value in this field scales all extensive performance variables including: supply air mass flow rate, fuel uses, and water use. If this field is blank, the default scaling factor is 1.
scaling_factor.title: Scaling Factor

minimum_time_between_mode_change.description: Any mode selected will not operate for less time than the value input in this field. If the value in this field is larger than each timestep, the mode selected in one time step will persist in later time steps until the minimum time between mode change is satisfied. Supply air mass flow rate and outdoor air fraction within a mode are not subject to minimum runtime and may change in every time step. Mode 0 does not have a minimum time. If this field is blank, the default minimum time between mode change is 10 minutes.
minimum_time_between_mode_change.title: Minimum Time Between Mode Change

first_fuel_type.description: Select the fuel type associated with field: "System Electric Power Lookup Table" in each mode. If this field is blank, default first fuel type = Electricity.
first_fuel_type.title: First Fuel Type

second_fuel_type.description: Select the fuel type associated with field: "System Second Fuel Consumption Lookup Table" in each mode. If this field is blank, default second fuel type = None.
second_fuel_type.title: Second Fuel Type

third_fuel_type.description: Select the fuel type associated with field: "System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table" in each mode. If this field is blank, default third fuel type = None.
third_fuel_type.title: Third Fuel Type

objective_function_to_minimize.description: In each time step, controlled variables will be chosen to minimize the selection in this field, subject to constraints. If this field is blank, the objective function will minimize electricity use.
objective_function_to_minimize.title: Objective Function To Minimize

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object. Information in that object will be used to compute the minimum outdoor air flow rate in each time step. If this field is blank, the system may still supply outdoor air, if it is capable as described by lookup tables, when doing so is the most efficient way to satisfy other constraints.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

mode_0_name.description: Enter a name for Mode 0. Mode 0 describes equipment performance in standby. Mode 0 is usually characterized by electricity use for controls and crankcase heaters, or other standby resouce consumption. Mode 0 will be chosen for any timestep, or portion of timestep, when no ventilation, cooling, humidification, or dehumidification is required. Mode 0 is available at any environmental condition.
mode_0_name.title: Mode 0 Name

mode_0_supply_air_temperature_lookup_tab.description: Enter the name of the Supply Air Temperature Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in C. If this field is blank, Mode 0 will not be considered for any period that requires ventilation, heating, cooling, humidification, or dehumidification. If this field is blank, when Mode 0 is chosen (during standby periods) the supply air temperature will equal the return air temperature.
mode_0_supply_air_temperature_lookup_tab.title: Mode 0 Supply Air Temperature Lookup Table Name

mode_0_supply_air_humidity_ratio_lookup_.description: Enter the name of the Supply Air Humidity Ratio Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in kgWater/kgDryAir. If this field is blank, Mode 0 will not be considered for any period that requires ventilation, heating, cooling, humidification, or dehumidification. If this field is blank, when Mode 0 is chosen (during standby periods) the supply air humidty ratio will equal the return air humidity ratio.
mode_0_supply_air_humidity_ratio_lookup_.title: Mode 0 Supply Air Humidity Ratio Lookup Table Name

mode_0_system_electric_power_lookup_tabl.description: Enter the name of the Electric Power Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in W. If this field is blank, Mode 0 does not consume electricity.
mode_0_system_electric_power_lookup_tabl.title: Mode 0 System Electric Power Lookup Table Name

mode_0_supply_fan_electric_power_lookup_.description: Enter the name of the Supply Fan Electric Power Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in W. If this field is blank, Mode 0 does not consume electricity for supply fan.
mode_0_supply_fan_electric_power_lookup_.title: Mode 0 Supply Fan Electric Power Lookup Table Name

mode_0_external_static_pressure_lookup_t.description: Enter the name of the External Static Pressure Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in Pa. If this field is blank, external static pressure will not be reported.
mode_0_external_static_pressure_lookup_t.title: Mode 0 External Static Pressure Lookup Table Name

mode_0_system_second_fuel_consumption_lo.description: Enter the name of the System Second Fuel Consumption Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in W. If this field is blank, Mode 0 does not consume a second fuel.
mode_0_system_second_fuel_consumption_lo.title: Mode 0 System Second Fuel Consumption Lookup Table Name

mode_0_system_third_fuel_consumption_loo.description: Enter the name of the System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in W. If this field is blank, Mode 0 does not consume a third fuel.
mode_0_system_third_fuel_consumption_loo.title: Mode 0 System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table Name

mode_0_system_water_use_lookup_table_nam.description: Enter the name of the System Water Use Lookup Table for Mode 0. Units for lookup table values should be in kg/s. If this field is blank, Mode 0 does not consume water.
mode_0_system_water_use_lookup_table_nam.title: Mode 0 System Water Use Lookup Table Name

mode_0_outdoor_air_fraction.description: Enter the outdoor air fraction for Mode 0. If this field is blank, the outdoor air fraction for Mode 0 will be 0.00.
mode_0_outdoor_air_fraction.title: Mode 0 Outdoor Air Fraction

mode_0_supply_air_mass_flow_rate_ratio.description: Enter the supply air mass flow rate ratio for Mode 0. The value in this field will be used to determine the supply air mass flow rate in Mode 0. Supply air mass flow rate ratio describes supply air mass flow rate as a fraction of mass flow rate associated with the value in field: "System Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate". If this field is blank, the supply air mass flow rate ratio for Mode 0 will be 0.
mode_0_supply_air_mass_flow_rate_ratio.title: Mode 0 Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Ratio

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_supply_air_node_name.description: Must match a zone air inlet node name.
zone_supply_air_node_name.title: Zone Supply Air Node Name

zone_exhaust_air_node_name.description: Should match a zone air exhaust node name. This field is optional, but is required if this this object is used with other forced air equipment.
zone_exhaust_air_node_name.title: Zone Exhaust Air Node Name

system_inlet_air_node_name.description: This field is only required when the Ideal Loads Air System is connected to an AirloopHVAC:ZoneReturnPlenum, otherwise leave this field blank. When connected to a plenum the return plenum Outlet Node Name (or Induced Air Outlet Node Name when connecting multiple ideal loads air sytems) is entered here. The two ideal loads air system node name fields described above, the Zone Supply Air Node Name and the Zone Exhaust Air Node Name must also be entered. The Zone Supply Air Node Name must match a zone inlet air node name for the zone where this Ideal Loads Air System is connected. The Zone Exhaust Air Node Name must match an inlet air node name of an AirloopHVAC:ReturnAirPlenum object.
system_inlet_air_node_name.title: System Inlet Air Node Name

maximum_heating_supply_air_humidity_rati.title: Maximum Heating Supply Air Humidity Ratio

minimum_cooling_supply_air_humidity_rati.title: Minimum Cooling Supply Air Humidity Ratio

maximum_heating_air_flow_rate.description: This field is ignored if Heating Limit = NoLimit If this field is blank, there is no limit.
maximum_heating_air_flow_rate.title: Maximum Heating Air Flow Rate

maximum_sensible_heating_capacity.description: This field is ignored if Heating Limit = NoLimit If this field is blank, there is no limit.
maximum_sensible_heating_capacity.title: Maximum Sensible Heating Capacity

maximum_cooling_air_flow_rate.description: This field is ignored if Cooling Limit = NoLimit This field is required if Outdoor Air Economizer Type is anything other than NoEconomizer.
maximum_cooling_air_flow_rate.title: Maximum Cooling Air Flow Rate

maximum_total_cooling_capacity.description: This field is ignored if Cooling Limit = NoLimit
maximum_total_cooling_capacity.title: Maximum Total Cooling Capacity

heating_availability_schedule_name.description: If blank, heating is always available.
heating_availability_schedule_name.title: Heating Availability Schedule Name

cooling_availability_schedule_name.description: If blank, cooling is always available.
cooling_availability_schedule_name.title: Cooling Availability Schedule Name

dehumidification_control_type.description: ConstantSensibleHeatRatio means that the ideal loads system will be controlled to meet the sensible cooling load, and the latent cooling rate will be computed using a constant sensible heat ratio (SHR) Humidistat means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to satisfy the humidistat. None means that there is no dehumidification. ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio means that during cooling the supply air will always be at the Minimum Cooling Supply Humidity Ratio.
dehumidification_control_type.title: Dehumidification Control Type

cooling_sensible_heat_ratio.description: This field is applicable only when Dehumidification Control Type is ConstantSensibleHeatRatio
cooling_sensible_heat_ratio.title: Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio

humidification_control_type.description: None means that there is no humidification. Humidistat means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to satisfy the humidistat. ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio means that during heating the supply air will always be at the Maximum Heating Supply Humidity Ratio.
humidification_control_type.title: Humidification Control Type

design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.description: When the name of a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir object is entered, the minimum outdoor air flow rate will be computed using these specifications. The outdoor air flow rate will also be affected by the next two fields. If this field is blank, there will be no outdoor air and the remaining fields will be ignored.
design_specification_outdoor_air_object_.title: Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name

outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.description: This field is required if the system provides outdoor air Enter the name of an outdoor air node. This node name is also specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
outdoor_air_inlet_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Inlet Node Name

demand_controlled_ventilation_type.description: This field controls how the minimum outdoor air flow rate is calculated. None means that design occupancy will be used to compute the minimum outdoor air flow rate OccupancySchedule means that current occupancy level will be used. CO2Setpoint means that the design occupancy will be used to compute the minimum outdoor air flow rate and the outdoor air flow rate may be increased if necessary to maintain the indoor air carbon dioxide setpoint defined in a ZoneControl:ContaminantController object.
demand_controlled_ventilation_type.title: Demand Controlled Ventilation Type

outdoor_air_economizer_type.description: DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy will increase the outdoor air flow rate when there is a cooling load and the outdoor air temperature or enthalpy is below the zone exhaust air temperature or enthalpy.
outdoor_air_economizer_type.title: Outdoor Air Economizer Type

latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.description: Applicable only if Heat Recovery Type is Enthalpy.
latent_heat_recovery_effectiveness.title: Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Name of zone system is serving
zone_name.title: Zone Name

surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.description: Identifies surfaces that radiant system is embedded in. For a system with multiple surfaces, enter the name of a ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:SurfaceGroup object.
surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.title: Surface Name Or Radiant Surface Group Name

hydronic_tubing_length.description: (total length of pipe embedded in surface)
hydronic_tubing_length.title: Hydronic Tubing Length

pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.description: Modifies the Rated Flow Rate of the pump on a time basis the default is that the pump is ON and runs according to its other operational requirements specified above. The schedule is for special pump operations. Values here are between 0 and 1 and are multipliers on the previous field (Rated Flow Rate).
pump_flow_rate_schedule_name.title: Pump Flow Rate Schedule Name

heating_high_water_temperature_schedule_.description: Water and control temperatures for heating work together to provide a linear function that determines the water temperature sent to the radiant system. The current control temperature (see Temperature Control Type above) is compared to the high and low control temperatures at the current time. If the control temperature is above the high temperature, then the inlet water temperature is set to the low water temperature. If the control temperature is below the low temperature, then the inlet water temperature is set to the high water temperature. If the control temperature is between the high and low value, then the inlet water temperature is linearly interpolated between the low and high water temperature values.
heating_high_water_temperature_schedule_.title: Heating High Water Temperature Schedule Name

heating_low_water_temperature_schedule_n.title: Heating Low Water Temperature Schedule Name

heating_high_control_temperature_schedul.title: Heating High Control Temperature Schedule Name

heating_low_control_temperature_schedule.title: Heating Low Control Temperature Schedule Name

cooling_high_water_temperature_schedule_.description: See note for Heating High Water Temperature Schedule above for interpretation information (or see the Input/Output Reference).
cooling_high_water_temperature_schedule_.title: Cooling High Water Temperature Schedule Name

cooling_low_water_temperature_schedule_n.title: Cooling Low Water Temperature Schedule Name

cooling_high_control_temperature_schedul.title: Cooling High Control Temperature Schedule Name

cooling_low_control_temperature_schedule.title: Cooling Low Control Temperature Schedule Name

fluid_to_radiant_surface_heat_transfer_m.description: This parameter identifies how the heat transfer between fluid being circulated through the radiant system and the radiant system (slab) is modeled. ConvectionOnly means that only convection between the fluid and the inside surface of the pipe is modeled using a conventional equation for flow inside a pipe. ISOStandard models convection between the fluid and the inside of of the pipe and conduction through the pipe material using equations specific to ISO Standard 11855-2.
fluid_to_radiant_surface_heat_transfer_m.title: Fluid To Radiant Surface Heat Transfer Model

running_mean_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperatur.description: this is the weighting factor in the equation that calculate the running mean outdoor dry-bulb temperature as a weighted average of the previous day’s running mean outdoor dry-bulb temperature and the previous day’s average outdoor dry-bulb temperature this value is only used by EnergyPlus when the user elects to use the RunningMeanOutdoorDryBulbTemperature control type
running_mean_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperatur.title: Running Mean Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature Weighting Factor

fraction_of_motor_inefficiencies_to_flui.title: Fraction Of Motor Inefficiencies To Fluid Stream

changeover_delay_time_period_schedule.description: Changeover delay schedule name for this system. Schedule value <= 0 allows changeover with no delay The schedule values are interpretted as hours. If this field is blank, the system allows changeover with no delay
changeover_delay_time_period_schedule.title: Changeover Delay Time Period Schedule

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Name of zone system is serving
zone_name.title: Zone Name

surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.description: Identifies surfaces that radiant system is embedded in. For a system with multiple surfaces, enter the name of a ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:SurfaceGroup object.
surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.title: Surface Name Or Radiant Surface Group Name

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the maximum electrical heating design capacity. HeatingDesignCapacity = > selected when the design heating capacity value or autosize is specified. CapacityPerFloorArea = > selected when the design heating capacity is determine from user specified heating capacity per floor area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity = > is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity.
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity.description: Enter the design heating capacity. Required field when the heating design capacity method HeatingDesignCapacity.
heating_design_capacity.title: Heating Design Capacity

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of autosized heating design capacity. Required field when capacity the heating design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: Name of zone system is serving
zone_name.title: Zone Name

surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.description: Identifies surfaces that radiant system is embedded in. For a system with multiple surfaces, enter the name of a ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:SurfaceGroup object.
surface_name_or_radiant_surface_group_na.title: Surface Name Or Radiant Surface Group Name

hydronic_tubing_length.description: (total length of pipe embedded in surface)
hydronic_tubing_length.title: Hydronic Tubing Length

heating_design_capacity.description: Enter the design heating capacity. Required field when the heating design capacity method HeatingDesignCapacity.
heating_design_capacity.title: Heating Design Capacity

cooling_design_capacity.description: Enter the design cooling capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method CoolingDesignCapacity.
cooling_design_capacity.title: Cooling Design Capacity

fluid_to_radiant_surface_heat_transfer_m.description: This parameter identifies how the heat transfer between fluid being circulated through the radiant system and the radiant system (slab) is modeled. ConvectionOnly means that only convection between the fluid and the inside surface of the pipe is modeled using a conventional equation for flow inside a pipe. ISOStandard models convection between the fluid and the inside of of the pipe and conduction through the pipe material using equations specific to ISO Standard 11855-2.
fluid_to_radiant_surface_heat_transfer_m.title: Fluid To Radiant Surface Heat Transfer Model

heating_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the heating design capacity. HeatingDesignCapacity = > selected when the design heating capacity value or autosize is specified. CapacityPerFloorArea = > selected when the design heating capacity is determine from user specified heating capacity per floor area and zone floor area. FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity = > is selected when the design heating capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design heating capacity.
heating_design_capacity_method.title: Heating Design Capacity Method

heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the heating design capacity per zone floor area. Required field when the heating design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
heating_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of autosized heating design capacity. Required field when capacity the heating design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_heating_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Heating Design Capacity

cooling_design_capacity_method.description: Enter the method used to determine the cooling design capacity for scalable sizing. CoolingDesignCapacity => selected when the design cooling capacity value is specified or auto-sized. CapacityPerFloorArea => selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from user specified cooling capacity per floor area and total floor area of cooled zone served by the hydrolic unit. FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity => is selected when the design cooling capacity is determined from a user specified fraction and the auto-sized design cooling capacity of the system.
cooling_design_capacity_method.title: Cooling Design Capacity Method

cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.description: Enter the cooling design capacity per total floor area of cooled zones served by the unit. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is CapacityPerFloorArea.
cooling_design_capacity_per_floor_area.title: Cooling Design Capacity Per Floor Area

fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.description: Enter the fraction of auto-sized cooling design capacity. Required field when the cooling design capacity method field is FractionOfAutosizedCoolingCapacity.
fraction_of_autosized_cooling_design_cap.title: Fraction Of Autosized Cooling Design Capacity

changeover_delay_time_period_schedule.description: Changeover delay schedule name for this system. Schedule value <= 0 allows changeover with no delay The schedule values are interpretted as hours. If this field is blank, the system allows changeover with no delay
changeover_delay_time_period_schedule.title: Changeover Delay Time Period Schedule

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

zone_name.description: (name of zone system is serving)
zone_name.title: Zone Name

supply_fan_name.description: Allowable fan types are Fan:SystemModel and Fan:ConstantVolume and Fan:VariableVolume
supply_fan_name.title: Supply Fan Name

exhaust_fan_name.description: Allowable fan types are Fan:SystemModel and Fan:ConstantVolume and Fan:VariableVolume Fan:VariableVolume
exhaust_fan_name.title: Exhaust Fan Name

high_air_control_temperature_schedule_na.description: Air and control temperatures for cooling. If outdoor air temperature is above the high air control temperature, then the zone inlet air temperature is set to the high air control temperature. If the outdoor air is between high and low air control temperature, then there is no cooling/heating requirements.
high_air_control_temperature_schedule_na.title: High Air Control Temperature Schedule Name

low_air_control_temperature_schedule_nam.description: Air and control temperatures for Heating. If outdoor air temperature is below the low air control temperature, then the zone inlet air temperature is set to the low air control temperature. If the outdoor air is between high and low air control temperature, then there is no cooling/heating requirements.
low_air_control_temperature_schedule_nam.title: Low Air Control Temperature Schedule Name

outdoor_air_unit_list_name.description: Enter the name of an ZoneHVAC:OutdoorAirUnit:EquipmentList object.
outdoor_air_unit_list_name.title: Outdoor Air Unit List Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available. Schedule values of 0 denote the unit is off.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

air_inlet_node_name.description: Air inlet node for the PTAC must be a zone air exhaust Node.

supply_air_fan_operation_during_no_heati.description: This choice field allows the user to define how the unit heater will operate under "no heating load" or cooling conditions. If the "No" is selected, then the fan will not run unless there is a heating load. If the fan does not run, this effectively shuts the unit heater system off when there is no heating load. If the "Yes" is selected, the unit heater is available and has a ConstantVolume fan, or has an OnOff fan with "Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule" value greater than zero, then the fan will always run regardless of the zone load.

heating_high_air_temperature_schedule_na.description: Air and control temperatures for heating work together to provide a linear function that determines the air temperature sent to the radiant system. The current control temperature (see A14) is compared to the high and low control temperatures at the current time. If the control temperature is above the high temperature, then the inlet air temperature is set to the low air temperature. If the control temperature is below the low temperature, then the inlet air temperature is set to the high air temperature. If the control temperature is between the high and low value, then the inlet air temperature is linearly interpolated between the low and high air temperature values.
heating_high_air_temperature_schedule_na.title: Heating High Air Temperature Schedule Name

slab_in_node_name.description: This is the node entering the slab or series of slabs after the fan and coil(s).
slab_in_node_name.title: Slab In Node Name

zone_supply_air_node_name.description: This is the node name exiting the slab. This node is typically a zone inlet node. Leave blank when the system configuration is SlabOnly or SeriesSlabs.
zone_supply_air_node_name.title: Zone Supply Air Node Name

outdoor_air_node_name.description: This node is the outdoor air inlet to the ventilated slab oa mixer. This node should also be specified in an OutdoorAir:Node or OutdoorAir:NodeList object.
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

relief_air_node_name.description: This node is the relief air node from the ventilated slab outdoor air mixer.
relief_air_node_name.title: Relief Air Node Name

outdoor_air_mixer_outlet_node_name.description: This is the node name leaving the outdoor air mixer and entering the fan and coil(s).
outdoor_air_mixer_outlet_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Outlet Node Name

fan_outlet_node_name.description: This is the node name of the fan outlet.
fan_outlet_node_name.title: Fan Outlet Node Name

fan_name.description: Allowable fan types are Fan:SystemModel and Fan:ConstantVolume
fan_name.title: Fan Name

hot_water_or_steam_inlet_node_name.title: Hot Water Or Steam Inlet Node Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.description: Currently only one OutdoorAir:Mixer object type is available. This field should be left blank if the WSHP is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through an AirTerminal:SingleDuct:Mixer object.
outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type

outdoor_air_mixer_name.description: If this field is blank, the OutdoorAir:Mixer is not used. This optional field specifies the name of the OutdoorAir:Mixer object. When used, this name needs to match name of the OutdoorAir:Mixer object. This field should be left blank if the WSHP is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through an AirTerminal:SingleDuct:Mixer object.
outdoor_air_mixer_name.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Name

cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to fan size.
cooling_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate

heating_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to fan size.
heating_supply_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to fan size. Only used when heat pump fan operating mode is continuous. This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the DX coil compressor is off. If this field is left blank or zero, the supply air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used.
no_load_supply_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Supply Air Flow Rate

cooling_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to supply air flow rate during cooling operation. This field is set to zero flow when the WSHP is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through air terminal single duct mixer object.
cooling_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: Cooling Outdoor Air Flow Rate

heating_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Must be less than or equal to supply air flow rate during heating operation. This field is set to zero flow when the WSHP is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through air terminal single duct mixer object.
heating_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: Heating Outdoor Air Flow Rate

no_load_outdoor_air_flow_rate.description: Only used when heat pump Fan operating mode is continuous. This air flow rate is used when no heating or cooling is required and the DX coil compressor is off. If this field is left blank or zero, the outdoor air flow rate from the previous on cycle (either cooling or heating) is used. This field is set to zero flow when the PTHP is connected to central dedicated outdoor air through air terminal single duct mixer object.
no_load_outdoor_air_flow_rate.title: No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate

supply_air_fan_name.description: Needs to match Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff object
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the water-to-air heat pump heating coil object
heating_coil_name.title: Heating Coil Name

cooling_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the water-to-air heat pump cooling coil object
cooling_coil_name.title: Cooling Coil Name

maximum_cycling_rate.description: The maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor Suggested value is 2.5 for a typical heat pump
maximum_cycling_rate.title: Maximum Cycling Rate

heat_pump_time_constant.description: Time constant for the cooling coil's capacity to reach steady state after startup Suggested value is 60 for a typical heat pump
heat_pump_time_constant.title: Heat Pump Time Constant

fraction_of_on_cycle_power_use.description: The fraction of on-cycle power use to adjust the part load fraction based on the off-cycle power consumption due to crankcase heaters, controls, fans, and etc. Suggested value is 0.01 for a typical heat pump
fraction_of_on_cycle_power_use.title: Fraction Of On Cycle Power Use

heat_pump_fan_delay_time.description: Programmed time delay for heat pump fan to shut off after compressor cycle off. Only required when fan operating mode is cycling Enter 0 when fan operating mode is continuous
heat_pump_fan_delay_time.title: Heat Pump Fan Delay Time

supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.description: works with gas, electric, hot water and steam heating coils
supplemental_heating_coil_object_type.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Object Type

supplemental_heating_coil_name.description: Needs to match in the supplemental heating coil object
supplemental_heating_coil_name.title: Supplemental Heating Coil Name

maximum_supply_air_temperature_from_supp.description: Supply air temperature from the supplemental heater will not exceed this value.
maximum_supply_air_temperature_from_supp.title: Maximum Supply Air Temperature From Supplemental Heater

maximum_outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_for.title: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature For Supplemental Heater Operation

outdoor_dry_bulb_temperature_sensor_node.title: Outdoor Dry Bulb Temperature Sensor Node Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule that controls fan operation. Schedule values of 0 denote cycling fan operation (fan cycles with cooling or heating coil). Schedule values greater than 0 denote constant fan operation (fan runs continually regardless of coil operation). The fan operating mode defaults to cycling fan operation if this field is left blank.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

heat_pump_coil_water_flow_mode.description: used only when the heat pump coils are of the type WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit Constant results in 100% water flow regardless of compressor PLR Cycling results in water flow that matches compressor PLR ConstantOnDemand results in 100% water flow whenever the coil is on, but is 0% whenever the coil has no load
heat_pump_coil_water_flow_mode.title: Heat Pump Coil Water Flow Mode

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

availability_schedule_name.description: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available. If this field is blank, the system is always available.
availability_schedule_name.title: Availability Schedule Name

outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.description: currently only one OutdoorAir:Mixer object type is available.
outdoor_air_mixer_object_type.title: Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type

supply_air_fan_object_type.description: Fan:ConstantVolume only works when continuous fan operation is used the entire simulation (all supply air fan operating mode schedule values are greater than 0). If any fan operating mode schedule values are 0 a Fan:SystemModel or Fan:OnOff object must be used.
supply_air_fan_object_type.title: Supply Air Fan Object Type

supply_air_fan_name.description: Fan type Fan:ConstantVolume is used with continuous fan and fan type Fan:OnOff is used with cycling Fan.
supply_air_fan_name.title: Supply Air Fan Name

supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.description: Enter the name of a schedule that controls fan operation. Schedule Name values of 0 denote cycling fan operation (fan cycles with cooling coil). Schedule values greater than 0 denote constant fan operation (fan runs continually regardless of coil operation). The fan operating mode defaults to cycling fan operation if this field is left blank.
supply_air_fan_operating_mode_schedule_n.title: Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name

availability_manager_list_name.description: Enter the name of an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object.
availability_manager_list_name.title: Availability Manager List Name

design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.description: Enter the name of a DesignSpecificationZoneHVACSizing object.
design_specification_zonehvac_sizing_obj.title: Design Specification Zonehvac Sizing Object Name

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_flow_rate_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of infiltration for this set of attributes Choices: Flow/Zone => Design Flow Rate -- simply enter Design Flow Rate Flow/Area => Flow per Zone Floor Area - Value * Floor Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate Flow/ExteriorArea => Flow per Exterior Surface Area - Value * Exterior Surface Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate Flow/ExteriorWallArea => Flow per Exterior Surface Area - Value * Exterior Wall Surface Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate AirChanges/Hour => Air Changes per Hour - Value * Floor Volume (zone) adjusted for m3/s = Design Volume Flow Rate "Idesign" in Equation is the result.
design_flow_rate_calculation_method.title: Design Flow Rate Calculation Method

flow_rate_per_exterior_surface_area.description: use key Flow/ExteriorArea for all exterior surface area use key Flow/ExteriorWallArea to include only exterior wall area
flow_rate_per_exterior_surface_area.title: Flow Rate Per Exterior Surface Area

zone_or_space_name.description: ZoneList and SpaceList names are not allowed.
zone_or_space_name.title: Zone Or Space Name

schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

effective_air_leakage_area.description: "AL" in Equation units are cm2 (square centimeters)
effective_air_leakage_area.title: Effective Air Leakage Area

zone_or_space_name.description: ZoneList and SpaceList names are not allowed.
zone_or_space_name.title: Zone Or Space Name

schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

schedule_name.description: If blank, defaults to always 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_flow_rate_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of ventilation for this set of attributes Choices: Flow/Zone => Design Flow Rate -- simply enter Design Flow Rate Flow/Area => Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area - Value * Floor Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate Flow/Person => Flow Rate per Person - Value * #people = Design Flow Rate AirChanges/Hour => Air Changes per Hour - Value * Floor Volume (zone) adjusted for m3/s = Design Volume Flow Rate "Vdesign" in Equation is the result.
design_flow_rate_calculation_method.title: Design Flow Rate Calculation Method

delta_temperature.description: This field contains the constant temperature differential between source and receiving zone or space below which mixing is shutoff. If a source zone is specified and it contains more than one space, the average source zone temperature will be used for control.
delta_temperature.title: Delta Temperature

delta_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the temperature differential between source and receiving zone or space below which mixing is shutoff. If a source zone is specified and it contains more than one space, the average source zone temperature will be used for control.
delta_temperature_schedule_name.title: Delta Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.description: This schedule contains the receiving zone or space temperature versus time below which mixing is shutoff.
minimum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.title: Minimum Receiving Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.description: This schedule contains the receiving zone or space  temperature versus time above which mixing is shutoff.
maximum_receiving_temperature_schedule_n.title: Maximum Receiving Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_source_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the source zone or space temperature versus time below which mixing is shutoff.
minimum_source_temperature_schedule_name.title: Minimum Source Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_source_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the source zone or space temperature versus time above which mixing is shutoff.
maximum_source_temperature_schedule_name.title: Maximum Source Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time below which mixing is shutoff.

maximum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time above which mixing is shutoff.

outdoor_air_node_name.description: Enter the name of an OutdoorAir:Node object
outdoor_air_node_name.title: Outdoor Air Node Name

zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.description: View factors may be entered for a space, zone, group of spaces, or group of zones in the same enclosure by way of Constructon:AirBoundary or open spaces within a zone. This name must align with an enclosure encompassing the same zones or spaces.
zone_or_zonelist_or_space_or_spacelist_n.title: Zone Or Zonelist Or Space Or Spacelist Name

schedule_name.description: This schedule defines the fraction of the time the refrigeration door is open For example, if the warehouse is closed at night and there are no door openings between two zones, the value for that time period would be 0. If doors were propped open, the value  over that time period would be 1.0 If the doors were open about 20% of the time, the value over that period would be 0.2 Schedule values must lie between 0 and 1.0
schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

door_protection_type.description: Door protection can reduce the air flow through a refrigeration door The default value is "None" Choices: "None", "AirCurtain", and "StripCurtain" A strip curtain reduces the air flow more than an air curtain
door_protection_type.title: Door Protection Type

zone_name.description: Name of zone that is the thermal chimney
zone_name.title: Zone Name

schedule_name.title: Schedule Name

design_flow_rate_calculation_method.description: The entered calculation method is used to create the maximum amount of ventilation for this set of attributes Choices: Flow/Zone => Design Flow Rate -- simply enter Design Flow Rate Flow/Area => Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area - Value * Floor Area (zone) = Design Flow Rate Flow/Person => Flow Rate per Person - Value * #people = Design Flow Rate AirChanges/Hour => Air Changes per Hour - Value * Floor Volume (zone) adjusted for m3/s = Design Volume Flow Rate "Vdesign" in Equation is the result.
design_flow_rate_calculation_method.title: Design Flow Rate Calculation Method

minimum_indoor_temperature.description: this is the indoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff
minimum_indoor_temperature.title: Minimum Indoor Temperature

minimum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the indoor temperature versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.title: Minimum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_indoor_temperature.description: this is the indoor temperature above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_indoor_temperature.title: Maximum Indoor Temperature

maximum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the indoor temperature versus time above which ventilation is shutoff.
maximum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.title: Maximum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name

delta_temperature.description: This is the temperature differential between indoor and outdoor below which ventilation is shutoff. If ((IndoorTemp - OutdoorTemp) < DeltaTemperature) then ventilation is not allowed. For example, if delta temperature is 2C, ventilation is assumed to be available if the outside air temperature is at least 2C cooler than the zone air temperature. The values for this field can include negative numbers. This allows ventilation to occur even if the outdoor temperature is above the indoor temperature.
delta_temperature.title: Delta Temperature

delta_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the temperature differential between indoor and outdoor versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
delta_temperature_schedule_name.title: Delta Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_outdoor_temperature.description: this is the outdoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff
minimum_outdoor_temperature.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature

minimum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_outdoor_temperature.description: this is the outdoor temperature above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_outdoor_temperature.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature

maximum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time above which ventilation is shutoff.
maximum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_wind_speed.description: this is the outdoor wind speed above which ventilation is shutoff
maximum_wind_speed.title: Maximum Wind Speed

zone_or_space_name.description: ZoneList and SpaceList names are not allowed.
zone_or_space_name.title: Zone Or Space Name

opening_area.description: This is the opening area used to calculate stack effect and wind driven ventilation.
opening_area.title: Opening Area

opening_area_fraction_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the fraction values applied to the opening area given in the previous input field (0.0 - 1.0). If blank, defaults to always 1.0
opening_area_fraction_schedule_name.title: Opening Area Fraction Schedule Name

opening_effectiveness.description: This field is used to calculate wind driven ventilation. "Cw" in the wind-driven equation and the maximum value is 1.0. When the input is Autocalculate, the program calculates Cw based on an angle between wind direction and effective angle Cw = 0.55 at angle = 0, and Cw = 0.3 at angle=180 Linear interpolation is used to calculate Cw based on the above two values.
opening_effectiveness.title: Opening Effectiveness

effective_angle.description: This field is defined as normal angle of the opening area and is used when input field Opening Effectiveness = Autocalculate.
effective_angle.title: Effective Angle

height_difference.description: This is the height difference between the midpoint of an opening and the neutral pressure level. "DH" in the stack equation.
height_difference.title: Height Difference

discharge_coefficient_for_opening.description: This is the discharge coefficient used to calculate stack effect. "Cd" in the stack equation and the maximum value is 1.0. When the input is Autocalculate, the following equation is used to calculate the coefficient: Cd = 0.4 + 0.0045*|(Tzone-Todb)|
discharge_coefficient_for_opening.title: Discharge Coefficient For Opening

minimum_indoor_temperature.description: This is the indoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_indoor_temperature.title: Minimum Indoor Temperature

minimum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the indoor temperature versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.title: Minimum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_indoor_temperature.description: This is the indoor temperature above which ventilation is shutoff.
maximum_indoor_temperature.title: Maximum Indoor Temperature

maximum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the indoor temperature versus time above which ventilation is shutoff.
maximum_indoor_temperature_schedule_name.title: Maximum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name

delta_temperature.description: This is the temperature differential between indoor and outdoor below which ventilation is shutoff.
delta_temperature.title: Delta Temperature

delta_temperature_schedule_name.description: This schedule contains the temperature differential between indoor and outdoor versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
delta_temperature_schedule_name.title: Delta Temperature Schedule Name

minimum_outdoor_temperature.description: This is the outdoor temperature below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_outdoor_temperature.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature

minimum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time below which ventilation is shutoff.
minimum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.title: Minimum Outdoor Temperature Schedule Name

maximum_outdoor_temperature.description: This is the outdoor temperature above which ventilation is shutoff.
maximum_outdoor_temperature.title: Maximum Outdoor Temperature

maximum_outdoor_temperature_schedule_nam.description: This schedule contains the outdoor temperature versus time above which ventilation is shutoff.
